text: These power crunch bars are awesome!  Absolutely the best tasting bar, and really hits that sweet tooth as well if you have one.  Great flavors, nice wafer format, none of the dryness of other bars - just super light snack that doesn't weigh you down nor requires a glass of water to wash it down (of course, you should drink that glass of water anyway!)  Note that it certainly has much higher fat than most others, but if you are not using them as your sole meal replacement, they are great to have in your mix.  They are in the middle of the pack for protein, low end for sodium, low end for carbs.These wildberry cremes taste amazing.Nutritional breakdown14g protein13g fat9g carbs100 mg sodiumLet's compare that to a few other bars:NUGO Vanilla 11g protein, 2.5g fat, 26g carbs, 150 mg sodiumLUNA protein 12g protein, 7g fat, 21g carbs, 140mg sodiumPURE Protein 21g protein, 4.5 g fat, 17g carbs, 85mg sodium

Great flavors, nice wafer format, none of the dryness of other bars - just super light snack that doesn't weigh you down nor requires a glass of water to wash it down (of course, you should drink that glass of water anyway!)  Note that it certainly has much higher fat than most others, but if you are not using them as your sole meal replacement, they are great to have in your mix.  They are in the middle of the pack for protein, low end for sodium, low end for carbs.These French vanilla taste amazing, and were the first ones I tried..Nutritional breakdown14g protein13g fat9g carbs100 mg sodiumLet's compare that to a few other bars:NUGO Vanilla 11g protein, 2.5g fat, 26g carbs, 150 mg sodiumLUNA protein 12g protein, 7g fat, 21g carbs, 140mg sodiumPURE Protein 21g protein, 4.5 g fat, 17g carbs, 85mg sodium
These are cheap little cars.  But they worked well, come in a variety of colors, great for the kids to trade, play with, etc.
Fantastic set for giveaways to school kids.  I bought several and gave 1-2 to each child, and a couple additional sets to teachers, and they all loved them.
The tattoos worked appropriately, and the kids loved them.  They were easy to use and tear off for multiple children.
The tattoos worked appropriately, and the kids loved them.

The best thing I have read on Elon Musk so far (and from what I understand, the only one that he has participated in himself).  Vance is an excellent writer, and you may or may not be familiar with him from Bloomberg Business and other high profile writings.  I loved the insight into Musk and how he operates, and you get a very broad and complete picture of Musk as a driven visionary that is absolutely set on delivering some of the most aspirational goals of any human in history.  You also get some great insight into the overall ecosystem around Musk - his companies (SpaceX and Tesla primarily), relationships with other companies and gov entities, as well as the important people around him.  Many bios give you a timeline of the person, but little insight into the broader context and I appreciated that in this book.You get unique insight into his personal relationships, how he coped with things that went wrong (not always a pretty story), and how he manages through both failure and success.  Since you learn so much about his childhood and formative years, you get a good grounding on why he is the way he is, and how those relationships developed.Finally, you get a lot of detail around 'green' industry, space exploration, etc. which really fills out this ecosystem and delivers an inspiring and educational view of one of the most intriguing people of our lifetimes.  The book almost seems to ask "What are you going to go out and reinvent?"  Well worth reading and even gifting to friends who may be fans.

I hate to give this book any less than 5 stars.  I am a big fan of other Trudi Canavan works, and I was really hopeful with this one.The quality of writing is not great, the story development is slow and predictable, and I found myself rushing to the end to find out if something, anything, happens.  There are two stories throughout the book, Rielle and Tyen, and they are completely different, unrelated worlds.  In fact, they almost seem like one story written to resonate with girls, and one for boys.  At one point, I remember thinking "I am on page 463, and I still have no idea how these stories relate."  Perhaps this should have been written as two series from different viewpoints - some authors have done quite well with that.I was disappointed as well with the detail around the magic systems, and use of magic, which was totally skimmed over.  Based on previous work, I was expecting something a bit more inventive, vs what became the same story told in a variety of environs.It was good enough that I will read the next books in the series, although I will wait a few weeks so they are not at the intro price!

We love this show, and watch every season.  Strangers start out naked, so they need to find safe shelter, water, food - in that order.  Fire tends to be a major problem, since that is often required for both the food and water requirements.  Season 4 is not much different from past seasons, just different locations.I only give it 4 stars, since it would be really interesting to see more evaluation.  For example, one pair spends 4 days trying to build fire.  We know there is a panel of experts always adjusting their PSR (or Primitive Survival Rating) - what is the consensus of what they could have done better?  Would be great to learn a bit more out of the show.  Naked and Afraid Uncensored doesn't do this, but rather spends more time on background of the participants.

These are one of my favorite bars. They are nutritionally balanced, and taste fantastic. They are not ideal for weight loss phase, go for the Nugo Slims in that case, but are perfect for maintenance phase.  This and the vanilla have become our family's current go to bar.Note, unlike the Nugo Dark, these are NOT vegan. They are, however, gluten-free.

I love to do crafts of all kinds, and know how to hand-embroider. I've always wanted to own an embroidery machine, but could not afford one. I was a little bit skeptical at first, since my first experience with Brother was a lemon sewing machine (it only truly likes to work in reverse!). Compared to other machines, the price point on this one just cannot be beat!The manual is more than a little intimidating. Some of it is very roughly translated-to-English descriptions, but I muddled through to the point I was willing to give it an actual try. Putting the parts together was much worse on paper than in real life - a simple snap-on to the bottom part, and then snap on the hoop and I was ready to roll. On to the pleasant option of which design to try first.My experience with the automatic needle threader was more frustration than helpful, and I found myself wishing I could take it off so I could reach the #6 threading spot easier. The instructions seem to overcomplicate it, so I'll try it again in another way viewed on a video and see if I don't want to take a hammer to it.On the embroidery - you do have to change the thread a lot to get the desired results. Thankfully, like most Brother machines, the threading sequence is printed right on the machine so you aren't trying to remember if the thread goes over or under that metal piece or around this little piece. We used a rayon type thread, which has a nice sheen to it. Since I was giving the machine a test run, we did our tests on simple (translation: cheap) muslin fabric with tear-away stabilizer on the back. I have included some pictures on our results. I wish we could load more photos, but I guess that would overload the website. (I also tried to take a video, but failed miserably for some reason.)  I would advise users to buy the best thread you can afford, because one of our cheaper colors caused the needle to break because of thread burrs hitting the eye of the needle. SNAP!!That was the one actual complaint I had about this machine - we had to stop and put on a new needle of course, and we were on Color #3 of a six-color design.  We could not go BACK to Color #3 and continue - we had to scrap the hoop contents and start over from the beginning.  I would have liked the option to continue where we left off, but couldn't.The embroidery is not perfection - there were little gaps between the colored thread and the outlines on a couple designs we tried, but nothing overly bad. If I wasn't fine-tooth-combing it, I might not even notice. We even tried one of the six-color designs in only ONE color, just to see how it would look (and to save thread!) - it looked surprisingly good! For those new to machine embroidery, the machine will have connecting threads by color - in other words, if there are five areas that use black, there will be thread running between those five areas. It is normal and perfectly ok. This machine starts with a few anchoring stitches - just trim away the connected threads - they are NOT part of your design. That goes for the front AND the back.There are several Disney and Pixar licensed designs included with this model. There are five fonts as well. I wish there were more, and you can bet that fonts are the FIRST thing I am going to look for to download! Yes, you can just download more options, designs, fonts and frames to this machine. Well, to your computer, then transfer them to your machine via USB port. I have also learned as of today that there is software available to even digitize your own designs, which will create truly custom designs for your machine. The Brother uses files in the PES format (there are a LOT of embroidery formats out there, so be sure you stick with the right type for the machine). Brother has included their design library website location on the front of the machine, apparently knowing they will be creating an insatiable thirst for more designs and fonts!There are many YouTube videos available on how to use this machine, in case you are not into reading roughly translated manuals (even though I recommend at minimum familiarizing yourself with the machine via the manuals before trying using it). I've been looking at some today, and have already learned some new tricks.All in all, I truly love this machine. It does everything you could want (except large designs - that will take a different model - the maximum embroidery area for this one is 4x4, even though the hoop is larger than that) and does it very nicely. I am thrilled and extremely grateful to have had the chance to own it! In fact, since trying it out, my mind has been racing as to all the things I could make (or try to make) with this, and I haven't done a lick of actual work. My daughter also tried out a design and had no trouble with it either. We are in the process of making her first quilt, and had been wondering how we could get some of the words she wanted to include on her fabric as part of the design. Now we know! We'll be creating our own blocks.I seriously can recommend this machine to anyone who enjoys making custom gifts or even wants to start selling embroidered items as a side business. This is definitely for home use - the size and speed are not going to work for a high-volume business. But this home user is incredibly happy with the machine, and can barely wait to try some new fonts!  You WILL enjoy this one!Note that I've read more than one review that complained about nesting on the back. If you have not done any sort of machine embroidery before, please know that you HAVE to use some sort of stabilizer fabric on the back of the item on which you are embroidering. Amazon sells many different types. I like to buy the precut, since it saves me a lot of time and frustration. This machine uses 8"x8" precuts. Any type will do, but I like the tear-away the best so far. If you are using a stretchy fabric, you'll want a more permanent stabilizer. Also, cheap threads are not a friend to this machine. That broken needle was on my first time out - the cheap thread caused a burr that snapped the needle in half. Get the best thread you can afford.Good luck, and happy embroidering!

Not as exciting as I thought it would be.  I've seen several commercials for spiral slicers, like I am sure we all have.Big, luscious-looking piles of zucchini "noodles" stack up on a plate. You see carrots being turned into strings as well.So, I had to try one. So far, I have tried it with carrots and cucumbers.I'm sorry, but the hype is more than the results. Yes, it looks great, but unless you can chew big piles of strings with the texture of licorice whips, then this might not be for you. Whoever did the zucchini would surely have to cook it first, and I'm not sure what the breakdown would be on the thin strips in the heat of a pot of skillet.  (We haven't had much zucchini yet this year, so haven't tried it with that yet.)It also doesn't use all the vegetable, so know that if you think three carrots will give you a plate full of orange curls, you would be wrong - you'll have a half plate of orange curls and three stubs of carrots that look like stubby sharpened pencils! I just chopped up the rest of the stubs and cooked them with everything else. Plus, you'll; have the fun of trying to get that thing with very sharp blades clean.  For those of us who do not have a dishwasher (I miss it! Wah!) and have to wash by hand, it is a bit of a challenge to get the bits out of the middle where the two ends meet.

I was skepticle about these bars being very good.  I mean, I know Barry from the commercials loves the Fiber One bars, but what about those of us to had to actually buy them, and weren't paid to eat them?Well, turns out that these are VERY good. They are also VERY small.  Apparently, Fiber One made the portion size with keeping under 100 calories in mind.  I was seriously surprised at the tiny size. But, you have to keep your focus on the fiber so you don't kick yourself for such a tiny bar. They do have a lot of sugars in them, mainly from the lemon flavored frosting squiggles. Not sure if they had to add so much sweetness to cover the taste of the inulin (chickory root), the fiber they use or what, but at this point, I don't mind.  Thanks to dental troubles, I can't chew as well as I used to, so getting fiber is a challenge. (Sorry, I just can't down a glass of Benefiber, even though I know it isn't supposed to be gritty! I know it's in there!)  These bars seem to be doing the job I hired them to do, and taste goodwhile doing it.Well done Fiber One.  This is one I'll be a repeat buyer for.

This fan and description seems to put a different "mental image" in my head than what we received.When I see 30", I think plenty big for a small room.  In reality, when we opened the box, I was shocked to see how very small these blades really are!  They are 10" from tip to tip.  Not sure how they measure ceilng fans - I'll have to google it - but two 10" blades with about 6" of housing inbetween doesn't equal 30".But, the fan part of our old fan/light had died, and warm weather is here.  We rent, so can't modify anything, can only replace. With all the area stores, even Wally World, wanting $55 and up for the tinest fans, I decided to go ahead and try this one.  Never heard of the brand before either.It is a SMALL fan.  Very small.  The foreign instructions stink, but my husband has put up much more than his share of ceiling fans before, so it was no big deal. He claims the hardest part was screwing in the tiny screws with the washer into the housing, because many of the holes were drilled at some sort of angle. But, he finally got it after a few mutters under his breath.I do have to say that I am surprised by the amount of light and air this Liliputian fan actually supplies. It was for a 10'x11' bedroom. The fan it was replacing was a 36" fan (actually 36" from tip to tip) with a globe style light with two bulbs. So I was not truly expecting a lot of this tiny offspring of normal fans. However, whether it is the six blades or the size of the motor, this tiny thing moves more air than the larger fan did. In addition, the light kit took only one bulb (the style that looks like miniature incandescents, not the "flame" ones), so I was expecting not much light. I was again surprised to see that it does a great job on the lighting as well.  Seriously - this fan offers more than meets the eye.  The pullchains are also miniscule, so unless you want to drag your knuckles along just below the blades to turn the light off and on, you'll need to add some ball chain to their pulls for both the light and the fan.  We just took ours off the old fan and attached them instead of using the mfg pulls.The blades are reversible, but you'll probably want to stick with the white with the faux wood pattern. The reverse side is a fugly brown with blue accents. Yuck!  The all white fan helps it to visually blend up and into the ceiling without drawing your eye immediately to it.So, while I was ready to hate it and disappointed to see the tiny blades, this fan does everything it promised.  I don't know how long it will last, but for now, it is the Little Fan That Could.

Okay, I realize that everyone's definition of "easy to set up" comes from a different place.  For me, I've worked around computers for over 25 years now, so pretty comfortable, BUT - I am more comfortable with software than hardware.  So although this should not have been intimidating, it was a little bit. I formerly was using a Linksys router on our home network. It did a fine job, and was very easy to maintain. However, it didn't give much of a boost to the downstairs connections. The computer was always slow, and would drop the connection from time to time, and require a reboot to get the connection back.This router is truly great looking. It is white, sleek and has nice blue lights. It sits vertically, rather than horizontally like my old one. I wasn't sure I'd like it, but I do. It comes with three screw-on antennas that can be pointed in any direction to boost your signal in that direction. The metal frame is very sturdy and would take a LOT of pressure to bend. I currently have mine on a separate little shelf because my current desk is too small.There is only a quick set-up sheet included with this item. Ironically, if you need help, it tells you to go to the company's WEBSITE! Ha! So, if you can't get it to work, go ahead and get online.  Yeah, No. But, if you are willing to disconnect and reset up a single-user home network using your old router, it could work! The sheet does give you very plain graphic instructions that tells you which item to plug in where, which many will find very helpful It came with a very short ethernet cord, so you either need to keep the router close to you or buy a longer cord. (The one I had was just purchased last year and was six feet long, so I was in good shape.)Now, I couldn't get it to connect right away. The short troubleshooter on the insert says to reboot your modem, then to reboot the router. I did. Several times. The computer refused to acknowledge the new router! I was ready to just reconnect my Linksys when I decided to go against all logic and swap the ethernet and modem cords. For many years, computers and peripherals have been fairly color-coded to make it easier for non-tekkies to hook things up. In this case for the TP Link, the ethernet ports (there are four) are yellow and the modem port is blue. I even had previously bought color-coded wires so I didn't accidentally pull the wrong one. After 45 minutes of not being able to connect, I take another look at the back. Everything is in the right spot. But, since I wasn't connecting anyway, I decided to swap out the modem cord and ethernet cord, plugging yellow into the blue slot and the blue cord into the yellow slot. Totally backwards.  As you might guess, it took off immediately! So apparently, our unit was either labeled backwards or connected backwards on the inside. Seriously strange. But as long as it works, I don't much care.The default setting of this router is PUBLIC, so be sure to change your settings to PRIVATE NETWORK, if you don't want everyone in the neighborhood to try and tap into your network. Yes, they would need your password, but there are a lot of smart hackers out there, so you just never know. Better safe than sorry. There are default settings for the account name, network name (your SSID) and passwords, so you will need to change those as soon as you can. (If you forget to write them down, there is a reset button on the back to rol it back to the default passwords.) I also had to change the other settings to WPA2 for our area for the home network. No big deal, just different from before.The TP Link C9 runs two parallel bands - 2.4Ghz, which is what most home routers use for regular internet access and browsing, and a 5.0 Ghz band, which is for streaming videos and movies. The nice thing about this router, is that if you name BOTH the 2.4 and the 5.0 the same name, it will AUTOMATICALLY switches to the strongest network for your use. I love that!  The on/off switch is on the back of the router, so it won't easily get bumped. While my photos show the antennas straight up (we haven't had to move any of them to get a better reception), they rotate and bend towards whatever area you might need a little boost.Has our reception improved? Yes! The downstairs computer now cruises like it was directly connected to a wired access point. The kids can watch movies and I can browse the net without anyone slowing down. The reception range is fabulous - we live in a multi-unit building, and could probably provide internet connection to all four units. It offers connection speeds of 1.3Gbps over the clearer 5GHz bandwidth and 600Mbps on the 2.4GHz bandwidth. We have not yet found a dead spot in our place - even outside picks up the signal.In addition to the fabulous signal and great connection speeds, this router can also handle your USB 2.0 and 3.0 devices. There are ports on the side of the router, so you can easily transfer files, photos or data from an external drive to your own computer, or even hook up your printer to print wirelessly. (I haven't tried that yet, but the possibilities are there.)It also offers a "tether" function for your smartphones.  I have not used that, and won't be using that, but it would be great for parents who want to monitor network access/usage from work for their older kids. It is nice to know that option is there.I am so very pleased with this router! I probably would not have looked at this brand, since I tend to stick with the equipment companies I've had previous success with, but I cannot state enough that this would be an asset to anyone's home network setup.

These are really cute rain boots.Note that they are HEAVY, so don't expect a lightweight, easy-to-wear-all-day boot.They are surprisingly heavy, in fact.What is really good about them is that they provide an alternative for ladies who don't have skinny calves!Almost all the rainboots currently available, adorable as they might be, are too tight in the calf area if you carry any extra weight below the waist. Who knew you were supposed to be skinny to have dry feet?  Yes, a few places make wider calved boots, but you have to invest in them, and they aren't very cute.Great for rainy, soggy days that are not gully-washers.  Since they are only ankle high, if you anticipate having to go through deeper water, you'll have wet feet anyway - use a higher rain boot.

Very cute movie.  Of course, I find it even more entertaining, since we were living in Houston during the whole Enron/Arthur Andersen debacle. If you've ever worked in a cube farm situation for a faceless corporation, then you'll truly relate to and enjoy this movie.I had already seen it many, many times. We bought it because my daughter needed to see it for a class assignment, and no one had it playing.I was surprised to see who was actually playing Milton!  I'll leave that for you to find out.Overall, funny movie, not too raunchy, and a fun way to spend a couple hours trying to not think about your own job.

Well, we used to buy Greenies for our dog and our cats all the time.  That is, until we got a cat that was allergic to corn!These things are mostly corn meal.If you have a pet with itchy skin, you might want to try and see if corn meal is creating a reaction. Just like with people, corn can be highly allergenic and cause gluten problems.The small amount of chlorophyll for their breath isn't worth a tradeoff of itchy skin and bloating for our cat.No more Greenies for us. And now that I know they are mostly corn (I admit - I never used to be a label reader), I wouldn't buy them for a dog either.

My daughter collects elongated pennies. Of course, they never quite fit in anything you already have.We decided to give one of these albums a try. They work very well.  Some of the pennies hang out at the edge, but the majority of them fit just fine.It would be nice to see more book color options.  The different colors as they stand seem to have slightly different designs and insides on them.She prefers the blue book, so I suggested she just make her own cover for the next one.Overall, a great way to keep your elongated penny collection in one place and unbent.

I use a lot of pins in my crafts, and this was a great way to get them - a big ol' honking box of pins!There is not a lot you can really say about straight pins, but I'll try.They have a coating on them, so they will not rust, leaving stains on your items or clothing.There is also a little bag of damp-absorber in each box, so there is no condensation in the box from the metals.I've been using this brand for about a year now, and have not found one that I like better. Prym pins are perfect for my crafting needs.

I decided to try these out more for the size than anything extra special about the formula.  I do not drink diet sodas, as I am allergic to aspartame, and sucralose seems to give me a headache as well. That leaves the very few sweetened with stevia, and this is NOT one of those.This simply uses sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup for the main sweetener.  As far as taste, I don't taste a lot of difference, except that this one is a little bland and less carbonated for some reason.  Perhaps our package got beat up too much on the trip.  Probably a total of 10 cans out of the 24 cans had dents or smooshed edges on them.  One could not be opened at all by hand.  The edges were the worst, but some of the ones in the middle were also a little mashed, which surprised me. It wasn't worth tryig to return it, so we kept it.There are a couple pros though -first off, aesthetically, I like the can color!  Ha!  Yes, I like the shiny green can.  I like shiny things. I also like caffeine, but once the evening wears down, I often don't want to drink a full can.  This is where this product shines.  They are just the right size for a late evening Pepsi without having the rest of the can sit and go flat overnight. (I've poured out more than my share of the blue cans the next morning.)I wish they were more carbonated, and they need to perhaps put them in sixpack rings AND the case to keep them from slamming around so much.But, they have a place in the Pepsi world. Would I buy them again?  Undecided at this point.

I'm a fairly new convert to the Fiber One bars, even though I've enjoyed their commercials for a while now.I decided to try this type of fiber.  I've tried three flavors now, and this is at the bottom of the list.If you have ever made cake-type chocolate chip cookies, and then left the jar open or they had dried out, THAT is what these taste like!So dry, I had to take a sip of something after every bite! Yuck! Already dry bars, combined with the drying effect of the inulin fiber, and it can be hard to swallow literally.While it might not seem like you could ever have too much chocolate, you CAN.These seem to have too much chocolate for what they are. I did not like the flavor of the squiggles across the top - very artificial tasting.Overall, this was my first and last purchase of this flavor.  Bleah!I like Fiber One bars, but this one fails the taste test.

I absolutely LOVE this little thing!They are not huge - maybe a little larger than a baseball. (It has been years since I held a baseball, so use your own judgement there.)Every one will vary a little, because they are carved from Hilalayan salt.  I have three other salt lamps as well. We have two asthmatics in the house, and they do seem to help purify the air.This candle uses ONLY tea lights. You can pick them up almost anywhere very inexpensively, so that is not a huge cost.You'll need a stick-style lighter (like you'd use on large candles or your grill) because you won't be able to get a match in there unless you have some fireplace matches.  DO NOT use votive size candles either - the wax will melt down into the base and make a very large mess.  Tea lights only please!They are a funky pink when sitting unused in the room. They don't really expire - my salt lamp in the bedroom is probably three years old and you can't tell I've even used it.  When you put in a tea light and light it up, the glow is a beautiful orange that is very eye-pleasing.Overall, I am very happy with this purchase, and with the product itself.  I would gladly give these as gifts (and receive them too!).If this is your first time to try out a Himalayan light product, this is a great way to do it!

This one has a ways to go before it is useful.I bought it because our family loves deviled eggs and I make them almost weekly in the warmer weather.I wanted a way to store more deviled eggs, as the container I had only held 12 halves. Not enough! The fact that each tray held 18 halves was really a great thing, so I thought. I also wanted something that wouldn't take up a lot of refrigerator room, and thought this might slide in on top of other items in the fridge.The item came with the two trays and lids shrink-wrapped together.  There are little clamps on the egg portion of the tray that hook to the lid portion. Not well, but they hook. There is NOTHING remotely sturdy about this set.  You cannot pick it up by the handle. If you think you can quickly grab an egg and pop the lid back on, think again - it is not quick and you will probably need both hands.The tray itself holds the eggs very well. Almost too well - the indentations are deep, and we found ourselves using a fork to get the eggs back out. No big deal, but something you should know about these. They would work very well for a buffet table (that is at your home, and you did not have to transport them in these trays anywhere).  Some others have said they put ice in the upside down lid and put the tray on the ice. I could see that being helpful in a picnic situation.Bottom line is that they do not fasten well enough in any way.  I would not trust them for transporting eggs. I would not trust lifting them out of the refrigerator. I would not even trust them to keep the eggs fresh, because the seal is not tight on the top/bottom. It basically sits on top of the gg tray, and you use the little latches to pretend to hook the top to the bottom.  Meh at best.  I would have returned these, but as mentioned, I can see these working well for a buffet or self-serve party situation. That's ALL they would be good for, in my opinion.  Just too flimsy for anything else.I have already purchased a different set via Amazon that is perfect for our needs and airtight too.So, if you have a lot of home dinner parties or family dinners, this will work on the food table.If you don't and might want to drive to somewhere and bring your deviled eggs with you, please get a different container.

This was my third egg keeper I've purchased.  I tried the Rubbermaid (okay, but doesn't hold enough and lost the lid in the last move), a set from Amazon that was two platter-type holders with plastic covers. What a mess those were - okay for a buffet table, but that would be all. Not good for transporting anywhere or even fridge storage.So, decided to give these a try.  Our family loves deviled eggs, and I make them almost weekly in the summer. Our fridge space is at a premium, so always looking for something that will help it store easier or in a smaller footprint. This is it!I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the quality of this set.You get a total of FIVE pieces in this set - two of the actual containers, two inserts for deviled eggs and the top latch/lid.The white trays come out, so you can use these to hold almost anything you'd want to. Each of the trays holds a dozen eggs (either hard boiled, fresh or deviled halves).The bottom snaps onto the upper tray securely. I wouldn't worry about it falling off, unless someday the snap itself broke off. Possible, but it would take some really rough treatment to break them. The lid snaps on to whichever tray is on the top level. You can easily pick it up by the handle and off you go.  Now, I haven't traveled anywhere with this yet, but I can see it working very well for about anything - picnic, car trips, etc.I'll be getting another set or two for sure. They can all connect together.  I'd love to see some different lid colors, but other than that, love this set!Both segments are full of eggs in the fridge right now from making devilled eggs yesterday. VERY pleased with the airtightness (?) of the containers and love how little space it really takes up in the fridge.  Well done, Snap 'N' Stack!

After I had bought another car seat warmer for my husband that wasn't ever used (he hated it!), I thought I'd try again.This one looked simple, soft and was a reasonable price.When I gave it to him, I got the standard eye rolling, and mumbling about how he didn't want the other one, why would he want this one, etc etc.But, if your hubby is like mine, he has a very small behind, and gets colder than I do. He has to get out in all kinds of weather for his job, and my thoughts were that it would help keep that tiny behind warmer this winter.As it turns out, he had to grudgingly admit that he really liked this seat, and used it every day this winter.  It actually felt good, warmed up just enough to take the chill off, and was comfortable as well.  That's about as good as it gets with him!So, we have to give it all thumbs up - finally found a seat that he liked, it worked like it was advertised, and it was affordable!  The Trifeca has been found!!

Well, I bought this one for a Christmas gift for one of my two chefs in the house.It didn't really make a good impression!  There were a couple things that have been flagged to try, but nothing that was "wow, I have to try this!".  Overall, somewhat disappointing, and I can't recommend it.

There's not a lot that can be said about these, except that they work really well for all kinds of sorting.They are not just for baseball cards!I know many people use them to sort coupons.  In my case, I use scrapbooking tags, and these help me to keep the tags sorted by design, rather than just a bag of "Christmas theme" tags.  Much easier to keep up with what I am running low on, or need to fill in. I put them all in a binder, and my tags are available at a glance, super easy.I wish there was a way to seal the tops - the pockets are all open, so don't turn things upside down!  ;-)For some uses, just taping the pocket shut would be fine, but my items don't fit entirely within the pocket.I'd recommend these though - nice quality.

I used to use these in the office all the time.  After a recent round of a lot of medical/doctor/hospital visits for my husband, I found myself wuickly being overwhelmed with the sheer quantity of the bills from the hospital, doctors, radiologists, labs, etc etc.  They ALL bill separately for your part of the cost, and with Obamacare guidelines, there is no longer just one account for your name - every procedure has a new account number. I bought these to try to keep the bills, estimation of benefits, doctor bills, etc under control.  Turned out that I needed HALF of this box just to have one folder per account set up by these various entities!  Good grief.  13 different accounts for the treatment of the same medical problem!  Yikes...These have been invaluable to keeping up with the accounts without losing my sanity. I am also going to recommend them for my daughter to keep her projects separate for her college courses.  Don't know why I didn't think about them sooner...  I tend to associate these with office use only, but they are great for home and school as well.  Love them!

I bought these for my husband, who likes his coffee strong enough to curl the hair on your chest (assuming you have chest hair).He loves bold, strong, coffee.BUT - he doesn't love this one!  In fact, after trying it plain, watered down, with creamer, with even more creamer, etc etc, he hasgiven up on this one, and gave me the rest of the box back, telling me to pass them along to someone else.His review is that the overall flavor is okay, but that it is still bitter, no matter what you do to it, how much water or creamer you add, the bitterness overrides everything else.So sorry Emeril - this one gets all thumbs DOWN from our house.  Back to the drawing board!

My son wanted this shirt for a costume at school.It fit a little snugly, but still worked.I wasn't the one wearing it, but I didn't care for the fabric at all.Don't light a match near it!Bu, since he loved it, giving the shirt four stars for making the son happy, deducting one star for cheap fabric.

This was a Christmas gift for my wolf-loving son.It was a big hit. The photos are beautiful, and nicer than the standard same-old-same-old photos that so many calendars offer.  I hope they do a repeat of new wolf shots next year as well.All thumbs up.

We buy this for my husband, to help control his blood sugar levels.This, combined with 2500mcg of biotin, does wonders to regulate glucose levels in the bloodstream.We are very happy with this brand, and will continue to purchase it in the future.

Ok.  So I have found the first Gloria Jeans coffee that I truly do not like.I had been wanting to try the butter toffee flavor for quite a while.Major disappointment!I do not like super strong coffee, and prefer slightly sweet flavors.But this was just not good.  I tried it three different ways - plain, with regular cream and with flavored cream.Then I tried it plain again. Sorry, there is just no win on this flavor!It smells great while brewing, but that is where the good scent ends. When you smell the coffee in the cup,it just smells burnt.  And sadly, that is pretty much how it tastes as well... like the last cup in a burnt pot of coffee!I'd return it if I could.  Bleah!  And I bought a whole box of it because I thought it would become a favorite.  Boy, was I wrong!This one was a bitter failure, literally.
Okay for some projects, but if you look closely, the word"Firefighter" is mis-spelled in the vertical column.Botched fabric on this one.  Not seller's fault, but folks need to know this is flawed.

Love the Kirkland brand, but there are no Costco's near us.I am glad some of their things are offered online.  While other chain stores do sell generic medicines,we've been really happy with the Kirkland brand for generics.  They always work just as well asany of the name brand counterparts.Well done Kirkland!  Keep up the good work!

These cans are visually appealing, but the cats don't really care about that.That's a people perk!Both of our cats like the Indoor recipes.  They smell like a gourmet meal when you open them.We warm our cans up in hot water before serving anyway, to loosen up any gravy in the cans.It smells wonderful!Apparently, the cats think so too, because these are always a big hit.I appreciate Amazon making cases available for shipment, which helps people like me with limited mobilityto get a larger quantity delivered right to the door.

We don't use these for food -My daughter has psoriasis, and the more she protects her skin, the better.  I bought these to keep bythe kitty litter so she can protect her skin from any cracks allowing in extra bacteria from the litter.She can then just toss them and wash her hands like normal, without worrying about some otherbacterial matter invading.I'd buy them again, but they go a long way for the reason we bought them.No complaints at all, the shipping was quick and the gloves are nice.

This is okay, but it was my first and last purchase.I wanted to try a jarred brand of anchovies, and thought I'd toss this into my order.The photo is deceiving, and the jar looks like it came from Barbie and Ken's pantry!TINY!!The anchovies are fine - we chopped them up and added to pasta salad.  But I would not buy these again.

This sauce is great!I first ordered it from Amazon Pantry to give it a try.  We all love Tso chicken from the Chinese food restaurant,and have never managed to reproduce the sauce at home.I expected a powder to mix up, but this is actually a packaged sauce.  You just open, dump and heat.It was really tasty, and everyone liked it a lot.  We did two packets for our family of four, tossed in chickenchunks and veggies, and served over rice.  Very good!We've since found one store that carries this brand, but they are usually out of this flavor.I would happily buy this one again.  Great addition to your pantry for a quick weeknight dinner.

Well, I have to say that Petstages has a huge hit with this item.Both of our cats adore these round beds.In fact, they adore them so much, we have now purchased four beds for two cats!The new ones get put in the room they hang in the most, and the older ones get putdownstairs for a spare place to lay.Made of tightly wound corrugated cardboard, these beds seem to thrill the cats.Our older (and larger) male loves curling up in these, no matter where we place them. He hangs over the edges a little, but he doesn't seem to mind a bit! Our little girl loves to sharpen her claws on them, no matter who's bed it is or where it is.She has no boundaries and regularly uses our male cat's bed as her sharpening place.I would love it if Petstages made a larger size of this bed, as our male hangs over the edge.(We included a photo of him hanging on to the newest bed as we try to put it on the floor. Hedidn't want to even let it go!  He's 13 lbs. We also included a photo of our girl cat curled up inher bed - she is 9 lbs, in case that helps anyone decide on whether or not to try this bed for their kitty.)All in all, it is the best purchase we've made that both cats adore, other than food.It will be on our permanent purchase list!  When one wears out (and it takes a while, despite allthe use they get), we just order another one.The legs can be a little tempermental, especially if they start wrestling on one of them. (And their humans have stepped on the beds from time to time by accident, popping off a bed leg!)  I've tried a few different glues, and found that a plain old glue gun with medium or hot melt sticks does a great job of anchoring the legs back onto the bed. Don't throw them away - just glue back on for more cat fun.Thank you Petstages for a real winner!

There isn't a whole lot to be said about a box.However, that hasn't stopped me yet.As boxes go, these arrived quickly and sealed so they were not sliding all over the place.They were nicely packaged as a community of boxes, living well together. No shreds, tears orruined boxes.The only mild complaint I had about these was that when they are put together, the corners areslightly open. In other words, if you had put a flashlight in the on position in the box, you'll see lightcoming through everywhere the corners meet.  Since I ship things with fabric in them, that meant I needto put an extra piece of tape on each little corner to keep as much of the outside out as possible.I also found out that I could have gone down 1" to ship what I make, but that's just something that you don't knowuntil you try it.  The price was fair, shipment was quick, and I didn't have to order enough to open a box store.In other words, it totally fits the bill for those who need a few boxes, not a case.

Well, this was not my favorite length of pin.  I misunderstood the designations on pin numbers.(I have since looked it up and have a much better understanding.)These pins are longer than the other pins. It is a fraction of an inch longer, and you wouldn't think that would matter.That entirely depends upon your project.  For my project, it made the pin too long to work.But, I've since learned, and will not ding stars on an item because I needed to understand the numbers better.The pins are nice, and come packaged with little moisture absorbers that help make sure the pins stay ina lovely condition - no rusty spots.  And the company did a stellar job of packaging and mailing.Zero problems with the brand - I just needed a shorter pin!

Well, I wish the colors had varied - we got the yellow shown in the current photo.  (That's just my opinion - I don't like yellow!)Anyway, I was hoping when it said it fit four different sizes that it would fit the small Fancy Feast cans.  I couldn't get it to fit. Maybe someone else will have better luck.The lid is very stiff plastic. It was easy to clean. That's the good part.It fit the regular 5.5 ounce cans (like Friskies) very well. Almost too well - I tried to get it back off last night,and finally got it off by using one of the "ears" to get the seal to break.Oh well.  It'll do what it is designed to do - cover an open cat food can.I didn't expect miracles, but I don't think I'd buy this one again.  We were really hoping for a cover for the small cans.Apparently, Amazon or the seller has changed the photos to adjust expectations - we only paid for one lid, and got one lid.No "sets" expected.So, if you are looking for a stiff little lid for open cat food cans, then this might just be what you are looking for.

I have purchased these many. many times now.I really love them!  The manufacturer even puts a little packet of dessicant in there so you don't getrusty pins.  I appreciate that. If it matters, they are very shiny silver, not dull like some pins.You can pick these up with a magnet, so that is also helpful, since I often drop pins!The only things I would change, is to make the heads flatter.  They are slightly rounded, which makes for a slightlylifted appearance on some of my projects. You can't really get them flattened out.  I also wish that this brand sold 7/8" pins in bulk, but I have not found any place that sells them yet. My Amazon seller does not offer that size.

This is a beautiful ornament stand.  BUT...the only way it can actually hold an ornament is if the ornament itself has a very SHORT hanger. In other words, all the beautiful ornaments with fabric ribbons and such won't work.  I tried four different ornaments, and every one of them hung way too low and touched the bottom curve of the stand.  If I cut the ribbon shorter, it would not ever be able to be hung on a tree, to be able to alternate decorations.It needs to have the top where it curls over be extended/uncurled one turn.  We experimented with ours, figuring since it wasn't working anyway, the worst we could do would be to break it. Either way, we weren't able to hang ornaments on it.  So my husband started tweaking the curves and coils with tools.  We managed to uncurl the top enough to raise it up, which helped a little bit, but not enough.  We also played with the curve in the middle, having to UNcurl it some to get a little more height. Once that was done, the ornaments still faced sideways, due to the placement of the top curl.  So yet again, we played with that, and turned the top curl 90 degrees out, which finally allowed a regular ornament to be put on there without touching any of the stand or facing the back of the stand.So, over all, it is a sturdy stand, and the bottom curl is beautiful. Note that it has a fairly large "footprint", and will take up some room. But the design is a little flawed in reality, with the curves' angles needing to be revamped to make it useful.  You'll note in the photo that the ornament they display is actually very small, and does not have a drop-down hanger of any kind - it is a very short little hanger too.  Most ornaments that you would display won't be like that.  This would be great for small ornaments, but the larger ones that you might hang on your tree just won't work.

Hard to say anything bad about a rotary cutter's replacement blades!I like the little plastic case that they come in - makes it safer and easier to store.These are the 45mm size, which is what I use here to cut fabric.Zero complaints.

We love Tropic Bee Orange Blossom honey.My husband likes to use it in the crock pot on pork roasts, and uses half of the bigger jars.I thought this size would be just right for his cooking ventures.It also seems a little easier to handle, since honey can be a little heavy.VERY happy with my purchase. The company packs their honey VERY well, and everythingarrived in great condition with no leaks or messes.We'll be long-time customers of this brand.

These are okay.  I ended up returning these.  I ordered 2E, because I have a very wide foot.(Think along the lines of boxes fit better than most shoes.)The colors are GREAT - this is a really nice looking pair of shoes.  I didn't want one of the trendypairs that look like a melted box of crayons - they'd be outdated and out of style by next year.I just wanted a more traditional look. The blue color is really great and I liked it.The width did not feel too bad, but the liners of the Asics are SLICK!I found myself sliding around a little too muchinside to be comfortable.  I also felt that they did not offer much support.  Note that I am NOT an athlete and didn't planon using these for running - just good ol' walking from place to place. They didn't feel like they would last long, andthe sliding was very annoying!  It wasn't just the width - I had ordered these and a pair in D width to check. I had the slidingproblem in both pairs of shoes simply because of the liner material.  Maybe a really thick pair of socks would help,but I really don't like thick socks, so that option was out.I returned them and went with a pair from New Balance.

We only buy SafeCat cat collars, because the latch is not so hard.I really do NOT recommend buying any cat collar that uses those black rectangular latches... those are meant forsmall dogs, who have a lot more neck strength than cats do.  Odds are good that if your cat got caught on a branchwith one of the black latch collars, they'd be stuck and subject to harm. The SafeCat latches are easier for cats to break away from.Our cats are indoor cats, but I buy reflective collars for our little girl, who sometimes likes to try to sneak out of the door.She hates it when she's out there and wants right back in, but just in case... I wanted something safe for her.  We normally takethe bells off, but this time, we left it on.  I have to say, it is completely for our own amusement, because our girl cat hates to be held, detained or otherwise blocked in any way at all. We have said her name should have been Houdini, because we swear she can be downstairs and if you turn around, she's sitting on the bed upstairs beside you, and you never heard her or saw her come up the stairs. The bell, however, announces some of her activity!  She hates being heard!  Ha!  It gives our other cat a warning before he gets pounced on as well.She is trying her best to walk in a way that the bell makes no sound, but we hear her bounding down the stairs now, as well as coming back up at breakneck speeds.  We might take it off at some point, but it has been amusing to hear her as she comes up, and see her face when we look her way.  She likes being anonymous! Ha!Anyway, you just cannot get a better collar for your cat than Safe Cat.  They come in many designs, so if you don't like this one, just look for some others.  The blue looks cute on her (she's a tortie), although we would have preferred black.  They were out when we ordered.(I think Safe Cat has even saved her life INSide the house too. She tries to climb everywhere and on everything.  She was missing her collar one day, and we finally found it about a month later behind our washing machine. She had apparently been climbing around and slid behind the machine among the hoses.  She could have strangled if she had some other type of collar on, but Safe Cat released for her and she was able to climb out by herself.

I've bought several hose nozzles this year, trying to find one that works as well as the old ones used to. They're all "new and improved" yet can't seem to do the job as well. I was really happy to get this one and find that it is not only has lots of options, but it actually works well. It's made of steel and has an enamel coating that makes it not only attractive but protects it from rusting. The rubbery grip is a nice feature and provides comfort when you're using it for long periods. The metal trigger is strong yet very easy to pull. There are 10 different settings and a knob that adjusts the flow pressure. That's something different that isn't on all nozzles. I've had nozzles with a variety of sprays, but often that just means a lot of irregular spray patterns. Not so with this one. They really have put thought into the design, and they offer a customer satisfaction guarantee. My husband has been frustrated with our last few nozzles. This one he loves.

I love the way these sunglasses fit. They're comfortable even after hours of use. I like the fact that they wrap around your face and keep the wind out. That's important to me, as dust and wind tend to bother my hard contact lenses. They're attractive and seem very sturdy. I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5 because I feel they are too dark. I actually have a hard time driving with them and even taking walks with my dog. I'm not sure if it's the overly-dark lenses or if the lenses don't provide enough contrast. Whatever it is, I usually only wear them if my husband is doing the driving. I can't see clearly in these, and I don't seem to have that problem with any other sunglasses. Again, I'm not sure what the problem is. I was offered these in exchange for an honest review, and I hope I've provided that.

This is a really nice, complete sewing kit for all those quick repairs. It includes a small pair of scissors, sewing needles, thread, measuring tape, safety pins, thimble, seam ripper, fabric marker, a few buttons, straight pins, snap fasteners, and a little pin cushion. It's all zipped up in a cute purple case. I'm putting this in a shoebox with other items for Operation Christmas Child with Samaritan's Purse. This would be perfect to include in the gift box for a teenage girl. Everything she might need to repair a button or sew up a torn garment.

This is the perfect solution for carrying all the basic necessities when I take my dog out for a walk. My iPhone 4s is a must of course, and that fits it either of the two zip-open compartments. I also like to lock my door and take my house keys and carry a plastic "doggie doo" bag. Everything fits in this little armband case, and it straps firmly and securely to my upper arm. I've tried a couple of these before and found that they tend to slip down my arm as I'm walking. I haven't had that problem with this one. I think it's because the band is a full 2 inches wide and has strong velcro. This is easy to adjust and would fit most people's arms, including men's. I measured the interior pocket, and it looks like any phone up to 5 1/2 inches would probably fit. The exterior looks pretty water resistant, and the side against your skin (if you were to have bare arms) is a soft neoprene. An overall good design for runners or dog walkers alike.

This is a seriously sharp looking men's watch. Classy, stylish, yet still casual enough for everyday wear. The face is quite large and easy to read, but the "numbers" are dashes and therefore not at all gaudy. The gold tone is almost a slight rose gold, very rich looking. The band is 3/4 inch calfskin leather in a croc-embossed design. Day and date are easy to set by pulling the crown out just slightly and turning either forward or backward. You set the time by pulling the crown all the way out. There's a thin layer of plastic protecting the entire face and back of the watch until ready for use. It has a mineral crystal window which is large, flat, and clear. I've had this for a couple of weeks now, and it has kept perfect time. This watch arrives in a beautiful black and taupe colored box sitting on a pillow. There's an instruction manual and a nice matching gift bag. This would make a wonderful gift.

I have to say that in the past I haven't really been that concerned with the need to "prepare" for disaster. But times have changed. With so much being said about the possibility of cyber attacks and what it would mean to our communities, I'm reconsidering. I've recently been reading up on some very basic ways to plan for short-term periods with no electricity...perhaps up to two weeks. Lack of clean water is a concern. Without getting into all the details, suffice it to say that having a means by which we can turn lake water into drinking water could be a blessing. So when this company offered me a discounted sample of their LifeStraw water purifier in exchange for an honest review, I was thrilled.This unit is very compact when empty. It can easily be placed in a backpack for hiking, suitcase for travel to other countries, or stored in your car in case of an emergency and need for water. I have the 12 liter (3.17 gallons) purifier which is a nice size, not too heavy to handle. It's a simple gravity fed operation using no electricity and no chemicals. The filtered water exceeds EPA drinking water standards removing 99.99% of bacteria, viruses, and protozoa. That means E. coli, rotavirus, hepatitis A, giardia, and cryptosporidium. In case of a sudden interruption in water supply, I know I can run down to my local lake and filter myself and my family enough drinking water to keep us going for some time. That's peace of mind to me.As if that isn't enough, for each filter purchased, LifeStraw will provide one school child in Africa with safe drinking water for an entire school year. Look it up on the internet.  FollowtheLiters.com  I love companies that not only make a product to improve the world, but make a difference in a child's life as well.

This laptop cooler is exactly what my husband needed to keep his laptop from overheating. He had a larger one made of metal that sat at a slant and was somewhat heavy. It did the job well, but it wasn't easy to take along when he traveled. This cooling pad is made of plastic and is amazingly lightweight. It's quite thin and actually fits in his laptop case with his computer. There are two fans that run quietly, which is great for when he watches movies. The unit is powered by the laptop using a USB cord. The pad can lay flat or sit at an angle with legs up. The USB cord is included. He likes this unit much better than his more expensive one. I received this unit in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that my husband is thrilled with the product.

This has been the perfect lamp for a number of uses. Now that I'm in my 60s, I find that even reading glasses leave me struggling to see small print and small items if the lighting isn't good. This has been so helpful for removing and replacing small screws in things, fixing broken jewelry, doing puzzles, light sewing,  reading the small print in manuals, etc. My granddaughter and I are planning to start doing more scrapbooking, and she likes to make earrings. This will be wonderful for that as well. I use the light and magnifier more often than the clamp, but my husband has used the clamp to hold small wires that needed soldered together. It's hard to hold  two wires together long enough by hand, so this makes things easy. So many uses!

Blueberry Pet makes really quality pet products, and this collar is no exception. It's soft and very heavily padded. The colors and patterns are always so bright. I have the black and multicolored one with lime green latches. One thing I have to note is that the color itself has such a heavily padded fabric that it's a little difficult to adjust because you have to squeeze the fabric through the clips.  I ordered the small and still needed to adjust it down a bit. By the time I did so, the collar was extremely thick. For this reason, I feel this is an absolutely wonderful collar for a larger dog. You have a nicely padded neckpiece without the extra bulk that you have when cinching it down for a small dog. I still have to give it five stars for excellent quality, because when I extend it out completely, the bulk isn't an issue. I think it would help if the plastic latch and adjustments were a bit bigger to allow for the heavy collar fabric to move through more easily. Anyway, I'm planning on donating this sturdy collar to my local Humane Society. My dog already has an adorable Blueberry Pet collar with a Christmas theme. Love their products!

My husband is really picky about what kind of wallet he'll carry and tends to use the same one till it literally falls apart. He likes something simple and slender...not bulky. This wallet is perfect for him. It's an attractive medium brown. It's closed dimensions are about 4 1/4 x 3 1/4 inches and about 7/8 inches thick when loaded. There are 8 pockets for credit cards/IDs, two long pockets for bills and checks, and pockets underneath the card slots as well. There's a flap that lifts up to reveal a framed slot for your driver's license. Holds everything he needs while still remaining slim. On top of all that, it's great to know that it has the RFID blocking protection...something we really hadn't thought much about until recently when somebody tried to use my credit card information to make a big purchase. Guess I'll need to carry one of these in my purse as well.

These are cute little plastic clips with a strong grip. I've had small and large clips that snap right in half easily. I took one of these Attmu clips and opened it over and over about 40 times (till my fingers tired), and it never broke. These are made to last. They come in a clear plastic jar with a screw-on lid. A great addition to your craft table. I plan to give some of them to my granddaughter for making jewelry. They're the perfect size for small projects. The backs are flat, so I tried gluing small magnets to a few of them and put them on my frig for hanging notes. That worked great, and they looked cute.My plan for the ones I keep are for Christmas. These are going to be just what I need to secure my keepsake ornaments to the Christmas tree. Every year I lose at least one that gets knocked off the tree, usually by the cat, no matter how carefully I think I've hung them. These strong clips will no doubt hold them securely and yet be small enough to not be seen.I was happy to receive these at a large discount in exchange for an honest review.

Well this LED light was snapped up instantly by my husband the minute he saw it on the kitchen table. He informed me that this was EXACTLY what he needed to work on his truck. He pointed out the magnets on the bottom and back that will hold it in place to free up his hands. He also pointed out that the light can be adjusted to a variety of angles, again just what he needed. The 32 LEDs are very bright, and there's a flashlight mode on the end for more direct light. There's also an emergency flashing mode if the need arises. He installed three AAA batteries (not included) and headed to the garage. I can say that he was very happy with the brightness, adjustability, and weight. The magnets were his favorite feature. Mine too. I didn't have to come hold a flashlight for him. (-:I was happy to receive this light in exchange for an unbiased and honest review.

These Glow Sticks are going to make great prizes at our local church's annual Harvest Party. The prizes for the games are usually candy...which children love, but it's fun to offer something more. Children  LOVE glow stick necklaces, and a bonus is the safety feature of making costumes more visible in the dark during trick-or-treating. For those people who like to find alternatives to candy to hand out  to your door-to-door trick-or-treaters, these would be perfect.There are 50 of them in a heavy cardboard tube, and there's a bag of connectors for making each stick into a necklace. You snap the wand in several places to "activate" it. I activated one about 8 p.m. last evening, and it was still glowing at 6 a.m. this morning...just not quite as bright. My husband pointed out that it was still glowing softly at 3 this afternoon. So your children will have plenty of enjoyment from their necklaces. I have a rather large neck, and the size was plenty big for me. A small child won't even have to disconnect the connector to remove it from over their head. It's safe of course, because the plastic connector would come apart if the necklace got caught on something.I was happy to receive these glow sticks in exchange for an honest review.

I've found these small garbage bags to be so useful. I use them for garbage of course, and they fit the cans in my bathroom, office, bedroom, and laundry room. The plastic is heavier than those flimsy, fly-away bags that are hard to put in the trash can...like the ones they use in hotel rooms. These maintain their shape and stay in place. But here are a few more ways I use these little bags:I keep some in each car to collect the garbage that always seems to accumulate.I use them when I clean the kitty litter box.I put my shoes in a bag before packing them in my suitcase to keep my clothing clean.I bag shampoo and other liquids when traveling just in case of a leak.I take one along with a paper towel to scoop the poop when walking my dog around the neighborhood.I cover packages of meat in the frig when thawing to prevent drips.They're perfect for wrapping up that diaper for disposing of later (though I don't have diapers around anymore).I was happy to receive these at a large discount in exchange for an honest review. I use them ALL the time, and I'm happy with the product.

This daypack is a wonderful example of a company putting lots of thought into creating a pack that provides everything you need to carry a days worth of goods and keep it safe. Theres plenty of room for books, files, a laptop...whatever you carry with you to work or school. Its all protected by good padding and sturdy clips and zippers.The fabric is a combination of polyester and Dupont Kevlar. Kevlar is a synthetic fiber of high tensile strength used especially as a reinforcing agent in the manufacture of tires and other rubber products and protective gear such as helmets and vests. That would account for the anti-slash/anti-puncture quality. Each heavy-duty zipper is covered by a fabric shield that helps keep rain out and also makes it difficult for anyone to see where the openings in the pack are. Theres a large fabric shield that covers the opening of the main compartment. It would be a challenge for anyone to try to get into your pack without you noticing it while youre wearing it.For added security, you have three combination locks. Two of the locks have a TSA key access so that the airlines can access your bag if you check it during flights. These locks secure both large compartments of your pack. The third lock is a cable lock that allows you to lock your pack to a stationary object. Note: Pull the lock all the way out of the pocket so you can access both buttons to operate and reset the combination. Obviously someone with cable cutters could cut through this if they really wanted to, but this is intended for situations where you might want to leave your pack for a few minutes in a low-theft situation. For example, this is going to be absolutely perfect for my husband to use when he travels by Amtrak train a few times a year. He always has a carry-on bag that holds his laptop and other essentials. When he needs to use the restroom or run up to the dining car for coffee and will be away from his seat for a few minutes, he usually has to haul his carry-on with him unless he feels pretty confident that he can trust the people seated around him. This pack is going to allow him to lock up all his compartments and also cable lock the whole thing to his seat. You could do the same thing on a plane, allowing you to go to the restroom without worrying about leaving your bag behind. These locks are a GREAT feature.There are other handy mesh pockets for water bottles and larger phones (on the sides) and also two small pockets on the outside next to your body that could hold frequently used credit cards or a smaller phone. The shoulder pads are lightly padded, and theres a top handle for easy carrying. The shoulder straps are adjustable and curved to fit properly around your shoulder blades. They really have thought of everything.I also have to make note that according to the tags on the pack, this company has joined together with the African Children's fund to help support a campaign to get children back into school and have the opportunity to provide a better life for them and their families. Numinous Packs provides 15 school meals for the most vulnerable children in Africa for every Numinous backpack bought at retail. These packs appear to be from London, and the charity is a United Kingdom charity that Im not familiar with. However, I think the donation is a good cause worth mentioning.I was very excited to be offered the opportunity to review this daypack in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I have to say, I couldnt have asked for a better made or more secure travel pack.

This is a nice set of dry face paints. I point out that these are dry because I've used some that are soft and wet and never actually dry enough on the face to keep from smearing. These start out dry and you add just enough water to your brush or sponge to make them glide on easily. Then they dry quickly and stay in place with a matte finish. I tried them out on my hand, but I plan to give these to my grandchildren to use for "spirit week" at school. I'm sure they'll use what's left for Halloween.The set has 9 very bold colors and a bonus silver glitter paint that I've never seen in previous kits. There are two brushes, one about a quarter inch wide and the other a fine point for more detailed work. There are three sponges, about 1 1/4 inches in diameter, that rinse out easily.The quality and coverage are very good. I was happy to receive this set in exchange for an honest review, and I'm very happy with the product.

This is the first time I've ever used ceramic knives. I read up on them to understand the difference between these and regular stainless knives. Basically you just have to remember that these are made out of a zirconium oxide powder that is pressed with 300 tons of pressure into a knife mold, thereby making the blade. For this reason, you have to be careful not to cut into hard things like bones or frozen foods, and you can't use it to pry open things or smash hard spices. The blade is more fragile and can begin to develop chips. These are intended for slicing and chopping fruits and vegetables.The first thing I did was grab a tomato and begin slicing. This is always my way of testing the sharpness of a knife. Amazingly it sliced a nearly paper-thin slice with ease. I was impressed. I can't imagine these knives will be this sharp forever, but I'm going to enjoy it while it lasts. Each knife comes with a thick and sturdy blade sheath, much better than the flimsy cardboard that usually comes with even very expensive knives. That totally surprised me, and I think that is a smart feature. I was offered this set in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that I'm happy with the quality and sharpness of this product and feel that this is a great buy for this price.

It's hard to describe how beautiful this set of prints is, as the pictures here can't do them justice. I was amazed at the color, the weight, the perfect framing, the work that went into making this wall art something anyone would be happy to hang in their home or office. Each section was individually and carefully wrapped so that it arrived in excellent shape. Not a crease or dent in any panel. The set is exact in size with corners that are perfectly square so that the three pieces make up a gorgeous continuous picture. You wouldn't expect such quality at this price. I have another picture in blue colors that would look great with this. Same water theme with adirondack chairs. I've decided to redecorate a room just so I can use these. The scene here is so peaceful. They've included three hangers for you to attach to the frames. These hangers are small, but each print is rather lightweight so they would probably be strong enough.I was absolutely thrilled to receive this set of prints in exchange for an honest review. I can sincerely say that they've exceeded anything I would have anticipated receiving. You won't be disappointed in any way if you order these prints.

My husband and I have tried many different types of iPhone 4s cases including the waterproof Otterbox and the bare minimum cases. This case is what we keep going back to. We each have one. It's simply easy to use, convenient, durable, and does just what we need. It protects our phones from drops on our tile floor, provides pockets for credit cards and/or driver's license, an extra pocket for a check or currency, and a magnetic closure. It looks good and fits in our pockets. The PU leather is smooth and durable. I was offered this case in exchange for an honest review and jumped at it because I knew it was our favorite style. Just perfect.

This retractable tape lease is heavy duty, strong, and well made. It's perfect for larger dogs. I have a small/medium size dog, and it's a bit oversized for what I need. That doesn't mean I don't use it, because it does work well. You would have good control of even the largest pet. The tape is wide and flows smoothly. I prefer these tape leashes to the skinny ropes, as I've gotten "rope burn" more than once with the others. That's never happened with this one. The button to lock and release is easy to reach and use. The 16 ft leash allows for lots of room to sniff around. I was offered this leash in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that the product is very well made, very sturdy, and of good design. You won't be disappointed.

This is my new favorite way to label things around the house. In particular, I keep items in shoe-box size (and larger) plastic containers, things like medicines, cleaning rags, soaps and other toiletries, craft supplies, candles, etc. Many of the containers aren't clear, so it's hard to identify what's in them sometimes. Labeling them with masking tape works, but it doesn't look very tidy. These labels actually decorate up my containers a bit, and I can wipe them clean and relabel as needed. I also have some Tupperware containers that hold large quantities of flour, sugar, and other pantry items. I've relabeled those using these chalkboard labels too. I think these would be a great gift for your favorite teachers and would be so useful in the classroom. I was offered these labels at a discount in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that these are a very handy, easy to use, and attractive way to label things.

I have gray hair that has become somewhat coarse over the years. I hate to use conditioning shampoos, because my hair is also thinning and I need all the added body I can get. I was reluctant to try anything with the word "oil" in it for fear it would leave my thin hair even flatter than it already is. To my surprise, this shampoo and conditioner not only made my coarse, dry hair feel soft, it still left me with some "lift" at the roots. I love the tea tree fragrance which is mild and refreshing. The bottles are a classy brown with large pump tops, making it easy to use. The bottles are also wide and sturdy, not easily knocked over. I appreciate that, as some bottles are tall and skinny and fall over when you try to pump them. I was offered a discount on this set in exchange for an honest review and can say that I am thoroughly enjoying using them.

I was surprised at the quality of this silicone cutting board. It's a full 1/4 inch thick, heavy, and sturdy. They say you can fold it to store it, but this heavy-duty board is really too thick for that. I just slide mine behind my toaster oven, and it's always ready to grab. There's a narrow channel all around the surface to catch any runoff. A tab for hanging is on one end, and a built-in handle is on the other. Both sides can be used for cutting. I've been using mine daily with very sharp knives for a few weeks now, and I can barely even tell I've used it. It's what you would call self-healing. It cleans up faster and better than any other type of cutting board I've owned, and I've owned them all. No stains, no odors. Easy to wash and easy to rinse. You can put it in the dishwasher, but it's so easy to sponge clean that I've never had to. They included two basting brushes made of acrylic handles and silicone brushes. I was offered this cutting board in exchange for an unbiased review. I can say that I've put away my others and use this one exclusively now. Nice product!

This is the first piece of silicone bakeware that I've owned, and I love the way it works. I made corn muffins in it the other day. They turned out perfectly with NO burnt bottoms. I was really impressed with the ease of cleaning. My muffin tins are so hard to wash. I soak them and then put them in the dishwasher. They still come out crusty, so I have to wash them by hand again. Not this silicone. It comes clean without even soaking. I decided to make some mini meatloaves in it, and again they turned out great. I was always reluctant to make them because of the difficulty with cleanup. This is so much easier. I realize you have to make the added step of putting it on a baking sheet for stability, but that's a  small effort for so much less work. I also like that I can "toss" this silicone bakeware under my cupboard and its flexibility allows it to fit anywhere. An overall great product. I was happy to receive this muffin pan in exchange for an honest review.

These are wonderful headphones that not only have a classy look to them but have awesome sound. How do I know? Not because I know a lot about earphones, but because my teenage granddaughter does. She's used every kind available from expensive to cheap, full size to tiny, wired and wireless. I gave these to her to try out, and these are the ones she ALWAYS looks for now. The sound is excellent. The cord is plenty long. There are three extra ear piece cover sets in a variety of sizes. My granddaughter is like me in that neither of us can stand large ear buds. They are literally painful to us. These ear buds are so comfortable because they are small and the covers are a very soft, flexible, rubbery material. These earphones arrive in a beautiful box appropriate for gift giving, and there's a sturdy round zippered case to keep them in so they don't get tangled in your purse or pocket. Just an overall nice product. I was thrilled to be given this set in exchange for an honest review.

It took me four months to get around to writing a review for this watch. But on the plus side, I'm able to say that it hasn't lost a minute of time yet. I checked it with my computer then, and it's still accurate to the minute.
