And before I forget to mention it, my husband pointed out that this is a great watch for men who do either mechanical or electrical work. The fact that the body of it is made of resin and the band of a nylon fabric means no "spark" to short anything out. He knows from experience, but that's another story. My husband says the wide nylon band is really comfortable because the pressure of the band is spread over a larger surface area than your average metal band. The velcro closure is easy on and off.Besides those good points, I can say it's packed with all the bells and whistles. Huge easy-to-read time numbers, large day and date, continuous countdown seconds, alarm, regular and military time choices, and blue back-lit numbers for reading in the dark. It's supposed to be water resistant to 330 feet. Pretty amazing if you like to shower, swim, or snorkel with your watch on.  It's attractive enough for a man to wear yet sporty enough for a teenage boy. Very classy and masculine. I was offered this watch in exchange for an honest review, and I can say this is a very well made, feature loaded, attractive piece.

What a great all-around sport watch. I love the soft rubbery resin band that fits so comfortably and feels good all day long. The metal on the buckle closure is flat and never feels bulky. I have an average size wrist, and there are four extra holes left, so a person with a large wrist would probably have no problem wearing this. The face is large but not overly large, and the digital numbers are black and easy to read. It has all the best features like the day of the week (a bit too small for my old eyes), the day of the month (much bigger), seconds that continuously count down unless being used as a stop watch, an alarm, and my favorite feature....backlit numbers for seeing what time it is in the dark. I LOVE that feature. The goldtone rings that surround the face give it a little dressier look. It's supposed to be water resistant to 330 feet so you can shower, swim, and snorkel with it on. I haven't tried any of that, but it's a great feature for those who would need it. I received this watch four months ago, and it's still absolutely accurate to the minute.  I was offered this watch in exchange for an honest review. I'm happy to say that this is a totally awesome watch that feels great on and is perfect for active women and girls who want a watch that can do it all and still look great.

This is a really lovely watch that is simple in design but elegant enough for dressier occasions. The oblong face is large enough to easily read. The bracelet is a smooth link style with a clasp that lays flat on my wrist with no bulky feel. There's an extension clasp attached that is easily removed for smaller wrists or if you prefer a tighter fit. Even though I'm a large person, my wrist is of average size. With the extension link, the bracelet fits loosely, so women with large wrists would probably find this a perfect fit. I decided to remove the link to keep it from sliding around. The face is a soft silvery tone, and the number marks are goldtone. There's a small genuine diamond in the "12" location. The case, band, and bezel are all made of brass. The two-tone is just beautiful, and the yellow gold color is soft making for a muted, barely noticeable, contrast. I've had this watch for almost 4 months now, and the time is accurate to the minute. It's supposed to be water resistant to 165 feet for swimming and showering, but I haven't tested that. I don't do either with a watch on, but that would be pretty convenient for those who do. It comes in a nice brown box with cream colored lining and is presented on a fat, fluffy "pillow" with a small instruction booklet tucked neatly in a pocket on the underside. I was offered this watch in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that this watch is truly beautiful, quality made, and absolutely accurate in time keeping.

When I received this bulb in the mail, I was pleased to see that it was relatively small. I had hoped it would fit under the glass shade of my bedroom desk lamp, and it does. Some color-changing bulbs are so large that you're limited to where you can use them. I love turning off my bedroom light at night and having this soft light glowing in the dark. It's fun to put it in the color-changing and strobe modes, but I like to go to sleep with a steady soft color. This would be a really nice bulb for a child's room. You could let her/him pick their "sleep color" each night, and the color-changing mode would lull them to sleep.The remote is handy for changing the settings or turning it off silently without waking anyone up. At first I thought my remote didn't work, but then I realized there was a plastic strip in the battery compartment that needed to be removed for connection. Be sure to look for that. The LED bulb is sturdier than your typical incandescent bulb. I even dropped it on my dresser, and it still worked. This is a nice product that I was happy to receive in exchange for an unbiased review. I'm happy to say that it's a quality product and I use it every day.

This set of filament for 3D pens arrived just in time to try out with my new pen. I was thrilled with the selection of colors. I put my creative granddaughter to work on trying it out, and she was able to make some adorable items like a small vase with flowers, some spiders, etc. This filament worked very well and melted appropriately. It actually goes a long way. The pen was from a different seller, and unfortunately it was not a quality 3D pen. It clogged and eventually broke. I'm planning on purchasing something of higher and sturdier quality and look forward to using this filament for more creative fun. I was happy to be offered this filament set in exchange for an honest review and can say that it worked well. Just wish my pen would have too.

The megaphones this company makes are of surprisingly good quality.  They're sturdy and heavy, not just a cheap piece of plastic. The handle folds down, and there's a nylon strap attached. Batteries are super easy to install by pushing a small button and opening the back of the unit, but it's difficult enough that a very small child probably wouldn't accidentally open it. There are two easy-to-use buttons; one for the siren and an on/off button for the megaphone. Voice sound is loud and clear, and the siren is plenty loud.  There's a volume control wheel to tone things down a bit. The police megaphone is just as cute, realistic, and well made.The only thing I would change is the strap attached to the handle. It would be better if this strap would unclip so that you could remove it when letting very young children play with it. They most likely will put the looped strap over their head to hand it around their neck. I definitely feel this could be a choking hazard and would cut the strap off. It won't affect the appearance or performance in any way.I was offered this really cool toy megaphone in exchange for an honest review and would certainly buy this item for a child's gift or a fun addition to an adult costume.

I gave these earphones to my grandchildren (both 14 years old, boy and girl) to try out, since they've used many pairs of gaming headsets. I asked them a few questions and will post them here.First, I asked how they liked the color (white). My granddaughter loved the white; my grandson was fine with it too. I was surprised since I assumed a 14-year-old boy would prefer black. My granddaughter pointed out that she especially liked the blue lights on each headpiece ("they're cool"). There's a USB plug that provides power just to those lights.I asked them the headset felt. Both said that they are very comfortable ear pieces and the foam on the head piece makes it easy to wear for a long time. They're also lightweight which they liked.They've used some very expensive headsets and yet said that the sound in these were good. Their friends had no trouble hearing them on the other end. Keep in mind that some laptops don't have microphone ports, so if you're buy these for a gift, you'll want to make sure that the recipient has a computer with both audio and microphone ports, which is of course why this is a "gaming" headset.Since these aren't the same quality of some $250 gaming headsets, I would normally give them 4 stars. But considering the price of these is so low, I'm giving it 5 stars for excellent value..

When I received this motion sensor light, I was surprised at how small it was...only about 7 1/2 inches long by 1 1/4 inches wide. What was more surprising was just how much light this little thing put out. It has 10 bright LED bulbs that can completely light up a closet. It can also shed a decent amount of light on a larger area, such as a laundry room, when you just need to go in and out without the need for complete lighting.I like the idea of using LED lights in tight spaces, such as closets. Regular incandescent lighting puts out heat from a hot bulb, and I've always felt uncomfortable having a heated element such as that so close to my clothing or linens. No problem with these LED lights as they produce no heat.It's simple to operate. Just insert 4 AAA batteries in the slide-open door at the end and mount the sticky tape wherever you'd like. That's it. When the infrared sensor senses any movement, the light comes on and continues to stay on till no movement is detected. I counted about 14 to 15 seconds between the time I opened my closet door and the time the light went out.One nice feature is that the light is actually attached to the sticky strip by a magnet. This allows you to remove it for replacing batteries. It also lets you use the light like a portable flashlight if you need to. You could also just sit the light anywhere in the closet without using the strip. The aluminum case is heavy, sturdy, and feels well made.I was offered a sample of this light in exchange for an honest review, and I would recommend this product to anyone who would like some automatic lighting in enclosed, dark areas.

There's nothing better than a long soak in a hot bath, and these bath bombs make it just that much more elegant. I love to drop one of these in the water and watch it fizzle away, faintly coloring the water and adding a gentle fragrance I can enjoy while I relax. There are six fragrances to choose from, and you pick the one to match your mood. I took a morning bath a few days ago, something I rarely do, and chose the coconut lime for a pick-me-up. These bath bombs make the water feel silky and leave the same feeling on your skin --- not greasy, just silky. When I'm  just soaking in the tub, I rinse off in the shower afterward, but I don't use soap. When I dry off, my skin still feels moisturized. I received this set in exchange for an honest review, and I can say I've thoroughly enjoyed using these bath bombs. They are nicely packaged and would make a beautiful gift.

This is a nicely made jump rope offered at a very reasonable price. Since it's advertised as being for kids (as well as adults), I like the fact that it has lightweight soft handles. One of the things I've found kids are tempted to do with jump ropes is grab the rope and swing the handles around, and that means an occasional smack in the face or shin. These handles are a lot safer in that regard, and they provide a great grip. The counter in the handle seems pretty accurate, but I can only jump a few jumps and therefore can't tell you if it stays accurate for long workouts. A big plus is the fact that you can easily adjust the length of the rope at each handle if you need to. A good feature for growing children. I was happy to receive a sample in exchange for an honest review.

This is a beautiful copper mug that holds 16 ounces of cold beverage. The metal is "hammered" for that old colonial look. The handle is somewhat squared off and plenty large. I love the way ice cold water tastes in metal cups...just like those old aluminum tumblers of various colors we drank out of in the 50s. The high-gloss shine is most likely protected by a coating that, when washed off, would allow the copper to eventually develop a natural tarnish. I'm planning on keeping my mug for decorative use, so I won't wash off the protective coating. I was happy to receive this mug in exchange for an honest review, and I can say that it's a gorgeous, quality-made product. A set would make a wonderful gift.

This is a nice little recorder that looks exactly like a flash drive, easy to carry in your purse or pocket. It's so simple to use. When I push the button to "on" a red light comes on, blinks a couple of times, then goes off. Now it's recording. My voice sounds clear, not at all muffled. When I first got this, I thought it would have a play-back feature, thinking I could make a voice-recorded shopping list and take it along to the store. That is not the intended use for this. You do your recording, and then you plug it into your computer's USB port. I go to MY COMPUTER, Drive E, then open it in Windows Media Player. It stores it in a folder labeled RECORD, and you can rename or delete each recording as you see fit.I don't subscribe to recording people without their knowing it, so this won't be my "spy" recorder. I plan on carrying it with me so I can record things for my shopping list, to-do list, reminder dates, phone numbers, etc. I can pull it up at the end of each day and then write down all of those reminders.I received this recorder in exchange for an honest review, and I can say it does exactly what it's supposed to do...and does it well.

I have a number of retractable dog leashes and have found them to be so much nicer than a regular standard leash that is always getting tangled around my dog or my legs. I have a somewhat small 17 lb. dog, and this leash is not only adequate but probably more than I need. I have the medium size, but I could get by with a small. That said, however, I always choose to buy the larger retractable leashes because I feel they're stronger and more dependable. I have one leash that uses a cord. It's strong, but it also "snaps" back at a dangerous speed. I like the way this ribbon leash retracts at a slower speed when unhooked. The handle is big and sturdy and has a rubbery grip. The lock/unlock button slides smoothly and easily. The fluorescent yellow ribbon makes you very visible...a great idea. The clip is big, heavy, and sturdy...much more so than others I have. I could easily use this to walk my daughter's three labs.I know some people have concerns about using retractable leashes, and I do understand that. I don't feel that these leashes are a good option for children to use, because they may not react quickly enough when the dog they're walking decides to run into the street or after another animal or person. It's important to be aware of how these leashes operate and be prepared to control them. But I do feel they're an excellent option for adult dog walkers.I was happy to receive this leash in exchange for an honest review, and I can say this is the best one I've owned.

This oral irrigator is an attractive unit, white with a blue water reservoir. It stands about 7 1/2 inches tall and 11inches when the pick is attached. The base is plenty wide, so it doesn't tend to topple over at all. It can be filled by opening the small fill spout, but that is a bit slow. It's a lot faster to slide the water reservoir down and fill it that way. I like that it doesn't use batteries and instead is charged with the included wall adapter. But you can unplug the adapter cord to use it cordless. It's very simple to operate. You just push one of the two included water picks onto the unit, push the "mode" button (normal, soft, pulse), and then push the "on/off" button. I only use the "soft" mode, as that is plenty strong.I definitely feel this irrigator does a good job of cleaning the gums and between the teeth. It would be good for anyone with dentures as well. The water reservoir holds enough water to get the job done, if you get right to it. Sometimes I refill it for a better cleaning. I use warm tap water.The set comes with two water picks, each one with a different color band. It took very little time to charge. I've never used an oral irrigator before, so I can't compare it with other brands. I've always wanted one, so I was very happy to receive this one in exchange for an honest review. I'm giving it 5 stars because it's easy to use, is quite powerful, looks nice sitting on my sink, and is much more reasonably priced than others I've shopped for.

This little power bank is just the right size to carry along in your purse or even in your pocket. It came with a short micro-to-regular USB cord, so you can charge it using your laptop. I chose to plug it into a wall adapter (not included), and it charged very quickly. The only negative thing I could say about it is that the included cord is too short. It's fine for charging in the laptop, but it barely reaches a wall adapter and still be able to sit on a counter top. After charging it, I used it to charge my iPhone. It was super fast and didn't seem to drain the battery level at all. The two charging ports are a plus as well. I was happy to receive this product in exchange for an honest review. It's a nice small, lightweight power bank.

These sunflower shaped lights are one of the new sets of lights I've just started collecting, and I was happy to be offered these in exchange for an unbiased review. They're solar powered and are just perfect to decorate the bushes, railings, large planters, etc. around my yard. One of my favorite uses is to decorate my window flower baskets. Till now I've never been able to light up the flowers without using a battery-operated set of lights. The problem with those is they require constant replacement of batteries, so you have to remember to go out and turn them off each night. These solar lights have solved that problem. I can drape them around the basket, position the solar collector panel so that it's exposed to some sunlight during the day, and the lights come on all by themselves. In winter, I usually put spruce tips in the planters so they look like miniature Christmas trees. These lights are going to be perfect for decorating them. I plan to keep adding to my collection until my yard looks festive all year round.

These icicle lights are one of the new sets of lights I've just started collecting, and I was happy to be offered these in exchange for an unbiased review. They're solar powered and are just perfect to decorate the bushes, railings, large planters, etc. around my yard. One of my favorite uses is to decorate my window flower baskets. Till now I've never been able to light up the flowers without using a battery-operated set of lights. The problem with those is they require constant replacement of batteries, so you have to remember to go out and turn them off each night. These solar lights have solved that problem. I can drape them around the basket, position the solar collector panel so that it's exposed to some sunlight during the day, and the lights come on all by themselves. In winter, I usually put spruce tips in the planters so they look like miniature Christmas trees. These lights are going to be perfect for decorating them. I plan to keep adding to my collection until my yard looks festive all year round.

My granddaughter loves beef jerky, and in particular this brand. She has a broken front tooth that has been repaired with a dental bond, and I'm always concerned about buying her food that is hard or tough. In the past, she has broken the repair by eating hard candy. When I found these beef tender cuts, I knew that would be a great solution. She can eat to her heart's content, and I don't have to worry that I've given her something that might damage the repaired tooth due to tugging and pulling on regular jerky. This would also be a jerky that someone with dentures or even a lack of teeth could enjoy. That all said, the meat has a wonderful smokey flavor and is very tender. It's become my favorite as well.

My grandkids love these fruit strips, but they're pricey in the grocery store. I bought them here on Amazon's Prime Pantry at a much lower price. Schools these days frown upon kids bringing sugary treats in their lunches, so these are a great alternative. All nature ingredients...fruit and fruit juice. No preservatives, no sugar. Just great taste.

This is by far my husband's favorite version of King Kong. The story has humor, excitement, some danger, romance, and great special effects. It's fast moving, has good actors, and has dramatic settings. Kong is realistic, and the emotion between him and Ann Darrow (Naomi Watts) is believable. You can't help but shed a tear at his demise. A good one for our DVD collection.

I love the idea of these solar-powered LED string lights. I've started a collection of them and plan to decorate my whole yard. There's no need to worry about expensive batteries wearing out, and they're practically maintenance free. Just drape them around bushes, banisters, trellises, etc. Position the solar panel so that it catches some sunlight, and you have automatic decorative lighting at night. How can you beat that? Scattered about the yard, it gives a really festive feel to your evening outdoor parties. I haven't used them during the long Minnesota winters yet, but I plan to leave the up for Christmas this year and give them a try. I was happy to receive this sample set in exchange for an honest review.

This is a really nice makeup set in an attractive train case styple. It has an attractive faux leopard print with a bright pink interior lining. There's a nice big mirror on the inside of the lid, a carrying handle, and a loop/snap closure to keep it securely closed. Opening it up, you'll find three levels. On the top, there are 45 different eye shadows in blues, pinks, greens, grays, browns, and even off-white. They've included six double-ended foam shadow applicators along the sides. On the second level, there are 12 lip glosses ranging in deep red to pink (applicators included), two lipsticks, and two lip gloss wands. There are also two eyeliner pencils. The third level holds powder foundations and blush.They include a brush, but I tend to use dry sponges for this.There's a surprising amount of makeup in this case for the price, and it would make a great makeup starter kit for a teen. I was thrilled to receive a sample in exchange for an honest review, and I'm planning on giving this to our local theater group. They always have a need for quick "touch-ups" during their plays, and this little case would be so handy for that purpose. The case measures about 6 inches tall, 5 1/2 inches deep, and about 9 inches wide. Easy to travel with and doesn't take up much room on your dresser.

This is a very nice set of grooming clippers. It comes in a sturdy padded case that holds the clippers and four attachments for varying lengths of cut. They're quieter than other sets I've owned, and they feel and look well made. This is just what I needed for my cat. His hair gets terribly matted on his hindquarters in the summer when he starts shedding, and there's no way to comb it out. You just have to remove it. It cuts easily and smoothly. The long cord is a plus. I also like the fact that this company offers a 2-year warranty and a money-back guarantee. I was happy to receive this set in exchange for an unbiased review.

These bowls are just what I've been looking for to take along in our car, truck, and motorhome. I frequently find myself digging around trying to find something to put water in when we're traveling with our dog. I've even resorted to cupping my hand and pouring water into my palm. I didn't really want a bowl in the way all the time, so the fact that these collapse is awesome. I also use them to share my ice cream cone or fast food with my pet...yes, she's spoiled. They're also perfect for taking into a hotel. I've had no problems with them at all. They seem to be very durable, and I clean mine in the dishwasher.

I've used this little facial cleaning/massaging tool a couple of times now. It's such a small unit that I didn't expect it to have any power. I was surprised that it actually was able to spin the brushes and sponges as well as it does. I had no problem with it stopping if I put pressure on it. I have to assume that it might lose some of its power as the two AA batteries begin to drain.The attachments I tend to use the most are the make-up sponge and short soft brush. I wet the sponge/brush and then spin it on top of my bar of Dove soap. It picks up just the right amount of soap, and water doesn't run everywhere. I make this point because the tool is not waterproof or water resistant. For this reason you have to be sure not to use too much water. I also use the latex soft sponge to apply a facial cream all over my face and neck, and it's very gentle around the eyes on low speed.I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it does lack a few things. The design of the "on" button makes it difficult to push upward. I have to use my fingernail to move it. The fact that it isn't at least water resistant concerns me, because this is a product that is being used with water and it would be easy to get water into the battery compartment. It's not like you're going to get shocked from batteries or anything, but it could damage the unit. Finally, there are 7 attachments, and it would be nice if there was a small bag included to keep everything in. Still, at such a reasonable price, you can't expect high-end quality.That being said, I think this facial cleaner would be a great gift for a younger child/preteen. It's small, safe, cute, and inexpensive. I think it would encourage kids to take facial hygiene seriously...preferably before they end up with a face full of acne. You could include a small vinyl or plastic bag to keep all the parts in. Any girl would love the pink, but I think a younger boy would be fine using this if you bought the blue one. I would caution them about overdoing the polishing attachment and pumice stone, but the rest of the attachments are all soft.

I'm definitely "wow'd" by this book and this book took me on a journey to a world other than my own. It's honestly the perfect blend of suspense and romance and I can't get enough of it! There's so much involved when it comes to Guy and Gabriela and the author truly crafted a great story.

This book is full of twists and turns--it definitely kept me guessing throughout and it's one of those books that you just can't put down once you pick it up.  Lyle Howard has captured the quintessence of "thriller" and put it all in this book. I highly recommend this book and look forward to future installments!

I'm glad the author decided to continue with Zigi the Alien adventures and make it a series! Zigi is a cute, quirky alien from the planet Nepi who occasionally makes trips to visit Earth. This time, he has an alien cold... which can be cured by one thing Nepi doesn't have--chocolate! In this book, we follow him on his quest to look for chocolate to cure his cold. It's certainly a fun book for young kids, and they will fall in love with Zigi for sure. Excellent children's book with great illustrations.

Anxiety sucks, but it is definitely possible to overcome it. If you suffer from anxiety, this book can be tremendously helpful. I think Stephen Hunter knows a lot about this topic and knows the right advice to give. In this book, he gives plenty of helpful advice that can easily be implemented into your life, from diet, to exercise, to sleep habits. In particular, I liked the meditation method he put in this book--it's invaluable! I highly recommend this book.

I think nowadays people have the misconception that ONLY going to the doctor's and taking medication will help with depression--as this book shows us, that is not the case all of the time. There are very simple things that you yourself can do at home and implement into your everyday life to overcome depression and feel happier. Things like being active (exercising), being grateful, being creative--can all improve your lives. This is a great book to check out if you have a loved one suffering from depression, or if you have it yourself. I think this book contains some great tips to increase your happiness overall.

I felt like I could really connect with this book, as a classical musician myself! However, whether you are a complete classical music fan, or just someone who enjoys music, Lost Symphony is an accessible book to all. Krissy's love and passion for music really shines through the pages, and I love how the author managed to incorporate elements of romance, history, and even a tad bit of adventure into this novel. A treat for sure.

"A DWI arrest is often the only time law abiding people will get into trouble." With that being said, it's obviously terrifying to be put in that situation and overwhelming to try to figure out what to do next. Andre Belanger really breaks it all down for us in this book (including answering some frequently asked questions), and since he is a lawyer, it's definitely credible. At the same time, though, everything broken down into accessible terms for us. I learned quite a lot from this book; I think it is an invaluable guide and a must have for anyone who is involved in a DWI case or knows someone who is.

Reading this book is like sitting down and chatting with a good friend. The author, Jacki Flynn, talks to her readers exactly like that. Her tone is down to earth, easy to understand, and as I was reading, I really get the feeling of "she's been there, she GETS this." She offers lots of helpful advice about what to do, what to say to those around you who are clinically depressed. What helps, what does not--for those who have never experienced depression, this can be tremendously helpful. I definitely recommend this if you know someone or love someone who is clinically depressed.

Quite a satisfying read with plenty of characters and plenty of action. You most definitely won't be bored while reading this book, and though it was a bit on the longer side than what I typically read, it felt shorter to me because I felt like I was IN the book. It's really a great blend of sci fi, fantasy, and military--I've never read anything quite like this, and it was a very pleasant experience for sure! Highly recommended for anyone who's feeling up for a bit of adventure.

This product works great and is overall, a fantastic purchase. I use it with my macbook and now it has many more USB outlets for me to use. I use it to charge my devices as well as work through an external hard drive, and it's been very useful. I also found it to be light and compact so it's easy to put into my laptop bag.

Ann Gimpel is a fantastic author and her writing skills truly shine in Highland Secrets. For those who enjoy elements of folklore, such as dragons, seers, Celtic gods and goddesses--this is a fantastic book to check out! I really loved Gimpel's vivid writing and she definitely brought the characters to life for me. I thought the plot was very original and the romance element in this book is to die for. I can't wait to read the next installment of this series!

I bought this for my sister's son for his third birthday and he absolutely loves it. What better way to start fostering a child's love for music? It has lots of features and sound effects that will keep a child entertained, and it's definitely a great addition to any play space!

This case fits my phone perfectly and I LOVE the fact that it doesn't make the phone feel super bulky. It also allows access to all the functions and ports, unlike another case I've tried in the past. I also really liked the sheet protector that came with it too, and it was very easy to apply. I'm feeling pretty good now that my phone is protected from drops--great case for a great price.

This was a very easy read--certainly easy to get into and enjoy, and it's one of those light reads that you can easily pick up and get through in a couple hours. In Cowboy Alpha Billionaire Bad Boy, Morgan Pierce is to gain her late-aunt's entire fortune. There's one catch, though: she must work there for five years. We meet Clay Walker, and their relationship was clearly established in the beginning scenes--it was incredibly fun to watch it all unravel. Can't wait for more from this author!

This book is my kind of humor! I wasn't sure about it at first, but after finishing the first essay, the author's got me chuckling. I think my favorite has to be "How do you complete a sex goal?" It's pretty unique and unconventional--not something you'd find in a typical book (not even a comical one). Honestly fantastic; great for anyone with a good sense of humor!

I've been following this series for a while now, and I've enjoyed every one. Shirleen Davies knows how to bring the old west to life, and you would feel like you've traveled, with the characters, to the frontier. I think the Redemption Mountain series is as good as historical romance gets: a vivid setting, memorable characters, love, and lots at stake. I especially loved Lena, and I thought that her past was written well--gave her a lot of depth. Another great book from Shirleen Davies and I hope there will be more to come!

This is a really refreshing book in the "mystery/thriller" genre, and I'm glad I picked it up. I found this book to be unique because it didn't quite start off like the books that I've been reading recently that are also in this genre! Instead of presenting the story first with an intense, high-adrenaline incident, the book started off relatively calmly--a meeting between Max Bowman, ex-CIA agent, and a client--Barry Filer. I actually quite liked this kind of mellow narrative for the beginning--there's a lot more opportunities for the suspense to build up, and once it does, it has a LOT more impact than the books that give it all away in the introductory chapters. Not to mention, this all gives the author plenty of time to flesh out the characters. In the beginning of the book alone, we meet Max, Barry, Howard, and Jules--all presented to us and characterized through vivid dialogue, description, and actions. I found that to be very compelling, and Max Bowman's narration (for the book is narrated by him) is interesting. I don't think I've ever read a narration from such a snarky main character, but it honestly adds so much to the book--for example, the descriptions in this book were never JUST descriptions--they're commentary. Take Max Bowman's description of Roosevelt Island, for example--It's not just a simple description of the place; his description had character, which made the place and the setting come alive.Overall, this is a book with a very compelling writing style and a plot to die for. Enjoy the ride--I certainly did!

I found this story to be quite fun and imaginative. Having read through the first one, I thought it was a wonderful treat to continue reading about Elle and Belle's adventures! This book is very well suited to younger kids, especially if they've started to read on their own. The plotline is great as well as the illustrations! I definitely recommend this.

Truly a captivating read. I loved reading about Cierra and her mentor Isabella, as well as Cierra's relationship with Ryker. I felt that there was a lot at stake as the story unfolded, and the author definitely kept my attention throughout the book. I really felt that this wasn't your typical romance novel as there are plenty of elements other than romance--suspense to keep you guessing, well developed characters that want more than just one thing... the list goes on. It's complex, multi-faceted, and I loved it. Brilliant.

I love this collection of short stories--Serves as good, short reads for right before bed or for a short wait. The stories are touching, oftentimes heartwarming, and the author came up with lots of very different (but awesome!) characters for each story while still staying true to the theme. My favorite is "Barbecue Dinner"--simply because it shows the power of family, and the power of being around people that you love that makes everything else seem superficial. If you are interested in heartwarming short reads, then this is one to check out!

I really enjoyed this continuation to volume one. I'm definitely intrigued by the setting and premise of this novel and I think the author pulled it off very well. Top it all of with an amazing cast of characters, and this book is a winner! Great read for anyone looking for something that will keep them on the edge of their seats. Highly recommended.

This is a captivating romantic mystery/thriller with a fantastic hook. Dennis Browne is a great author and created a great beginning to the book that drew me in right away! I really like the format the story was told in as well, switching between Samantha and Dalton. It was really interesting to get in their heads and learn about their histories, as both are unique and well-developed. This is definitely different from the romance novels that I typically read, but that's what makes it so exciting and refreshing!

This is a very unique book about Eurasians in India in the 20th century. Though the events happened less than a century ago, I still felt like I was being transported to a world that was entirely different, through this book. It was certainly interested to read the story of these women in this book, and I thought that the topic/setting of this book--Anglo-Indians and their lives--was something that was really interesting to dive into and read about.I think my favorite character in this book was Dolly. I saw her as fierce and independent, marrying James against her parents' will and living through the Depression and Independence movement in India. It was very interesting to read about since I don't know too much about it, and the author is very well-informed about this topic. Whether or not you're familiar with this historical time period, you will be able to enjoy it--no prior knowledge is necessary to know what is going on!This is probably one of the best biographical books I've read this year. It's captivating and so interesting that it reads like a novel. I loved getting to know this time period, the characters, and this gave me a lot of insight on the history of India and the people who lived there then. India, at the time, was going through big changes, and I thought the author really portrayed the people's struggles and reflected the time period well. Fantastic novel, and I definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good read!

Outside, Daniel seemed like he had it all--a job, a family, success--that's all everybody ever wants!! But still, there was something simply MISSING, and he sets out to fix that. I loved this contemporary fiction and following Daniel in his journey of self discovery. Truly fantastic and highly recommended!

Fun, fresh, and easy to read, especially for those who enjoy an intense and sexy romance. I absolutely adored this tale and basically finished it in one sitting. I really loved Diane and James, and the author's writing style was truly spectacular!! I would love to read more by this author in the future.

IELTS is an exam that can be used to apply to American universities (it is an exam that is accepted by most universities in the world) and this book is tremendously helpful in the process of preparing for it. It's clear, easy to understand, and provides the necessary and crucial information for a student to do well on the exam. I found the tips to be very helpful, and certain things in the book (such as the assessment criteria) are just really handy to have around. Great for reference and test prep. Highly recommended.

This is a fantastic story for anyone looking for a short read. This is longer than a short story, yet shorter than a novella. Appropriately called a novelette, Half Past follows the story of Dolores, who, at the beginning of the book, has turned 40. While 40 for a lot of people means kids and fulfillment, for Dolores, it just seemed more and more like time is running out. She has no kids, no significant other, and though she has a great degree and stable job, we know early on that she was missing something from her life. Without giving away too much, this is a book about love and loss, a book about the "almosts" in our lives and a book about what "could be."One thing I really liked was the length of this book. A lot of short stories are not quite satisfying, and longer length novels sometimes take me hours upon hours to read. This book, I easily finished within 2 hours, and I enjoyed a full length story with well fleshed out characters. I liked getting into Dolores's head and really getting to know her character and history, and I think the author did a fantastic job with that too.

I was really interested in this analysis and summary guide because I've recently picked up The Girl in the Spider's Web. This book really helped enhance my reading experience with a chapter by chapter summary and analysis. I think I would have loved even more insight from the author as far as analysis goes, but the summary was superb and so is the extra information (symbols, motifs, themes) at the end of the book. A great resource!

I love the biblical background in this book. The Cub's Mistress is a first person narrative told in Moses's, a priest's, point of view. I was pleasantly surprised with just how realistic the backdrop of this book was, and how vividly the author developed this character and conveyed his every emotion and temptations. This book was throughly enjoyable, and the narrative was engaging. The character was fictional, but developed well and intertwined brilliantly with the culture of the time period and the setting. Fantastic Historical Christian Fiction--can't wait to see what's next.

As advertised, this is indeed, the only guide you need to navigate the maze that is mortgage loan process. This book gives the reader a visceral sense of what it's like to go through the mortgage process and provides accountability checks for homeownership. Sylvia M. Gutirrez is a great writer, breaking down things so that her readers understand the information. I felt that this book really helped me in understanding this very complicated (and overwhelming) process.

This is smaller than I expected, I ordered it to use in my husband's lunches as he travels several days a week. On the one hand this fits perfectly in his soft sided lunch bag Harley-Davidson Durable 6-Pack Bar & Shield Cooler. CLP302304  I haven't been able to fit an entire can of soup into it so whatever I put in it, I plan on being more of a snack or side. (It kept pudding cold for several hours!) It kept homemade chili hot for 4 hours.  I even like the color, it's a bit of glittery green and very pretty.I always handwash things like this and the opening is big enough to get a washrag or bottle brush into and there are no weird recesses to harbor mold. Very easy to clean. You can top rack dishwasher it also but I just prefer hand washing something like this.I was provided this at a promotional price in exchange for my usage and review. I was interested in it because I haven't used anything like this since the old days when we had those leaky plastic and metal food jars of the old days (that were so bulky). I really liked this jar.

These were initially described differently so I didn't expect them to be so very small. At best they are for use as cuffs because there isn't enough length in the loops to go in the earlobe. I selected them because they looked like a nice wardrobe of hoop earrings for the earlobes so I was a little disappointed that I couldn't use them.However, they are very sturdy and very pretty! Lightweight so they won't drag your ears down and hurt.  The current Amazon description now reflects their true description. It has been changed a few times.I received a promotional price in exchange for my honest review.

I have several pairs of S9's that I prefer because the buttons are pronounced enough that they are easier for me to find. I bought the s10's for my husband and he prefers the sleeker feeling of them over the 9's.At any rate we have had both 9 and 10's for years! YEARS! And they just don't quit. Especially when I'm running and have sweat pooling in/around my ears and these things are getting soaked, they just keep going.I've used them as a phone while walking/running outside and short of interference from wind (very noticeable) they serve that purpose well also. I can't say enough good things about them and I'll use them til they die or til they are no longer compatible with my iPhone!

This would make a great gift!! It came packaged with a bit of silk cocoon and information about it. I love silk pillowcases because I've read about how gentle they are on your face and hair. I have long curly hair and I can comb through my hair in the morning with ease, no more hunks of tangles!It's very soft and luxurious, I wash it in a lingerie bag with other delicates once a week. You could hand wash it, or put it on cold delicate gentle wash. I wouldn't use it in the dryer myself. It dries super fast!I I have used other pillowcases (satin) like this and the one thing this pillowcase has over most, is that the bottom is cotton. If you ever have used a silk or satin case the worst thing about them is that they slip all over your darned bed while you sleep OR they slip off the pillow. THIS ONE ZIPS so your pillow doesn't go anywhere from inside it, and the cotton bottom of the case catches on your sheet and doesn't slide all over. PERFECT!I paid a promotional price for this item in exchange for my review after using it. The packaging was nice enough to give as a gift and I think I will add this to a list of things my mom would like.

Where has this been all my life?!?!?!?!I have too many clothes to fit into my closet space (clothes hoarder!) so I have to divide by season. Summertime, I put the winter clothes away and label the plastic tubs "WINTER CLOTHES".  Then when Winter comes I take the tubs out, put the summer ones in, and turn the tub around so the sticker that says "SUMMER CLOTHES" is facing out. There are probably about ten plastic tubs. As you can imagine, when anyone else messes with my tubs it gets confusing. Nothing is more frustrating when I go to swap out closet space and there is a jumble of tubs where they've been knocked over and now I have to open each and every one. I never could figure out a better organizational system until these came up.ONE STICKER on the front. Wipe off, write new season, put away, and don't worry...!! I LOVE THESE STICKERS. I also started using them on my shoe boxes (shoe hoarder) instead of trying to put new labels over old ones over and over. (I can't find good clear shoeboxes cheap that actually have a lid that stays on----)  They have been handy to label clear plastic containers of 'ingredients' that I use and reuse in the pantry.  How on earth I made do without something so ingenious as these??? Will never know!I ordered these at a promotional price in exchange for my usage and review. They were the answer I've been seeking for my organizing problems!! I would buy these (and will, for my mom's Christmas present!!) Love them thank you!

This is the perfect solution if you want to set up a universal charging station somewhere in your house! I set one up on the breakfast bar in our kitchen. I was getting so sick and tired of everyone grabbing whatever cord they wanted out of my stash and then I couldn't find what I needed. We have an array of devices that use a PILE of different USB chargers, and the most common ones I just keep plugged into this on the counter and told everyone no more taking cords, leave your device.  What a relief!! It was so frustrating to need to charge something and having to track down whichever family member took the *^$(*%T cord I needed. This charges FAST as well. There is a 'charging station' fancy wooden display at Bed, Bath Beyond (not allowed to put the link here) and this would fit perfectly in it.I received this at a promotional price in exchange for my testing and review. I've been looking for the perfect device to fit into the BBB wooden box and this is just the ticket!

Ever since I first purchased Motorola S9 and now S10, we've had the problem of earbuds popping off occasionally. They are all but useless without both earbuds! This is a great replacement product. I've had to purchase them from time to time and always a different seller so I'm leaving a review on these now.Perfect replacements!

My husband loves this sprayer (combined with the collapsible hose we bought)! It has all kinds of spray patterns from gentle to more aggressive (perfect for washing the cars!)I love the most that when you turn it off it doesn't leak water everywhere. So when "someone" forgets to turn off the hose and we notice a day later, water hasn't been running all over like it does with the $20 sprayer we bought at Lowe's.I received this at a promotional price in exchange for my usage and review and reflects my honest opinion of it.

I love the case, it's like a generic Otterbox! It was easy to put on. The only problem I had was the included screen protector lifting around the edges when the box goes on. I have lifting top and bottom. I'll replace that with another screen protector soon but I LOVE this case. All the buttons line up perfectly! Very secure in my hands. And the stand lets you prop your phone horizontally.I received this at a promotional price in exchange for a review after I applied it to my phone and tested it for two weeks. I would buy this case again!
VERY heavy duty and worth the price!! I ordered these to hang my heavier winter clothes that tend to bend lesser hangers. I will reorder more!!

I've tried several Luseta products. (The packaging alone is so nice I'll be refilling the bottles with body wash and lotion!)  The Tea Tree Argan Oil set mimics the smell and experience of my favorite shampoo: Pureology Hydrate. If these cleaned and felt like Pureology I'd give them five stars, but they do have sulfates so they get a 4 star because they aren't quite as gentle.I would recommend this set to anyone with fine to medium hair who doesn't get a lot of product build up and who doesn't let their hair get really dirty between washes. I have color treated hair and this set was fine for everyday use but I much prefer the coconut set for more hydration AND the coconut set seems to do a better job getting many days of oil/product buildup out. I passed the argan oil set on to my mom (medium/fine hair and doesn't have lots of styling product to wash out) and she LOVED them and will reorder them for herself.  The price for the set is reasonable for the quality.

This is one of the nicest lavender oils I've tried---it's not harsh like the 40/42 Lavender I got at the health food store or at an online 'essential oil superstore'. I truly enjoy this oil because it's smooth and not harsh or medicinal. I reach for this most when using my diffusers or making body products. Very nice oil. The cost of this is comparable to lesser quality Lavender EO I've purchased elsewhere (even from the 'big name essential oil supplier")This is one I would reorder.

I thought this would make a great sleeping bra (for my big ones) and it does. This is very comfortable and I wore it around the house cleaning (very low impact)  There isn't enough support for 38DD boobs to wear this during vigorous activity (in my opinion). My only gripe was that I am accustomed to adjusting a bra by grasping the top of the cups and pulling up to allow the girls to settle comfortably---try that with this one and the cups unhook themselves and your girls fly free! But overall very comfy and I loved it as a sleeping bra.I was offered this at a promotional price to try it and leave my opinion of it.

The center piece and the hanging weight that makes the chimes sound, are both of an amber colored glass. This wind chime is SO pretty! It fits into our decoration theme of the wrought iron/oil rubbed bronze coloring. My husband announced that he HATES wind chimes....I didn't know this....so he relegated it to the back deck where the wind doesn't catch it as vigorously as out front. I love it however! It's a lower level sound, not the high pitched tinkly sound that would drive us both crazy!I received this at a promotional price in exchange for my usage and opinion of it after using it.

This is the most rocking shower speaker I've used to date! My husband and I have a motley collection of various speakers and Bluetooth speakers. Some are just adequate, very few are so great that we BOTH use the same one! (yes we have a couple in the shower that we rotate as they die, rarely do we use the same one as we like different things)  THIS speaker is so loud and doesn't distort at high volume---and instantly connects to both our phones--so this is our go to speaker at the moment.  It's all self-explanatory, easy to use, and I love that it takes a common charger and not a special cord. This happens to share the same charger as my Motorola headphones so what a bonus!The only reason I didn't leave it five stars is because I can't get the suction cup to hold for anything. Even if I get it to stick, within a minute or less I hear it hit the shower floor. So I use the string lanyard it came with. I'm going to get an adhesive hook to hang this on the back wall of the shower and get it out of direct shower spray where it hits right now.I was provided this at a promotional cost in exchange for my use and review based on my long and frustrating history trying to find good Bluetooth speakers! (It's not as easy as you think and price is very rarely any indication of quality)  Right now this speaker has supplanted a $50 speaker that I've loved for most of the past year! Nice and loud without killing your ears with distortion!

We have a house full of devices now with kids in/out, work phones, tablet, etc. So I've used a LOT of cords!! Now I'm one of those people who do NOT think that Apple branded cords are worth two cents----$30 for a cord/charger and within a short time they are ripped/cracked/tearing right around the base. The bad thing is that aftermarket cords eventually get the boot thanks to Apple's stingy policy about anyone making money off accessories except themselves.  My favorite ZEETRON heavy duty cord now will not even trickle charge my iPad.....damn you Apple.I was offered this cord at a promotional price and jumped at the chance to potentially find a new cord that is better quality than Apple, as I did not want to buy another Apple cord. This cord charged just as fast as I expected, no "not supported" message! And very durable around the ends where they tend to be stressed. Everyone else seems to grab this cord out of my charger so I think that's a pretty good endorsement of it! I would buy more Haweel products. I'm very happy that there are more aftermarket chargers and cords now that are better than Apple and cheaper

This is for Style 2, the pearl and crystal pendant.I love this necklace!! This looks like actual gold jewelry/pearl, not cheap costume. It's a nice bright plating and if someone brought this into my store I would have to use a loupe to tell it was not in fact solid gold. I am a jewelry hound and appreciate "costume" jewelry that is of quality and doesn't look cheap. This is something I would notice and buy in a store.I wore this for a day while shopping and it felt like a solid piece of jewelry. (No tangling either, I love the chain)A nice weight to it, and I plan to wear this to holiday parties soon! With a black sweater dress I think this would be absolutely stunning!I received this at a promotional price in exchange for my use and opinion of it after wearing it.

I really loved how this swimsuit felt on; it does not feel like a $15 suit at ALL. I loved the design. I loved the concept.  I didn't rate this down because of how it fit me (explained below) ---this is probably not going to fit most people like it did on me. If you aren't overweight in a disproportionate way this will probably work for you.I'm about 30 pounds overweight right now---and my top is much bigger than my bottom. The bottoms of this suit looked great---I got an XL but I could have fit a Large on my lower half. I'm in between 12-14 at the moment.  Now--the cups on the top are great! No nipplage will show past this! But my 38DD boobs were all over the place in this top. I needed another size up for the top and it would have to have some modifications. The straps are too stretchy to offer any kind of support and it didn't take but about 20 seconds before one of my boobs popped right the heck out. if I'd been in public ....ha ha  The XL top would probably fit you if you were under 38C.  The top is tied both top and bottom and that is almost impossible to tie properly to restrain the ta-tas if they are very large.I do however love the design and it feels like a really nice quality so I'm going to save this and see how it looks when I drop these 30 lbs.  It's adorable

I have purchased and reviewed a ton of chargers and cables----some great, some not so great. I loathe the Apple-branded chargers because the cords always ALWAYS fray and crack. $30 for a charger/cord and it's delicate?? No thanks. Sadly Apple also loves to make it so that your non-Apple cords eventually either stop working or offer a minute trickle charge at best. (My Zeetron cords no longer even trickle!)I got the dual-port black charger and a 4 ft. USB lightning. I really love how small this charger is, it doesn't block the other outlets and fits so well. I don't get an error message on either the iPhone 5 or iPhone6. Fast charge too! No reduction in charging speed when I had an iPad and iPhone plugged in simultaneouslyI was offered this item in exchange for my review after testing it on several devices. I would buy any of their other products now after seeing how well this set performs.

I've seen these on TV infomercials and always thought they looked interesting but would never buy them, as my experience with "As Seen On TV" usually disappoints.My husband LOVES this thing and wants to get several more!! It decompresses easily and collapses easily making it easy to use and store. He even wants to get one for his work truck because it takes up so little space when collapsed.I will buy more for next gardening season!I received this at a promotional price (I paid for it!) in exchange for using it and reviewing it. My husband absolutely loves how easy this hose is to use and store and doesn't want to buy rigid hoses ever again
This made me REGULAR AS HECK!! No more bloating and going days with discomfort. I loved this and I'll gladly keep using it!

This is my favorite headband and I get compliments from other lady riders ALL THE TIME. Unfortunately it's out of stock whenever I try to tell them where I got it.Fit is impeccable. Handwash and all the studs have stayed on. LOVE IT
There is something too sweet and too cloying about these, they make my throat sore. I prefer the lavender ones hands down!
These are my dog's favorite treat along with Nature Balance bites! I give these as gifts to other dog owners as well and they are always well received
This is the strongest smelling catnip I've ever purchased. My cats LOVE IT! Definite repurchase
These are so thick I can't even get all my toes into them. I can't even use them as toe separators for pedicures. Useless for me. I applaud anyone who can get their last few toes THAT far apart!
Matches my orange HD shirts perfectly! And it IS a women's headband, it has sparklies. So unless your man is secure he won't want to wear it

I thought I'd be able to retire my 20 year old 3 qt. Hamilton Beach cooker that I use only for cooking whole chickens (fits perfectly) but this Crockpot is not deep enough for a whole chicken---but it WILL fit a whole cut up chicken!This thing is like a casserole dish on steroids. You can assemble your food in the 9x13 dish just like you are about to cook it in your oven. I made a batch of queso dip in this, normally I use my round Hamilton Beach crockpot but it's so deep that only the edges soften up first. With this rectangular shallow design my cheese and chili melted together perfectly without dried and burned spots in it!I LOVE the very secure rubber gasket on the lid also! You can latch the top down with liquids inside and it's not going anywhere while you travel. I love the timer feature (something my 20 year old cooker lacks)  I can't wait to use this at Thanksgiving and during entertaining, it will be perfect on the buffet on WARM to keep food ready to serve!!it comes with a little Cambell's recipe book as well. Very easy to use this neat Crockpot!UPDATE: Months later and I still can't believe how much we use this. My husband always grabs this one first if he's using a slow cooker recipe. Sure it's not that deep so you can't cook EVERYTHING in it but what it can do, is amazing. Another bonus I hadn't realized til lately is that the wide and shallow cooker design is perfect for meatballs or meatloaf. The deeper designs often make your meat boil in grease or liquid and this shallow concept actually lets your meats get cooked properly.

I use this to make my nails longer, read below for how I do it. This method works for me with my equipment, your mileage may vary!I love this gel, it is self-leveling and I get smooth results!  This is HARD GEL, if you want something to just give your nails a little hardness then you can use STRUCTURE GEL.....it's softer. I'll do a review on that too.I had acrylic nails lately and they were a thick mess. Rather than go back and have them further butchered I bought this gel and now I do my own fill ins. Yes you can use this gel to do fill ins over acrylic nails! When the acrylics pop off (because that's how schitty a job the tech did) I just replace them with a dual form gel nail and they are slender and pretty and look like my own nails!This is what I use and how I do it.*GELISH  18G LED LIGHT: Yes it's expensive. Yes it's worth every dang penny! I wasted more than this costs, buying lesser quality lights. It works with every single gel polish I've tried. It never fails me and I can always count on whatever I use, working.  My instructions are based on my light and I can't be sure what results you'll have with other lights. I've watched Youtube videos of people doing these nails with other lights and their instructions didn't work with my light or they used much longer times.*HARMONY PRO BOND: Yes you want this instead of just the PH Bond. Don't try to sub alcohol or acetone for this. Just buy it. It's cheap and it lasts forever*DUAL FORMS: I got the 100 pcs for about $5, I'll try to put a link in my review.*HARMONY HARD LED BUILDER GEL: Make sure it's the hard builder and not structure*#6 nail brush*Gelish Foundation coat (what you use for doing the colored gel polish)*Very fine buffer squareStarting with clean nails----use the very fine buffer sponge and lightly buff your nails in a downward motion from cuticle to free edge. Just enough to take off shine. Wipe with alcohol then dab on Pro Bond. Let dry.Apply a thin coat of Gelish Foundation coat, cure 5 seconds in Gelish light.Select the dual forms that fit best on your natural nails---make sure they fit from side to side, edge to edge, without overlapping or having a gap. File to fit if you need to.One nail at a time, paint a light coating of Builder Gel inside the dual form. Place inside your light and cure 5 seconds.Paint another light coating of the builder gel inside the nail. Fit the nail to your finger and press gently--don't make the gel squish out. Make sure there are no bubbles under the form. Place the finger under the light and cure 30 seconds.Remove finger from light, grab form at end with tabs and gently work it side to side to remove the dual form from the nail. If the form is not damaged you can put it back in your box and use it again.At this point the form should release cleanly from the nail and you are left with a shiny nail. It may be soft-ish. That's where I do something I have not seen in any other how to: put the finger back under the light (now minus the dual form) and cure another 20 seconds.Trim nail to desired length.To paint just lightly buff with the sponge, use your foundation and color coats like normal. I get over a month of color with this method and just fill in as they grow out.

I've had sleep problems for decades, tried everything ever recommended in any magazine. Had a doctor tell me to take Benadryl. (Yeah love that 24 hour zombie feeling!!) Even tried Ambien for a couple of years but the stuff "Ambien Angie" did while on that is appalling. (I didn't know she was a gourmet cook until I woke up to a dirty kitchen with no recall of cooking!). I've been off the Ambien for 7 months and tried a Schiff Super Melatonin product that is 3 mg----it was better than the last time I tried melatonin 20 years ago and I've been using it.  I have been using the Ubervita for 4 nights now and I will not be reordering the Schiff!It says to take it 30 mins before bedtime, so I did. An hour and a half later I'm still trying to get to sleep so I wasn't thinking good things about this product. I woke up a few times in the middle of the night from some really disturbing and upsetting dreams, so the next morning I wasn't forecasting a good review on this.The last few nights though have been different. I know I'm in deep sleep because I am having vivid dreams and I'm remembering them. When I wake up I'm stiff because I've been sleeping like a log and not rolling over 100x a night like normal. I have even woken myself up snoring on my back and I'm typically a side sleeper. This morning was the first time in years that I was ready to get up when the alarm went off.I'm giong to use the rest of the bottle and I'll update if anything changes but at this point if it keeps working like this I will use it as long as they make it!

I received this product free for a review.In my opinion it is very natural to feel cynical about five star reviews praising a product that the reviewer received free.  I've done it myself so I know where you are coming from.  However, in this case the square storage containers passed every test I could throw at them and came up still worthy of five stars.  Go figure.This is what you will get from the standpoint of sizes.  The cup measurements are from me, not listed on the bottom of the containers with the other measurements and are approximate because I would never fill any container all the way to the tip-top because of the need for expansion of the food in the freezer.Size #1:  1.25L/42 oz/1.32 qt or approximately 4 3/4 cupsSize #2:  900 ml/30 oz/0.95 qt or 3 3/4 cupsSize #3:  700 ml/24 oz/0.74 qt or 2 3/4 cupsBelieve me, I put these containers through every kitchen torture test I know because I've had so many failures with other plastic sets and the national brands sold in grocery stores.  I put water in them and left them upside down on the kitchen counter on a towel all night to check for leaks.  I froze pot roast in the largest one and left it in the freezer for a week, then nuked it in the microwave.  No damage and the container was still firm and perfectly shaped when I took it out.  I put made-from-scratch banana pudding in the 3 3/4 cup size, snapped on that airtight lid and slapped my husband's hands for three days before I would allow him to dig into one of his favorite desserts.  The custard had no 'skin' on the top and the bananas had not turned dark.  I've kept tomato soup in the fridge for a day, frozen for 3 days, then defrosted and heated it in the microwave with no evidence of the bubbling and discoloration of the inside of the container.  I've placed the containers and the lids on the top rack of my dishwasher and put them through the normal wash and heated dry cycle multiple times and can see absolutely no warping of any of the pieces.  All are still firm and square.Honestly folks, I've run out of ways to prove this product is inferior.  The containers stack inside each other and sit on the lids in my cabinet.  Yes, I did have to give up some space to have room for them.  I'm sure I will miss those flimsy containers from the deli which no longer had a lid but I think that will be a long way down the road.  This is a quality product and I'm glad to have it in my kitchen.  You just can't recommend something any more than that.

I received this product free for a review.I happen to be a skeptical consumer when it comes to plastic storage containers.  IF I buy the ones sold in grocery stores it's always with the thought in mind that they will be for a single use, no matter what the packaging may say.  All of that to let you know I approached this set of plastic storage containers with raised eyebrows and low expectations.  Whew!  Am I ever glad to say this set has met and exceeded all my expectations.  The one thing the product page doesn't do a very good job of is telling you the sizes you get so I'm going to give that information here.  The cup measurements are my approximate measurements because I would never fill a container to the brim, leave a little air space at the top - especially for items placed in the freezer.#1 size:  2L/68 oz/2.11 qt---approximately 8 cups#2 size:  1.25l/42 oz/1.32 qt---approximately 4 3/4 cups#3 size:  700ml/24 oz/0.74 qt---approximately 2 3/4 cups#4 size:  3.25ml/11 oz/0.34 qt---approximately 1 cupI put water in each container, used the "click" closure, turned them upside down on a towel and went to bed.  In the morning.....no leakage at all.  I then repeated this leak test after each container had been in the freezer for at least 48 hours (some up to a week) and after each had been used in the microwave and gone through a dishwasher cycle with heated drying.  Still no leaks and the "click" closures are nice and firm.One of my ultimate tests involves red sauces, a plastic container and a session in the microwave of at least one minute - in one case it was almost five minutes - to see if that dreaded rough, red ring would form on the inside of the container.  Nope, clean as a whistle for both barbecue sauce and red pasta sauce.  The creamy cheese sauce in the container worked wonderfully also.  Plus I love the fact that these containers don't come out of the microwave squishy soft.  The container still felt firm and strong even straight from the extended time it took to warm up five cups of beef vegetable soup.Believe me, I've put these containers through my personal torture tests and they have come out smelling like a rose - not like the garlic salad dressing I kept in one for three days in the refrigerator.  I almost hate to give the product five stars because consumers (such as myself) tend to think something received free is going to automatically garner a five star rating.  No, not from me it won't.  However, try as I might, I just can't find anything wrong with this set of 4 round plastic containers.

After seeing her three girlfriends killed, then being held hostage by that psychopath, Evelyn Talbot decides to devote her adult life to trying to understand why they do the horrible things they do. Now a Psychiatrist, Evelyn has received the funding necessary to build an institution devoted completely to trying to unravel the psychopathic mind. Her Hanover House is being located outside Hilltop, Alaska and Evelyn is making the final preparations to leave Boston and take up her position as head of Hanover House. Unfortunately for her, the person who terrorized her years ago has found her again.The author describes this prequel as a long novella and at almost 200 pages I can certainly agree with that. Readers will have a full understanding of what came before the beginning of WHITEOUT, the first full length novel in this series which will be released in September 2016, with a second due out in September 2017. This novella zeros in on an area of psychiatry which I am very curious about and since the author has obviously done a lot of research to craft not only her characters but also the facility to house them, it will be interesting to watch how she handles the subject.There is a sneak peek at the first chapter of WHITEOUT in this novella along with the first chapter of THE SECRET SISTER.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

Having read many of the Burren mysteries by Cora Harrison set in 16th century Ireland I already knew how well she writes and how interesting and challenging her plots can be. I was eager to find out how a more modern character, a Catholic Reverend Mother, would fare in a more modern time setting, here in Cork, Ireland of the early 1920s. I found some positives and some negatives which caused me to enjoy the story only a moderate amount. I do think I would be willing to read a second book in the series but I'm not breathlessly awaiting word of its publication date.Reverend Mother Aquinas is the head of St Mary's of the Isle convent who finds the body of a dead young woman close by the convent chapel. The victim is obviously a member of the upper echelon of Cork society as evidenced by her expensive clothing, Rev. Mother sends for her friend Sergeant Patrick Cashman of the civic guards, the equivalent of a policeman in the turbulent political world of Ireland at this time. It is obvious the young woman has been washed ashore on the flood waters caused by heavy rain just as it is obvious she was in attendance at the social function of the year the previous evening, the Merchant's Annual Ball. What is found in her evening bag will rock the Cork social world's foundations.I enjoyed reading the novel, but it wasn't as engrossing as I had expected it to be. The Rev. Mother has been established at over 70 years of age in order to fit her place into the history of the events which take place in this novel. That also makes some of the things she does seem out of character or to be difficult for her to do. Being over 70 in 2015 is quite different from what it most likely would have been in 1923. Also, the character of the Reverend Mother is not very well established as to her duties in the convent. She is in charge of the convent yet seems to have unlimited amounts of time to spend on investigating while spending very little time attending to her job. She also doesn't show a very religious nature which I would certainly expect from the nun in charge of a convent. Probably the most obvious problem I had with the story was the blatant disclosing of clues which would form the entire focal point of the mystery. If I could see that answer so early in the novel, why in the world did it take those investigating it so long to catch up? As I said before, I would probably give a second novel a try if this becomes a series. I just won't be waiting impatiently.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

This pair of cargo shorts by Wrangler definitely fall into the casual category.  The pockets are many (9) and most of them are made to hold a lot of items.  (That means they are big.)The fabric is well softened so the shorts are not stiff at all.  This pair is size 38 and if my husband had been trying them on in a store he would have gone down to a size 36.  He has to wear a belt with these or they won't stay up.  The color is a dark gray.  My husband is tall, over 6', and the shorts cover his knees.  Perhaps this pair is mis-sized or this particular Wrangler Cargo shorts style just runs large.  The shorts themselves are very well made with Velcro type closures on all pockets except the two front slash pockets.  The shorts have the metal closure in the waistband.As long as you want to wear these shorts exclusively as sporty, active wear they will work fine.  If you want to try to iron them to get all the wrinkles out of that excess pocket fabric.......good luck.  They went through the washer and dryer just fine, but they do come out wrinkled.  To go do his exercising in, they will be great.

As soon as I took this shirt out of the plastic packaging I was impressed with how soft the flannel is.  This is one of those shirts that will be worn a lot because it isn't such heavy weight that you can only wear it in the extreme cold of winter.  I can see this being a favorite to wear around the house with a nice t-shirt on underneath to give just enough warmth as the days begin to cool down.  I like the blue indigo color, it is a rich, deep color and not faded at all.  This size is the XL and the fit through the body is not snug, but it definitely isn't cut to be full either.  The sleeves are exactly the right length for my husband who has long arms so I will be watching this shirt carefully as I launder it more times.  I'm hoping the sleeves won't shrink even if they will usually be worn rolled up.  So far it has gone through the washer and dryer once and come out looking great.  The two patch pockets don't match the pattern lines of the shirt so that's a little distracting, but acceptable for a casual wear shirt.  This is the first Wrangler flannel shirt for my husband and I'm definitely impressed so far.  The seaming and finishing of the shirt are well done, the buttons are sewn on securely, and the buttonholes are stitched all around and fit the buttons.All in all, a good flannel shirt for casual or work wear.

I'm finding myself in the "caught between star ratings" situation with this book. I've read some novels by Anne Perry before but they were in a different series. This was my first reading of a novel featuring William Monk and his wife, Hester. The mystery was definitely not a standard murder mystery plot and in the beginning I thought there would be two plots taking place simultaneously, one featuring Monk and one Hester. That situation with Monk simply ended with no resolution for what had happened at all. I waited through the entire book to get an explanation which never came. That wasn't expected, nor did I like it.  If I had more choices I would assign this book 2.5 stars.The plot line involving Hester is the primary story of this book with her finding herself unwillingly involved in experiments carried out by a rogue chemist to develop blood transfusions. She finds herself so conflicted by her outrage over being kidnapped to help with the experiments and yet her knowledge as a nurse of how priceless the use of blood transfusions would be to medical practices. So the first half of the novel is taken up with these two non-connecting story lines and then a seemingly whole new set of characters are added in. If you are a follower of this series, you will know if these are new characters or not, but it felt strange to suddenly be presented with them at this stage of the novel. I felt as if I was standing out in left field all alone.This book was alright, just not so good that it made me want to go back and read all the previous books in the series. I felt that Hester and Monk were both a little distant as characters for me to try to fully understand them and my curiosity was not engaged at all to uncover their histories. If you are already a fan, I'm sure you will enjoy it. If you are new to the series, it might be a better idea to start with the first book so you understand how Monk and Hester met and formed their relationship. Unless you want to come stand with me out in left field so I won't be alone.

I received this item free for review.This waterproof case will hold an iPhone 6 without having to remove it from the protective case.
