If any other item is to be placed in the case, you really need to take the phone out of any protective case.  This product has come in very handy for my husband when he goes on long walks and he enjoys using it very much.  I find it to be heavier than I am comfortable wearing so I prefer to use something like a waterproof belt when keeping track of valuables in as small a space as possible.  The case is very well made and the snap closures do snap very securely closed; in fact I have to have help getting them opened again.  My husband doesn't have that trouble so he is now the one who uses this Frieq bag.  The product comes with a lanyard in case you want to use the waterproof bag that way.  There is a jack attached inside the pouch to plug into your phone and then a plug on the outside for ear buds if you want to listen to music or a book as you exercise.This is a quality constructed item which will give you waterproof protection for your expensive phone.  Some of the family members are already thinking about borrowing it when they go on their next canoe trip.  That would be a great use for this product.

I received this product free for review.This waterproof bag is one of those items you appreciate more and more the longer you use it.  The belt is very well made with two types of closures to make sure the items inside stay dry.  After you put in your items you push out as much air as possible, slide closed the plastic "zip" type of closure then roll the top down so the two pieces of Velcro meet to form a complete closure of the bag.  That "zip" type closure can be pretty fiddly to work with and it doesn't always close securely so make sure you have that working properly before you trust that the bag is really waterproof.  Also, if you put too much in the bag you will not be able to roll the top down so the two Velcro strips meet.My husband and I use the bag to hold different items.  He carries his iPhone 6 easily in the bag without having to remove the protective cover from the phone.  He also puts in his car keys.  It will not hold his phone and his wallet.  When I'm using the belt I put in house and/or car keys, a credit card and a small amount of cash.  The belt is approximately 34 inches fully extended, but then it stretches, so up to a 40 inch waist is no problem.  You can wear the bag in front or around on your back plus it easily goes under a t-shirt.  If you are wearing a jacket the bag doesn't show at all when you place it under a shirt or blouse.

I received this product free for review.Both of my German Shepherd dogs are showing their age.  Both are rescues but we know one is 11 years old and the other is probably 8 or 9.  Both dogs are beginning to show signs of joint problems, the older, heavier male quite a bit more than the female.  We decided to try the liquid Glucosamine supplement and have seen really good improvement for both dogs.  This is the first bottle of Dog Dream we have tried and I'm glad to say the quality is excellent.  This is a glucosamine, chondroitin, and MSM formula which we use twice a day.  One of my dogs weighs 85 pounds and the other 100 pounds so they both get 2 teaspoons of the liquid twice per day.  Even using a combined 8 teaspoons per day this 32 fluid ounce bottle goes a long way.  I usually plan to re-purchase the product about every thirty days.  The instructions say to refrigerate the container once you have opened it and I also give it a little shake before measuring out the dosage because the liquid will separate as it sits.  Neither of my dogs objects to the taste at all and even though the female has a very delicate digestive system, we haven't had any tummy upsets since using the liquid glucosamine.I'm glad to have found a product which will make my dogs more comfortable as they get older.  Nothing that I've found can stop the joint problems from happening as a dog grows older, especially large dogs such as my Shepherds, but it makes me feel better knowing I am giving them something that is making it easier for them to go up and down stairs, get into the car, and get up from off the floor.

What the manufacturer means when they say this fan is 100% Recycled is that everything (except the motor) is made of plastic.  This makes the fan  very lightweight which in turn makes it easy to move around.  There are the high, medium, and low settings and the fan will tilt to any position you want and stay there.  You can even position it so the air is blowing straight up.  Assembly of the fan only requires that you snap the two feet into position, plug it in, and turn it on.  When the fan is on the lowest setting I can still feel the air moving when I am 20 feet away.  We find this fan on the low setting to be so quiet that it does not interfere with our television watching.  This 20" fan is especially nice to have outside on the porch because it means that area can be used more in the Southern heat of August.If you are looking for a lightweight, quiet (especially on the lowest setting), efficient way to move the air around in specific spaces in your home, this fan will fit the bill for that.  I'm already thinking about how I can use it to help shorten the time it takes for the carpet to dry when I have to spot clean from doggy accidents.  This is an appliance I am expecting to get a lot of use out of.

People kept telling me I would love these Bose in-ear headphones and while I did believe them, there is just nothing like experiencing them for yourself.  They have given me nothing but quality sound and usability so far and I'm looking forward to that continuing for a long time to come.  I didn't understand that the three sizes of earphone tips have nothing to do with the physical size of the user so it took me three tries to figure out that the large size is perfect for the configuration of my ears.  Please be sure you try all three sizes (small-white, medium-gray, large-black) to get the best quality sound possible for you.  On the cord there is a control for volume up and down and the center button is for beginning and ending telephone calls and moving back or forward when listening to music or audio narration.  The mic is on the back of this set of controls.  The cord also has a tiny clip for your clothing, but that didn't stay attached very well for me.  There is a definite right and left designation for the tips and I find that easy to keep up with by making sure the Bose logo is facing outward where the two sound cords join.  These headphones come with a tiny storage case (good quality, I just hadn't realized it would be so small) which holds the headphones as well as the two extra sets of ear tips.iPhone testing:  I don't use a cell phone so I asked my husband if I could borrow his phone for the morning to test out these headphones.  Then I asked some friends and family members to call me so I could experience the hands-free aspect of the headphones.  The sound quality was excellent, it was easy to receive and end calls once I became used to finding where the control center sits when I have the headphones in, and I was able to adjust the sound volume easily.iPod testing:  I used the headphones for listening to music and for listening to an audio book.  In both cases it was pretty easy to use that central control button for skipping a song or repeating a portion of the book narration I had missed.  This is definitely going to be where I use these headphones the most.iPad testing:  I used the headphones to watch a movie and several episodes of an old television comedy series and they worked very well.  The sound quality was absolutely amazing.I'm not usually very interested in "sound" quality but it was very apparent that the sound I hear through these headphones is excellent.  Unfortunately for me my husband is very interested in sound quality and I've already had to use the "ownership" card to get my headphones back.  Interesting how they somehow became public property.  Nope, not going to happen this time!

I absolutely love this bag.  It is definitely a backpack, but with the handle on the top you can also carry it at times like a large purse or book bag.OUTSIDE:Made from heather blue boiled wool with gray leather closure straps and gray woven web for the backpack straps and handle.Unbuckle the main compartment and you will find an industrial size gray zipper with a leather zipper pull.The two lower straps on the front are decorative but the flap opens to roomy storage with a magnetic closure.The two buckles on the sides are decorative only.The entire back is boiled wool so it is smooth against your body.The backpack straps are 1 1/2 inches wide and adjustable so the bag sits where you want it on your body.INSIDE:There is one deep main compartment lined in a soft vinyl type of fabric, a muted burnt orange with orange and gray dots.One deep zipper compartment.Two deep pockets.One strap with a metal clasp for keeping track of your keys.The outside of the bag is very attractive with the soft, supple leather, vintage style hardware, and the boiled wool fabric.  The stitching is very even and all the seams are completely finished off.  I'm not positive what the lining material is (I suspect vinyl) but it looks as if it will resist moisture and stains.  No information about the lining material came with the bag.  One of the leather patches on the front has the name of the brand (Sherpani) but this bag is one of those understated accessories which will catch everyone's attention!  The bag is definitely roomy because I have put three bulging file folders in it and could still easily fold down the flap and buckle it closed.  I've also put in a 1 1/2" three-ring binder which was full of notebook sheets.  That was a little harder to buckle.  In both cases there was still plenty of room for a phone and personal items.  This would also carry a tablet, e-reader and/or small laptop with no problem.  Or you could go in a totally different direction and use it for an overnight bag for a casual trip or even carry it as a purse when you go shopping.  The product picture was a little misleading for me because I was expecting more of a briefcase style which could also be worn as a backpack.  Instead, the bag is longer than it is wide.  The dimensions are given on the product page, but once I saw the picture I wasn't paying attention to the measurements.One final super good thing.....this bag comes with a lifetime warranty.

I am always amazed at how an author can change the 'voice' of their novels from one book to another. I have read many of the Elly Griffiths novels featuring Ruth Galloway and have enjoyed them very much.  The Zig Zag Girl has an entirely different feel to it.  Not just because this one is set in 1950, but also because this one isn't as stark and it doesn't verge on the darker feelings I get from the Galloway novels.  Even though this book has the focus on murder, and the first murder is especially brutal, there is still a lighter feeling about this set of characters.  Maybe it has something to do with the fact that there are magicians and comedians and stage performers involved which kept the book from getting that oppressive feeling that can happen with murder mysteries.There are two main characters in the novel and they are quite different but each has strengths needed by the other.  At this stage in the series there is no partnership between these two, they are just reunited from their days of serving in the military during World War II.  This particular mystery very obviously concerns the group they were in during the war and now that one is a policeman and one is a famous magician they team up to figure out who is killing off the members of their old unit.  Someone has every intention of extracting revenge for something that must have happened during the time the team spent in Scotland.I liked this novel well enough to look forward to the second book in the series.  One of the major characters was a little weaker than I would have liked and I hope that will be addressed in the next novel.

This is going to be a good product for us to use to change up the food flavors in our dogs bowls.  We use canned food as something to perk up jaded appetites at the early morning feeding when the dogs get tired of the kibble they are eating and there is still 10 pounds left in the 28 pound bag.  Using this Nutro adult food with chicken, rice and oatmeal has been a good addition for us.  I have two large dogs so it would be extremely expensive to try to feed canned food exclusively, but by putting some of this in their morning food bowl and adding water to it I make a gravy that then moistens and flavors the dry kibble.  The dry food we give them is high quality but the dogs have 'trained' us to augment their picky palate with an equally high quality wet food.  This Nutro is working well.  The food is ground so don't expect to see recognizable pieces in the food, however, it really does smell like chicken or chicken stock.  According to the label if you are going to use this as the exclusive food for your dog, you should feed between 1/3 to 2/3 can per 10 pounds of body weight.The positives about this food is that our dogs both really enjoy it, there have been no tummy upsets since they have been eating it, and according to the label, there is no hidden corn meal.  This food is not the major component in their diet so I would be very surprised if it began to have any negative or positive effects on their skin and coat.  This is a great way to supplement the feedings for our dogs.

I was amazed at all the information in this book.  Concentrating on the types of poisons used by Agatha Christie in her novels had to be pretty much a labor of love for British chemist Kathryn Harkup because you can tell immediately that she is also a fan of this great icon of crime fiction.  The book is written from the British point of view with changes in book titles noted for the American market.  I really had my doubts that this subject matter could be presented in such a way that it held my attention for the time it took to read the book, but by the end I found myself wishing there was just one more chapter.  But then I would have wanted another and another.The book is very stylishly presented with artwork which is wonderfully evocative of the 1930s art deco style that I somehow assign to the Christie novels even though they were not all written during, or for, that time period.  Maybe the really good television series has something to do with that.  Each chapter deals with one specific poison beginning with arsenic, then belladonna, cyanide, digitalis, eserine, hemlock, monkshood, nicotine, opium, phosphorus, ricin, strychnine, thallium, and veronal.  Each chapter leads off with a brief synopsis of the major novel, or in one instance a short story, the author will be using as an example of the use of that specific poison, then moves on to the story (history) of the poison, how the poison works in the body to kill, whether there is an antidote, some real-life cases, and then how Christie used the poison.  I had been afraid the chemistry associated with where the poison comes from and how it works within the body would have been either too technical or too boring for me to enjoy.  Wow, was I ever wrong.  I discovered all kinds of wonderful facts.  This book is wonderfully readable by those of us who aren't trained in the science of chemicals.  Plus Kathryn Harkup has a very wry sense of humor which caused me to get some strange looks when I was sitting in a doctor's waiting room laughing out loud while reading a book about poisons.  Let's just say the chairs on each side of me became vacant when someone asked what book I was reading.  This is the type of book Agatha Christie fans will keep right on the shelf with all their copies of the novels for reference during future re-readings of the novels.  Because let's face it, if you love Agatha Christie novels you don't read them just once.Another fascinating section of the book is Appendix 1: Christie's Causes of Death.  This is a chart listing each novel and short story written by Agatha Christie and the method of the murder in that story.  Sometimes, with multiple victims there are multiple murder methods.  I found this absolutely fascinating and used the list to make sure I do own each story Christie wrote.  Actually I own them multiple times over, but there is no need to go into my personal addiction here.In discussing how Christie used the poisons the author has revealed some spoilers, but she always warns the reader to skip ahead to another section if they aren't familiar with the story and don't want to know who and how.  I really appreciated how Harkup complimented Christie on her thoroughness and knowledge when it was warranted, but she didn't hesitate on several occasions to point out that Christie had gotten some things wrong.  Interesting for me was how seldom Christie made mistakes in her information.This book is most definitely aimed at the devoted Agatha Christie fan.  I found it fascinating and if you didn't, well........I challenge you to a duel with the infamous Calabar bean!Added Sept. 10, 2015:  I received this book as an ARC through the Amazon Vine Voices program.  Often ARC copies don't hold up very well over time and they will have portions omitted because it is not the shelf-ready book.  I enjoyed this one so much I purchased the finished copy in hard cover to keep on my shelf for reference material when I'm reading mysteries.

There is a new edition of this novel by the British Library Crime Classics and Poisoned Pen Press released in 2015.I thought this was a wonderful book but that is probably because I am a fan of the older mysteries and enjoy seeing how authors approached the genre in its young days. In this case, not just an infant but practically it's birth day. You might appreciate this novel more if you forget about it being billed as a detective novel because it definitely is not that. Instead you have an investigation presented from the point of view of an investigator for an insurance company into the death of someone the company he works for insured. As you read more and more of the letters, journal entries, statements and reports compiled by Mr. Henderson you watch his case build up.The first of the letters concerning the characters were dated in the 1830s and the story concludes in about 1856. Watching Mr. Henderson line up his evidence regarding Baron R** and the mysterious happenings going on with those whose lives he touched was fascinating for me. Granted, this style of novel can be rather bland and dry but if you appreciate watching an expert gather his evidence you will be more likely to enjoy this novel. Knowing this story was published in 1865 gives readers a wonderful example of how the genre has evolved over time and how remarkable it was for Charles Warren Adams to have written this "first" so well. This is a novel for the reader who enjoys the language of the Victorian era and the meticulous gathering of evidence and presentation of that evidence in summary form. Quite an interesting curiosity and I'm very glad I had the chance to read it.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

For me, this novel had such a thin mystery plot that it almost didn't even qualify for that genre designation. If Pru Parke had insisted on straight answers to her questions the first time she asked them the entire story would have fallen apart and the book would have then consisted of nothing but the romance portion. I don't read mystery novels for romance portions.Approximately one fourth of this novel is concerning a mystery and the remaining three fourth is all about Pru and Detective Chief Inspector Christopher Pearse with London's Metropolitan Police. Pru has taken a job researching the authenticity of a portion of a rare horticultural journal excerpt so she and Christopher are apart for the three months the job is supposed to last. The person Pru is supposed to report to makes it very clear he is dissatisfied with her and on we go from there.Don't worry if you haven't read the previous two novels in this series, they are very well detailed so you will be able to pick up the threads of the relationships Pru - originally from Dallas, Texas - has made in England. I've given this novel a 3 star rating because everyone doesn't have my same determination for what constitutes a mystery novel. Personally, for me, the rating went lower than that.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

Evidently I like to read novels in the horror genre which have a completely different emphasis on that subject matter from what I found in this book. I prefer the author to use subtlety and finesse to illustrate their craft, not bludgeon me with a sledgehammer. I understand this is not the first book in the Harry Erskine series, but as far as I can tell it isn't necessary to have read any previous books prior to starting this one.The novel is treated almost as two books with Professor Anna Grey, a research scientist at Saint Louis University Hospital featured in one portion. She is trying to find an antiviral medical solution to an aggressive virus which is attacking people all over the Saint Louis area. As her research and investigation continues she finds the victims have been bitten by bedbugs before they become ill and die horrible deaths. The second portion has Harry Erskine in southern Florida plying his trade as a fortune teller who does something really stupid and gets himself kicked out of the state. I only kept reading this book to find out when in the world these two portions of the novel would finally intersect. I had to read all the way to chapter 25 before Anna and Harry met to fight this gosh-awful plague of blood and gore; there are only 28 chapters in the entire book!I didn't enjoy reading this at all, it simply isn't the style of horror novel I enjoy. I can understand the use of the profanity and sexual references used in the novel, principally by the demons, but the two sexual episodes in the Anna Grey segments were offensive and repulsive to me.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

When I discover that a novel is set in 1829 in an area of small villages in Worcestershire I have come to expect certain things from that novel. I love to read historical mysteries and especially those where the author has conveyed the time period and the atmosphere existing among the various levels of society. What I do not expect is to find the "f" word thrown around by the villagers as if they are impelled by some psychological malady to use that word repeatedly, by men and women alike. It was not only unexpected, it became a serious detraction from the novel for me. I've not read any previous novel by Sara Fraser so I have no idea if this profanity is common in her historical mysteries. I also felt very uncomfortable with the villagers being so needlessly cruel and harsh in their attitude and treatment of Constable Thomas Potts. These two devices used by the author caused me to only marginally enjoy the novel even though I think she used some interesting and different elements to cause her criminal activity to take place.I'm giving this novel three stars, but I would definitely tell any friend of mine the drawbacks which kept me from liking this book and certainly will keep me from reading previous or future novels in the series.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

In the Acknowledgements section of this novel the author describes his main character as mouthy and recalcitrant. Who am I to differ with the author? Quintilian Dalrymple is a new character for me and I was fascinated by this world of the city-state of Edinburgh in 2033. A lot has changed, but the Council of City Guardians has come to realize they were holding the reins in just a bit too tightly on the regular Citizens, so the ban on football (among other things) was overturned a few years back. The revival is most welcome to the citizens but the Guardians can't possibly let them become aware of what was found in the center of the pitch in one of the stadiums. Call in Quint Dalrymple, demoted a long time back down to the rank of just plain citizen. Quint's job is to solve the riddle of the object found on the pitch without disturbing the bustling tourism industry that is keeping Edinburgh's financial head above water. He certainly can't let gang warfare or an upcoming referendum to rejoin Scotland get in his way.This story was especially interesting to me since it deals with how this individual city had coped with the collapse of the governing countries as we know them now. I have to say this imagined world sounded perfectly logical to me. Not that I would want it, but I can certainly imagine it turning out this way. The character of Quint was a pleasure to watch unfold along with his sidekick Davie. There is a lot of humor in the book along with Quint's love of blues music. The only criticism I have is that Quint made a lot of declarations of probable wrongdoing only to have the challenged person respond with "prove it" and there was not any proof. After a few times of that happening I began to wonder why the author kept doing it. Still, definitely a recommended read.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

Yeah, the Youth Boost is working!  I'm 72 and now my hair doesn't look a day older than 69!!  Seriously, though, if you shampoo and style your hair every day this product is probably going to be just as good for you as other mousse hair styling products.  At first it is a little hard to know how much to use and that isn't helped by the fact that I get a different amount of mousse in my hand each time I press the dispenser.  I'm hoping that will even out as I use more of the product out of the can because I feel I am wasting a good bit -- I seriously don't need all the mousse that is being dispensed right now but it is so hard to control.I apply the mousse to towel dried hair and work it through before combing.  I like to allow my hair to dry naturally, but for the first time using this product I did use a hair dryer.  There was definitely more volume when my hair was dry and it actually was quite a bit softer.  I don't shampoo every day so now I just allow my hair to air dry each time.  I get exactly the same results with and without a hair dryer.  Unfortunately, the added volume seems to only stay in my hair for the first day.  The softness stays really well and the mousse isn't causing my hair to become oily between shampoos.  I do not notice any particular scent, but since I have just finished using a tea tree oil shampoo which has a wonderful minty smell, I might not notice anything from the Tresemme unless it was just overpowering.Overall I will definitely use the remainder of the product in this can and buy another to have it as a "sometimes use" alternative to the product I use most often.  The container is very stylish looking with the combination of the black and lavender colors so it looks nice sitting out on the vanity.  Really, this works as well as any regular hold strength mousse I've used before.  A nice addition to my product shelf.

Here is why I wanted to read this book: there is a teen in my family with this diagnosis and I wanted to understand more about the condition. Ive never read any other books on this subject.The first five chapters are introductory to a great extent, but they do put some emphasis on young children and teens with this diagnosis and how the number of kids now having this designation has grown to nearly epidemic proportions. Dr. Archer provides some good ideas for how families can learn to incorporate their treatment plan of an ADHD child within their family. He discusses when he feels medication is most appropriate and when it might be better for the child to not medicate. He also discusses the do medicate/do not medicate issue regarding adults. He comes down probably a little more firmly than I had expected on the non-medicated side. There is a test within this section to find your personal number if you know you are ADHD or if you just suspect you might be. I'm afraid this test might make it easy for someone to come up with their own diagnosis concerning ADHD. Frankly, none of this information was new to me simply from standing on the sidelines and watching one daughter deal with ADHD children in her teaching classroom and the other daughter exploring every avenue for her child with ADHD.Beginning with Chapter 6, what stands out to me the most was Dr. Archer saying that he had diagnosed himself as being ADHD. It is not stated in this book if he consulted professionals in the proper field to help him confirm his own self-diagnosis. Since he has written another book on this same subject, perhaps the information is contained there. Many of the individuals Dr. Archer uses as examples for how a person can use some of the manifestations of their ADHD to do great things in their lives are either very famous or very rich or both. There are only two examples of what I like to think of as ordinary people, both of whom have achieved their own levels of success utilizing strong ADHD qualities. Because there appears, to me, to be such an emphasis put on the rich and famous I soon began to feel I was reading one of those magazines you can pick up in the check-out line of the grocery store. With so very many of the references the doctor was using coming from non-medical sources I lost the feeling I was reading a serious, medically oriented book dealing with a complex condition. The New York Times, CNN, and his own previous book seemed to come up much too often as sources with some references to scientific research, just not enough to give the book the weight I would have expected.I can certainly understand an adult with the medical diagnosis of ADHD finding many examples of their own trials in dealing with this condition in this book and being inspired. Maybe there will be enough examples to help someone deal with their hyper ability to multitask, or perhaps it was new information to have someone suggest they make written lists for their constantly bingo-brain activity and this will help them look and see what is truly important to do next. Or perhaps they had not noticed that having physical exercise prior to an important event can calm them down enough to deal with situations better. But, really, boredom cannot be alleviated for every person with ADHD by suggesting changing the location where they live. I understand that advice was not stated, but it certainly was implied and given examples of so often it began to seem like advice. I think I was most disappointed in the fact that this book was  to my perception  not a serious look at ADHD. Rather it was a way to show how some very wealthy people with connections readily available to most of them have coped and even thrived while dealing with their ADHD. Can the ordinary ADHD person benefit greatly from most of this advice in anything other than a pep talk manner? I would say, probably not. Certainly I would not think this book would be of much practical help to parents of a young child when they are simply trying to understand what is happening in their offsprings brain.I received an e-ARC of this book through NetGalley.

I have to admit to being out of my reading genre comfort zone with this novel, but I have noticed Jennifer Estep's name come up on several book lists lately so I decided to take a chance and read this book. Obviously she has a very large fan following and there are many novels in this series.The concept of having people empowered with elemental magic (here Gin Blanco has control over ice and stone) made it very interesting to watch the characters, both our heroine and the super bad guy, try to eliminate each other. Gin has taken over the top spot as the leader of all the criminals in her town since she took care the previous crime boss in the previous novel.  Obviously a promotion based on strength. Gin's not finding it an easy job to get a handle on, mostly because her personality makes it difficult to trust and work easily with others. So now someone has tried to blow up a riverboat where she is holding a meeting and she's pretty darned steamed up about her friends innocently being in the line of fire. Let the hunt begin for who and how, but mostly, why.If you are already invested in this series, you will like this one too. If you are looking for something new to read in the urban fantasy genre, you can easily begin the series right here  because the author pretty much fills in the blank spots from the past as she goes.  As with all series, if you want to get the full background on the characters it is probably best to at least read the first book in the series before jumping around through the remaining books.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

My family is liking this set of Motorola T460 two-way radios for lots of different situations.  The product description says these are blue, but that blue is so dark it might just as well be called black.  I like the way the radio fits in my hand (medium size, female) with easy access to the controls.  We tried these out here in our suburban neighborhood and got about one mile of reliable reception.  There are just too many traffic lights and other electrical interference issues.  Out on the greenway, though, they were wonderful for keeping contact between the bike riders and the walkers.  Last week we had to have a new air conditioning unit installed for the upstairs of our home.  That means one technician in the attic and one in the backyard where the compressor sits.  Those guys absolutely loved using our radios to keep from doing the double staircase routine too often.The NOAA weather function works well and is easy to use.  The "trouble" alert is a good feature and the sound is loud enough for it to be easily heard, especially if you were in the woods camping or hiking.  The LED flashlight is built into the unit and is activated with one press of the button.  The clip on the unit works well for hooking to a belt or strap of a backpack.  The units will withstand rain and snow conditions, but they aren't "waterproof" so try not to drop them out of the canoe.  The units arrived with a light charge so we could play around with them for a while, but then we let them fully charge overnight.  So far with all our usage over three or four days the battery indicator still shows 'full'.  There are two micro-USB charging cables included.Our family is finding many different uses for these two-way radios just around the house, not to mention when we leave home but need ways to keep in touch.  Even if you have never owned two-way radios before you will find them valuable tools to have and use.  There was no users manual included, but you can access the website to get the answers to your questions.

My standard way of testing out a cookbook is to try three recipes just as they are written in the book and see what happens.  The reactions I get to the finished product as suggested by the author makes the basis of my usability for that particular cookbook.  I'm afraid my results with the three recipes from this book were not successes, each for different reasons.I made Loaded Chicken Casserole (page 18) and will make it again, but by deconstructing the recipe and doing it my way.  Garlic powder is not one of my favorite flavorings to use and this was twice as much as my family likes.  The bacon sounds like a nice accompaniment but made the overall dish much too salty for my family.  Sixty minutes cooking time was much too long for my 400 degree oven.  Next time I will cook the potatoes first, then add in the chicken, then add the broccoli last.Thanksgiving Shepherd's Pie (page 58)  makes for a pretty picture on the page but my family did not care for the dish because of the Boursin cheese.  If I ever make this again I will definitely find a different cheese ingredient.Polka Dot Lasagna Skillet (page 83) doesn't resemble lasagna at all because it uses bow tie pasta and is cooked in a skillet.  This recipe was okay, but I have a large assortment of recipes that are so similar that it had nothing new to offer me.  If I ever use this idea again, I will probably use the no-boil lasagna noodles but still prepare the dish in a skillet.This cookbook makes no pretense to specialize in low calorie or low fat main dishes or desserts.  What I found most interesting, in a confounding kind of way, is that there is no nutritional information at all.  There are no tips for cutting down on the calories so if you are trying to restrict your caloric intake, be aware this book will not help you there.  I like the concept of picking up five ingredients in the grocery store and having the choice of three different recipes to make from those ingredients.  That is what will make me think about going back to this cookbook and flipping through it to see if anything perks up my ennui with menu planning.  But I will definitely rework the recipe to fit what my family likes and not lean so heavily on garlic and onion powders.  The layout of this cookbook makes it very easy to work with and each recipe has a full page color picture.  Almost every recipe has a "tip" or "hint" supplied by the author.

I've come to the Kathy Reichs series of Temperance Brennan novels pretty late since this is book #18, but am I ever glad I finally tried one. A story about a forensic anthropologist written by a forensic anthropologist can't help be anything but completely realistic. I like the way Reichs plotted the novel so that it flowed very logically. I also liked her sparse wording for the technical material while still giving me the chance to understand this information I'm not familiar with.This story begins with a woman who uses the Internet to try to find missing people. She comes to Dr. Brennan with information she feels is pertinent to human bones found and data entered into an official database by Dr. Brennan. Hazel "Lucky" Strike is a Websleuth who spends her time trying to solve missing person cold cases. She thinks the digital recording she located at the site of human remains holds the voice of Cora Teague an 18 year old woman who disappeared about three and a half years ago in a nearby North Carolina county. Dr. Brennan finds it hard to believe the search team who found the small number of human remains would have missed the voice recorder, so what exactly is Lucky Strike after and where did she get the recorder?It was interesting to watch the case unfold little by little and to see how Brennan worked with colleagues from her own county as well as the county where the bones were found. Even coming into the series at this late time I was able to pick up easily with the family and personal relationships which are ongoing in the series. Brennan needs to make a decision in her personal life and it looks like she's ready to finally do that. I really enjoyed reading this novel and look forward to catching up on other mysteries presented in previous books.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

This fourth book in the Davis Way Crime Caper series was absolutely laugh-til-you-cry funny, but it wasn't all cute and cozy. There is a serious problem that happens in the life of one of the recurring major characters and that has the potential to lead in some interesting directions for the series.Davis and Bradley have been married for nine months but are still living in the voodoo suite at the Bellissimo casino in Biloxi, Mississippi because Bradley is the general manager of the casino and someone in authority has to be there all the time. Richard Sanders, who owns the Bellissimo, is off-site while he oversees the building and opening of his new casino in Tunica, Mississippi. His totally crazy wife Bianca is shopping all over the world. Both of them make it back to the Bellissimo on occasion long enough for Richard to clear off his desk and Bianca to stow her shopping goodies, so Davis and Bradley are truly stuck living in the luxury suite - reportedly haunted - and decorated by the wife of the former casino manager in truly tacky rusting wrought iron New Orleans "found" objects. You know it is bad when your coffee table is an actual headstone with a clearly readable inscription.So our story begins with a missing Events Planner (who would have thought a Hello Kitty wedding cake could cause so much trouble?), a completely secure casino vault which has been breached and robbed, conventions and weddings planned for every minute of the day, and a Siamese cat Davis rescues which even the owner would have trouble loving. Now all we need is for Davis' ex-ex-husband to make an appearance.....which he does. Davis was married to and divorced from him twice but everyone is entitled to make a few mistakes when they are young and foolish. It all gets very tangled up, utterly hilariously at times, and filled with action. These novels are absolutely well written which is what keeps me coming back to read each new one as it is released. This one came very close to crossing the line from humor into silliness at several points and I still don't believe what happened with the cat would have ever happened with a real cat, but I tend to forgive the minor irritations because I really like the character of Davis Way Cole. These are books written for entertainment purposes so allow yourself to be entertained. And just maybe you will be inspired to learn from Davis the (almost fully revealed) ways to hack into computers and computer systems.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

We are loving this shredder.  Because I knew it was on the way I saved all the things I would normally shred and had a stack of over 60 items by the time this shredder arrived.  It was a great way to test out the product.  We are using this in a home setting so will not have as much use as an office setting would, but it handled my bundle of saved up "trash mail" like a champ.  I tested out the 12 sheet capacity by shredding a bundle of standard copy machine paper with three sheets stapled together with a household stapler.  The machine reduced those sheets to a micro-cut just the way it is supposed to.  We tried one CD just to test out that function - it worked fine - but probably will not use that portion of this shredder very often.  I also put a credit card through for testing purposes and am so glad to know I will never have to worry about anybody being able to recover any data from that card.The feature which sold me on this machine in the first place is the removable wastebasket.  At 5 gallon capacity it will hold a lot of micro-cut paper.  The see-through window on the front lets me know how much debris is in the basket and pulling it out (which automatically disables the machine) and emptying it into a brown paper bag to put in my recycling bin is super easy.  No paper bits strewn all over the floor and just slip the bin back into the machine and you are ready to perform your next shred job.  According to the very good manual which comes with the product, if you allow the bin to get too full you will have a problem with the micro-particle pieces being sucked out of the basket and back up into the cutter blades causing a jam.  Just keep a watch on the clear window and don't let the bin get too full.  I like that the entire machine is on rollers so it can be positioned exactly where it is most convenient for regular usage.  The only small problem I'm encountering is learning exactly how to place the paper in the slot to activate the shredding motor.  I find I need to be standing over the machine so I can ensure the paper is exactly straight to begin the shred.  Luckily for me, this machine is taller than any of our previous shredders so it is easier to perform this operation.  I'm sure I will adjust to the angle needed within a short time.  We haven't used the machine in one continuous shredding session for it to overheat, but there is an indicator light which will come on if overheating happens.  There is also a light to indicate when the waste paper bin is not in position.The manual says to use a shredding lubricant sheet or shredder oil after 30 minutes of shredding or at least every 30 days.  Our home use will not require more than lubricating every 30 days so we will stay with the oil instead of the sheets.  The noise level on this machine is much less than any other shredder we've used (72 dB) so I am quite happy to welcome this machine into my home office environment.

If youve never read any of these mystery novels presented from the point of view of a canine investigators perspective, it might take you a while to catch on to Chets tone. Actually, Chet isnt the investigator, Bernie Little of the Little Detective Agency is, but we all know Bernie would be lost without Chet. The pair are back home in Arizona after their last trip to visit Bernies girlfriend in someplace Chet knows was called Foggy Bottom, he just doesnt spend much time trying to figure out why it was called that. The Parsons next door are having serious health issues, but even so Bernie was surprised to learn, after such a long friendship with them, that they have a son. They also have a saguaro cactus in their front yard which is being repossessed by an agent with the Department of Agriculture. It seems the Parsons new cactus has an ID chip showing it is illegal for them to have it without certification papers. You wouldnt think a stolen cactus would lead to murder, would you?I had to be convinced to read my first Chet and Bernie novel years ago but Ive never regretted starting the series. It helps if you either have dogs of your own or have been around them enough to watch their facial expressions and their body language. When I finish reading one of these novels it takes me some days to stop trying to interpret what my own dogs are trying to tell me when they give me those looks. You might expect the book to be less than serious in its approach to crime investigations because it is told by Chet, but that doesnt happen. You get your full value criminal investigation by a rather unorthodox duo and in this case, both Chet and Bernie have some pretty dangerous situations to contend with. Now I really, really need to read the next book so I can check up on Bernie and both Mr. and Mrs. Parsons.I received an e-ARC of this novel through NetGalley.

I've always been skeptical about the micro needle rollers and, frankly, just thought it was hype until I was asked to review one. I'm a semi-retired NMD, but had never read any research on them so before I agreed to evaluate them, I did my homework and found that there's many double-blind US studies on their efficacy. Even the NIH (US National Institutes of Health) has research available showing how well they work to reduce scars. So I agreed to review one and I'm glad that I did.ProsSuper durable titanium micro needles. Titanium is a metal that will not wear down like stainless steel, yet has many of the same properties desired in medical tools/devices: easily sterilized, durability, not corrosive-no rust, etc.Great price. Titanium is very expensive so I was surprised at the amount of it used in TinkSkyGreat ergonomics - the handle is design to fit comfortably in your hand as you use it on yourself.IT WORKS! Just based on studies alone, micro needle rollers reduce scar tissue. Most of the studies were done on the face and all of them showed excellent scar reduction.I'm using it after I use anti-aging skin care, no studies on this, but I know that I'm delivering the much needed anti-aging products deeper.ConsPlastic handle (at this price point I will not take off a star, it's just that I don't like plastic)

Very well crafted! Intricate pieces that were very detailed. Much more difficult to construct than I had imagined! Needed more tools than the instructions listed. Could not cut through with exacto-knife as instructed instead used nail clipper which worked better. I am so glad that I attempted this challenge!

Another wonderful Magnolia Organics product. I love these zippered pillow cases. Very well made. The price is so low for this high quality--can't say enough good things about them, plus they come in a reusable org. cotton bag that I use for carrying my Kindle in my purse.

I used 250 mg Forskolin 2X per day for a little over 1 month and at first I noticed a slight increase in energy and reduced hunger, lost 1.5 lbs but after 2 weeks I couldn't feel any more changes for the rest of the time but I didn't gain the weight back.  As a doc in alternative medicine who knows that this herb has some impressive research behind it, Ive ordered more to try it again, this time using a higher dose to see if that helps to maintain the benefits and if not I plan to take it with an adaptogen.Because the manufacturer had a free first bottle sale going on, I asked several people I know to try it and some had pretty amazing results that I wanted to share with you. I asked them to take the highest dose recommended on the label since they have been diagnosed with health issues.Female diagnosed with hypothyroidism whose main complaint was fatigue and weight gain, she takes 2 Forskolin 2X per day along with Lugols Iodine and the adaptogen, Rhodiola. After 1 month of taking them every day her energy levels improved and she lost weight.Male with asthma, taking just Forskolin noticed an immediate improvement and at the end of 1 month hed lost weight without any changes to his diet.Female with Chronic Fatigue did a juice cleanse for 2 days when she began taking the Forskolin.  She added daily freshly made veggie juice to her new diet of no processed foods and reduced starchy foods. At the end of the month she reported feeling lighter not only did she have more energy it felt as if a heaviness has begun lifting both mentally and physically.Female with fibromyalgia added Forskolin to her normal supplements and lost 5 pounds and doesnt have as many carb & sugar cravings.The reason that I recommend and trust this manufacturer over other people selling Forskolin on Amazon and elsewhere is that they listed the important contraindication information. The information regarding who should and shouldnt take Forskolin doesnt change between brand names, but its only the most conscientious manufacturers who care more about the wellbeing of those who take their products will list this important information. Companies just selling it to make a quick buck dont provide contraindications and they usually make over-the-top health claims.

I love the Boston's they've been my favorite go-to Birkenstock style for years. The adjustable arch strap makes for a perfect fit even for people with high arches and/or high insteps. The strap keeps them from stretching out the leather when you wear socks no matter how thick the socks they are. I've stretched out other Birks across the arch area wearing them with socks during the winter and can never get them to fit right for summer or sockless use again. I've never had that problem with these.I recently bought some of the oiled leather Bostons. Yes, they look older faster and they have a lot of character because of the patina but beware, like other kinds of oiled leather, anything oily will stain them a dark stain that doesn't come out using natural products.I like the regular polished brown leather Bostons better than these oiled leather since after 3 years I can still polish them and they look like new again. No need to polish the oiled leather just use a slightly damp cloth to clean them.Also, did you know that many shoe repair stores carry authentic Birk rubber sole (bottom layer) of your Birks? It adds years of life to your favorite Birks.

These are called Econo-Patch and I don't recommend them. They are very uncomfortable because of the pinching and stinging. Some of the patches are worse than others. The lead wire came out of one, they aren't made very well. I bought these trying to save money but they don't hold up and I've had to throw some away because they hurt like there's not enough insulation. I'm better off with the silver or higher quality carbon electrodes.

I'm finally getting around to writing the EMS 5.0 review 2 years after buying it.Pros: I can't recommend this enough for you if you suffer from any kind of back, neck or shoulder pain. Its very, very effective and gives you super fast relief. Its lightweight and has a clip so you can slip the unit in your pocket or clip it to your waistband, which means you're not stuck laying or sitting around when you want to use it. I've dropped my unit a couple of times times and they built it to last b/c it works as if nothing happened and it didn't chip or crack the body. Although I just use mine for pain relief, the various settings allow you to optimize your treatments and uses making it versatile. The carrying case is well made and has plenty of room for extra stuff when you travel.Cons: although this has nothing to do with the efficacy I wish that it came with an AC plug and a super strong rechargeable battery pack and charger. Using normal rechargeable batteries makes the unit's strength reduce quite a bit and it ran out very quickly. I'm careful about batteries going to the toxic waste collection instead of the trash can/landfill and I go through a lot of 9V batteries when using both channels on high.The only problem I've had isn't with the unit but with cheap electrode patches. Good quality electrodes make all the difference in performance. Most of the cheaper ones aren't as effective and many are very uncomfortable. They don't disperse the electrical pulse throughout the patch and/or the lead wire isn't insulated enough so you get a pinch on low settings and shocks at higher levels settings and they don't stimulate a very large area regardless of the size of the patch. The carbon patches are cheaper than silver but the silver electrodes stimulate the entire size of the patch and can feel stronger on lower settings. If you buy carbon, get the best quality and avoid the economy patches. If you don't want to buy the gel, just lightly wet your used patches and it reactivates the adhesive and gives better contact. Especially if you have chronic back pain, take time to learn the muscles groups involved and place the electrodes along the muscle length. Use the same channel on the length of one muscle. You can stimulate large areas and can usually find a way to stimulates deeper muscles with good electrode placement. If you don't pull on the lead wires and if you store the electrode patches on the slick plastic it comes on and if you carefully and slowly peel the patches the better quality electrodes can be reused many, many times.Also, if you have deep pain try getting the 100mA instead of the 80mA.

I sowed the seeds in rich loamy organic garden in early May (last frost is generally beginning or mid-April). We had a weird and unexpected frost within a week of planting and none of the seeds came up. Will try these again and hopefully post better results since they're a traditional yet hard-to-find spice for Mexican cooking. Be sure to follow the planting directions about frost and temperature.

I've had several openers of this type and I will say that the Peak Reserve is the best, highest quality corkscrew of them all.  The last one I bought at around the same price wasn't nearly as smooth as this one,  and the others were huge, clunky, and difficult to operate,  requiring some muscle on behalf of the user. It is easy to spot the superb quality of this opener upon examination.  It is heavier than my previous openers in hand,  and it's components are top notch. The screw is extremely sharp and moves through the cork in a flash like butter-  with practically no effort from the user.  There is no pushing the lever.  A simple nudge does the trick. Within a matter of 2 seconds your cork is out without struggle.  The second inner handle holds the opener secure to the bottle with very little pressure from the hand during the two stage up and down motion of the outside lever.The foil cutter is equally as excellent in quality and performance ,  with the 4 sharp cutting wheels aiding the task.  Again,  the best foil cutter I've had the pleasure of owning.On top of receiving a top quality corkscrew and foil cutter,  you can expect a beautifully packaged set.  The black box has a magnetic flap,  and is reminiscent of a box that contains  finely packaged expensive cigars.  What a great gift this set would make!  (especially at this price)I definitely give this set 5 stars,  and recommend wholeheartedly. If you enjoy wine and your face quinces while opening your bottles,  you will really enjoy this opener. :)  You can say goodbye to broken corks.  This opener will take even difficult corks out easily.***Sample provided***

As usual Folkmanis delivers with the best hand puppets ever.  "Harbor Seal"  is no exception and I am delighted to add him/her to my grandson's  Folkmanis delighghtful collection.  I have so much fun interacting with my grandson as the puppeteer.  It definitely sparks my creativity and he thoroughly enjoys himself.  My grandson seems to especially enjoy sticking his finger in seals mouth.As to the other reviewers  that say Harbor Seal is not a good hand puppet,...  I disagree.  No- you can't control the flaps in front  other than by shifting the seal from side to side to flap them,  but one does have total control of the mouth.  Realistically the front flappers would be too far from your fingers if you were to control the mouth.  I think Folkmanis know what they're doing.  The seal is life-like in proportion so I can see why the puppeteer would have difficulty spreading their hand wide enough to reach flappers and mouth at the same time,  unlike the owl which gives the puppeteer control of both wings and head because the wings are close enough to the head to accomplish this.This is an awesome hand puppet and my 10 month old grandson adores it.  5 Stars

This brush is extremely nicely finished and well priced for what you get.  The Bamboo is superb. (love Bamboo)  Speaking of Bamboo, ...my brushes in the past have ended up rotting,  and Bamboo should be more resistant to rot,  so that's a good thing.  (my Bamboo cutting boards have held up much better than regular wooden boards...)Bristles: are just the right softness and length to get the blood circulating without irritating the skin. They are a bit longer than half inch,  which I presume enables them to stay straight without folding,  yet soft enough not to irritate the skin. Nubbies: I've owned a lot of natural bristle brushes but never rubber nubbies and I have to say I'm quite impressed with the nubbies.  They offer a deeper message with a bit of friction that stimulates by tugging on the skin somewhat without stretching too much.  It feels totally different than bristles.  I'm for anything that gets blood to the surface!  (and deeper tissue)  With the skin being the largest organ of the body,...it only makes sense to increase circulation to it.  The nubbies go a bit deeper into the tissue.  (ie cellulite....)Handle: Thought has been taken not only in the use of Bamboo wood,  but in the shape of it  to insure a comfortable grip near the bristles as well as the end of the handle for length.  There are two ergonomically shaped places in the handle for the hand to fit,  depending on what you're doing with the brush.  It could be dry brushing, (near the brush head)  or reaching areas that are difficult to reach. (near the end of the handle)The true test will be how the bristles hold up over time.  For now I give this 5 stars and will update.  Awesome brush!***Sample provided***

We are a pork butt family.  As far as I'm concerned the butt is the tastiest cut of pork on the pig these days since so much has been done to take all the fat out of today's pork products. (well ribs are good too!)  My husband, the griller--usually has a couple/few stages he goes through when he cooks a butt,  which require moving the butt around.  He loves these gloves because he says they just make everything so much easier.  (moving the butt around on the grill,  transferring them off the grill )  We wash them in between the different stages while they are still on his hands. (much easier than washing them off of the hands!)  He just goes to the sink with his hands still in the gloves and I spray the gloves down for him while he washes and rinses them.Protection:The gloves are super thick (yet pliable)  and substantial at protecting from heat.  We haven't experience too much heat coming through them to burn as yet.Fit:They fit both myself and my husband comfortably and still offer control with their bulk.  Not so sure how they would fit very large hands.  Mine are medium women's size and my husbands a bit larger than mine but not big.Picking with claws:I usually am the picker helper.  The claws are hefty and sturdy.  (they make good backscratchers too :)What used to take us quite some time-- (shredding and picking out fat) --we are able to do a whole lot faster with the claws than with fingers.  It has cut at least half off the amount of time we used to spend picking.  Less time equals warmer meat.Brush:The brush is fine.  Simple and does the trick but not as good as some other silicone brushes I have.  (doesn't hold as much sauce...)All in all it's a very good set for the money.  I give it an A.***sample provided***

I've been using this little light for a couple of weeks now.  I chose the yellow one,  set it for "auto" and adhered it to the wall adjacent to my bed so that when I get up to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night I can see where I'm going.  (usually I use a flash light)  The motion detector on this light is so sensitive that the second my foot comes out of the bed to get up,  the light goes on.  (and when I turn over in bed too...)  It's just great.It's not the most attractive device in the world,  but it's made well and serves a great purpose.  My husband appreciates it because I'm no longer startling him out of his sleep if I accidentally knock the flashlight over while searching in the dark for it.I'm very happy with the Fireflyflux.  I chose the yellow.  The white might offer a bit more light,  but the yellow gives me enough.It might be a tad on the expensive side for $15.99.  However I don't really know how much motion detector devices are priced and I still give it 5 stars.**Sample provided**

The Kash is a quality lightening cable at a good price.  It charges extremely fast, (works great/FAST with my iphone 5)  and has a lifeme guarantee,  so what's not to like?I also like that it comes in a little plastic zip bag so that I can keep easier track of it.I would recommend Kash Tech cables to anyone.  Thumbs up!***Sample provided***

1:11 Mins Although I've been into essential oils for many years,  I have never owned a diffuser until now.  I'm wondering what I've been missing all these years because right now my house smells heavenly like an upper scale spa.When I first opened the Vtin Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser it didn't look like there was a whole lot to it.  It's very light,  plain and simple.  Fill the water up to the max fill line,  put your essential oil in,  plug it in.  You can choose from an array of colors to suit your mood.  That's it,  except within a matter of minutes your house will smell heavenly!I put this in the entry hallway of my home but I can see how it would be fantastic in a bedroom, nursery,  powder room or bathroom.  The mist is super fine.  Much finer than a regular humidifier.Wishlist: I would love to have a choice of  a natural color pallet such as autumn colors verses more primary colors.  Just as people tend to buy candles that will match their decor,  It would be nice to have a diffuser with colors that coordinated with their homes as well.  That being said,  I really love the Vtin diffuser!  It would make a great gift along with a bottle of really nice oil.***Sample provided***

Love these lights by Minger! We have a cabin up in the mountains and when it gets dark there, it is pitch black inside the cabin.  (no street lights there!)  We do have night lights but they are the type that must be turned on manually and it can be a hassle to do before we go to bed and turn out the lights,  so instead we keep a little flashlight on the table next to the bed for night time bathroom trips.  I took the two pack Minger night lights up there and placed one in the bathroom and one in the living room (it's a small cabin) and between the two of them they offer all the light we need to navigate ourselves around the cabin without the need for a flashlight at night.  I'm going to purchase one more pack of two so that I can plug two of them into the kitchen area.The lights a small,  not obtrusive,  and look to be very well made.  I love the fact that they come on only when it's dark,  and there's no need to mess with them at all once they're plugged in.  This is the first light of it's kind that I've seen that lights up from both sides.  The light is soft and pleasing.The Minger LED Night Light is a real winner of a night light!  Highly recommended!***Sample provided***

1:11 Mins Although I've been into essential oils for many years,  I have never owned a diffuser until now.  I'm wondering what I've been missing all these years because right now my house smells heavenly like an upper scale spa.When I first opened the Vtin Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser it didn't look like there was a whole lot to it.  It's very light,  plain and simple.  Fill the water up to the max fill line,  put your essential oil in,  plug it in.  You can choose from an array of colors to suit your mood.  That's it,  except within a matter of minutes your house will smell heavenly!I put this in the entry hallway of my home but I can see how it would be fantastic in a bedroom, nursery,  powder room or bathroom.  The mist is super fine.  Much finer than a regular humidifier.Wishlist: I would love to have a choice of  a natural color pallet such as autumn colors verses more primary colors.  Just as people tend to buy candles that will match their decor,  It would be nice to have a diffuser with colors that coordinated with their homes as well.  That being said,  I really love the Vtin diffuser!  It would make a great gift along with a bottle of really nice oil.***Sample provided***

Having purchased several Folkmanis hand puppets for my now 10 month old grandson,  I can't rave enough about the excellent quality of these puppets. His favorite up until now has been the Folkmanis Ostrich Stage Puppet,  but Snowy Owl is absolutely a huge hit with him.  The 360 degree head rotation simply amazes him,  as well do the flappy wings.It's hard to say who's having more fun with this owl,...the puppeteer or my grandson!  The other great thing about these puppets is that they will give years and years of entertainment from babyhood through childhood,  making them a great investment in the long run.  My son plans on building my grandson a puppet stand when he gets a little older.  We are looking forward to adding more Folkmanis hand puppets to his collection!**Fits comfortably on a women't medium sized handAdorable and Highly recommended

What a lovely, attractive, very unique bracelet this is.  I've had many compliments while wearing it... Even from a stranger.  The serpentine design intertwined with silver makes for a very interesting piece.  I appreciate the flexibility which makes it possible for this bracelet to fit many different sized wrists.  I had to squeeze it in a tad to fit my wrist more comfortably.I agree with the other reviewers that say this bracelet looks even better in person.  Very nice quality and would make  a great gift!

What is the first ingredient in Perfectly Simple Oatmeal Chocolate Chunk?The answer is Soy Protein Isolate.  Soy Protein Isolate is a super-processed offspring of the soy bean.  It may have started out as a plant,  but once it gets to you,  its far from it.  To create SPI soybeans are chemically engineered to isolate their protein,  and in the process this strips out all of the other nutrients the original bean contained.  This chemical process used to isolate soy protein often leaves behind substances like aluminum and hexane.The soy is probably genetically modified.  Over 90 percent of the soybeans grown in the US are genetically modified.  (according to the USDA)For the reasons mentioned above I am unwilling to partake in these delicious little bars that pretend to be made of quality ingredients.Here is a partial list of the other ingredients in order:2.  Brown Rice Syrup  (it is basically just 100% glucose,the same sugar that raises blood sugar levels)3.  Rolled oats that are gluten free.  (thats nice)4.  More sugar5.  Chocolate Liquor6.  Cream7.  CORN SYRUP.  (No doubt GMO corn.) Before I examined the list of ingredients I ate one and did think it was tasty but too sweet.  The  sugar content says 10 grams.  The 10 grams of sugars in these bars is equal to 2 1/2 teaspoons of sugar.  For women it is recommended not to go over 25 grams of sugar per day,  so eating one of these bars will use up nearly half your allotted daily amount if you are a woman.Conclusion: These Perfectly Simple bars are far from being perfect and simple,  and I hardly doubt nutritious according to the list of ingredients.To the inventors of this product,  bring us some bars that are REALLY healthy and stop trying to fool us.

This mat is super comfortable,  longer than average, and thicker than most yoga mats.  It's  high density foam offers  plenty of support for floor exercises, and when I'm sweaty I have no problem keeping my grip.  I broke my tail bone when I was a kid so I'm very sensitive to sitting but this mat offers plenty of cushioning for me.  It's easy to carry with it's handy harness too,  which is easy to get back on the rolled up mat and  slings right over my shoulder.**Unlike another reviewer mine does not smell at all.**Sample provided in exchange for honest review**

2:42 Mins This is a rugged little water resistant speaker that you can attach to your bike.  It looks like something you might find at REI.  I think a bike speaker like this is a great idea and much safer than listening to headphones when riding so you can hear what's going on around you. My husband attached the speaker cradle to my bike with no issues,  and the speaker fits securely in the cradle.  The speaker is straightforward and easy to operate as many other reviewers stated. One feature that stands out amongst other bluetooth speakers of it's type is the volume control disc at the top of the speaker,  which makes it much easier to control the volume than searching for volume control buttons amongst other buttons.  This makes it especially handy when riding around to just reach down and control the volume safely without fidgeting around.The sound comes out of the top and bottom,  as well as two very narrow cut outs on one side of the speaker. A rubbery coating is covering a majority of the speaker, and I feel that this inhibits some of the sound from coming through. The speaker sounds good,  but I do think it's missing some oomph compared to other blue tooth speakers I have tried in this price range,  however- none of the others I've tried will attach to a bike, nor are many of them water resistant. I really like this little unique speaker!  It's built like a little tank- water resistant and GREAT for biking around, camping/hiking and other outdoor activities.  Highly recommended!***Sample received in exchange for honest review***

We recently discovered our 9 month old grandson is intrigued and totally entertained by hand puppets. Being new to the hand puppet scene, I did quite a bit of shopping around and reading reviews before finally deciding to kick off his collection with a Folkmanis. Almost every one of their puppets has high accolades from their owners and it's no surprise, as each one of them is so very charming.It was difficult to decide on a species, but ultimately I chose the ostrich because it struck me as one of the sillier puppets. I find real life ostriches to be somewhat ridiculous and borderline obnoxious, so this puppet with her long lush eyelashes and sweet expression is particularly funny to me. It was a good decision, as my grandson's little toothless mouth broadens to his widest possible smile at the sight of this puppet. Now I just have to summon my inner hand puppeteer and come up with some interesting ostrich scripts/shows.It will be a real pleasure to build my grandson's puppet menagerie. I am now a true Folkmanis fan and if you're in the market for hand puppets look no further! Quality craftsmanship and classic, whimsical character assure your puppet will be treasured.

I love this toy as much as my grandson!  He is 9 months old now, and I regret not having purchased it when he was much younger, as we are all enjoying having it around. It's simply beautiful to look at and a joy to hold. It's perfect for tiny baby hands to explore-- so much to marvel as the beads rotate around each other-- and the soft texture of the natural, unvarnished wood is a sensory pleasure. It's hues are rich and simply extraordinary, giving it an almost magical appearance. It just looks like something you can't resist picking up.In the vast world of toys and baby products, the beauty of simple wooden toys is a welcome relief from hollow chunks of plastic and overwrought design. I think pure and simple toys of this nature are a boon for a developing child's imagination and motor skills, as well as as adding to the well-being of a "toyscape" and the individuals who share its environment.I'm now a huge Grimm's fan and plan to show it with future purchases. I highly recommend these beads for your little one, and of course they would make an unforgettable gift.

My husband and I strolled our grandson through a local farmer's market last weekend, which was the ultimate way to put the Bugzi stroller hooks to the test. We typically purchase quite a bit of heavy produce and end up looping bag upon bag over the stroller handles, which is neither convenient nor safe, as essentials like the diaper bag end up buried under purchases and the stroller can become unwieldy and imbalanced.  Our stroller company offers storage bags that attach to the stroller, but the Bugzi stroller hooks proved to be a very functional and economical option and greatly enhanced our stroller's carrying capacity while allowing us to conveniently access items.I was concerned that our stroller has no horizontal bars on which to hang the hooks, but the strong Velcro loop made it possible for us to hang it from the vertical handle which is wrapped in a spongy material which added extra grip for the Velcro. This may not be ideal for some users, as the hook hung at an unexpected angle, but the curvature of the hook itself held our grocery bags sturdily.This hook's best feature is its double-hook design.  One can use both hooks together for an extra sturdiness to use with heavier items, but it's extra handy to be able to separate them for lighter individual items. This feature certainly improved the organization factor of our market visit.All-in-all, if you're in need of a stroller hooks, these are a great option. In my travels I've not yet come across another hook with similar innovation in design. These Bugzi's were very functional, but I knocked off one star because I feel the hard plastic they're made of could've been finished a little more smoothly. Let's just say the finish doesn't do the functionality justice, and if they were a bit sleeker a huge fan base might develop. Another reason I took the fifth star away is because my two hooks were stuck together on arrival and when I pulled them apart the logo stickers that identify the brand came off. I was able to reapply them, but these (very) minor details could improve.I would definitely purchase these again and certainly recommend them!**Sample provided**

This is a very good  little selfie stick at a reasonable price.  It's light weight yet sturdy,  super easy to operate,  great quality- and works well-- just as advertised.  The handle is comfortable to grip while snapping a photo.  I much prefer having the release button built right into the handle verses a separate remote.  The extension ranges are perfect for our needs.  There are longer poles out there but the Coolreall is quite long enough in my opinion.  (It is easier to hold the camera steady if the pole doesn't get too long..)I like that the poles screw to lock.  Makes it easier than fiddling with a clasp.  The spring head clamp that holds the phone grasps it tightly and securely.  I was able to get my iphone5 Otterbox fitted but had to pull up on the spring clasp a bit more than I wanted to..and was afraid that I would spring it but it did not.  In the future I will probably be removing the outer portion of my case when I use this selfie stick.Other things I like:-Pairing was a piece of cake after charging.  No problems there.-Nice little storage pouch makes with attachable cloth handle make it easy to store with charging wire and transport. It fits in my purse.-Plenty of angles with the head.Economical, excellent choice for selfie stick.  Recommended.You can't go wrong with this selfie stick.  The Coolreall  has everything I need or want,  other than I wish my Otterbox fit with a little less effort from me,...but seems like most selfie sticks are not designed for the hefty protective phone cases these days.**Sample provided in exchange for honest review**

This little light makes me smile. :) -  It's very bright and really packs a punch of light for it's size. A very simple light with a magnet and a hook,  it runs on 3 AAA batteries.  There are no instructions at all,  but it's pretty easy to figure out so you don't really need any instructions.  The red covering has a rubberized feeling to it,  so it feels good to grip either to position the rotating head or to unscrew to place new batteries.  The swivel mechanism is tight so that it will hold the light at the angle which you place it without shifting placement position.  The hook has a nice little home around the magnet when not in use and it's easy to grasp the hook with the tip of a fingernail and pull it out should you wish to hang the light.  (the hook swivels also and is not stationary...)  The magnet's pretty strong.  It sticks to my fridge without issue. I can see this little light really coming in handy for odd jobs as well as emergencies.Others have mentioned that the price seems a bit steep.  It may be by a few dollars or so but to me it looks like it's made pretty well except the hook looks like it could break off easily if not a bit careful.  The plastic is tough enough on the rest of the light,  and the rotating mechanism seems pretty sturdy to me.I think it deserves 5 stars.**Sample received in exchange for honest review**Update August 18-2015:  This little light is awesome....we are finding that we use it all the time.  Would miss it if it weren't here!

I have a couple of Silpats- same size and one giant one that I use to do pastry and biscuits on.  I honestly can't tell a difference in how the Kitchen Classics look compared to the Silpat other than the name.  As far as I can tell thus far with cookies both mats perform the same.  Time will tell if the Classic wears as well as Silpat.  I've had my Silpats forever...For an knock-off of Silpat these look almost identical and perform well.  Again time will be the test.

Adele is on the cusp of musical history with her third album "25".
