This little oximeter, powered by two AAA batteries, appears to be accurate in reading oxygen and heart rate when I compare readings with my older oximeters.  It adds something that none of my olders one have  you can read the output from any angle just by pressing the button at the base of the LED readout.  This is particularly handy because you can easily read it without becoming a contortionist, and it just as easy for someone else to read it on your finger without turning upside down.The oximeter is stored in a small, sturdy case.  It comes with a lanyard that can be attached to the oximeter easily.This little oximeter does what it should and offers a backlit LED readout handy for anyone who needs the information.FIVE STARS!Sample provided for impartial review.

Although this is a very nice-looking cooler with two large fans, it does not provide cooling as effectively as my five-fan cooler.  How do I know?  Ive measured the temperature of my laptop at its hottest area for both coolers.  This one was more than five degrees hotter (ten minutes after turning the laptop on).This cooler has a nice ledge at the bottom of the cooler.  It holds my laptop securely and keeps it from sliding off.  The cooler is held up by two foldable legs on the rear.Its important to keep laptops as cool as possible in order to extend the life of the various components, and this one will reduce heat to a certain extent.  However, because its not as effective as my older cooler, it will not replace the setup I currently use.THREE STARS!Sample provided for impartial review.

If youve recently shopped for a new laptop, youve undoubtedly seen versions that are smaller, thinner, and lighter for sale.  While they may offer the latest in components, these laptops do not offer an optical disk, thus the manufacturers can keep them smaller and thinner.Lately, I have seldom used the disk reader/writer in my own laptop.  Nowdays, many software manufacturers offer downloadable versions of their software.  Downloads can be saved on an independent drive, so I have little use for the optical drive  except when I do.  Some of my critical software is available to me only on a disk and not on an internet site, so Im not yet ready to give up an optical disk.Here are the choices Ive been offered:1) full sized laptop with an optical disk (more expensive, heavier, and thicker) or,2) lighter sized laptop with no optical disk (less expensive, lighter weight, thinner.Given those choices, Id chose the second, except that Id have to do without certain critical software, so Ive chosen the first option.  Now I have a third choice:3) lighter sized laptop with an external portable optical drive.The Ruban optical disk serves well as the external portable disk in option 3.  It is easy to install.  Plug it into a usb port using only the cable included with the drive. Load the software from the disk included in the package, and youre ready to go.  The disk runs very quietly and accurately.  Ive not tried it as a disk writer because I store files on external drives, but I anticipate that it will perform as well as a writer as it does as a reader.FIVE STARS!Sample provided for impartial review.

Heres a tool with a surprising number of uses.  You can check the temperature of meats cooking on the grill.  You can check the heat from electrical outlets and possibly prevent a fire.  But, Ive been using it to check the heat of my laptop.  I want to keep it as cool as possible, and this infrared thermometer is just the thing to help me do it.To use it, insert the battery, set the mode, and press the trigger.  Youll get a reading within a second or so. It couldnt be easier or quicker.  And you can get a reading from a fairly long distance away from the item youre checking.Im stowing this handy tool with my other tools for future use.  Im quite delighted with its performance!FIVE STARS!Sample provided for impartial review.

Several years ago I gave up Christmas lights in my yard.  Oh, they were cheery, but the cords that littered the ground were a safety hazard for family and guests.  And they were expensive to run.  My electric bill told the tale.This year the lights go on again.  LED lights on a long string will do the trick with no increase in my power bill and, more importantly, no wires stretching from tree to power outlets, no extension cords waiting to trip someone.  I particularly like the fairy lights from Addlon.These lights are powered by the sun, and Ive found that putting the solar panel out in bright sun for a full day will actually power the light string for several evenings.  The back of the solar panel has two buttons.  One turns the power on or off.  The other offers the user a selection of how the lights sparkle.  You can have half the lights on in rotation.  You can have all the lights flash.  You can have the lights on with no flashing at all.  You choose.The lights themselves are tiny, hardly larger than a single LED, and they are charming without being overpowering.I love these little lights, and theyll be brightening our holidays this year.FIVE STARS!Sample provided for impartial review.

It will happen.  Youll have a fall, or youll have a tire punctured, but if you spend any significant time riding your bike, you will have a minor emergency.  This little tool kit will help get you back on the road or trail.Included in the kit are stainless steel wrenches - all kinds and sizes of wrenches.  The multi-function tool folds down into a small space, small enough to fit easily in your under-the-seat  bike bag, and it's sturdy enough to outlast your bike.In addition to the tool itself, youll have tire patches to get you going soon (bike hand pump should be part of your must-have tools).This is a great, compact tool that is available at a very modest price.  Get one.  Keep it in your bag.  Youll be prepared to cope with any number of minor problems.FIVE STARS!Sample provided for unbiased review.

I enjoy audio books, and I listen to them while Im working around the house or in the garden.  Heres a small speaker that does a good job with those books, especially outside where its waterproof feature means no worries when its near a hose..Although its not my choice for musicals or symphonic music, this speaker does a fine job reproducing audio books.  Its neither too tinny nor too bass but simply perfect for books or podcasts.I charged it before its first use, about two hours, and it played for just over five hours before alerting me to needing a new charge. No ones metabolism is exactly the same as anothers, and, my bodys metabolism does not react to the vitamins and caffeine in this minty formula. Polanfos battery is a big source of power.  It has recharged my iPad twice, my iPod once, and a cell drawing power down only to 50%. Ive powered it up overnight to be sure I had enough power for a trip, and it really does a good job of keeping all my devices powered up. With a charger attached to the cigarette lighter port, you could go for weeks with this battery.The battery offers three USB ports for recharging almost any device you use.  It comes with a flat cable for recharging, and the cable fits easily into the pocket of the felt envelope that comes with the battery for storage.  When in use, the battery has LEDs that show how much power is left, so you never need to run unexpectedly.This has turned out to be my favorite battery.  Its too large to be carried comfortably in my purse, but its great for use on a long trip or just recharging devices on your desk.Id choose this for a gift for the family or friend who need extra power.  Theyll be as enthusiastic as I am.FIVE STARS!Sample provided for unbiased review.

The heat in Texas is finally going down, so its again time for bike riding.  Ive cleaned and lubricated the bike but, until now, Ive had to use a loose pair of sunglasses during an extended ride. Heres a small camping lamp that produces enough light in a tent that you could actually read by it.  Its powered by a rechargeable battery. Wow, I love this charger!! It's the fastest multi-charger I've owned yet. Finally, I can charge two of my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3's in one device with both being 2.4 A!! The chocolate pieces are really good and even my little cousin can't stop eating them, but the regular pieces are quite bland and hard to eat if you don't have any chocolate pieces with it. It's alright, but I probably won't rebuy this.

Wow, I definitely did not expect this cereal to be as sweet as it was - I think I like it even more than regular Cheerios. Delicious and crunchy, and with protein - definitely going to consider buying this from now on.
Interesting texture, but surprisingly addicting. You can't go wrong with peanut butter and chocolate though lol. This didn't even last a full day in our house.

I love love love love this flavor. Not to mention, these bars are still a whole lot healthier than me trying to grab some chips. Definitely will keep buying this.

My little cousin LOVES this cereal. The taste doesn't compare to warm out of the oven cookies of course, but it's not a bad alternative. She's always a big fan of how the cereal is shaped and it's this huge box is perfect for her snacky moods when she wants to just grab some and try to dip them in milk haha.

1:19 MinsWow, this spinner is so much fun! You do need batteries for it to work, but it's very easy to use and glows brightly. Simply plug in the batteries and press the button to turn it on. After pressing the button for a few seconds, it stays on until you turn it off. It is EXTREMELY bright - it's great and after a while, the balls actually spin in different patterns for endless fun.My little cousin actually plans to use this when trick-or-treating and it's great for parties as well. I would just beware that trying to touch the balls when they are in motion can hurt, so be sure to keep this a good distance away from your own face and other people's bodies to prevent any harm. Otherwise, this product is very simple to figure out and loads of fun to play with for a cheap price! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

2:29 MinsI was so surprised how big these tools were! Since it was only $15, I expected something actually toddler size, but when this came in my mail, I was definitely shocked at the size. This is such a cute kit and it's absolutely wonderful. My little cousin is obsessed with play shopping and cooking, so I wanted to get this for her birthday which is coming up soon.You get utensils, a knife with a cutting board, pots and a stove, as well as salt and pepper shaker with matching mugs. They are very nice and bright colors and well made. They are lightweight, but they are also thick and nothing is too sharp. It's a great play kit for kids to learn and play to their imagination and I know my little cousin is going to love it. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I am obsessed with adult coloring books right now and I received this one a few days ago and love it!! The designs range from sort of simple to very complex, and so it is very interesting! I love how abstract all the pages are, and no two pages are the same at all. Every single one has its own unique aspect to it and so for that, I give it an A+!I use pens to color in my drawings, 0.5 mm sometimes, but despite the pages being a bit thin, nothing bleeds through to the next page (although when I look at the blank page on the back, I do notice the color) ! Each page is wonderfully made and it's really up to your imagination of how you want to color it. Coloring relaxes me a lot, but I hated children's coloring books because you could maybe color in the person or animal with one color and 50% of the coloring would be done. I get bored easily, so if I color with one color for too long, I lose interest. However, with all the little spaces in details in this book, it's hard to get bored. This book is lots of fun for a great price. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is beyond adorable! I was initially worried about the mess that would come with this product since it is sand and my cousin loves to make a lot of mess when playing around. However, once I received the kit, I was surprised to see that the sand was actually quite dense so that you don't spill bits and pieces of sand everywhere. The density was quite nice, and it had a nice texture for molding. It's not sticky at all so once you pack some sand in the mold,it's very easy to get a clean mold and the molds are very easy to clean if anything.I love all the little animals that came with it (elephant is my favorite), although my little cousin loves the roller. This toys provides a lot of imagination really, and my little cousin kept requesting to play with it and refused to stop until she just had to go to sleep. Nothing in this set is too sharp and it is 100% safe although I would be sure to keep an eye out so that nothing gets eaten. Overall, I have no complaints. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Flashcards are a great study tool and I've learned a lot using these flashcards to flip through and learn some quick facts and pick up some basic things that I had forgotten. However, the flashcards are not updated for the 2015 MCAT and the fact that it's so much more expensive for an oudated set is very off putting. It's definitely detailed and very helpful for those who don't like to study by reading, but you definitely need a lot more than flashcards to study for the MCAT. It's hard to tell how much of this will be helpful for the MCAT, but it's at least decent in review for the science sections. The cards are quite thick and the way the information is organized is very helpful and makes it an easy read for those like me who don't always have the best attention spans.The diagrams and points made are very helpful and give me some great quick lessons and summarize important lessons and tips very well. However, as stated, it's missing the sections for the new updated MCAT, so I would personally not buy these if you're looking for a good and detailed flashcard system for the sections of biochemistry, psych, etc. Still, it's definitely a good support for some of the science sections that make it easier to study than reading huge books.

Wow, I've always bought cheap paintbrushes in the past, so I was very impressed by this quality set of brushes. I knew they were going to be long from the picture, but the actual size of the brushes when I got to opening the case just made my jaw drop. The brushes are longer than half of my arm!I love that the brushes have the sizes on them too. There are many varied brushes for different sizes, making it easier to paint in the larger backgrounds for different canvases as well as layering on intricate details to a piece. The bristles are a bit tough at first, but they soften up with water and spread the paint very well. The hard bristles actually are a good thing since they don't seem to shed easily.However, one thing that got to me was the very strong smell when I first removed the case. I left it to air for a few days, but there's still a slight smell coming from it. Although it's not nearly as strong now, I was quite set off by it. There was also slight damage to my size 10 brush, but it wasn't a huge deal. However, that was my only complaint with the brushes. I love how you can make the paintbrushes stand up with the pop up velcro tabs that support the brushes. It definitely makes it easier to grab the brushes and it's quite sturdy so there's many ways it minimizes possible mess. Overall, the case and brushes are very nice quality, and I can imagine these are going to last a very long time. My sister has already requested that she wants to use it for her next art idea, so that's how I know they're really good since she's much more knowledgeable about the arts than I am. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is so cute and fun to play with!! I absolutely love all the different flower shapes and they definitely make vegetables more fun to eat. I have a picky little cousin who absolutely hates vegetables because they look and taste icky. But, once she saw me trying to cut carrots into the shapes of pretty flowers, she wanted to join in! My mother put them into her dish that day, and I told her that my mother used the vegetables we cut - and she immediately ate them because she was so attracted to the shape!The cutters do require some force to push and cut down if you have thick slices of vegetables, but the cut precisely and always make the same size shape of the cutter you are using. I really appreciate the hand guards because the edges of the cutters can be quite sharp and sometimes vegetables can be very slippery - so I also recommend wearing some thick gloves in case you are dealing with unsteady pieces of food. Beyond vegetables, I plan to use these for dough as well so they work very well as cookie cutters! Lots of versatility and fun with this product, and no complaints. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I've never had a memory foam pillow before but WOW, I can't imagine why I never even bought one despite having read all types of good reviews. When I first got the pillow, it came in a round cylindrical bag - I nearly thought I had bought a yoga mat and didn't even remember. However, upon inspection, I realized it was my bamboo pillow! I got really confused and was wondering why my pillow was shaped like this. I took it out of its bag and unwound it, and after taking off the layers of plastic, I realized it was just very flat. I didn't see any instructions for it, but I remember the description said to let it air out for 24 hours - and so that is what I did.There was a smell coming from the pillow, most likely due to the tight wrapping of the plastic, but that all quickly disappeared to a minimal once it had aired out completely. It was really neat watching the pillow grow near me and after about 12 hours, it seemed to have grown to full capacity - although I did let it sit for 24 hours just in case.The pillow is extremely soft! I kept pressing my hands on each side just to test it, and I love how cool it is. In the summer, my house usually doesn't run too much air conditioning anyway, so we need all the cool we can get. I felt very relaxed lying down on it, and it felt like I was sinking into a cloud. I don't sleep too easily due to various reasons, but I definitely felt more at ease and ready to sleep with this pillow when I took a nap earlier. I woke up to see that it had left an imprint of where my head had stayed, so that was very interesting. I'm definitely going to buy memory foam pillows for the entire family now. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Although I just got the mouse today, I am already loving it! It's super easy to install and extremely easy to use. The only thing I had trouble with was finding where the USB receiver was - but thankfully due to another reviewer posting a video instruction, I found that the USB receiver is actually on the bottom of the mouse, and you pull out the brand name to reveal your USB receiver. I thought that storage idea was very cool, although it would have been nice if that information was stated somewhere.You do need 2 AAA batteries, but once you stick them in, you should see a flash of red light on the bottom which means that it's ready to use. I was able to use my mouse immediately after turning on the mouse and plugging in the receiver. It's easy and the mouse feels very comfortable in my hands. My hands are quite small and so the mouse is only slightly smaller than it, but it's still an easy grip and everything is within easy access for me to reach. I was only interested in getting a wireless mouse, so I have no idea how it works for gaming - although it states that it's only for basic gaming. Everything works for what I wanted it to, so no other complaints here! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are cute stickers for a great price. They are very big and very nice quality. I love all the funky rainbow patterns and they really stand out on a page! They are easy to remove and stick very well and there's so many in each roll that it makes it cheap to buy these. I'm definitely going to rebuy this heart set once I run out, but that most won't likely be for a while since I'm not sure what to use all of these stickers for just yet! However, I love that it comes in a roll rather than a sheet of stickers because it makes it easier to go through and store. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are great stickers! They're a nice size, have lots of fun and various rainbow designs, and there are plenty in the roll to go around. They are also very easy to peel off and stick extremely well. I honestly can't decide which one I like the best but I am so happy that the price is so cheap because I am definitely considering buying more once my current stock runs out. So far, I've used them on little "Good Job" cards but I will be trying to find more uses for them soon! No complaints here about anything and it's definitely a great product for a good price. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Works exactly what I needed it for. I lost the installation disk for my Brothers printer and so I wanted to connect my laptop to the printer via Ethernet cable. I was able to connect my printer port to my router easily and the cable went in securely and had a large enough length for me to bring the printer next to my desk. Cheap price for a long cable and it comes with a ton of clips and ties (which I most likely won't use though). No complaints! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Decent price for a 16 oz box. It's crunchy and it's the original flavor, so there's nothing I've found to complain about. I prefer some of the new bolder flavors in the Wheat Thins line, but sometimes it's good to go back to the original :).

I absolutely love the individual packaged stacks because they're so handy to bring and give to other people on the go. I have always loved Ritz crackers, never bland and lightly salted. I love making my own cracker sandwiches and this is a cheap enough price for me to consider buying more. Can't complain and was very impressed nothing was cracked once I got it.

This is a much nicer toaster then it looks like in the picture. There are some characteristics that really make this one worthy:The space it takes up on the counter is actually less then a fatter wider toasterThe color is a rich vibrant red that is beautifulThe slot width is great - I've used it for bagels to handmade bread to thinner sliced muffins and all work fabulouslyToasts super fast - like you won't be able to put your toast in and go and get ready and come backIt toasts evenly, does not get overly hot, appears of nice quality - and it's easy, due to the wide slots, to get the bread, bagel, or other out of the toaster.

Setting the scene: 2 bedroom townhouse with a bath on each floor. Outside sunroom. Fall in DC - with a huge tree in the front yard. 4 Cats - one longhair -  4 litter boxes and 3 cat scratchers made out of cardboard that the cats love so much they leave pieces of them everywhere. Laminate and tile flooring. Rugs. Lots and lots of rugs.The Plot: Business traveler - only at home for 48 hours. Teenage daughter - freshman in college with no interest in neatness or order.The mission: 15 minutes max to put together the vacuum and do the whole house.Mission a-c-c-o-m-p-l-i-s-h-e-d! Super easy to put together (you'll need a Philips screwdriver only). This thing sucks like a champ, is easy to maneuver, covers a wide path, and tools can be used to pick up lint/dust/corner stuff. No rug pulling nor issue with going from laminate to rug (it did not immediately spit out all the stuff like a regular vac would do). It is lightweight - but it's not light guys. So you'll still be carrying it upstairs - it's not going to carry itself. The bag seems doable - I've had bagless for many years but I really do detest cleaning them out so we'll give this a go.

I live in a 1937 concrete block townhouse with baseboard heaters from 1971. It's also all open concept downstairs which means there are no "rooms" to heat where you can shut off space. That means it eats money for heating like crazy in the winter and fall. It's a tragedy. So I try to find ways to economize. I use radiant heat via space heaters and we dress warmly. I normally run very hot - but my daughter and her friends are perpetually cold. Enter this blanket. It works for all of us.This is seriously the most plush blanket I've ever had. You wrap yourself up and you want to cocoon and not come out until Spring. I'm not kidding. The heating element is great - it doesn't get so hot that it makes you sweat and the controls are easy to use. It's a great size for lounging around. I'm probably going to buy another so we can have two. This is one of those purchases that your mother in law might give you for Christmas or you might think about for a relative. Contrary to so many hokey lame gifts - this one would be a big score putting you in good graces for many years with those you love! Strongly recommended!

I've been reading Ally Carter books since I was in middle school. I have always loved the world of espionage and intrigue, and combined with some badass teenage girls kicking butt I was in love with the Gallagher Girls series. Heist Society was just as good, looking at the less legal side of the intrigue coin, but with the same charm of the Gallagher series that I loved. Cammie Morgan and Kat have been with me since I was a kid, and I was beyond excited when I heard news of Ally's new book All Fall Down. Overall, I was not disappointed by this read. The story takes a more diplomatic approach to drama, set in the political peak of Embassy Row in the land of Adria, where Grace- the granddaughter of the American ambassador- is trying to figure out the truth behind her mother's death years ago. She makes friends with other kids on the row, and together they try to figure out whether or not Grace's belief that her mother was murdered is true or if she really is- like all the doctors say, in the nicest terms- crazy. The plot of this story kept me reading like a fiend. There were moments where I wasn't sure the doctors were wrong about Grace, and others where I was sure she had to be right. Grace's character as a whole had me in tears some moments from her frustration and self-doubt about what she was doing and the fact that nobody seemed to be listening to her. The entire story had a dark undertone, one that reminded me a lot of the second to last Gallagher Girls book (if you read it, you know what I'm talking about) and the truth behind what happened to Grace's mother genuinely surprised me. The characters were fun, and I loved Grace's ragtag team of youths that she got together to help her solve this mystery and catch her mother's killer.However, I had my fair share of gripes with the story. First, Grace's relationship with the cute Russian boy next door, Alexei. Though Grace recounted knowing him as a kid, and how he was her brother's close friend on the Row, I never really got a sense for how their relationship developed in this book. I was never sold that they had any real interaction when they were kids, though she mentioned it a few times, and when a "relationship" seemed to develop between the two I found it all sort of... Random. Especially considering for half the book she just kept pushing him away. They had a few large interactions, but his presence in the book overall felt scarce. I couldn't understand how such a deep bond had formed by the end, and even though he had helped her keep cal during her attacks and tried to keep an eye on her throughout the book, I just didn't see enough of an interaction there. I'm hoping that in the next book we'll see much more development if that relationship is planned to continue.The last thing that bothered me was some repetition and a few aspects of Grace's character. A lot of serious phrases in the book just felt overused, and they lost their impact as the story went on. For example, a phrase like "I'd never feel safe again" would be used like five times. A line like that loses impact when used so often, and it wasn't the only one. Grace would say things like this like virtually every chapter, and I understood she's been through hell and back these past few years, but at times it just felt unnecessary to state it over and over again. It didn't detract from her character majorly, though, and I still enjoyed reading from such a dark perspective. I just wish things like that would've been used more sparingly, and I feel it would've made her character more solid.Overall, I genuinely enjoyed this book- just like all of Ally Carter's work- and I can't wait for Embassy Row Book 2!

After receiving Corel Painter 2015 last year, I was very excited to see what changes would be made in the new 2016 edition. As an art student, I've used several types of software for art and illustration including Corel Draw, Manga Studio (now Clip Studio Paint), Corel Painter 2015, and of course Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. Of all these products, Corel Painter 2015 definitely had the most resources and tools focused on digital drawing, painting and illustration- and that holds true in Corel Painter 2016 as well. There are a multitude of tools and mediums, all categorized by their sections (such as pencils, oil paints, acrylic, gouache and more) that span essentially the entire spectrum of traditional mediums. The textures of the brushes and the tools are beautiful, and on the canvas layer look exactly as they would if they were being used traditionally. As in most art programs, there are several other windows that can be utilized as well including the navigator, layers, and color tool (all digital staples). Overall, this program has an impressive amount of tools (especially the various brushes, pens, pencils, etc. which are my favorite thing about Corel Painter) and on top of that, they've added a few new features to this edition. The most interesting one was the ability to turn music into patterns and brushes that could be integrated into your work. I've never seen a feature like this before, and while it is not perfect (as the it is very sensitive to the sound and beat of the music and not every song translates well into a digital pattern), it opens doorways to several very interesting designs, projects, and opportunities. A gripe I do have with Corel Painter though, and have since 2015, is the Undo feature. The program I use the most often is Manga Studio 5, because of its simple interface and tools- including a very convenient and easy to use Undo button. I am not someone who enjoys using keyboard commands, so having an Undo option somewhere on the screen is a big plus for me, and Corel Painter doesn't seem to have that. Going to the command bar and clicking on the Edit tab and clicking Undo is a tedious process in my opinion (especially if you have to use it more than once in a row), and something as simple as an Undo feature would be nice to have displayed in my workspace, versus under a tab in the command bar. One other issue I have is, while the tools look absolutely gorgeous when used on the Canvas layer, they lose all their texture in any other layer you create. Perhaps there's a way to edit this that I don't know of or haven't figured out yet (I'm still experimenting with digital illustration and design, so I don't claim to be an expert in this field) but it is very frustrating when I want to color or draw something on a layer that isn't the base canvas layer and all the tools I use lose their gorgeous textures. Since the large array of tools and the way they look when used is my favorite part of this program, it makes me sad that I can only see what they really do on one layer. Finally, there is one large feature I have yet to experiment with in this program and that is the Animation feature. I have looked at it, and it seems like it has some potential for basic animation, but I haven't actually created anything with it yet. Overall, this edition of Corel Painter is just as good as the old one with a few new tricks added in. I'm excited to see what Corel puts out next.

For the subject matter content this is quite good. It's an anthology of stories and not all are even but all certainly cover the subject well. If this is your thing this book will surely satisfy! This is the best of the bunch by the way - the other offerings are not nearly as good as this one.

So far so good with the sneakers. I'm a runner and I have a teen. All of my shoes are in the entryway and I often get told that they are a bit smelly so thought I'd try these just to give it a go. They work well and don't impart a weird odor to the place. They are a bit big for my shoes (I wear a size 6.5 or so) and that's the only negative I can see. I think for regular size feet these would be awesome and work well in athletic shoes. I'm very tempted to send my sister some of these for the hockey paraphernalia because that stuff reeks the worst of anything I've ever smelled! I received a sample of this product for my review.

Probably my fave travel guide ever when it comes to properly preparing you for the attractions and what you should do. I bought the touring plans as well and they helped - but the book itself was a lifesaver when it came to Disney. I went to all four parks using this guide and had not only a great time but was able to plan my fastpass well. All the hints and tips worked - and the descriptions were spot on. This is simply a must if you are going to Disney!

I used this and the Unofficial Disneyworld book on a recent business trip where I took advantage of tickets to USF and Disney at every available opportunity. It was a great read before getting to the park and I found the suggestions helpful. I actually don't agree on which ride is the best but that is subjective anyway and nothing I'd mark down for. I found this super helpful to get me through Universal Orlando in the time I had with the best happiness. I didn't take my own advice and did a one day two park hopper - but if you have to do that this book is a MUST!

Perhaps best for hair that is not super long and thick. My daughters hair is very thick but she just got it cut to below shoulder length. That made a big difference for her with this brush. When her hair was longer this brush was a bit more difficult to get through her hair. It's not huge - and it seemed to lack enough umph to push itself through without some amount of constantly going over the same area more then once. Now with slightly shorter hair, but still thick, this works very well in shower and it replaces her beloved comb for detangling. I received a sample of this brush for review.

I am a runner and, as such, always seem to have a time or two per year where I need extra help. I regularly go to the chiro and get ART and Graston Technique done as well as adjustments and I foam roll, use yoga therapy balls, and otherwise do fascia release. So I'm not a stranger to support in helping me run my best at nearly 50. I quite like this tape. I find it more flexible then KT Tape - and not quite as thick which means I have an easier time of maneuvering it over curves and bumps on my legs. I also don't "feel" it quite as much as the other tapes. However this tape is really painful to remove - more so then other tapes. It does last longer though so there is a trade off. It is my choice when I need something for longer term (not for one single race) and that seems to be its main benefit. The bands and such that came with it are fine - they are good tools to help. I received a sample of this tape for review - and will definitely be buying it when this roll runs out!

I like this a lot but it is HUGE. I am 5'1" and petite this is really just too big for me and it's quite hard. If you are a larger person (taller or bigger) this would probably work well. It is not very portable because it is very heavy - I cannot easily bring this to work or the yoga studio because it's just too big and bulky. For home use it's fine - and I use it for relaxation type yoga with poses that are designed to get you comfortable and breathing over a several minute timespan. As a bolster for a more flow based yoga this doesn't work for me at all. The quality seems good - the cover is a nice color and it's held up to much use.

This hydration reservoir works great in all of my packs. It has a nice big mouth opening (more like Camelbak then Hydrapak) and is easy to fill and maintain. It is, so far, easy to clean and did not come with that terrible plastic oil taste that several of my other hydration pak's reservoir's have arrived having. It fits in my Ultraspire Astral Vest, Ultimate Direction Jenny Vesta, and in the older Nathan Intensity vest as well. No leaks, no issues. Happy runner! I received this reservoir for review - and I've bought my fair share. This one is a good value!

This stuff is worth every penny you spend. It is not the same as what can be had here in the states normally - and it works amazingly well. Better than all the other arnica creams I've got. It will heal bruising, muscle soreness, small lacerations, rashes - this stuff is truly multi purpose. It has me buying this from strange countries like Bulgaria!

These pads are all it. They are comfortable to wear all day, do not come off your panties easily and stick well, and are appropriately absorbent. If I bring any other type of pad home my daughter complains. Though these are not the cheapest option - they are by far the best. They don't stick to you either (I mean how awful is that!). Whether the unscented or scented versions of this product it is an absolute mainstay in our house and the reason I switched back to pads at least at night - before this they were just so uncomfortable, really did not absorb well, stuck to your body and not your panties, and just were generally uncomfortable.

For the price this is a great value. It does collect a bit of lint and cat hair but then most of the portfolio's we've got do. It holds quite a few objects but don't make it too heavy or the handles start to feel like they will give way. This is not a pricey expensive option for a professional artist - it is a nice option for a student or other on a budget who wants convenience in carrying art supplies and papers all about campus.

This is my favorite coffee, bar none. I have a hard time finding it locally in stores so have shifted to online for convenience. It has a great flavor, no bitterness or "burnt" odor or taste, and no aftertaste. It's mellow but rich and I love it because it seems I cannot brew a bad cup of this stuff. Even if I put a little too much coffee in the pot. A mainstay in my house - this and the breakfast blend as well as the decaf are my go to coffee!

While there are definitely some editing issues - this one has a nice plot that gets an extra star for the religious element. It was not over done nor overly played and it synced perfectly with the two characters. There was a reason for all things - and that let ties be known and claimed without issue. The pacing was a bit uneven and, at times, confusing, yet I came away with a flow that was pretty solid. The sex is fine - standard to me - and Aidan will tug at your heartstrings with his past and his decisions. This has a bit of little boy lost flavor if that's your thing.

My cats love this food. I thought, as is their usual practice, that anything not pate would end up on the bottom of the bowl but between the 4 of them they lick every bowl clean that this goes into. It is a sort of slimy option but that makes it slide out easier. I prefer that to digging out the pate in the cans. The taste must be excellent because they stand around whining for this food incessantly and have been known to push it off the shelf. I expect at some point they'll chew into it enough to open it. I've got clever cats!

It is a sort of slimy option but that makes it slide out easier. I prefer that to digging out the pate in the cans. These are very good razors - with 3 blades. The last set of Soleil razors I had were only 2 blades. What I notice about these is that they cut very close - which means you get a shave that lasts a little longer but which also means you have to be very careful not to nick yourself. The handles are easy to use when wet and did not slip out of my hands (one of my major complaints in razors). This is a nice economical package - and the colors bring a bit of brightness to your bathroom!

These are the softest washcloths I have ever used. Ever. They are a good size (not too huge and thick - which prevents a good scrub down) and of a shape that works well. I really cannot get over the softness. I actually stopped using washcloths years ago because they tend to be thick or they are scratchy or they are larger sized - all of which prevent me from using them for their purpose which is washing my skin. I have sensitive skin (compliments of my Scandinavian heritage) and these work flawlessly. They are easy to clean and they keep their shape. Any skin would love to have these washcloths next to it. This is a must have for your gift basket for a new mom or dad as well as anyone who likes the finer things in life! I've already got several folks at my work raving about these cloths - and we all agree our pregnant coworker is getting these in her gift basket! I received these washcloths in exchange for a review and just could not help but share then with a few friends - it's like the best restaurant you simply must yelp about!

Even for those who enjoyed the home decorating aspects of past Animal Crossing Games this will rapidly demonstrate that it lacks any form of depth or breadth.As a huge fan of the AC games (I still have every one of them and play them all even many years later!) I was aware that this Happy Home Designer (HHD) focuses solely on designing homes. I eagerly anticipated getting home design requests and finding out how I did on meeting the villager's goals. I thought of all the hours I spent collecting unique items in the other games - often traveling to stores to download limited time special items and happily enjoying visiting so many other players' towns hoping to find a rare piece of furniture at their Nook's. How I loved to send letters to my villagers and eagerly wait for their letters back - with the attached presents - some of which would be items I wanted for my house. As I progressed in the games and catching (or purchasing) needed museum items became more rare, my attention turned to satisfying Lyle and the Happy Home Academy. Pursuing expansions, going to flea market's, and exchanging thousands of bells with other players just to get that last item in a set were weekly activities. I feel like AC should come with the warning that you *might* need to go to a 12 step program before long as I found myself hopelessly addicted within minutes of every new offering.So - 2 stars. One is just because it is Animal Crossing and there is some, albeit limited, charm in designing in this game. However the long list of woulda, coulda, shoulda built up by the minute of playtime - until I was spending much more time noting everything that could have been but isn't. Incredibly disappointing. So below I've expounded on all the things things that could have been.I could have my own house to decorate - and perhaps I could have unlocked items or received special items from villagers for doing an outstanding job (vs an ok job) decorating their house. I could have had interesting, funny, sad, inspiring, or affectionate conversations with villagers while designing their house and when I finished. While there are a few gems here and there this game utterly lacks the charm of the characters. They can practically be interchanged - not much sets them apart personality wise. I could freely roam my town - visiting the folks for whom I've designed their home -- so happy and proud of my accomplishment. I can do that - but I cannot walk around to do so. It's only menu driven. HUH? Why wouldn't you be able to walk around your town and enjoy it? I do get that designed hundreds of homes would be a big town and rather expansive - but I still wanted to feel like I was part of the game (rather than an employee who goes home to a different town every night - I wanted to live there too!). To compare the equivalent in ACNL would be if you could only walk in the museum/shops area and the entire rest of the village (below the tracks) you could only get around to via menu and choosing a character to visit. It leaves a dead and disconnected player - without any connection to the greater whole of the players creation. Epic miss here.OK so then I thought, well, focus on designing. Except I can do no wrong. I'm stuck in a Groundhog Day on a loop where I am perfect. It's pretty satisfying the first few times - but after that I must confess I wanted to start deliberately sabotaging what I was doing. Apparently the "everybody gets a trophy" construct has now invaded Animal Crossing just like the blob did the theatre in the old movie. No matter what I do the animal loves me. I can do no wrong. That makes me boring, vapid, and lame. I'm not a fan of those feelings. This is the part that is most painful to me. Sure take away many other elements to focus on the core of home designing - but for goodness sakes make it have some level of challenge or reward! Something, anything to reward my hour long work in designing the perfect home. Instead I'm met with the same "I love it" reaction from every.stinking.animal. This, IMHO, is the game killer. As others have noted perhaps a scale of "that's ok" to "super awesomeness" should have been offered. You could even OPT IN to this when you set up the game. Much like choosing whether you want to go easy or grindingly difficult in games that offer that option. Let the kiddies parents tell them to choose the "easy" setting if they cannot handle realistic criticism and encouragement. There is being creative and stretching your artistic muscles and then there is just mindless wandering without any aim. So far I don't even get a badge for doing so many homes or any sort of recognition beyond every villager loving what I do. That might work for 6 year old - but I want to have some sense of satisfaction. Even if the villagers had a scale - I would go back and re decorate just to move higher on the ranking scale. Anything to reinforce the value of my work. Yeah yeah - intrinsic value. I like both my own satisfaction and an external indicator.To be fair there were enjoyable elements but the lack of connection I felt to the game (you cannot even change your clothes!) overshadowed all the positive stuff like a black cloud and it became pretty monotonous and repetitive very quick. It seems like a few choices could have been made that would have had a real measurable impact on my enjoyment of the game. In an effort to see if I can interject some more love for me for this game - I'm going to get some amiibo packs and go online to see and rate others. However I'm not a fan of rating others and them rating me. I want Lyle to do that - and I want to have to work to get a better rating.  EDITED: I did buy several Amiibo packs. For the special characters like Isabelle you can make her appear but she does nothing. You cannot talk to her, she does not interact with the villager nor the homes. She just stands there - like a hologram without a voice. I LOVE the cards (they are giving me the satisfaction I'd hoped to get from this game because of course I want them all).I bought this with the new 3DS unit and I'm very happy with the unit itself. I love the faceplates and the smaller size for travel. However I'll be loading in my Animal Crossing New Leaf to take with me on my travel this fall. I think I'll start a new game (I almost always have at least 2 carts of each game - I like to have multiple games going at the same time) there. The bottom line here is no risk, no reward. It leaves you with a hollow feeling - like seeing a whole table full of plastic food - it's pretty and if you don't look too closely it looks appetizing but it's never going to satisfy. At this price point I cannot recommend it.

Both my daughter and I tried these panties. We are not quite the same size (I am a 6 and she is a 7) and we have different body shapes. These did not fit me but she liked them a lot. I would give them 2 stars and she says 5 as she really likes them - so we compromised on 4. For me they ride up and I don't like how the elastic feels - it almost seems to cut into my skin. I have sensitive skin. My daughter wears a larger variety of different panties and she says these covered well and did not ride up. They seem a bit larger then a 6 - so perhaps if you are a size 7 these are a good option. For me, as a 6, there seemed to be a little long and big. The fabric is standard and the panels are not super soft but neither do they scratch. These are very thin underwear for a cotton blend - and the bands are also think and narrow.

Bottom line: You can finally be the person who says their you-know-what does not stink!Seriously. This really does work. It's a strong smell - however not all strong smells will mask poop. I do have to say that, once I went vegan, my poop (and farts) smell way less nasty then they used too with animal products. People in my house remark on this all the time. I remark on it when I have to use the bathroom after they are done. No lie. It's like a reason to go vegan man. I'm trying to craftily find a way a way to gift my ex a bottle of this when he comes to visit (we share our kids...so we end up in the same locale occasionally). I think if you have a guy and his diet is full of stinky stuff this would be a required element. Possibly before food. I'd even hold out sex. Yes. Yes I would. NO ONE should have to go into the bathroom after a guys been in there doing his business and reading the paper or whatnot. That could be considered a form of domestic discipline. Who needs spanking when you can use poop stink? No one. That's who.This actually works as well on cat poop as human. It doesn't erase smells from carpet or anything. But if you have a multi cat household and the litterbox is somewhere you will smell it - like in a bedroom closet by your bed - this will do to banish that stink as well. As a general rule I just ignore it (after all my cats ignore it..they seem not bothered by it at all) but there are times I just cannot let it lie. I scoop and throw - but the smell lingers. For that this works good too!When this bottle arrived my daughter was overjoyed. She just started college. Think dorms and other situations where you don't want to stink. She loves it too. I will need to purchase more. I'm not overly bothered by the strong smell and she is not either. Most of the women and men I know are so over perfumed/cologned you can barely tell anyway.

I got the red one's and they are excellent. There are 4 to the package and they are super easy to use and clean. Considering I'm a vegan I cook a lot. I also make a lot of messes because I have a small kitchen and so there is little room to really spread out and cook. Having 4 of these is a lifesaver. They work great to not only rest a spoon but also to rest other things like measuring cups, measuring spoons, and I've even used them to hold some crushed nuts when I ran out of little bowls. They wash up easily by hand (I have no dishwasher). I like silicone because I have a flat top stove and these don't scare me like some of the other types. Metal gets super hot and I've had ceramic break (not sure what caused that..but it was not fun!) and these are simple to stack and pull and use. They are flexible so don't expect this hard spoon rest that is easily moved with a spoon on it that's heavy. They won't do that because they are not super thick silicone. For all my uses these are outstanding. I received these in exchange for a review. I think they'd make a great gift for a newlywed. I often create a big basket of fun kitchen gadgets for wedding gifts and these would be excellent put in one of them. They are better then anything similar I've gotten at IKEA (my normal shop for gadgets place). Plus - the colors! How great they come in so many!

Easily a top 5 of the year book for me. While I enjoyed the first one in this series I was not as thrilled with #2. #3 definitely blows them both out of the water. And that's saying something. Complex characters, great action, and a story spanning over a decade mean you get to spend a ton of time with these boys and you really know them. They speak to you and their lives are utterly irresistible. There is a train wreck going on - but you cannot look away. I could not put this down through a metro ride, flight, and into the cab on the way to the hotel. I think others have amply showcased the strengths of this novel - I will just say that I absolutely loved it.

Firstly this is one of the best tasting supplements I've ever had. It's got a fresh citrus'y taste that is not strong nor overly sweet. I like stevia but I know others do not and this did not have a funny after taste. I mixed it with rice milk. At this point I cannot tell a specific benefit but I am using it as part of an overall fitness routine while training for a marathon. I used this in place of one of my recovery drinks and felt just as good as I do with the other drink in terms of muscle recovery. I'm hoping this boosts my immune system so I do not get sick. So I'm going to continue using it daily and see what happens. I will update my review as time goes on. The ingredients are excellent and there are many servings in this container though the scoop is smaller then I expected.

I've got a few of these types of units and this is a favorite and one I travel with frequently due to it's pro'sPro'sIt is a surge protector (SO many of my USB hubs are not!)It can handle universal input which is super helpful to me with international visitors (we are a host family for foreign students)It has enough power to do at least 2 IPAD's (though they say 3 - in the USB port area - two ports are only 1A so IPAD's would probably take longer to charge)It can charge and provide power to 6 at once. YES!!It feels pretty heavy dutyConsThe plastic unit itself does not feel as sturdy as others I've got - however I've had no issues.The reason this is such a fantastic item for me is that my daughter and I work together on opposite sides of the table. In fact we're ready to ditch the smaller kitchen table for a larger desk with some filing cabinets underneath to give more space to work. She's an artist and I'm just a "spreads out'er". This is placed between us and it can handle everything we've thrown at it from phone's to handheld gaming systems to IPAD's to regular PC and my MacBook and no issues! This is a case of you don't know what you are missing until you have it and this makes our life so much easier. Additionally our cats often play under the table so having an assortment of cords was providing some chewing opportunity that we didn't want them to have - and this solves that by allowing us to just have the one cord. Although I got this item in exchange for my review I would happily, willingly pay the asking price. If you have this type of need this is a must have. I gutted and remodeled my house before I moved in and I put USB outlet's in but even they aren't enough and this works better for everywhere they aren't (AND they are protected in this one..all the better!)

These are very cute scrubbers! They match nicely with my black and white kitchen and they are made of material that is washcloth like. They work on scrubbing most things but not the heavier baked on items - they don't have the type of fabric required to get at tough to scrub food remnants. Because they are cloth (think cotton feeling) they are also a little awkward to hold while scrubbing. There is no "heft" to allow you to get a great purchase vis a vis a thicker pad you can double up or similar. They do work well for when you've soaked an item in water and for general sort of everyday type situations - but I wouldn't reach for them for heavy duty scrubbing action. You'll want to maintain another cloth or scrubber for those areas.

OK I haven't had this machine very long but I have rolled 600 cigarettes so far both king sized and 100's with out any problems at all. I have been rolling my own cigarettes with a manual Topomatic machine for a lot of years. I consider the topomatic to be a very good manual machine. As the years go by my arthritis makes it harder and harder to roll cigarettes with a manual machine so I decided to try this machine despite the mixed reviews. Here is the things to avoid on this powermatic 2 machine. When you get down to the last 1 inch of tobacco in the bag DON'T use it. Instead mix it a little at a time with new tobacco. The reason for this is the last amount of tobacco has very small pieces in it and it is easy to over pack the machine and jam it. There is no doubt if you jam the machine you will eventually strip the gears out of the machine. I use one pound bags of pipe tobacco. The most important thing to remember is if you feel a lot of resistance when you press the lever down STOP and take out some of the Tobacco. You should only feel slightly more resistance on the lever then if there was no tobacco in the machine. Now when it comes to rolling 100 size cigarettes here is the way to do it. Put the tobacco in the machine normally and then with your two fingers in the center push the tobacco into both corners of the machine, then add a little more to the center, presto perfect 100 size cigarette. I have no idea how long the machine will last so for the time being I am going to only give it 4 stars but after 3,000 cigarettes I will update my rating if it proves to be reliable. There are two good video reviews on YouTube about this machine. One video is about rolling the cigarettes and the other one is how to completely tear the machine down for maintenance. So far I think it is GREAT!Update: 9/18/2014 three thousand cigarettes rolled and still working great.

Just a heads up to fans, there IS a 23 episode "Season 1 & 2" 6-disc set being sold at CostCo for $28.Buy it from Amazon.com here:The Wonder Years: The Complete First and Second Seasons***** - for the show*** - for the DVD mastering (old analogue videotape masters)  Note the editing credit at the end "Edited on the Ediflex" "Electronic Laboratory Pacific Video".The Costco season 1 & 2 combo version:Season 1:disc 1Pilot  (24:40) 1/31/88Swingers  (22:42) 3/22/88 * note that this is a minute short.My Father's Office  (23:51) 3/29/88Angel  (23:40) 4/5/88disc 2The Phone Call  (23:50) 4/12/88Dance With Me  (23:45) 4/19/88Bonus Material:Highlights from The Wonder Years Cast reunion  (20:23) 5/28/14Featurette: With A Little Help From My Friends: The Early Days Of The Wonder Years. (24:35)Cast Interviews:Neal Marlens & Carol Black (creators) (33:53),Fred Savage (Kevin) (29:24),Danica McKeller (Winnie) (12:17) &Josh Savino (Paul) (21:34).Season 2:disc 1Heart of Darkness  (23:33) 11/30/88 - has THE DOORS tribute group singing "Children Of the Night".Our Miss White  (23:55) 12/7/88Christmas  (22:53) 12/14/88  * note that this is a minute shorter, but it does have the Glen Campbell Christmas Special playing on the Color TV.Steady As She Goes  (23:51) 1/11/89Just Between Me & You & Kirk & Paul & Clara & Becky  (23:37) 1/18/89disc 2Pottery Will Get You Nowhere  (22:46) 2/1/89 * note that this is a minute short.Coda  (23:20) 2/8/89Hiroshima, Mon Frere  (23:20) 2/15/89Loosiers  (23:06) 2/28/89Walk Out  (23:13) 3/7/89disc 3Nemesis  (23:19) 3/14/89Fate  (22:49) 2/28/89  * note that this is a minute shorterBirthday Boy  (23:11) 4/11/89Brightwing  (22:26) 4/18/89  * note that this is a minute shorterSquare Dance  (22:11) 5/2/89  * note that this is a minute shorterdisc 4Whose Woods Are These?  (23:07) 5/9/89How I'm Spending My Summer Vacation  (23:14) 5/16/89Bonus Material:School Days: A round table discussion with Danica McKeller, Fred Savage and Josh Saviano (7:52)Featurette: The Times They Are A-Changin': The Era (28:45)Cast Interviews:Daniel Stern (narrator) (30:59),Dan Laurie (Jack) (20:43) &Alley Mills (Norma) (33:34).Note on the VIDEO QUALITY: You have to understand that TV shows produced in the late 1980's & 1990's were filmed, sometimes on 16mm instead of 35mm, then transferred to analogue video tape for editing.  Thus the final edit of the episodes are on analogue video tape.  So unless the original camera film negatives are re-transfered to HD Video and re-edited to match the original edits (like Star Trek TNG, Seinfeld, That 70's Show), this is the best it will look.I notice that there is no continuity to the run times of each show, which indicates if a song was cut out.As far as the show itself, Fred Savage & Danica McKellar give amazing performances as Kevin & Winnie.  Every subtle nuance of their personalities is perfectly portrayed.  The stories themselves capture the 1960's era perfectly.  The original music included is essential to the mood of the show and thankfully most of it is here.This is much more affordable than the cheaply packaged complete series sold at Time-Life's website.
