I had heard a lot about Jag Jeans before I finally decided to try them.  They lived up to my hopes!  These jeans are very comfortable, particularly in the waist.  I have a "pooch," I guess you call it, and I hate how the waistband of pants digs in, especially when I sit for long stretches, like during car rides.  These jeans are a big improvement.They do stretch out some, although I haven't had the problems with a "saggy butt" that I see other commenters describing.  To me, these jeans don't stretch out more than my "regular" jeans that have stretch in them.  I have learned to deal that it -- when the stretch gets a little bad, I throw the jeans in the washing machine.  If it's really bad, I will put them in the dryer, too.  That takes care of it.A note on sizing:  I am between a 10 and a 12.  I ordered both sizes, and I decided to stick with the 10.  I didn't notice a huge difference in the waist -- with both pairs, I have to kind of work them around my hips, which makes sense, given that they don't have a zipper or belt.

Does a good job of forming nice wavy curls (with 1" rollers).  This is concentrated, so the best thing about it is that you can dilute it to suit your hair. I started with the suggested amount and then added more solution the second time for a firmer set. I got a small spray bottle at the dollar store to use with this. No messy gel or sticky solution to deal with . I really like it.

The information says this is good for scalp massage but it's really too soft for that. It brushes OK, but just doesn't feel right. I prefer the sturdier bristles. Surprisingly, even though the bristles are soft,  it broke off more hair than my old brush.

Great big bargain! I cut this to fit the bottom of all my baking pans, especially the cast iron dutch oven I use for bread. No burning! Outstanding quality and a ton of paper. No mess to clean up on anything. Great for rolling out dough, cookies. biscuits. Roll out things with bottom and top sheet. Remove top, and transfer bottom sheet to the pan. Easy.

I wanted to like these. I ordered my usual size and one slipper was a lot bigger than the other. Not a little, a lot! The bigger one seemed to have less of the foam  padding on the bottom, and less fur inside. One logo patch was on straight and the other was crooked. I sent them back.

Fun and functional!  We all know how difficult it is to hold a taco shell and fill it at the same time. Whoever invented these sure knew. Set the taco in the holder to fill, and while eating. You'll wonder how you ever got along without these.

These quick oats taste the same as the "slow oats" that take longer to cook. The only difference is that these are cut thinner, and are great for oatmeal, cookies and home made granola. Let's talk bread. For added nutrition (and lower cholesterol) nothing beats oatmeal bread. Just add a half cup for every loaf. I also add raisins and walnuts!  Can't beat the price and organic too!
Delicious ideas for dumplings. I make mostly vegetable ones to put in soup. Although I don't deep fry,, they sure look good too!  Very creative ways to fold too. Impressive for parties.

Super good tasting and even better than green tea. (See Dr. Greger's Nutrition Facts.com for details). This makes an excellent cold brew. 4 bags to 2 quarts of water (8 cups). I use 1/2 cup lemon juice and a little splenda. Tastes like fruit punch. The price on Amazon is far better than any supermarket.

These sure come in handy. I purchased them with my new Genesis screwdriver. All but the largest one fit into the screwdriver. I never know that removing a damaged screw could be so easy. Great addition to my "single woman" tool bag. Great invention!

You may not be able to build a house with this tool, but you sure can fix a lot of stuff around the house. I purchased this because of the bonus drill bits and screw driver bits. It's easy to recharge with the included charger. I also purchased a Mazu damaged screw remover and extractor to use with this and it works perfectly. This does not have that "Tim the tool man" power, but for small jobs it's fine. Small enough to get into tight spaces, and the charge lasts a good length of time. It even has a charge indicator. This has two speeds and adjustable torque too. I will use this a lot.

These are not really what I expected, but they will do for the fall display. They are Styrofoam, apparently spray painted with a black paint that is a bit sparkly. You can't see the sparkle unless you are up close though. There are a few tail feathers glued onto the end, but no wing feathers. They are not realistic looking at all. I will use them, but will look for more realistic crows next year.

WOW! I'm an instant fan of this instant gel!  I make ranch dressing a lot and always used a cup of low fat mayo and a cup of low fat milk with the dry mix. I tried the recipe on the back of this package using 1/2 cup of low fat mayo and 1 1/2 cups of low fat milk, (not the suggested buttermilk). I put in the onion and garlic powders and some parsley and dill, and a touch of tarragon. I also added a 2 tsp of balsamic vinegar. Then I whisked in the one tablespoon of the gel. It got thick enough to use for dressing and tasted wonderful!  What a calorie saver! The fruit spread idea also turned out great with mashed strawberries and some of the gel.  This also makes instant pudding with no cooking. I can see that the uses for this will be endless.  Non GMO too!!!

Interesting that most of the one star reviews said the pulse/pressure action was too weak. I found it intolerably harsh. It was so forceful that it hurt my gums and I do not have sore gums or any dental issues.  It was almost impossible to open and close the battery compartment and the instructions said the batteries only last about 20 minutes total. Not good. I sent this back.

My handicapped child can use these by herself. I was having trouble trying to help my child floss her teeth. The long handle on this brush makes it easy for her to use. She does have to watch in the mirror as she flosses, but even with teeth close together, she can manage to use the "tight teeth" thin brushes without bending them. The best thing about this 3 brush set is that you get samples of the brushes so you know what kind suit your needs. I also have a handle for myself and found it very easy to use. This is a great purchase for us.

Perfect size jar to keep my winter mulling mixture fresh. This jar is indeed air tight. When I put my heavily scented mulling mix in here, I couldn't smell a thing around the lid. I use fresh cloves, cinnamon sticks, star anise, allspice berries and orange peel in the mulling mix and if the jar was not air tight I would have smelled it. That makes me more confident that other things stored in these Oggi canisters will also be kept fresh and air tight. I will be ordering more.

I purchased these for a fall mulling spice mixture to put into a stovetop simmer pot.  I also use the mulling mix  in a cheese cloth bag for spicing up hot apple cider. I had no idea how outdated and stale my cloves and other spices were until I opened these. The smell of sweet cloves was so strong I was overwhelmed. I immediately dumped out my old jar which was probably over 5  old and had no smell whatsoever, and vowed to replace my spices every year! These are reasonably priced and made an enormous difference in the simmer pot as well as the cider.

I purchased these for a fall mulling spice mixture to put into a stovetop simmer pot.  I also use the mulling mix in a cheese cloth bag for spicing up hot apple cider. I also boil some mulling mix in water to make a nice flavoring for use in winter breads and apple pie.  I had no idea how outdated and stale my cinnamon sticks and other spices were until I opened and smelled  these.  I immediately dumped out my old jar which was probably over 5 years old and had no smell whatsoever, and vowed to replace my spices every year! These are reasonably priced and made an enormous difference in the simmer pot as well as the cider.

I had no idea my star anise and other spices were so old until I smelled these. The sweet smell of licorice was overwhelming. I threw out my old star anise and promised myself to get new spices every fall. I use the mulling mix in a stovetop simmer pot and in a cheese cloth bag to spice up apple cider. I also boil some in water to make a nice flavoring for use in winter breads and apple pie. These spices are very reasonably priced and sure make a big difference in the mulling mix, simmer pot and cider.

I purchased these for a fall mulling spice mixture to put into a stovetop simmer pot.  I also use the mulling mix in a cheese cloth bag for spicing up hot apple cider, and  I boil some mulling mix in water to make a nice flavoring for use in winter breads and apple pie.  I had no idea how outdated and stale my allspice and other spices were until I opened and smelled  these.  I immediately dumped out my old jar which was probably over 5 years old and had no smell whatsoever, and vowed to replace my spices every year! These are reasonably priced and made an enormous difference in the simmer pot as well as the cider.

I finally splurged and bought this. Now I know why everyone loves this system! For summer bounty from your garden, for premade meals,  for pantry items and emergency supplies, for hunters and those who hunt for bulk sales of meats at the store, there is just nothing like this system for keeping everything fresh. If you read the directions, it's very easy to use and works every time. Seals in less than 30 seconds with no waiting to seal the next bag. No wasted bag edges either, it seals very close to the end.I use a regular zip type bag (with the zip area cut off),  inside all the foodsaver bags to make it easier to re-use them. Usually no washing necessary! For long term storage, I use the rolls and premade bags. For short term, and frequent opening and closing, I use the ones with the vacuum hole.  Although I was told that the vacuum hole type were "not recommended" for the freezer, I have found that they work just fine. All that is required is very careful sealing technique and a small piece of freezer tape over the hole for added security.For soups, sauces, pie fillings, and other liquids, I freeze them first in lock n lock containers, then I transfer the food into the bags. If you are going to boil the contents at some point, it may be better not to use an inner bag. No telling if it would melt.  For real economy, and longer term storage,  I use Ball freezer jars with the wide mouth vacuum  attachment. Cook that big batch of spaghetti sauce or soup once and enjoy it all winter!At first the cost of the bags seemed to be more than the savings on the food, but with inner bags, or better yet wrapping portions in cling or even sandwich bags, all bags are re-usable, and even easy to wash if desired. For added cost savings on premade and rolls of bags check out "food vac bags" they are sold here on Amazon, and are just as good as the name brand. What an invention! This is the best purchase I have made this year!

These, work perfectly if you remember to do a few simple things:  1. Wrap moist food lightly in plastic wrap, cling wrap or press N seal. If freezing, freeze liquids like sauces in flat containers (like lock n lock), remove when frozen and wrap, or place into a regular zip bag with the zipper cut off, then put into the foodsaver bag. This enables you to reuse the foodsaver bag later.  2. Press some of the air out of the bag. Press the zip strip firmly on a hard surface two or three times. Use the back of a butter knife or spoon to ensure the bag is tightly sealed.  3. Place the sealer firmly over the vacuum hole. Start the vacuum process and twist/wiggle the sealer a tiny bit to ensure a good seal. For added security, place a small piece of freezer tape over the hole.The manufacturer said these bags were "not recommended" for the freezer because they "might" not hold the seal. I tested this... THEY DO HOLD, if you seal them correctly. I make portions of meats and cheese for sandwiches, fruit, vegetables, and other items and wanted to be able to remove a portion and reseal the bag and return it to the freezer. These re-sealable bags are perfect for that.Remember though, for use in freezer or refrigerator, you must blanch vegetables before sealing. Especially broccoli which gives off gasses when sealed fresh, Read the manual ( I know, I usually don't either) but this manual has important information and no one wants to take a chance and either waste food or worse, get sick. To freeze fruits, wash, dry, peel, slice and freeze on cookie sheets first. Place in zipper bag then into the foodsaver bag. Take out what you need and reseal. For long term storage use the regular foodsaver bags or rolls.Obviously these are terrific for non freezer and non refrigerator storage too.  All your pantry items will stay fresh seemingly forever.Like me, you will wonder how you ever lived without this system and these bags.

So sorry to report that this leaked out the bottom, and the on/off switch on the handle was so tight it was impossible to move. I had to return it.

This is the best of both worlds. No clunky food processor to take up space on the counter or that you have to drag out of the closet to use.  My Kitchenaid is kept on the counter and this attachment is right under it in a drawer with the small box of blades. Better than that? The dicer on this model!  I cook a lot and I've spent far too many hours hand slicing,  dicing  and shredding vegetables. This makes quick work of it all!The blades are very easy to install into the main assembly and then attach to the mixer just as you would any other attachment. Clean up is easy, sometimes with just a quick rinse and dry with a paper towel. I don't put these in a dishwasher, it's really doesn't seem necessary. The blades are super sharp and best of all you're not limited by the bowl size as with a conventional food processor.I got a terrific deal on this from Amazon warehouse. Saved almost $40. They always say there is a little "cosmetic damage" on the product, but all I have ever experienced is a slightly dented box with no damage whatsoever to the product. No manual for use was included however, but that was quickly remedied on line at Kitchenaid where I downloaded the manual. I'm so glad I got this!I love this new kitchen toy, and expect to have many happy hours of fun with it. I think you will too!

Sweet delicious tea! I mix this tea with other flavors and a little lemon juice in an infuser pitcher and leave it in the refrigerator overnight. Next day I have the best iced tea ever. Green tea goodness and antioxidants what could be better. Watch for Amazon price on pack of 6, it's half the price of outside venders.

I was pretty skeptical about this, but after years of overflowing coffee grounds,(using Bunn filters)  I had to try it.  IT WORKS! Not a single bit of the 2 overfilled scoops of fine grind decaf (enough for 10 cups) overflowed the basket into the pot. I was also concerned that the filter would not remove the bitter tasting oils or whatever they say the paper filter removes to make good coffee. IT DID.  Amazingly, the coffee tasted smooth, clean, and definitely un-bitter. Compared to this, my coffee used to taste like heavy, leftover-from-yesterday stuff.Regular filters are 2.25 inches tall, Bunn filters are 2.5 inches tall and this filter is 2.75 inches tall. I have an old NHB Bunn coffee pot, and even the Bunn filters weren't tall enough. This is. There is even room to spare at the top.  I do have a special flow regulator for high altitude; free from Bunn.This is so easy to use. Just dump the grounds into the trash after brewing, rinse it out, and you're ready to go again. I will never go back to paper filters again.

Really nice. Clear gel with just a hint of mint that goes away quickly. I don't detect any smell after a minute or so. Seemed a bit tacky to the touch when I first put it on, but it went in quickly and left a smooth silky feel within a minute. I have done a lot of research and found that aloe is one of the best things you can use on your skin. My face feels a little tight as if some of that loose, over 60 skin is being tightened up. That would be nice! I know cucumber is good to reduce puffiness under the eyes, so altogether, this gel is a winner!  It's much nicer than a gloppy cream that takes too long to sink in. I will definitely be buying this again.

Terrific for 2 very large entrees, (or smaller portions with leftovers!), generous side dishes for 4, and a very nice artisan loaf of bread with crusty goodness.  Details: The lid has nice deep indents for easy removal even with oven gloves. The bottom part is glazed, the top is not. You can spray the bottom with cooking spray, but do not spray the top. Soak the top for about 20-30 minutes. Pat dry.For food other than bread: place the entire cooker with your meal in it into a COLD/unheated oven. Set the temperature and time for cooking. Remove the lid for the last 10 minutes of cooking time if you want to crisp the contents. For bread: Spray the bottom, soak the lid, and place the entire EMPTY cooker in the cold/unheated oven. Set the temperature desired. When it has reached proper temperature, carefully transfer the risen dough into the cooker (Raising on parchment helps) put the lid back on and set the time desired. Remove lid for the last 20 minutes of cooking time to obtain a crisp crust.I read somewhere that to convert a recipe to the clay cooker you can raise the temperature 50 degrees and decrease the time about 20 minutes. I have not tested this because there are plenty of good clay cooker books and recipes everywhere to use.Details: The cooker base exterior is approx. 8 3/4" x 8 3/4" at the top.  The interior diameter is approx. 7 3/4" x 7 3/4" at the top and 6 1/4" x 6 1/4"  at the bottom. It is about 3 1/2" deep.  The height of the base alone is 4". The entire cooker is about 6 1/4" tall with the lid on.The most fun thing about using this is the feeling of the connection to the "old days and old ways". These clay pots have been used for hundreds of years, maybe thousands and are still used today in all parts of the world. Sure, technology is nice, but there's nothing better than the feeling of making a nice loaf of bread in a clay cooker like our ancestors did.

What a great double turnerWhat a great double turner! I don't have a Panini grill so I use my ribbed cast iron pan and bacon press to make sandwiches. This sure makes it easy to turn them over without making a mess!  I also use it to turn food on the grill. Better than using a fork and letting out all the juices. You can't flip things with a spatula in each hand, I tried, and regular tongs are too narrow. The widest part of these is almost 3", and they are 4" from the end, to the beginning of the handle, so appx. 3" x 4"  for the turning area. The come apart to be used separately if needed. Great purchase!

Lots of color choices and combination of waxes and markers make fixing  scratches easy. These made little flaws and cat scratches  virtually un-noticeable on my furniture, cabinets and walls. Nice to have handy when getting my house ready to go on the market for sale. These did a nice job of hiding a cat scratch on a leather coat too.  I'm glad I bought these.

The absolute best there is. I have used this for years and found it to be the fastest acting, neatest, and safest product for eliminating ants anywhere. I will not spray anywhere in my house because we have pets and children around. At first you will see a ton of ants around the bait for a few days; this is a good sign. They take the bait back to the nest and in few days, the ants are gone. You can hide this small bait container almost anywhere and when the ants have left, just toss it in the trash. Takes about a week.

I finally decided to ditch my ancient dymo with the thick plastic tape and get this easy to operate new model. I removed all the old labels on my extensive spice collection and replaced them with sleek, elegant silver labels. This unit is very easy to use and the directions are clear.  There are lots of options in text size and graphics too.The label prints with no wasted tape on either side. The backing is easy to remove with the perforation along the whole length of the label (unlike the backing on the old plastic tape). The labels can be repositioned and even placed on another item without losing the sticky on the back.You will probably have that "what can I label next" excitement like everyone has. I got a great deal from Amazon warehouse too!

The best book to come along in a long time! I love to make home made crackers but was tired of trying to roll out thick dough into thin crackers, This method is one of those "why didn't I think of that" things.  Well, Alice did think of it and you will be glad she did. The book is relatively small for the price, only about 73 pages. She spells out in detail a lot of things you probably already know about flours, supplies, baking tips, and why you should make your own crackers, but there are still things to learn here.The recipes are pretty simple, and very inspiring. Once you understand the process by making her recipes, you move on to being creative, and that's where the fun begins! I did not go out and purchase all the specialty flours, I only had organic whole wheat and buckwheat flours from my bread baking supplies, so I substituted a little organic white bread flour for the spelt etc. (horrors! I know), but it was only a couple tablespoons.The fun is looking around your kitchen and finding fun things to use in your cracker creations. It really does only take 5 minutes from mixing to baking The pictures in the book are really beautiful, but let's just ignore the goofy hat and costume that is her Alice in Wonderland persona.  As she says, you will never buy store crackers again. This method is so easy, any kid can do it and it would make a great gift for all aspiring kid chefs! (Don't forget to get them their own chefs hat!)PS, I almost forgot to mention the sweet crackers! How about chocolate for example, and with NO OIL, they are easy on the calories. Splenda  and stevia work great in all the recipes too!

I have a picky eater cat. One day he likes something and the next day I get "the look" when I serve it. Those of us who are "cat staff" know what that means.  ( Translation:I had that yesterday, I want something different today ). Although Max Cat makes a lot of flavors, this duck is the only one my picky cat will eat every day. In fact if I try to serve him something else now and then, I get the "smell and walk away" thing.  He now gets duck Max Cat every day and we're both happy! The other cats will gladly eat anything I serve, but they do love the duck the best. We do love our cats don't we?  Amazon's price is less than my local store too.

The works beautifully on my spice jars and all the lock & lock containers in the pantry. The slightly shiny silver metallic is a nice elegant change from plain white. The cartridge slips easily into the Dymo too. I experienced a bit of a learning curve trying to figure out how to remove the backing, because I didn't see the lengthwise perforation. I was used to fighting the thin backing on my ancient hard plastic tape in my old dymo.This seems a bit pricey for label tape, but amazingly you can remove it from one item and place it on another without any problem. Just be sure the surface is clean and dry. I  use rubbing alcohol to clean the surfaces of plastic and the tape sticks really well, even when used two or three times to reposition or move to another container. The LetraTag is really fun to use, and the tape is beautiful!

It was hard to believe all the different types of cakes that were in this book. I figured I had thought of them all. Not even close. There are several "special diet" variations and substitutions too,, like dairy free, sugar free, gluten free, vegan etc. I did not see a substitution for oil or butter, but I have always used banana, avocado, pumpkin puree, mayo, or my favorite, yogurt. I choose, depending on the cake flavor. (Gotta keep those calories down). The first cake I made was (yogurt) chocolate cherry, with fresh cherries. Outstanding!Just a note: If some of the cakes turn out a bit too rubbery in the microwave for your liking,  and you don't mind waiting, use a toaster oven and ramekins. 350 deg. for about 10-15 min. It's worth the wait. (I use the small ramekins, not mugs,  in the microwave too. They cook faster)I think that the whole point of this book is to inspire you to think up your own combinations and be creative. Satisfying your sweet tooth with a small gourmet treat is sure better than making a whole cake and ending up eating too much of it. If you use the substitutions, you can really create a nice dessert with very few calories. and.....if you're so inclined, a TB of liquor (say, Grand Marnier?) in that chocolate cake wouldn't hurt either..

I purchased these for their terrific health benefits, especially for my eyes. They taste somewhat like cranberries, but a little more tart and just a little more chewy. I put them on my yogurt and toss a few in my salad. I have incorporated them into my homemade granola too. 1/4 cup contains about an ounce of dried berries, and is considered a daily serving of about 100 calories.I understand these are very easy to grow in containers and I am looking into purchasing a few plants. I have a dehydrator which will be vey useful, I'm sure. I'm very pleased with these overall, but they are expensive and if I can learn to grow my own, I will be even happier.P.S.  I have found that one of those ceramic brown sugar saver things keeps these moist and prevents them from getting hard.

Perfect for fancy hamburger buns, and individual desserts too!  I was trying to make relatively uniform buns but not having much success. I use a rich egg bread dough and shape them like a pretty Kaiser roll. Unfortunately the dough always seemed to have a mind of it's own. I didn't want them bakery perfect, but I thought a little consistency would be nice. I now measure out 3 1/2 ounces of dough, shape, and place in the pan. They come out just perfect.  The straight sides of the pan keep the dough contained and my rolls are not spread out and flat any more. They rise to just a little over the top. Unfortunately this pan is too big for most toaster ovens, even my large Breville toaster oven.  If you're using a mix or scratch cake or muffin batter, fill the wells only 2/3 full.  I like this pan even better than a muffin pan for corn bread and biscuits. The larger flat bottom really makes it easier to use those things in the bottom of a bowl with chili or stew over the top. as compared to a regular muffin pan.Mini pies with pie crust, filo dough or puff pastry work great. Meringue shells also turn out perfect.

Blum wins again! I have tried several different brands of facial wipes only to find them too harsh, too heavily perfumed and with simply too many unacceptable ingredients. I was leery of the smell of these with chamomile as I prefer unscented things, but the scent is very light and surprisingly pleasant. These do not further dry out my already dry skin, and they do remove makeup and dust (I live on a dusty mountain).  This is the one I am going to stick with! Great product. Lots of choices to satisfy everyone.

This is the moisturizer you have been searching for! Thick and rich, creamy and luxurious, it has every ingredient you need for terrific skin. The first ingredient is organic aloe, used for hundreds of years  to treat skin conditions and dryness. I live high in the mountains (8,200 ft) in a ski resort. The dry mountain air has really made my face look dry and  dull. After only a few days of using this cream, I am starting to see a difference. I have tried almost everything on the market (organic) and I am sold on the ingredients in this. The harsh exfoliating chemicals in the other creams  made my face burn. This has no smell, nothing to irritate your skin, only natural moisturizers. The price seemed a bit high, but the jar is a very generous 4 ounces compared to the others who have only 2 ounces for the same price, and you only need a small amount.Recap: The best things about this are the excellent line up of natural ingredients. It has no offensive smell, you get double the amount for the money compared to other organic creams. It has no harsh exfoliating ingredients, and it's thicker and creamier than most of the others, I will be ordering this again.

This is the best concentrated cider ever! It can be diluted 1 cup cider to 7 cups water for a great drink, but I use it as is in everything from cookies, cakes and caramel applesauce (caramel flavoring from Lorann) to my extra special smoked ribs.  I smoke ribs in a stove top smoker for an hour and 1/2,  with about 1/4 cup of pecan and apple wood, (Camerons) and the drip tray filled with 2 cups of diluted cider. Even though the directions say to smoke "dry" I have found that this cider keeps them moist and tender, and the flavor is unbeatable! I finish with a whiskey bbq sauce made with a couple TB of undiluted cider.

Sharpens with very little effort. Stores easily too. The "bars" inside the grooves are positioned so that there is no guessing if you have the knife in there correctly. No need to tilt the knife.  Pull the knife from heel to tip several times. Use the next two grooves to smooth out the edge. All my knives are "tomato slicing sharp" now. All my scissors, from kitchen shears to craft scissors to sewing scissors are a joy to use. No more frustration with dull cutting and slicing tools!

This is the best thing since the sliced bread you will use the jam on!  (Homemade bread, if you can). Prepare your fresh ripe (or frozen) fruit, no need to cook it,  just clean and remove any stems etc. Mash or cut in small pieces and mix with the pectin and sugar if using. Splenda and Stevia also work perfectly. I found that my fresh strawberries needed very little added sweetener. Pectin is used at about 1 TB per cup of fruit. All you do is mix for about 3 minutes (or until your hand gets real tired!). There is a bit of confusing information as to how many jars of jam this will make, but that is because you may need to add a little more to some fruits to get the consistency you want. I would say there are between 15 and 20 cups worth of pectin. It makes the best jam you have ever had! I tried this with juice and it didn't work very good for making jelly. The Ball web site "doesn't recommend it" for jelly, but I just had to try. I used the Wood's Boiled Cider, (available here on Amazon) and diluted it 1 part cider to 7 parts water. I tested it with two cups of the cider and 2 TB of the pectin. It really didn't set up at all.  I will use the low/no sugar pectin next time, and boil the cider as recommended by Ball. I will add a drop of LorrAnn cinnamon oil next time to get that apple/cinnamon jelly taste like the kind I had purchased at a local orchard. (it was $15 a jar, yikes!)In summary, what could be easier than crushing some fruit a little, stirring in the pectin and letting it sit a few minutes to thicken?  The entire jar of jam will cost about 50 cents and the best part for me is that you can add any herbs or flavorings you want, to create one-of-a-kind gourmet jams. Grandma never had it so easy!***UPDATE***: I found a recipe for caramel apple jam and altered it to make with instant pectin. 4 cups apples (peeled ,cored and chunky-chopped). lightly boil to just slightly tender, crush a little and cool, then and add 1 tsp  butter flavoring and 1 tsp caramel flavoring, (or to taste)and 3-4 TB of instant pectin. and sugar, splenda or stevia to taste.Stir for 3 minutes or so. For apple pie jam, use vanilla instead of the caramel flavoring and add apple pie spices, and raisins if you like. These are not only good on toast, but terrific on yogurt and ice cream too!

For those of you complaining about the directions being inside and no way to remove the top...they have added directions on how to open the top, on the handle bar of the lid. They point to where to release the latch and flip the top open for easy removal of the infuser. This item is very versatile because you can remove the infuser and use as a plain pitcher. It does look very pretty with the infuser in and filled with lemons or strawberries when having company.For every day use, this 3 quart size is just right. I found a 4 qt too heavy and a 2 qt was empty too fast. The directions also tell you how far to turn the lid to open it for pouring. There is an arrow to guide you. I also love the handle on the lid because it's so easy to get your hand under it to turn the lid. (The red lids on other pitchers are not deep enough, and very frustrating). My only little gripe? It took me almost a half hour with hot water, goo gone and an sos pad to remove the label.I purchased two of these for our use, and I will be getting more for gifts, they really are nice.

This does tan nicely, but even though I was careful, I got some streaky and uneven areas. My fault, not the tanner. I will try to put it on more carefully. I have found that a small portion does go on more evenly. Takes about 2 hours to develop. I only needed to reuse every other day to keep a nice light tan. I am pretty pale, and "over 60" so I didn't want to look like I had used a tanning bed or heavy sprayer. Those of you my age group remember the baby oil and iodine routine that we all got burnt from using. This is more natural and very subtle provided you do not over do it. Others among you can put it on every day and look great with a darker tan. There are no harsh chemical ingredients in this and I did not detect any smell at all.

Real nice lather and no smell. Easy to push for a handicapped child who was unable to hold onto a bar of soap. However a bit pricey, and next time I will try Dr. Bronner's liquid soap (no chemical additives), with an automatic soap dispenser that needs no pushing..

I vacuumed first with my old vacuum cleaner just to see if this new Shark could find any more dirt. I was astounded! The dirt cup filled up after vacuuming only one small room. I had no idea I was leaving all that dirt, litter dust and cat fur in the rug!  How embarrassing!This was sure easy to assemble, but I must admit I couldn't find the dirt cup release until I looked at the manual. It's the large grey button on top. Attachments are so easy to put on, you will actually use them often. Overall it's light weight and very easy to push. For the price, it beats all other vacuums I have ever had for it's ease of use, and especially for it's suction power. This is the best appliance purchase I have made in long time, and I'm sure you will say the same thing once you try it!.
This is perfect for litter box duties. It's a little thinner than the ones I purchased at the Big Box store years ago, but a lot cheaper too. It's  not flimsy by any means. Worth the money.

This is my favorite of all the InstaNatural products. I use it twice, sometimes three times a day, every day and my under eye area looks so much better. I admit I am  "over 65" and should not expect miracles, but this cream really has made a dramatic improvement. The deep, somewhat dark crevices under each eye are now almost gone and the dry wrinkles are non existent now. I use it under my brows too and in the crow feet area. This company makes so many great products with carefully selected ingredients, and they really got it right with this one. I received this product at a discount the first time, to use and give my honest and unbiased opinion, and I have reordered it many times at the very reasonable full price!

I received this product at a discount to test and give my honest and unbiased opinion. Well, after years of living in the mountains at 8,000 feet elevation,  my hair was so dry it crackled with static and flew in all directions when I tried to brush it. What a mess. Nothing from the drug store worked to tame the fly-away strands. So many people said this made their hair softer, but I didn't need soft, I needed hydration. The first two times I used this, there was only a small improvement. I had let it sit on my hair for 5 minutes or so before rinsing. The third time, I got a phone call, and it "accidentally" stayed on for 45 minutes, covered with a plastic shower cap, before I had a chance to rinse it off. That did it!  My newly moisturized hair was sleek and manageable, not dry and out of control. Yes, it was soft too, but I was looking for an answer to my crackly dry, stack filled hair problem, and I got it. I now use it once a week, for 30-45 minutes before rinsing. I don't think 5 minutes is enough, so try the longer time and I think you will be very happy with how this works.

I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased opinion, and since I love all the other InstaNatural products like the eye gel and keratin hair cream,  I was expecting to like this one too.  Sadly, I just couldn't get past the smell.  I know we all have our own likes and dislikes when it comes to smell, and I am in the minority on this one. My sister tried this and said the cream really was a nice moisturizer, and appeared to tighten the skin on her inner thighs. She wasn't bothered by the smell at all. Lots of nice ingredients in this, which will tighten the skin and moisturize, smoothing out some of the cellulite if used regularly.

Shiny and bright, this cake pan is great for lots of things from biscuits to coffee cake. I make casseroles in it and quiches too. A quick, light spray of Pam before using, and there is virtually nothing to clean up. No more "non stick" pans for me. I have given them all to the thrift store and now have no more worries about non-stick coating coming off on my food. Peace of mind!

There's nothing like the good feeling of eating organic produce, and when growing your own, organic fertilizer is best. This formula is prepared with optimal nutrients just for tomatoes. The directions say to use about 3 TB of this dry fertilizer per tomato plant every 2 weeks, and water thoroughly.  There is enough in this bag for a full season with several plants. Well worth it.

It turned out that the seller of this item did not have it in stock like they thought, and they refunded my money quickly. Luckily I found this 4 qt on another web site. I really love this Anolon Ultra Clad for it's  light weight and beautiful classy look. The older I get, the less I want to lift my cast iron cookware. Being light weight, you do have to be careful not to drop the lids and pans, or they will dent easily. They aren't thin, just softer (18/0) than regular stainless steel cookware.  They don't scratch with stainless steel utensils, but I use wood because that's what I have. This line has been discontinued, but there are still lots of full sets available on Amazon. If you want easy to lift cookware and you're prepared to treat it gently, these are really beautiful.

Finally an easy clean up grilling pan. I sprayed this with "Pam high heat" grilling spray before using it and the steak just slid off. I cleaned this with a dish cloth., no scrubbing as I had to do  with the "non stick" pan. I had been a bit afraid of using the non-stick pan because I wasn't sure how hot the grill was and didn't want the coating to come off on my food. With this stainless steel pan, no worries! Nice removable handle too. Large enough for one large steak, or a lot of veggies. Thick heavy stainless steel, this should last through many seasons of grilling.

This is a great addition to all multigrain artisan breads. Lots of nutrition. The flour is fresh and has a year expiration date. If you haven't had buckwheat pancakes with banana and walnuts, you're in for a treat. Get the recipe on a baking website like Allrecipes,com, the one on the bag is too complicated. Buckwheat flour is a bit bitter so be sure to add a little sugar to any recipe that you use it with. Yes, the texture is different from wheat or graham flour, but it is not gritty, just more coarse. It soaks up more liquid, so adjust your bread recipes accordingly. I keep this in the freezer to avoid having the oils in the flour spoil.

Decided to get the money saving large jar this time. The best feature is that this is shelf stable, and needs no refrigeration. Easy to prepare as needed and to your liking as to thickness. Use this for chicken sate, cookies, smoothies, and even my "famous" peanut butter and jelly homemade bread. Wonderful flavor with a little bit of sweetness. Lower in fat and calories, and organic too!  Just can't any get better than this.

Nothing easier than tenderizing with this gadget. The holes allow the marinade to get deep into the meat. Heavy duty and inexpensive. Easy to clean if you soak it for a few minutes in a small bowl of dish detergent. Swish around then rinse. I follow up with a soak in straight vinegar for an hour to be sure I have eliminated any remaining contaminants.  No rust, no tight spots for meat juices to hide. Great gadget!

We use this for iced coffee drinks. Why pay a fortune for fancy coffee at Starbucks when you can make your own and keep it chilled all day. This is easy to open with one hand, easy to drink from, and really does keep cold drinks chilled al day. No need to add ice and dilute your drink.This Thermos does not leak. Just be sure to put the latch up when you are finished drinking. We purchase Torani and other sugar free coffee syrups right here on Amazon. Make your coffee the night before and chill in the refrigerator.

Just right for moving heavy "earth boxes" around. Easy to change locations to get the most sun and move closer to the water spigot when necessary. I also easily moved my tomatoes into a safe corner of the covered patio when we had a heavy thunderstorm. I'm glad I got this and intend to get a couple more.

.Latest intelligence, from Rebel spies deep within Imperial Space confirm that Elite units of the First Order Tie fighter pilots have exclusive access to specialised craft. In the form of a two-seater TIE craft, supplied with superior weapons and new sensor systems. As a former arm chair general, my nephew and I wanted to see how much of a threat these weapons are going to be. Will the new Tie fighter be a game changer?This is the latest incarnation of the imperial tie fighter from the forth coming episode 7; Star Wars: The Force Awakens. For those Lego aficionados this model joins the rank of Imperial close quarter fighters and their variants. The build itself was straight forward and enjoyable. It was a pleasant surprise that not too many stickers were required for application (only 4), because my nephew and I always make a mess! The new shaped pieces make the build a bit more interesting that said; Lego confirmed on-line that the heighted new pricing, for this item, was due to this introduction and manufacture costs. The fact that the fighter fires lasers is another nice touch, and the incorporation and replication in the form of 2 spring-loaded shooters adds to the detail. The additional two tone colour palate enhances the new design. The rotating antenna weapons are a new and troubling feature giving effective defensive protection, although they do not rotate that well. The red and black scheme does look great, the cockpit is remarkable with red transparent screens and seats/controls for both crew members are well done too. The booklet and instruction manual are easy to follow and was well produced. This Tie fighter looks like it emerged from the Dark Side.It doesn't offer as much as far as playability with the spring loaded shooters being the only feature. The 4 mini-figures are good quality with lots of detail, I really like the new helmet for the pilots and the variety of outfit for the officer is a good touch. This is 2 seater tie fighter, has pilot for front seat and rear seat gunner. It looks like the imperial officer and Death Star trooper are thrown in there for a little something extra. Overall there is nothing to complain about the set itself, however, we haven't seen the movie yet so we do not know if anything is missing or not.This is a good themed set and will be a great add on for anyone who collects Tie Fighters for your Star Wars collection or just wants a stand-alone set. Please note the price can vary for this item, so best to shop around to get the best price..

ALEX Toys Craft Do-It-Yourself Card Crafter was a perfect product for my seven year old niece, I must say that the quality of the, corresponding, parts of the merchandise was of a good standard  which in turns means that older children as well as adults would enjoy this crafts based creations. I was actually surprised by how much this kit contained. I love the aesthetic too - the colors and print blocks she loves it and we had so much fun creating with fun greeting cards. The colors are vibrant and everything is good quality. There is something really special about receiving homemade crafted cards. This is a product that really helps a childs creative process. There is also a process which reinforces manual dexterity, the use of shapes, layering, as well as the ability to pursue personal expression through positive play as well helping a childs imagination.I recommend this for anyone whose children are interested in and making homemade crafted cards! Please note not suitable for very young children.

What could I possibly say, which other reviewers have not already mentioned? This Anker PowerPort 5 (40W 5-Port USB Charging Hub) Multi-Port USB Charger has good build quality, good form factor, small, handy and a breeze to use.What you have here is good universal charger, Just attach your devices with the applicable cables to the PowerPort 5 and you would not need to apprehension about overcharging any longer. You have a device that will ensure surge protection plus numerous power adapters, you will only essential this to charge as well as de-clutter your plugs. For the price paid, you get a quite affordable unit with numerous features that it supports.All in all a good piece of kit, which does a good job.

The Cat People evolved way back in prehistory. As certain tribal groups sacrificed/offered up young women to leopards who seemed to have been deified, who coupled with them. These Cat People look similar to humans (or can they be described as unwilling shape shifters?), however, they must mate with other Cat People before they transform into panthers. If they do not mate with their own kind, the results are bloody and terrible.The initial narrative is Irene Gallier who was raised by adoptive parents and meets her older brother Paul for the first time since childhood. We follow brother and sister - who seem to be the only ones of their kind. It soon comes to the fore that for Paul to attain any physical relationship with a woman, he must contemplate an unpalatable truth.The underlying principle in both the 1942 Cat People and the 1982 remake are the same: A striking Anglo-Saxon beauty is given to metamorphosing into a black panther when she is sexually aroused. The caveat here being that the remake also deals with a mans sexuality and his possible social transgressions from what is acceptable, and what is not in todays society, such as incest and violence.For me the 1942 original is a real classic and was a daring film for its time. Moreover if you consider the powers and tenets of Hays Code; which were meant to preserve public morality, from overzealous film makers. The film can truly be called daring and original. The 1982 remake, in certain circles is much lampooned. Many site thematic inconsistencies in the plot, the non-cohesiveness of the narrative. A film that is more skin, then horror and then there is the growing misogyny that seems to go unfettered. I do not want to even try defending against these accusations. However, for me the combination of a good OST and David Bowies classic song made this film haunting and certain aspects a very cerebral experience, and hence my five star rating.

Rating: 3.5I got the 6XL sized Baltimore Ravens hoodie for my nephew, who is a somewhat large young man. It is always good to know from other reviewers whether sizing for clothing is as expected, so our thanks to the other reviewers for heads-up because the 6XL fits, although, it is a snug fit. All in all, this is an OK sports themed hoodie. The weave of the garment is not as thick or as substantial as some other similar hoodies we have bought in the past. It is comfortable sweatshirt; great for chilling out at home, or out and about, the color is nice vibrant, the quality of the material and stitching seems to be good too.

.This is pretty much partners' review.The Merumaya Overnight Recharge Night Cream is rich yet not overly-so and it sinks in relatively quickly leaving skin feeling hydrated but not greasy. As Im very dehydrated lately, I use two pumps, but oily to normal skins would only need one pump. This really does go rather well with the Treatment Toner, as it contains a lot of similar ingredients that can continue the good work of the toner and I would really recommend this if you have skin that has areas of dryness and then may be oily patches, as its one of the few night creams that really nourishes without blocking pores.It still early days with this product  but so far seem to going well, as with most things only time will tell how good and productive this Merumaya Overnight Recharge Night Cream is. From my limited look on the internet Merumaya products have a good and mainly positive feedback. As with all products that are applied to the body, best to do a patch test, on small area first just to ensure no negative reactions. Unfortunately the cost list here is expensive, so best shop around from this product..

Sony have launched their new h.ear (pronounced hear) series  a range of fashionable headphones and a Walkman that support High Resolution Audio (HRA). They are a minimalist design and come in a variety of colours with a metallic finish. As there bumf says the Sony h.ear in NC High-Resolution Noise Cancelling Headphones comes with two microphones which are used to detect ambient noise, which is offset by opposing frequencies, this then supposedly delivers clear audio without disturbance from background noise. The earphones come with an in-line remote and microphone on a 1.5 m cable to ensure ease of access to the device. It makes answering calls and browsing through playlist, on the go, a breeze. With just the click of a button you can answer your calls and speak without having to hold the phone in the hand.The key thing here is that Sony MDR-EX750NA earphones are equipped with the Hi-Res Audio technology, which purports to offer the highest quality music. As they go on to say this feature plays sounds in the exact range as the artist intended to hear them. This provides higher sound quality than you will find in a CD. From my understanding of things, and I may have got my facts muddled. Due to the features outlined above, then these headphones are mainly designed to go with SonysNW-A25 and NW-A26HN series of Walkmans.Key Features & Highlights 9mm high-sensitivity drivers 16 hours battery life Inline remoteWearing Style: In  earNow on the subject of how they sound, I believe sound reproduction can be a very subjective discussion - that said, for me, the sound here is equal to its design, supplying the listener with good reproduction, which offers good balance, rich in detail and a deep bass in equal measure. The headphones sit comfortably in the ear (for me anyway). I am rather particular with my headphones and for me they must sound good and should be robust and have a good quality build - to a certain degree these headphones fit the bill hence my four star rating.

Possible spoilersThinking this will prevent war; the US government gives an impenetrable supercomputer total control over launching nuclear missiles. But what the computer does with the power is unimaginable to its creators.The film is based upon the 1966 science fiction book of the same name Colossus, by Dennis Feltham Jones about a massive American defence supercomputer, named Colossus, becoming sentient after being activated, and the resultant consequences. This is one relatively uncommon movie. It deals judiciously with multifaceted scientific concerns and does so without dumbing down perceptions, nor making any painful errors in trying to keep up with its own narrative. This is a film that shows how Mankind is given the stark choice between the "peace of plenty" or one of "unburied dead".I first saw this movie as child, and really had impact on me  if anything I found it a scary concept. Returning to the players of piece; the choice Eric Braeden, as Dir. Charles A. Forbin, was excellent he really brings presence to the screen. He does not suffer fools, even if it is the United States President. His co-star Susan Clark as (Dir. Cleo Markham) makes for an intelligent love interest, and their on screen chemistry is very good. As for Colossus, it is at its spooky best when the viewer reads his short to the point Q and A. When Colossus gains a voice I feel it detracts from the overall menace of sentient behavior. If it is not already the case, then this film should be a Cult classic. Lastly its interesting to note the computers shown were not mock ups, but the real thing. A film worthy of a good five stars.

Caracal is more considerate and measured approach, as opposed to Settle as Disclosure seems to be growing and, moving on in their development, showing the audiophile a different side to their musical talents. As the music people @ NME say This is dance music for grown-ups.

The whole landscape of the previous book has changed as we find Thomas in Barbados, in the Caribbean. Not only did this give the author the opportunity to show the corruption of Cromwell's Republic. The republic's existence was initially declared through "An Act declaring England to be a Commonwealth". Swanton brings the Civil War to the fore, which did not just affect England and its close neighbours such as Ireland and Scotland, but its colonies too. Here we are usually shown the reverse position, where trouble in the colonies undermines the situation at home. The difference between the rigid, strict nature of Cromwellian society and the more relaxed, less parochial Barbadian planter society is shown, and used to good effect, but Swanston doesn't paint Barbados as a utopia, in fact he stresses the unpleasant conditions of slaves and indentured domestics were forced to live and work in.The King's Exile is a good sequel to The King's Spy, Andrew Swanston to prove that the theme of cryptography was not his only strength he can still write a compelling story, without it being the central tenants. The King's Exile is very much a character-driven story and all the stronger for it. I am looking forward to getting my hands on The King's Return the third segment in the trilogy.The narrative here is very different from last book, with far less conundrums and decrypting and more surviving and action, yet all very entertaining.

These Panasonic Infinium Ready-to-Use AAA Rechargeable Batteries were delivered in good time, I might add that they are not is easy to find locally. My friend recommended these, and said that he believed they were well made and lasted a fair time. These batteries are pretty good, as we use them in our remote controls, and other devices, at home and they do a sterling job. They arrived fully charged and ready for use. We would recommend them for your phones, remotes etc.

.Criminal Justice can be summed up as the, structures, institutions and processes involved with the deterrence, analysis and prosecution of crime, the workings of the criminal law and criminal court system and the handling of offenders within society. As with other titles in this range of A Very Short Introduction series, are intended to give the reader a jump start in subject, a primer if you will. This is done in a reasonably short, straightforward and concise fashion in the form of bite sized chunks.The author is Julian Roberts, is Professor of Criminology University of Oxford. His narrative gives a good overview, as well critical analysis, on most subjects that are covered. The book also does a decent job at trying to attract the reader into each topic field. The book draws upon the latest examination and current practices from various countries around the world. He, mainly, looks at the adversarial system or adversary system, which is a legal system, used in the common law (also known as case law or precedent) countries, for example, such as the United Kingdom, United States and Australia. The adversary system is a legal system used in the common law countries where two advocates represent their parties' positions before a neutral person or group of people, usually a jury or judge, who try to determine the truth of the case. This is in contrast to the inquisitorial system used in some civil law systems (Roman law or the Napoleonic code) where a judge or group of judges investigates the case. It is interesting to note that mainly through the British Empire, the adversary system found its way across the world.This text would be of interest to lay readers interested in the topic, as well as all students of law..

There is a girl calked Sika, a boy called Shen, 66 pugs, a race to the top of the world. If you win there is a wonderful prize  and it will be your hearts desire. At the beginning of the book Shen is shipwrecked and finds he is looking after 66 pugs. Stranded he meets Sika. The two of them plus the 66 pugs take part in a sled race. The competition is fierce. The path to victory is littered with snow trolls, sea monsters and a gang of particularly hungry yetis.There are some other interesting characters, but I do not want spoil it for potential readers, sufficed to say they are exceedingly interesting. Humour is the crucial element of this book; this is yet successful collaboration between the authors Philip Reeve and Sarah McIntyre. They form a comedic double-act, and as they have very different personalities the resulting collaboration really works. Only Philip Reeves imagination could make snow so interesting and so varied. This book will leave adult and child alike chortling for some time. The drawing of the yetis making noodles are truly enthralling and so very well by Sarah McIntyre.Look out for the 50 types of different snow. All highly recommended for and check out the other books by these two as the stories are all unique with great sketches.
