This is a well-made netbook sleeve, in a nice thick durable black neoprene manufacture with extra protection for packing a laptop and good lining. However, it is still slim; compact case, which fits an IPad or tablet up to 11"and is lightweight too. My main issue with this sleeve is that the zipped power pocket, which stores your power adapter and other accessories  does not really support a UK power plug, as it will really stick out. As other reviewers have commented, only those people with collapsible USB three pin plugs or flat chargers will be suited to this sleeves design. Apart from the issue outlined, I am happy with this sleeve and I believe it is more than adequate for my needs.

This Protective Carrying Case from Case Logic is a robust hard shelled carrying case designed specifically for a 10 device. The removable, adjustable shoulder strap is nice and tough, making it easy to carry. The way the case unzips allows it to be opened up fully. While that may be of help to some people, as it allows for easy insertion and removal of whatever device placed in it. This design feature leaves one side of the case unfastened, resulting in the contents sliding out without warning. More over even if the two loops are engaged, which are there to hold one side of your iPad/similar - will not keep your device in situ!Other areas of issue - alas this case has no side or internal compartments or pouches, so nowhere to carry any small extras such as USB drives, or power supply. This is all rather disappointing, considering there is quality here, in terms of build.To conclude then, although this product is of a good manufacturing quality, however it lacks more positive design features both its practicality and its usefulness.

Triangle Sun is a Russian pop/they encompass the Genres of Down-tempo, pop and indie. You can often hear their music playing on social events at musical festivals, private events in private nightclubs, at the places where you can find the aficionados of best in electronic music. This latest offering Dubai Eklektic Vol.3 is pretty good, in my humble estimations, really nice chill back music with a bit of 1990s old Skool through-in for good measure ------ highly recommended.

The UH400 form factor on this device is compact in design, with a sheathable cable makes it an ideal USB Hub that is Portable by Design. It supports hot plugging, no driver required and device is Plug and play. It has 4 data transfer ports make switching between devices redundant.The UH400 supports all USB devices including USB drives, mice, printers or any other USB peripheral device you want to run at the same time. The USB 3.0 ports offer transfer speeds of up to 5Gbps, 10 times quicker than USB 2.0. Please note that it is backward compatible with USB 2.0/1.1 however, the actual transmission speed is restricted by the setting of the device connected. The general bumf says there are built-in safety features such as to prevent overheating, short circuit and over voltage. Lastly, as mentioned by another reviewer the connecting cable from the hub to your PC, Mac or laptop is very short and is a real drawback.Essentially UH400 is a good device that does its intended job well, that said - the caveat here - is if you are happy with hubs cables length to your connected device.

To be perfectly honest I had heard of the brand, but I had never owned a pair before of their shoes. So when I was offered this Mizuno Wave Ultima 7, Men's Running Shoes I got a pair in size 11. I found the fit to be very good; in particular I like these because I have wide feet and appreciate the spacious toe box. It has the perfect amount of cushioning and support where you need it in a running shoe. I really have no other experience with this brand, but I find that this particular model seems light weight. While appreciate that these shoes are for running, I feel they will also be great to use in cross training, which something I enjoy doing. They are excellent build quality, and feel robust too. I have had a couple runs, with these and they afford great traction with just enough cushioning on the road.To sum up these are a wonderful pair of running shoes, and I am very pleased with them, I shall certainly be getting a second pair.

This is my most recent foray into the series A Very Short Introductions. I have always been fascinated by the proposition that these titles are intended to give the reader a jump start in subject. In a reasonably short, straightforward and concise fashion, and how this is accomplished. The topic here, being Social psychology. This discipline had traditionally bridged the gap between psychology and sociology. The definition of the subject is; the scientific study of how people's point of view, emotional state, and behaviours are predisposed by the actual, imagined, or implied presence of others.The author tells the narrative of Social psychology. He gives a good account of its history, its key thinkers, major breakthroughs and what has made this subject one of the most important and relevant subjects of the 21st century. For mankind is gregarious by nature. We as people do interconnect, whether it is through families, our working relationships, our attractions, prejudice and persuasion  in short the whole gamut of the social universe, can be looked at analysed. This AVSI primer is done in a very manageable fashion. There are monochrome diagrams and pictures to best exemplify point. This edition is readable without getting too technical in its approach. It is cram packed with a plethora of information, without going into overload. Any person new to the subject matter will not be daunted with this edition.

.The Oxford Illustrated Shakespeare Dictionary is an illustrated alphabetical lexicon of all the words and meanings students of Shakespeare may need to know. It is well laid out, easy to use and informative.Each word has a specimen sentence selected from the twelve most studied and popular plays such as Macbeth, Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, A Midsummer Night's Dream, and Henry V. Also included are notes that provide additional related to material on Shakespearean times and details, which relate to the presentation of his plays. Shakespeare is not always easy to understand, this book clarifies matters largely. If you're studying Shakespeare, and or one the plays covered for drama performance then this will be invaluable. There is subsidiary support in the form of etymological of the language used and conventions of the period in question, and how it relates for example to money, humour and honour. This is a book, which displays an extremely accurate contextualised approach to studying Shakespearean lexicon.There are full-colour graphics that show and feature clothes and armour to music and recreation. The lexicon is easy to use with its clear colour coding enables the user to zero in on areas of interest, accessible design, and has an expertly levelled up-to-date look and feel. The authors Professor David Crystal and actor Ben Crystal, a father and son team, have conceived an academic, as well as a theatre based approach to better understand, bring together language, literature  this is a Shakespeare dictionary of universal appeal, for students, teachers and parents..

.This is a beautiful book for some great illustrations from the natural world to color at your leisure and using your own imagination. This is a very creative and relaxing way to rid yourself of the stresses and strains of a busy day. On first inspection we felt it was too beautiful to spoil such a lovely, detailed and well-designed book. This coloring book can be appreciated by all ages to share. This book has quality written all over it, the binding is tight and firm. The quality of the paper is good, and as the guide lines suggest you only use dry drawing media such as coloring pencils. There are also supportive tips and methods on how to use coloring pencils, by layering and blending color so you can get the most out of your coloring book. This then means you should not have any bleed through of colour. Please don't be misled - by the books' size, the involved detailing will require that any half interested user will be kept absorbed for hours, as there is plenty to do. This is very much a cross-generational coloring book that should keep all ages happily occupied. Over all the Flora and Fauna theme is done rather well.Considering what you are getting in this beautiful book, the pricing - in my humble opinion is fair. My family and I will certainly be getting more of these books in the range, both for our coloring-in pleasure as well as sending them out as presents, over the festive season..

.The new multifunction printer is designed to handle a wide range of wireless scanning, copying and printing tasks with ease, from office documents to homework and photosPIXMA MG3650 key features:1. Connect and print with your smartphone or tablet using the Canon PRINT Inkjet/ SELPHY app2. Apple AirPrint and Google Cloud Print support3. Compact All-In-One for printing, copying and scanning4. Print and scan using PIXMA Cloud Link5. Double sided document printing6. WLAN PictBridge to print pictures directly from compatible cameras7. Prints border-less, long lasting photosOverall, this device offers better features and performance than could be realistically expected at the price; it is easy to set up and has even-handed running costs given the low purchase price. Not the fastest printer you can buy, and we have had only for a short while so cannot attest its durability or robustness, but overall it is good value for a color printer, offering performance that is good enough for the average home user or student, very straightforward installation and good value for money..

.Many gamers are zealous about their gaming, and thus demand the best that budget allows. Whether it's having a purpose built gaming PC, or upgrading to the latest PC hardware for better gaming involvement. Thus many look for ways to make the most of the gaming experience. Logitech has produced the G633 headset, which caters to those who request high-performance audio and cross-platform compatibility.Logitech's wired G633 Artemis Spectrum gaming headset supports 7.1 surround sound and are designed to connect with mobile devices, home theatre systems, game consoles, and PCs. As opposed to speakers, these headphones are easy to carry. In addition the Artemis Spectrum headsets offer both Dolby and DTS Headphone compatibility.With 7.1 surround sound, your gaming experience is heightened by creating a full-on gaming environment, which enhances movies - and mission critical to many types of games these days. Having correct spatial cognizance and being able to clearly hear the direction of subtle sounds can mean the difference between preventing a surprise gunman attack and losing the game.This is only my second, only, foray into the realms of gaming headsets, so I have no real base line to judge them against (as my first set were rather basic fare). I have always used bog standard headsets for my gaming needs. However, Logitech's wired G633 Artemis Spectrum gaming headset has really been a game changer - no pun intended. I have found them comfortable to wear, although I am not one to play any one game for more than a couple of hours. So I cannot attest to how comfortable they are - after a really long gaming session. I really love the bass on these headphones and overall the sound fidelity is very good as you get the full on immersed effect. The surround sound effect is a surprising experience when you hear it for the first time. My only gripes are the overall design could have been more refined and certain types of music do not sound well through these headsets..

This is a fragrance that got my attention for its uniqueness.I will say this is easily unisex which is probably why I enjoy this moreover the Noir scent, It has tones of rose, saffron, kulfi, vanilla, sandalwood - a warm, sweet and spicy smell give it a very alluring & intriguing smell one of those scents that has longevity . It is a future contender for a new fall/winter scent. Overall great job Tom Ford, but that price I mean its TF, best to shop around.

As a former arm chair general I have always been fascinated by the Rebels defeat at the battle for Hoth. The Imperial forces mainstay assault on the ground was the AT-AT Walkers, which seemed effective, although there were losses due to Luke Skywalkers ingenious counter attack.The AT-AT (please correct me if I am wrong) is the second edition produced by Lego. So my nephew and I went ahead and purchased this newer version. Much to our surprise, this unit is a huge improvement over the older version. The build quality is really solid, although the main command module at the front seems to be disproportionate, in size to the rest of the body. The Lines, of this significant battle unit, are nice and tight; the head unit is solid and won't come apart. The overall design is exceptional showing lots of detail.My nephew and I love the spring loaded laser guns; the projectiles can travel at least six metres. The inside of the body is bland; there is not real detail in there, but plenty of room to store a couple of imperial storm trooper mini-figures.We added the AT-AT to our Hoth battle scene simulation, and it was soon apparent that one AT-AT Walker was insufficient for an accurate demonstration on the field of battle. My Nephew informed me that either we would have to wait for Christmas, his birthday, or I could purchase the additional unit. My answer was short and to the point, I said that I only gave strategic advice  and my valuable time to help build the Hoth Lego simulation, financial assistance is not within my remit.Overall a good unit worthy of a good four stars.

.This circular cutter style is the best option of any shaver. It has a good feel and is easy to use and gives very close shave and the head glides smoothly - definitely one of their best, now this is probably not as good as a full on wet shave but it still does a sterling job, and you get the feel that the blades on this shaver are very sharp. The battery life lasts for a good long time. The attachment that is used as the side burn trimmer is pretty good and performs that aspect of the shaves well and you get rather neat results. The spring-loaded cutting head glides smoothly over the skin and adapts perfectly to the contours of the face. It handles hairs in such problematic parts as the upper lip, chin and neck easily. On average, the shaving is done after about 5-10 minutes without any strain to the skin. If one uses the shaver as a wet razor with foam or cleansing cream, the results are clean and notable.To achieve, the best possible results, and achieve a close shave I would recommend also using light shaving oil. The oil helps to penetrate the skin easily to protect it from damage whilst enhancing shaving, especially when used before shaving cream/foam.When it comes to shaving beard growth that is longer than four days, this shaver will easily tackle it with no effort at all. In fact, on the first pass you will already start seeing remarkable results that from a distance seem to be satisfactory. To achieve a truly good shave, you will need to go over the skin a few more times. Cleaning is by simply rinsing under running water, brushing regularly and applying a drop of oil occasionally.Overall a good solid product which does its intended job well and therefore recommended.

The story itself is both amusing and completely barmy along with being loads of fun to read. It made me laugh, out loud while I was commuting (I must say I got strange looks from other passengers on the train), all the way through I couldn't put it down  it was a real page turner. Philip Reeve is a very accomplished writer for children, which adults happen to read too. Both my partner and I love his work. The book is affectionately fashioned with some charming effective graphics from Sarah McIntyre and their partnership is a real force multiplier as the narrative and the pictorials enhance the story. A book that would be a bright and notable addition to any bookshelf - be it, for a child or adult.Sarah McIntyre has lovingly produced some gorgeously effective illustrations  that are lovely and zany I hope we get to see the colourful edition when it comes out. This book is a worthy addition to his other brilliant books such as Oliver and the Seawigs and I really hope that a sequel to Cakes in Space is made. A narrative that I think boys and girls aged 6-9 would appreciate, especially if they like adventures and speculative fiction.

This lip balm is nice compact and goes on so smoothly, without that overtly greasy feeling that some lip balms can be like. It leaves your lips nice and supple, which lets you know its working. You get a nice tingly on your lips and good texture as it is always soft. It comes in a great tube suitable for keeping in your pocket or a little pot. Lip balm is something I tend to use it throughout the day and especially at nighttime. This is good lip balm product, which my family and I would definitely recommend.

As the blurb says these books are designed to be readable, a way to get ahead in a new topic rapidly. The narrative gives a good overview on most subjects that are covered. The book also does a decent job at trying to attract the reader into each topic field. This is the second edition of British Politics VSI and is quite up-to-date. The narrative talks about the current position of British Politics and the coalition government that we have at this time (as of 2013).However, there is a problem here, in a book that should remain neutral in its delivery, and as other reviewers have commented the author's politics seem to influence his writing as it progresses. So here in is the `rub', so to speak and hence my rating.

Got this for my brother who is a big guy, he normally takes a 5XL, however, I went with the 6XL - as we had had issues before with garments coming in too small. All in all he is happy, the quality is great, from the material,Fleece,the Ribbed knit cuffs and waistband all tailored well. That said the zip fastener can be very stiff on occasions(and we are keeping an eye on that, because if it is an issue we will return it). Our only other slight issue is the length of the hoodie is a bit long, but i guess that is the trade off when you go for 6XL for a 5XL guy.

.Used this micro SD card in our Samsung S5 mini phone for music and video playback, where it does a rather descent job. That said these Pro cards are good in a mid-range point and shoot camera as well as the GoPro Hero series. Although I do not have any practical test equipment to analyse manufacturer claims, regarding upload or download speeds, I am satisfied in transferring data from my Desktop PC or my Toshiba laptop, in both upload to the card or download to another device. I have generally had very good results in using this Pro Samsung micro SD card.I have found it is best, especially with SD cards, to purchase them directly from Amazon, because you assured to get a genuine product. In the rare instance that there may be a problem, Amazon is easy to work with unlike some third party sellers. When installed you will not get the full 32 GB from the card - but that is to be expected, so please bear this mind.On the face of it - it seems to improve video camera performance and a certain amount video recording. Overall are very happy with this micro SD card..

.Possible spoilersBoth my partner and I saw this film at the BFI London Film Festival October 2014Film makers Ronit and Shlomi Elkabetz's latest film, is supposed to be the third in a trilogy films exploring male-controlled undercurrents in an Israeli family. However, the viewer need not have seen the other two films to be able to understand the subtext of their narrative. This film was exhibited at the 2014 London Film Festival under the `Dare' category and has since, in the case of the UK, gone straight to DVD.This production has its attentions zeroed in on Viviane (played by director Ronit Elkabetz) and her five-year journey to obtain a divorce from her husband, after her 15 years of marriage. However, she is forestalled - in that in Israel, there is no a straightforward civil marriage or divorces. For a wife to wish to live her life independently it is wholly reliant on the acceptance of either her husband or the sternly conformist rabbinical courts to agree. This is a film, which at times has ridiculous hilarity of the human condition within the context at hand, and is countered with its heart-breaking humiliations. The filmmakers approach in their direction takes an uncluttered and Spartan approach. The narrative conveys the atmosphere of rigidity in the courtroom - right down to the strict and appropriate dress code. All the film's scenes take place in the courtroom, a small claustrophobic room with white walls. It is the former wife Viviane - who is the key issue of the piece, and Elkabetz's portrayal is one to be applauded - as we see her go through frustration after frustration and her resilience.One of the themes that really got under my skin was the fact that the court session cannot get underway until the husband is present! By using this stratagem Elisha played by (Simon Abkarian) declines to present himself in court. He uses his influence to delay the court in order to wear out his wife and force her to withdraw her annulment request. In reality this tactic is unfortunately used by Israeli men who want a postponement or curtail a divorce, and is a cognitive act of revenge, or a way to illicit child custody.For me a `Gett' offers a deeply troubling view of a system whereby misogyny seems, as if it is, codified into the court system.Review update____________________________________________________________________________(12/21/2014)'Gett' fails to make it into Oscar finals for 2015 - Sad really as it is a important film.Review update____________________________________________________________________________(02/19/2015) For those interestedA rabbi has gone on trial in the United States accused of plotting to abduct Jewish men who refused to grant their wives a divorce("Get"). Defence lawyer Robert Stahl argued that his client was acting as an advocate for women and had a reputation for "convincing these husbands to go give their wives a get"..

.The year 2015 marks the 70th anniversary of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and NagasakiThe narrative is about Amaterasu, who along with her husband leave Japan after the war. Amaterasu is living in a retirement home in the United Sates, her daughter Yuko and grandson Hideo died when the Americans attacked Nagasaki with an atom bomb. Amaterasu is truly alone as her husband has passed away and there is nobody else who is close to her, in her new homeland. When one day someone, who is badly burned, shows up on her doorstep and tells her he is Hideo  the grandson she presumed died during the horrific events of August 9, 1945.The last conventional U.S Air Force raid on Nagasaki occurred the August 1, 1945, and was deemed effective to a degree. The damage from these few bombs was relatively small, it, however, created considerable concern in Nagasaki and a number of people, predominantly school children, were evacuated to rural areas for safety, thus reducing the populace in the city at the time of the atomic attack on Thursday, August 9, 1945. On that day, a plutonium bomb code named "Fat Man" was used by the U.S Air Force. In fact, Kokura province was the primary target, or intended target for the "Fat Man" bomb. However, due to poor visibility the secondary target of Nagasaki was chosen (Major Charles Sweeney, commander of the B29 bomber, had orders to drop the bomb visually and not by radar, hence he diverted to the secondary target, of Nagasaki)  and thus the cities fate was sealed.After 53 seconds from its release, the bomb named "Fat Man exploded at 11:02 a.m. at an approximate altitude of 1,800 feet - some 39,00080,000 people were killed. About half of these died instantly, while the other half suffered prolonged deaths.Jackie Copleton, the author, paints a sensitively told narrative about an absorbing woman with a heart-breaking past, who also suffers from guilt. This is a narrative, which is encapsulated within a complicated history, much of which remains secret until the end of the book. At times, it is quite intriguing and the reader is left wanting to know more. Jackie Copleton tells us a poignant tale, which is done with great sensitivity, thus making it even more striking..

Not only are these floss picks reasonably good value,but there also pretty good at the job they do. without snapping or wearing thin quickly. Why these picks cannot be found more generally is a really mystery - to quote a recent reviewer. You would think that apart from good brushing of your teeth - flossing is really important as well to maintain good oral hygiene. Now some people maybe great at using just floss wrapped around their fingers - but i am not one of them, so I find these essential.

.The Deep Sea Submarine in this set is a beautiful piece, which would look good on any shelf. The build, itself-went quickly, and all parts were bagged by step, directions, for the build were clear and everything came together nicely. My one main criticism (as usual) is about the stickers, they are difficult to apply for a nice finish. The assembled sunken treasure chest/bone cage display are OK in the set, their adequate, but it's just kind of generic, especially when compared to the sub itself. Now the addition of two divers and a shark was nice touch and affords some room for play time scenarios. The submersible, though, is the jewel of the set and everything about the sub looks marvellous. Everything looks good in this set as whole, and if you can afford to marry up either the smaller sets in the theme, or one of the larger then you have a great set piece and lastly this beauty, meaning the sub, can float and it floats real well!.

With this set, there is a large exploration vessel, a sunken ship, various underwater vehicles, a full team of divers, and plentiful supply of sharks!This is one of our favourite Deep Sea sets. This set has so many great features and is bigger than I expected, it is a great standalone product. That said there is a lot of fun to be had, with little details like the sea creatures. The main vessel, which is a new design, is cool and it really floats. My nephew had an enjoyable time discovering all the mini figures, the boat fenders, the usable winch, the shark cage and just the overall attention to detail that is here is pretty good. Of course, there is little challenge in building them especially applying the stickers. With continued collecting the variety, in this series will ensure a good themed collection. A good new product from Lego, which has more than one build part to it, and represents a good value product.For kids one of the most fun activities is to play with LEGO in the bathtub or in the kitchen sink  and this set really fits the bill.

-1519 and the Aztec Empire is at its zenith, their Empire is perhaps the most powerful in the America's, their `age' is dominated by human sacrifices. Although human sacrifice is practised throughout Mesoamerica, the Aztecs for their part took to this bloodthirsty practice to new levels of religious zeal. The architecture of the Aztec Empire is truly impressive, as can be seen by the Great Pyramid of Tenochtitlan. For the Aztecs their decadence saw no bounds, as they seemed to have conquered all in their wake.When the Spanish appear on the scene, almost by magic, they appear in their fleet of strange looking sea faring vessels and land on the coast and begin their headlong journey into the Aztec hinterland. You get a feel for the way in which these, Europeans who are almost alien peoples to the Aztecs, sweep away all that oppose them. Corts and the rest of his Spanish invaders wield carnage and inflect defeat after defeat on the Aztecs, as they destroy in a few months an Empire that had been around for nearly one hundred years. For me, Mr Hancock artfully recreates the biggest clash of civilizations, revealing aspects that only a scholar in the field would have the knowledge to put together, couple this with his skill as a great story teller. Then throw into the mix the `characters on the ground', minor players in the history of the time. However, in this weighty novel - they are main stay of the book- Tozi, Pepillo and the slave Malinal; these characters are the main ingredient in this historical fiction. They are brilliantly constructed characterizations and they bring this book to life, as they are caught in the events of the time and place.This has been my first reading, and certainly will not my last, of a book written by Graham Hancock, War God is real sizzler of summer read. I am somewhat impatient to read his next novel and hope it is out soon.-

A nice affordable starter set in the series with many good details. The large dark red octopus looks amazing, and definitely does not disappoint. The diver has good detailing with a nice print diving suit, some of which is in bright silver. On the back and front there is black-and-red upper body, the figure has a red helmet, red flippers, a grey air tank, and a transparent light-blue diving mask.The yellow-and-grey scuba scooter has great detailing with rotating propellers, two harpoons and bendable arms which the diver can use to explore the sea floor and possibly to poke at the poor octopus. Lastly you have included in this set, is one light green seaweed-type plant on a round plate.All in all a nice little set on its own, or great point to start collecting and adding to new Lego City Explores set.

.Bought this for a colleagues' daughter, who loves alls things related to the Minions.This is a nice compact bag. Ideal for school kids of nursery age. The quality is good. The characters don't look faded. It has the Minion characters with enough space for carrying books, pencils or lunch the backpack. The backpack also has adjustable and padded shoulder straps.The Dimensions are: 9L x 25W x 30H cm.Batteries Not Required.

A rather impressive shirt, made from nice  fabric. The shirt is of good quality and the stitching looks and feels strong and robust. So why rate it at three stars? The reason for was because the sizing was all wrong by a large margin, impossible to return as cost was too high, so be warned, beware of getting the size right.

This Oil-Control Mattifier SPF15 is an excellent product. This product does what it says on the tin, it applies easily and you can notice the difference. I have oily skin, around the T on face. I find it keeps my foundation on much better when use I this product and I do find I use less foundation, which in turn means it has that extra staying power. I would highly recommend this product. The pricing is a tad on the high side  that said, do not be put off with the price, as it really does job and worth every penny. If you use small amount, and really that is all you need to be honest, then this will last you ages and a little bit goes a long way

.This is a book for readers of approx. 9+. It has about 248 pages, with nice short chapters and great fun laden black and white illustrations. The short chapters means a child can approach this read in a bite size fashion.The protagonist of the book is young Danny Dread, the latest family member in the dishonourable Dread clan  a long line of villains and evil masterminds. However, Danny has no wish to follow in his fathers footsteps, and the family business of lawbreaking and bedlam. Despite going to the prestigious Dementos Academy for Young Evil Geniuses, he fails to achieve any of the principles for a future villainy. Can he try an alternate career at being one of the good people instead? He has a trusty subordinate rat who aids him on his adventure to good. Danny sets out to fight crime; but how easy will that be, when it is his own father who is planning big and terrible things  and can he be thwarted?A well-paced book, enough to keep a young reader well engaged. This has a plot with oodles of hilarity, adventure, enthralling narrative and with good characterisations. This is a storyline, which should appeal to both boys and girls..

In this stimulating comic allegory, Peter Sellers plays Chance who is brilliant as a slow-witted, innocent gardener who becomes destitute when his employer dies, as a former house cleaner of his said that that boy had rice budding between his ears and was short-changed by God. The gardener's only understanding of the world comes from watching television, for he had never been allowed to leave his home. As the narrative proceeds, the audience are shown that through an odd series of circumstances, Sellers ends up being a close personal advisor to the President of the United States (Jack Warden). His Nave pronouncements are professed as reflective insights, to such a degree that he is seriously considered as a Presidential contender.--------"Life is a state of mind"---------- (One of the pronouncements from the film) ------------Sellers made this film, a timeless comedy - but wittier than most of the comedy we see in film today. This performance is second, to maybe his role in Lolita and in the Pink Panther series, Sellers is not only funny, Sellers turns in one of his most skilled performances ever, in what would also be one of his last before his sudden death.Not matter how small your movie tastes are; this is a film that is really worth seeing.

"Power" is the narrative of James "Ghost" St. Patrick (also known as ghost), a well-heeled New York City nightclub proprietor who caters to the city's elite. He wants to build network a of high end clubs. However, St. Patrick has a secret for he leads a double life. He is also a major drug dealer in New York City. His nuptials, family and his legit business will all become embroiled, as he wants to leave his felonious life behind and be a legitimate businessman. Actors Omari Hardwick (Ghost) and Naturi Naughton (Tasha) have real chemistry as husband and wife, even though their marriage is in free fall, for they are not only husband wife but also business partners, regardless of their marital situationThis is a very good crime drama, which is stylish and has a decent and vibrant sound track.

Possible SpoilersAn examination of sexual predator, which is framed against the locale of, post-Troubles Belfast. This is Where a cop has to deal with sectarian riots outside a murder scene. In addition, where a serial killer's painstaking plans can be confounded by Loyalist thugs?Dornan plays Paul Spector grief counsellor, former Samaritans voluntary helper and serial killer who is terrorising the city of Belfast. This series revolves around a PSNI (Police Service of Northern Ireland) investigation in Belfast into a string of Murders. Detective Superintendent Gibson played by Gillian Anderson, who is on secondment from London's Metropolitan Police Service, heads the police investigation. This is a gripping cat-and-mouse series, where Dornan plays an intelligent, articulate - but deeply flawed character who gives into his deep dark desires, yet his misogyny seems rather selective or maybe he has a degree of self-control. Whatever, the case, vis--vis his predilections each episode of the five part episodes of this first season is a rather addictive to watch, as we see Detective Superintendent Gibson trying to find him and stop predatory killing spree. The provided Mise-en-scne of Belfast after the troubles, is none the less still a potential tinderbox, where sectarian gangs still hold sway. Some may be less satisfied by 'The Fall' finale - or feel that they were left hanging, whatever the case this series leaves enough mileage to run into season two.This series as with the first exhibits disturbing voyeurism, where the audience is placed in the uncomfortable position of watching the killer, as he carries out his perverse crimes. Unlike other shows in the genre, the audience is precluded from a synopsis of dangling different suspects to maintain suspense - as we already know the psychopath from the onset. The figure we are given is a humanised psychopath because the homicidal sadist was not some socially pathetic loser, but a softly spoken man called Paul Spector, with a wife and a loving daughter, and a career as a bereavement counsellor. The Fall, has been called the most popular drama in the last two decades (the in UK media) and has returned for series two very much as a slow burn thriller as opposed to a bang.This is a series that stands accused of misogyny, and of portraying the glamorisation violence against women. The first episode is set some 10 days after series one's unresolved, if not vexing, finale. The episode follows a prolonged hunt for a murder weapon in a Belfast river, and a hospital bed testimonial from Spector's half-strangled victim Annie Brawley, there is Spector's return from self-imposed exile. There are a total of six episodes in series two, for me a cleverly crafted series that on one level or another makes the viewer pretty uncomfortable - and poses some very disturbing questions about for example relationships, the effects of 'grooming' on children, as well as adults, and at times seems to come close to crossing the line - my humble opinion.---------------Review update 03/16/2015----------------------The BBC(UK) have announced that there is to be a season 3

.Both my partner and I were able to see this film at the 59th BFI London Film Festival in October 2014.Possible SpoilersThe Duke of Burgundy is not really for fans of soft-core naughtiness.Evelyn (Chiara D'Anna) is a housekeeper in the employ of Cynthia (Sidse Babett Knudsen, best known for playing the Danish Prime Minister in the television political drama Borgen), a keen collector of butterflies and moths who lectures at a local institute. On first impressions the dynamic seems straightforward where we seem to have curt and dominating employer with a somewhat submissive employee. While the premise of the narrative is their relationship and it's changing dynamic, there is a fair amount of close up filming, as well as specialist audio, relating to the topic of Lepidoptera, which is interesting - although both my partner and I were lost on the symbolism.This film can be unpromising and deeply sensual while it explores the formalised but affectionate realms of fetishism. There is not a bit of nudity and most of the sexual acts are behind closed doors, or obscured by soft-focus. You, the viewer, are left with the audio and your imagination to fill in the `gaps'. The camera work, is at times soft focused, well lit and almost filmed in style that would be recognised from the 1970s.The scenes are further enhanced with mood and at times otherworldly setting music. Nevertheless, between those scenes it has an oddball sense of humour. It is a grounded film, and has dry humour - one where we are laughing at them for their sexual quirks rather than with them. Such as during an anxious discussion about the construction times of various extravagant bondage apparatus, the would-be creator of these imaginative contrivances is played by Fatma Mohamed, who offers, for the purposes of saving build time, the rapid construction of one gadget and suggests: "Would a human toilet be of interest?" There is a lot to appreciate here, mainly with the bold performances, the dress and lingerie by Andrea Flesch and it does raise thought-provoking ideas about the subtleties of control in relationships and sexual fulfilment. For this couple live in their own enclosed world and seem to only venture out to attend talks by the self-important Dr Schuller due to their mutual interest in entomology.For this viewer the film was more a fable-like tale of two people locked into what looks like an ailing S&M relationship, but boiled down in its constituents it's about a relationship, based on trust and love. I am sure That Duke of Burgundy will certainly have its critics - but who cares?.

.Possible SpoilersWe saw this film at the London Film Festival October 2014 (in the Love Gala section).Kate Winslet (Sabine De Barra) plays a landscape gardener employed by King Louis XIV, via the chief gardener Andr Le Ntre (Matthias Schoenaerts) to design a fountain that will be a centre piece of the gardens at Versailles. Her boss is a man who prizes order above all. Sabine is the breath of fresh air that the stuffy geometry of Versailles needs. To gain her position she needs to overcome gender politics, where her skills are belittled, by her so called colleagues, who see her invading their work place. This unfortunate theme continues, although she is soon charming all she meets and innovating with fresh approaches to horticulture. Never the less, Sabine struggles with class barriers as she becomes romantically entangled with the court's renowned landscape artist."""""""""""""""""""""""""" Stanley Tucci is in fine glitzy form """""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""This is a narrative where there is scheming at the Court of King Louis XIV, a vipers nest of gossip and shenanigans, where Helen McCrory is bristling with predatory feline feel as a woman who believes she is scorned and thus holds great resentment towards Sabine. There is much for the viewer to take in, with colourful back drops, and the even more colourful characters of the court. Rickman himself plays King Louis XIV, the Sun King at Versailles, with a dry befuddlement. Stanley Tucci is in fine glitzy form. This is a film, which at its core deals with women and their relationships. Winslets Sabine is a woman fraught with her own inner demons, as well as the world at large. This then is a film that has its detractors, although my partner and I thought the film was an enjoyable fun period piece  and believe it is worth seeing..

.Possible spoilersAs season 2 comes into its own, as ever Penny Dreadful, continues to provide sumptuous sets and gothic atmosphere. This is a season, where Helen McCrory comes to the fore; she plays the head of a Lucifer-worshipping coven, her singular mission to deliver Vanessa (Eva Green) to the Prince of Darkness. I am still at loss to understand the role of Reeve Carney as Dorian Gray, as his character continues to indulge his carnal needs. While Harry Treadaway as Dr Victor Frankenstein continues to have problems of his, with his two creations Lily Frankenstein and Rory Kinnear as The Creature, his first creation that loathes his creator for numerous reasons.This is season where we see some of Vanessas back-story. Timothy Dalton as Sir Malcolm Murray seems to go off the rails, with a little help from Helen McCrorys character. Danny Sapani as Sembene, a long-time assistant of Sir Malcolm, his main role, as ever, still remains a mystery. While Josh Hartnett as Ethan Chandler becomes more Canis lupus during certain lunar phases.While not a central character, Simon Russell Beale as Ferdinand Lyle, an Egyptologist with an unhealthy interest in the occult and a certain duplicity when it comes to his friends, - at times his character is a real scene stealer. There are other characters of interest, but enough on the spoilers front, return to the tenets of the seasons narrative. The story telling as ever, is unhurried in nature. With this genre, the path the narrative takes is almost as important as the final destination, with its amassed diversified assortment of characters and themes.This show is impenitent fun..

Dry hard ground makes it difficult to get grass growing. This Scotts product is a clean, easy way to try to increase moisture retention. Much more please to apply than other things such as peat moss or straw.The shaker jug works great for spot treatments. It's easy to hold and spread and is a good storage canister.If you plan on a large area, consider using  a bag of Scotts Every Drop Granule with a spreader.

Dry, hard ground makes it difficult to get grass growing. Using this Scotts product is probably the easiest way to increase moisture retention. Other options are difficult to apply and dirty such as peat moss and straw.This bag is good for large areas using a spreader. If you are just doing spot treatments, consider the Scotts Every Drop Shaker Jug Granule which has a very convenient and easy to use shaker storage canister.

Probably the biggest annoyance of the PS4 is the lack of good remote control options for dvd/bluray watching. Sure, you can use the dualshock but good luck trying to remember the button functions and by all means, avoid bumping it causing unintentional skips and spoiler alerts. This PS4 remote somewhat solves those dualshock problems.Negatives:-No backlighting. Good luck trying to use this in a dark room.-Remote is not "always on". Requires you to push the ps4 button before it can send commands. After a certain period of time, the remote turns off and you must push the ps4 button again. Very annoyingI use the Logitech Harmony Ultimate for all my devices but it does not work well with the PS4 because it can't turn it on and it can't do most standard movie functions (fast forward, reverse, skip, etc.). For some reason, the Harmony works perfectly with the PS3 but not the PS4. Hopefully, it will get updated to work with the PS4 someday.Until then, I'll maybe use this PS4 remote alongside the Harmony. Except for the aforementioned negatives, it works ok for the specific purpose of watching blurays.

This review is of the Kulipari Strawberry Bullfrog Poison Ranger Figure which is what I actually received. The figure is very tiny at only about 2" high. It doesn't stand up well because it is so small. The details are decent but it's so small it's hard to see anything.This might be worth a dollar or 2 but definitely not the current price of $10.

While this is a soft, huggable doll, there are some negatives:-Dress-up options are severely limited as you only have 2 sets of arms and legs.-Buttons are not durably sewn on. Within 1 day, one of the buttons fell off.Your child may certainly enjoy this doll if she likes how it looks and can use the buttons delicately. However, the buttons need to be reinforced and there should be more clothing options included.UPDATE: 1 week later, a second button has fallen off which means my child's doll currently has no legs. Given how much stress is put on these buttons, the buttons should have been attached with plastic or nylon string instead of standard yarn.

This review is of the 21.5" version. If you are looking for a cheap, small monitor, look no farther.-Build quality is pretty good especially given the low price.-Stand is very sturdy however it only tilts up and down and not side to side.-Includes HDMI port which can be difficult to find in small monitors.-Picture quality is perfectly fine.-No built-in speakers.It's amazing you can get a decent-sized, IPS, LED monitor for <$100. I love technology.

I have 3 kids that are in varying stages of train track building ability so I was able to get a good gauge for how well this toy works.My thoughts:-EZ track is a very good idea as it does make it easier for little kids to get going and is much easier to clean up also.-The EZ track does not hold together securely. The yellow attachments are too easily pulled apart by my 2 year old.-The EZ track is only long enough for a single small oval. Even the most enthusiastic child will get bored of it pretty quickly.-Pedestals are lightweight and flimsy which means they are hard to position and fall over easily. A child who needs the EZ track won't be able to use the pedestals.-Trains are large-sized and decent quality but nothing special.-Includes enough single track pieces to complete a figure 8 but not enough pieces to really get creative.-All the track pieces look great with impressively detailed graphics.CONCLUSIONYou are basically paying a lot of money for a small oval-sized EZ track. The other pieces included are things you can get much cheaper in any generic train set.This toy tries to make it easy for a child who has difficulty putting a track together. However, the toy still tries to cater to more advanced kids by throwing in a limited number of pedestals and separate track pieces. This leads to a product that doesn't work well for either child demographic. There aren't enough EZ tracks for a beginner child and not enough single pieces for an advanced child. All this wouldn't be so bad if the price was far cheaper (currently $50) so that getting multiple kits wouldn't put you into poverty. As it is, other train kits offer far more pieces for far less money which outweighs the benefit of the EZ track.This product would be better if it had gone all-in on the EZ track idea by including multiple EZ tracks and skipping the pedestals and single track pieces entirely.

This is a highly durable, one-piece (nothing to get lost) book that doubles as a toy.-All the major shapes are included.-The button is easy to press.-Sound quality is mediocre but still intelligible.-A velcro tab to keep it closed would have been useful but otherwise this simple toy works as intended.

This book doubles as a highly durable, one-piece (nothing to get lost) toy. The button is fairly easy to press. The sound quality is mediocre but that's to be expected.Negatives are:-Only counts to 5 which is lame.-No velcro to keep the book closed.Overall, a good purchase for any baby.
Excellent thickness and longer length make these gloves highly useful around the house. Good to use when cleaning with chemicals or in any wet situation.The medium fits true-to-size.

Excellent build quality. Attractive metal design. The plastic insert is very useful for cleaning or dumping purposes.I have this located in the garage. The 15 gallon version has a compact size which can fit almost anywhere in my garage. Very sturdy and won't get knocked over easily.This garbage can is not a good choice for inside the house. It's a bit industrial looking and the wide open cavity allows smells out and bugs in. Best suited for a permanent spot in the garage or outdoor space.

Every bag weight seems to have a different mix. Here is what I received:40lb bag:10% Navigator II creeping red fescue10% Aberdeen creeping red fescue9% Revenge GLX perennial ryegrass8% Envy perennial ryegrass6% Gaelic Kentucky bluegrass3% Abbey Kentucky bluegrass3% Right Kentucky bluegrass50% Water smart coating20lb bag:10% Wendy Jean creeping red fescue10% Kent creeping red fescue9% premium perennial ryegrass8% silver dollar perennial ryegrass6% gaelic kentucky bluegrass3% jump start kentucky bluegrass3% midnight II kentucky bluegrass50% watersmart coating7lb bag:10% Wendy Jean creeping red fescue10% Fenway creeping red fescue9% Defender perennial ryegrass6% Gaelic Kentucky bluegrass5% Charismatic II GLSR perennial ryegrass4% Secretariat II GLSR perennial ryegrass3% Jump start Kentucky bluegrass3% Right Kentucky bluegrass50% water smart coatingRealize that 50% of what you are paying for is the coating which can be useful if you have trouble keeping the seed wet for 3 weeks.I really like a mix of creeping red fescue and perennial ryegrass which has grown well for me in the past. All the bag weights have a nice all-in-one mix that should work great in the Pacific NW. I will update this review in the future with growth results.

Here is the mix I received:19% Silver Dollar Perennial ryegrass15% Majesty II perennial ryegrass15% Uno perennial ryegrass50% Water Smart coatingRealize that half of what you are paying for is the coating which is useful if you have trouble keeping the seed wet for 3 weeks.I prefer mixing in some creeping fescue with the perennial ryegrass for a more diverse and resistant lawn. Because of this, I would recommend the Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed - Sun and Shade Mix instead.I will update this review in the future with growth results.

Here is the mix I received:17% Endeavor II Tall Fescue15% Gazelle II Tall Fescue14% Dynamic II Tall Fescue4% Thermal Blue Kentucky Bluegrass50% Water Smart coatingRealize that 50% of what you are paying for is the water smart coating which is useful if you have trouble keeping the seed wet for 3 weeks.I have had good luck with perennial ryegrass and creeping fescue so I would recommend Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed - Sun and Shade Mix) which has a better mix. I will update this review in the future with the growth results.

I'm pleased that Yamaha is entering the whole-home audio market as I've been happy with my Yamaha receivers over the years including the Yamaha RX-A3050 with MusicCast.DESIGN-I have the white finish which looks good with its brushed metal accents - a good fit for a modern house.-The cabinet shape is a bit bland.SOUND QUALITY-Not superb, but pretty good for such a small speaker. The clarity and crispness of vocals is not great but acceptable. Not much bass but that's expected in a speaker this size. The volume can fill a large room reasonably well.-Most will be happy with the sound quality. Audiophiles probably will not.MUSICCAST APP-Fairly intuitive and straightforward to use.-Allows independent volume adjustments for each speaker,-Linking speakers is easy to allow for simultaneous play. I have this WX-030 speaker linked to my RX-A3050. My testing revealed that playback on multiple speakers had no delay which allows you to put speakers as close together as you want.-I was unable how to configure my speaker to use my wired connection instead of wifi. Not a big deal as most people will use wifi.BLUETOOTH CONNECTIONFunctions very well as a bluetooth speaker for your phone. Any phone media (podcasts, Google Music, etc.) can be streamed to the speaker. However, you can't stream your phone media via your wifi network unless the music files are actually stored on your phone. This means I can't use Google Music or Podcast Addict unless I am bluetooth connected.An interesting feature: If you are bluetooth connected to one speaker, your music can simultaneously play in other speakers in the house that are not bluetooth connected. Nice.WHOLE HOME AUDIO via HOME NETWORK (wifi)The benefit of a home network connection vs bluetooth is the significantly larger range of the home network. Assuming your wifi mojo is strong, you can take your phone anywhere in your home and not lose connection to the speaker.If you are a Google Music user or just want unfettered ability to stream any phone media, MusicCast will not give you whole home audio. If you are on Pandora, Spotify, Rhapsody, Airplay, or Sirius, then you are good to go. If you have mp3s/playlists on your computer or phone, you are also fine.CONCLUSIONLife would be much easier if a whole-home audio solution allowed all phone media to be streamed to the speakers. Unfortunately with the MusicCast (and the Denon Heos which I also tested), we aren't quite there yet. If you are a Google Music user like me, then the MusicCast system requires you to be within bluetooth range which is a severe limitation.If you are totally fine with one of the supported music apps or are happy streaming local files, then the MusicCast system is a great choice. This WX-030 speaker in particular is a worthy product at an excellent price point considering it includes both wifi and bluetooth.

I also own the Logitech Wireless Touch Keyboard K400 and will do some comparisons.AESTHETICS-The K830 looks modern and elegant with its brushed metal accents on the front and back. Even the font on the keyboard looks decidedly modern which is a nice touch.-The K400 is ugly in comparison.TYPING-The K830 keys are not concave but rather perfectly flat. The keys are also silky smooth which makes it a bit slippery. All this means it can be slightly difficult to keep your fingers in the correct position. Not a big deal if you are only doing minimal typing on it.-The K400 feels easier to type on because the keys are concave with a slight texture.IN THE DARK-The K830 illuminated keys look great in the dark. Unfortunately, there should be illumination of the touchpad and touchpad buttons.-If you have a home theater or a very dark environment, the illumination makes the K830 the obvious choice over the K400.BATTERY LIFE-The K830 is rechargeable with standard micro-usb and lasts 1 year without backlighting and 10 days (2hrs/day) with backlighting. This will be fine for most people.-The K400 uses 2 AA's.CONCLUSIONThe K830 stands out with its modern beauty and illumination. It's a great choice for a dedicated home theater. If the keys held your fingers slightly better and the touchpad was illuminated, it would be perfect. If you don't need the illumination or want to save some money, the K400 is a good choice.

Does the MotionSense work? Yes, but there are some negatives.PROS-Installation was straightforward and easy. The motion sense contraption adds minimal difficulty to the installation.-Love how it is battery operated and the batteries are included. Batteries supposedly last 1 year.-Having both the top sensor and the front sensor is very convenient. Both are reliably responsive within about a half a second.-MotionSense works pretty well if you let it run through the setup process properly. The range reaches just to the faucet output. Hands will trigger the sensor but clear plastic bottles don't.CONS-Build quality is average. Metal thickness is on the lightweight side. Disappointingly in this price range, the pull-down nozzle is made of chromed plastic. I currently use Hansgrohe Talis S  and Hansgrohe Axor Starck which are made of heavier gauge metal and have a metal pull-down nozzle.-There is no hot/cold indicator on the faucet. This is a surprising oversight.-The sprayer button can only activate the spray. It can't deactivate it. You can't change back to full flow unless you turn off the faucet.-Faucet arc is fixed at about 150 degrees which works for most people. Hansgrohe gives the option of a 150 or 180 arc with each faucet.-On full cold, the handle sticks a couple inches out into the sink area which can get accidentally bumped by large pots and pans.CONCLUSIONIf motion sensors are what you want, this faucet is pretty good. However, there are drawbacks compared to other faucets at this price point. If you don't care about the motion sensing, you'll do better with the Hansgrohe Talis S or Hansgrohe Axor Starck.

Way back in the day, I got an Asus eeePC because of its low cost and compact size. It served its purpose as a simple, internet device. This HP laptop is reminiscent of that eeePC.BUILD QUALITY-The all plastic construction feels rigid and durable. Screen does not flex much.-Keys are solidly responsive.-Overall, impressive build for this price point.TOUCHPAD-Nicely responsive. Comparable to most touchpads I've used.-Uses hidden hard-click buttons which can be problematic as you don't know exactly where the left and right buttons are. You must click way to the far right to activate the right button. Dedicated hard buttons are preferable.FORM FACTOR-It's a very thick, heavy laptop.-Using it as a tablet is not a good experience because it is extra thick with the keyboard folded back. If you need a viable tablet option, look for a laptop with a removable keyboard like the Surface Pro.AESTHETICS-Despite the chunky size, it is quite attractive.-The wedge shape on the front and back makes for a sleek look while the metallic, white finish and mirrored HP logo give this laptop a luxury, modern look.-Overall, it looks like a high-end device.SCREEN-The large bezels (~1" on all sides) make the screen look smaller than it actually is.-Contrast ratio of the screen is poor but still perfectly acceptable for internet use and viewing casual photos.-Resolution and sharpness is below average. Pixels are subtly visible in text and pictures. No dealbreakers here but you aren't getting "retina"-level resolution like with higher end tablets and smartphones.-Tapping the screen causes it to vibrate significantly. The screen hinge could be a lot stronger.SOUND-Quite good. You can definitely enjoy youtube music videos on it. Lacks any semblance of bass but that's to be expected in a laptop.PRELOADED SOFTWARE (aka JUNKWARE)-I hate preloaded software on my computer which is one reason I build my own desktops. Thankfully, HP kept preloads to a relative minimum.-McAfee antivirus is preinstalled with a free "trial". Evernote, Avast Security, WildTangent Games are hidden.-I immediately uninstalled all these programs using the Windows control panel. (Search for "remove programs" if you're as confused by Win10's control panel as I am).OVERALLThis HP is reminiscent of the eeePC which I have fond feelings for. You are getting a totally, functional internet device at a fantastic price point. Simple computing tasks like word processing are also well-suited for this HP. The nice build quality and aesthetics belie the low price.You don't want to be doing hard-core computing tasks like GIMP, Sketchup, etc given its processor limitations.If you want more processing power, a better screen, or a thinner, lighter form, consider a Microsoft Surface Pro 3 or Surface Pro 4. I've been using the Surface Pro 3 for many months and it is great.

This tricks book is a beautiful complement to the Disney Frozen Hairstyles: Inspired By Anna and Elsa book. The original Hairstyles book teaches start-to-finish hairstyles while the tricks book teaches tips on managing hair and accessory use. Most people will want to start with the original Hairstyles book.Both books present real photos and lovely illustrations that help guide you. Paper quality is excellent with glossy, thick stock. The overall presentation is extremely well-done. Highly recommended for Frozen fans (or even non-fans) who want to learn how to style hair.

This is an high quality iron but the controls are not intuitive.-Build quality is excellent.-Heats up very quickly.-Curls hair effectively.-Has auto-shutoff.-There are 5 LED's and it is not intuitive what the LED's mean.Control summary (i.e., in case you lose your instructions)-The lights cascade up when heating and then turn solid when ready to use.-To change temp, double click the button until lights flash. Then continue to click to cycle through temp settings. Release the button after reaching desired temp. The selected temp will flash and all lights will cascade up or down to your selected temp. Wait for lights to turn solid before using wand.-Temp settings (not marked on device):410deg390deg350deg300deg260degAs you can see, unless you are using this regularly, you will not be able to intuitively control this iron. Some simple text markings on the iron would have helped. Otherwise, this is an excellent iron.

This is my first experience with an IR thermometer and it's like magic. I don't know the science behind it but it seems accurate.-Batteries are pre-installed so once you open the box, you can start shooting.-The form is lightweight and easy to hold.-Construction quality is good.Overall, if you have a need for an IR thermometer, this is a good one.

Calling this a "starter pack" is overstating things. I would call this a "sample pack" which offers the bare minimum to see if you might like the Gladiator system. It's only 32" of track which isn't much.If you really want to dive into the system, I would recommend the Gladiator Gear Track Deluxe Pack.As far as the Gladiator system in general:PROS:-Tons of accessories readily available on Amazon and elsewhere.-Tracks are very easy to install. If you are mounting on wood studs, have some 2" wood screws and a leveler ready.-Looks nice.CONS:-I wish the accessories locked in a bit more securely into the track especially the J&L hooks which can get dislodged easily.Note: Craftsman Versatrack accessories have a locking twist tab and are compatible with the Gladiator tracks.

After trying various generic sealer bags, I've settled on the FoodSaver brand bags as being the best. The GameSaver version is slightly thicker and tougher than the standard version. These GameSaver bags work in a standard FoodSaver unit.For most purposes, the standard FoodSaver bags work just fine. But if you want the best, get these GameSaver bags.

My kids have been playing with Megabloks for years. The large size is great for younger kids (<6 yo) because there is no choking danger and it is easy for them to grab and assemble.The included bag is made of rip-proof material and is a quality storage solution.My only complaint with Megabloks is that they don't lock together all that tight. Your structure will collapse easily if it is tilted, gets bumped, or hits the ground.

After trying various generic sealer bags, I've settled on the FoodSaver brand bags as being the best. The GameSaver version is slightly thicker and tougher than the standard version. These GameSaver bags work in a standard FoodSaver unit.For most purposes, the standard FoodSaver bags work just fine. But if you want the best, get these GameSaver bags.

Everything about this is oversized - charging station, power brick, and price. If you really need 2.4a x 10 ports and have the space, go for it. The construction quality is good. The design is a nice, modern white although you will need some place to hide the hideous black power brick and a mess of thick power cables.Dimensions (inches):Charging station: 10x5x1.5Power brick: 7x3x1.5If you can get by with less amps (slower charging) over 10 ports, then consider something like Sabrent 60 Watt (12 Amp) 10-Port USB Rapid Charger which is about a fifth of the size, does not require a power brick, and is much cheaper.

Cleaning a car can be frustrating because of cramped spaces and tiny nooks. Cordless vacuums make it much easier. This Bissell is a great addition to your car cleaning arsenal because it is easy to use and cordless.There are some compromises that make it not ideally suited for the house.-Suction is weak. It will have a tough time with plush carpets.-No heat generation.-The hose and accessories don't attach securely and fall off a lot.Overall, I'd say get this for the car or other situations where being cordless is of high value.

This sealer is a bit of a niche product but it serves the niche very well.-Beautiful stainless steel finish. Squared edges and flat top/sides makes for a nice industrial look.-Build quality is excellent. Feels solid with no flimsiness or creakiness.-Can seal wide bags.There are some drawbacks though.-It's a massive device that's probably should live in the garage.-It is about 4x the cost of a standard foodsaver.If you need the wide bags or massively repetitive seals, this sealer is great. Otherwise, stick with a standard foodsaver which will be much easier to store.

Does this vacuum live up to it's claim of being quiet? No way. It's as loud or louder than other vacuums I have used including other Hoovers, Miele, and Dyson.PROS:-Drop dead simple to use. This is the kind of vacuum you can give to anybody and they can figure out how to use it immediately.-Can use any extension cord as the primary cord.-Lightweight and easy to carry around.CONS:-Construction quality is mediocre and includes lots of creaky plastic. I expect it to hold up fine as long as you aren't banging it into things all the time.-Feels overpriced at >$200.OVERALLThis is not a quiet vacuum despite its claims. Putting that aside, it is a decent, utilitarian vacuum. If the price stays at over $200, there are better values out there such as Hoover Platinum Collection Lightweight Bagged Upright with Canister which includes a pretty handy canister vacuum.

This is a long book with only a little bit of text on each page which makes it good for young readers or for storytime. Plenty of pictures are on each page to maintain interest.The material quality is average. Only half the book is in color. It is pretty compact and thin which would make it good for travel.

If you have an Asian face, you know how difficult it can be to find sunglasses that sit on the nose bridge while avoiding contact with the eyelashes and cheeks. In my entire life, I have only been able to find 1 other sunglasses that have fit well (Nike Skylon old model that was discontinued years ago.)These "Asian fit" sunglasses fit great. The scooped out lenses allow clearance for the cheeks. The nose bridge protrudes out far enough for low nose bridges. The arms are plenty wide enough with a nice curve to prevent any pinching or tightness.Construction quality is excellent. They look good too.Overall, these sunglasses are expensive but totally worth it if you have trouble finding ones that fit.I also tried many of the other Oakley Asian fit models (Radar Pitch, Radar Path, Flak Jacket (non XLJ), Half Jacket 2.0) and none of them fit as well as these Flak Jacket XLJ Asian Fit.Note: Make sure that the glasses you receive are labeled Asian Fit. I ordered a white version from seller Extreme Supply and it was NOT the Asian fit model and fit completely differently.

I like to run a multi-monitor setup for general productivity tasks (non-gaming). I strongly prefer the displayport cables and look for graphics cards that can support multiple displayport connections. My least favorite cable is the DVI which is tough to manage. The new GTX960 cards allow me to run 3 monitors with displayport and a 4th with HDMI.My setup includes:-Asus X99 Pro motherboard-Intel i7-5820kInitially, I tried the Gigabyte GTX 960 G1 which was incompatible with my motherboard for some reason. I switched to this Asus Strix which is working fine.Currently, I am running a BenQ BL3200PT WQHD 32-in Monitor 2560x1440 plus 2 other smaller monitors and it works great.If you are looking for a card to run up to 4 productivity monitors at a reasonable cost and with good connections, this card is a great choice.

This review is of the bluetooth version:I typically use Logitech keyboards which all require the little usb receiver. I sometimes wish that I could forgo the receiver and just use bluetooth. I build all my computers myself and use Asus motherboards with integrated wifi/bluetooth.Pairing with my computer bluetooth was incredibly fast and easy. I was up and typing within seconds.Pairing with my Samsung Note 4 was just as easy. Again, I was typing within seconds.-Keys are comfortable.-Key travel is pretty minimal like a laptop computer.-Keyboard is very thin and low profile.-Keep in mind that this is a full-size keyboard so it is pretty wide (17.5"). A bit wider than Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K750 which I typically use. The Kensington is much shorter though because there are no solar panels.This Kensington keyboard is a good option if you are looking for a full-size, bluetooth keyboard.

I use this exclusively for nose trimming so I will only comment on that.-It's a bit intimidating with the exposed blade but there is no pain or discomfort at all.-With only a couple swirls around the nostril, the trimming is done. It only takes seconds.Comparison to Panasonic ER-GN30-K Nose, Ear n Facial Hair Trimmer Wet/Dry with Vortex Cleaning System which I have used for weeks.-Panasonic takes much longer to get all the hairs because the blade is hidden behind a guard with only a few perforations for hair to get through. The Norelco has more exposed blade area which requires fewer passes. To put this in a time perspective, the Panasonic would take about 60 seconds to trim nose hair; the Norelco, 10 seconds.-Both trim comfortably with minimal to no pain.-The Panasonic has a wider, blunter tip so which is good if you are prone to shoving things too far up your nose.-Overall, the Norelco is superior because it is so much faster and more efficient.

If you are looking for a dress-up toy that bridges the gap between cheap paper and expensive dolls, this TS Shure set is a decent option.Overall construction quality is mediocre. Using the term "wooden" to describe it is a bit misleading in the same way paper shouldn't be described as made of wood. The pieces are made of a dense, fibrous, cardboard-like material and bend easily. They will not stand up to abuse. The magnets are weak but are good enough if characters are laid flat. The carrying case is flimsy and doesn't hold the pieces well.Despite the negatives, this set is a decent value given the reasonable price of <20 dollars. There are a lot of nicely-illustrated pieces that can keep a child busy for a while. As long as your child is gentle, the pieces should last a fairly long time.

One key feature of duct tape I look for is that it is easy to tear by hand. This Iron Grip tape tears width-wise easily while generally avoiding length-wise runs.-Thickness is good.-Adhesive stickiness is good. Not phenomenal, but good.Comparisons to other tapes I own:Almost indistinguishable in thickness, adhesiveness, and tearability to Gorilla Tape.Much thicker and tougher than 3M Scotch Transparent Duct Tape.

I've always liked maps on the wall. This TS Shure map presents the country in a fun, colorful, interesting way that will surely appeal to kids.The lamination quality is mediocre. It is thin and gets crinkled easily. A thicker lamination would have been nice to prevent damage by enthusiastic kids. It also does not lay flat easily. If you really like this map, you probably want to get a 24x36 frame to protect it.

Bored of playing with square blocks with numbers or letters on them? Not quite ready for real action figures that are hard to position? This pirate themed set bridges the gap nicely. You can piece it together like a simple 3D jigsaw puzzle or just go totally free-form with it. The construction quality is impressive. The blocks are so thick they won't be broken.The book is a bit of an afterthought. Small and too texty. I'd rather have more blocks.My main complaint is the lack of a good storage container. It is packaged in a nicely made box but it has no top which makes it pretty useless as storage. Plan on supplying your own container.

Not adhering to the official motherboard "qualified vendor list" is playing with fire. Sometimes you won't get burned, but don't even try this ram with the Asus X99 Pro. One stick was never recognized by the mobo and the other stick caused recurrent Windows startup freezes and random shutdowns and within 2 days became unrecognized itself. The mobo would also keep giving me "overclock failures" during POST even though I wasn't overclocking.I swapped in the Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (4 x 4GB) DDR4 2666 (PC4-21300) 2666MHz C16 memory kit for DDR4 Systems (CMK16GX4M4A2666C16) which is on my mobo's qualified vendor list and everything is working smoothly so far. Night and day difference.For those of you who think you have defective sticks or unstable systems, double check your qualified vendor list to see if this ram is on there. Your problem might be compatibility, not defectiveness.I don't totally blame the Crucial sticks because there was no guarantee of compatibility.

If you like making sushi, this rice is perfect for it. The short, sticky grains are just the right consistency. I cook them with slightly less water than recommended by my rice cooker so the grains don't get waterlogged after you add the seasoning vinegar.This rice is also great for non-sushi meals such as plain or fried rice.

I raise miniature sheep and have been testing the Myfox Wi-Fi Security Camera in the barn. I have two cameras: one aimed inside the pen where they sleep and the other aimed at the entrance of the barn.The camera aimed at the entrance has the motion-activation sensor installed, which immediately sends alerts to my iPhone if there is any activity (it's there to protect against coyotes, primarily). No coyotes yet but I've tested it several times and it works perfectly.The other camera is aimed inside the pen where all 10 miniature sheep sleep. This has been especially important for me when I am on vacation: It provides piece of mind that the people I hired to care for the sheep in my absence are doing all of the tasks I've arranged for them to do.I know this is an unconventional use of the Myfox security camera but it has met a huge need for me and I love it. Two thumbs up!
I was surprised at how easy it was to connect with my iPhone via Bluetooth. This is my first selfie stick and it's been super fun during family gatherings and our vacation. Two thumbs up!

I've been battle-testing the Char-Broil Charcoal Kettle Grill for the past month and it's by far the easiest to use grill I've ever owned. And I've own quite a few.I love the hinged lid... where to place a super-hot lid has always been a pain with other round grills and the people at Char-Broil hit a home run with this feature. I also like the over-sized vent on top, which lets me heat things up cool temps down fast.The porcelain-enameled cooking grate is also instrumental in evenly distributing heat. I've found that I need about 25% less charcoal on average due in part to this added efficiency. By positioning the coals in a ring or to one side, I'm able to low smoke pork shoulder for excellent pulled pork. That has been a family favorite this summer.This grill has so far been a huge hit with my family and I recommend it for yours.

I've been testing the PDP AG7 True Wireless Headset for Xbox One for a few weeks. The first truly wireless headset that I've seen, the PDP AG7 is comfortable -- even with my large head. All of the other Xbox One headsets I've tested have a wire for chat that runs from the headphones to your controller. Not the PDP AG7. The key is in the clever USB transmitter that plugs into the Xbox. It connects automatically so you don't have to struggle with those awkward BlueTooth connection processes.One feature I especially LOVE is the separate dials for Chat and overall game volume. No more messing about with the plus or minus tabs trying to strike a balance. The PDP AG7 gives you the control to dial down (or up) chat with a dial. The same with game volume.The overall sound during gameplay is amazing. I can now hear when enemies are behind, to the left or right -- or above me in games like Titanfall. LOVE the sound.The on/off button is on the outside of the left hear piece. Just tap during game play to mute your microphone.The only ding for the PDP AG7 is that the mic is way too sensitive. It picks up everything -- the ceiling fan included in my case. I wish the mic were only calibrated to picking up your voice. Not a huge deal but annoying. Also, when you mute yourself the tip of the microphone (which is blue or red (extra bass)) flashes periodically to let you know you're on mute. I could see it out of the corned or my left eye (even when retracted) so I put a little piece of duct tape on it. Problem solved.Overall though this is by far the best headset for Xbox One I've come across. Comfortable. Excellent sound -- and truly wireless. Two thumbs up for the  PDP AG7!

I don't always chat on Xbox Live, but when I do, I prefer the Ear Force Recon 30X Chat Headset. Why? Because while the earphone looks huge and like it would block out all other sound - it is light, comfortable and enables me to hear everything normally (as though I weren't even wearing it).Best of all it puts the chat into a single speaker, which I am used to from back in the Xbox 360 days. It's simple, easy to use -- and it works. Two thumbs up from me. If you use chat during Xbox Live gameplay, I recommend the Ear Force Recon 30X Chat Headset.

I've tested the Little Griddle Kettle-Q KQ17R Round Griddle on my round Char-Broil Kettleman as well as my more traditionally shaped Master Forge grill/smoker. So don't limit use to the recommended round grills is my advice. Once the griddle is hot, just add olive oil and throw on some veggies.
