My favorites to cook on the Little Griddle Kettle-Q are asparagus, green beans, mushrooms, garlic. I have been using two metal spatulas and found this system to work the best.I also grill up delicious burgers using a bacon press. For steaks, I still prefer the traditional grill but have finished up ribeyes on the griddle to give it that extra seared goodness. I've also had great success with hash browns.I'm still exploring new foods to cook up with the  Little Griddle Kettle-Q. It's like having a diner griddle at your disposal on your BBQ. I love it and my family says they do, too. Two thumbs up!

Until the TP-LINK TL-PA8010P kit, my access to the Internet been tethered to the rooms immediately around the modem. Because our house is large, only our master bedroom can get a signal.I'd been wanting to move my office to one of the our spare bedrooms and the TP-LINK TL-PA8010P kit now brings the Internet to that room. I don't see any reduction in speed when using Go-to-Meeting and Skype for office meetings. Downloads and uploads are also blazing fast.It was very easy to setup. I plugged on of the two units into an outlet near the modem, then connected an ethernet cable. And plugged the other until into an outlet in the bedroom, then plugged the computer into it and connected the other included ethernet cable. It was that easy. Two thumbs up for this product tester!

0:34 Mins Hachi is 100 pounds of puppy dog and he loves squeak toys. The problem is that he's usually deactivated the squeak part in a few minutes -- one day at the longest.Until now. The Nerf Dog Squeak Rubber Ball Dog Toy (Medium/Large, Green) is at 10 days and counting. He brings it outside and we play fetch with it, then he brings it into the house (usually onto the sofa) where he squeaks it endlessly (it would seem).I've made a short video to give you some perspective as to the ball's size. Hachi is a tall golden retriever mix and weighs 100 pounds. The ball is not easy for me to squeak and it's tough enough to survive Hachi's powerful squeak-loving jaws.Two paws up for this Nerf Dog Squeak Rubber Ball!

This cleverly designed docking station is made of butcher-block quality wood. It's all one piece and it's solid. There is a round slot for the Apple Watch's charger -- it fits perfectly. The slot for the phone features a slot so you can hit the home button without taking it out.Before I got this docking station my Apple Watch would sit rather awkwardly on my desk. A few times now it has gotten separated as a result (the charger is magnetic).The only minor thing I'd like to see is a slot underneath for the charging cables of the watch and phone. I've included a photo to show what I mean. Again, a small ding to an otherwise excellent docking station. I recommend it. Note: The seller invited me to review this product and provided me with a discount code.

0:34 Mins Hachi is 100 pounds of puppy dog and he loves squeak toys. The problem is that he's usually deactivated the squeak part in a few minutes -- one day at the longest.Until now. The Nerf Dog Squeak Rubber Ball Dog Toy (Medium/Large, Green) is at 10 days and counting. He brings it outside and we play fetch with it, then he brings it into the house (usually onto the sofa) where he squeaks it endlessly (it would seem).I've made a short video to give you some perspective as to the ball's size. Hachi is a tall golden retriever mix and weighs 100 pounds. The ball is not easy for me to squeak and it's tough enough to survive Hachi's powerful squeak-loving jaws.Two paws up for this Nerf Dog Squeak Rubber Ball!

0:58 Mins Our dogs, Skip and Hachi, reviewed Hill's Ideal Balance Crafted dog food. Their verdict: Delicious!In this short video review they are eating, for the first time, the shredded natural salmon. We slowly introduced them to this variety of Hill's with the shredded natural chicken; and then the shredded natural beef the following week. We always mix the boys' (as we call them) wet food with dry. In this video we used Hill's Science Diet Adult Advanced Fitness Small Bites dry food. They are big dogs but prefer the small bites.I'll let their video review speak for itself, but in a nutshell, they love Hill's Ideal Balance Crafted dog food! And they are picky eaters, too.

This bed is more on the large side, but it is perfect for travel since it's thin. It's also washing-machine safe, which is important since we use it in our Jeep and our dog, while he likes to travel, sometimes pees when he gets excited (like when he sees another dog taking a walk and he's stuck with us, inside the Jeep.If you have an older dog, or one who needs a softer bed (more cushion) then you might want to consider a thicker bed. This one is thin on the bottom. For us we place have a few old blankets underneath for added comfort. I like that this bed can also be hosed off easily. Two paws up!

I was a bit concerned when I saw these treats were made in China, but after reading the ingredient list, and because I trust the Purina name, I decided to give these dog treats a chance.We have two dogs, both large, and they LOVE chicken. I use these Waggin' Train treats as an incentive for them to get into their crates when we are off to the store or run an errand. They'll destroy the house if left alone. :)Since our dogs are large (95lb and 65lb) I give then one curl each as treats no more than once a day. But if you have a smaller dog, they do rip into smaller pieces quite easily. Two paws up from our house!

Last summer an age spot appeared on my cheek and it really bothered me when I looked into the mirror. My doctor confirmed that it wasn't cancerous... just a "sun spot" she called it (I like that term better). :)I started using Nia 24 Rapid Depigmentation Serum a few weeks ago and the hated spot is indeed fading! I have been using a small amount on my entire face each night but add a bit extra to the spot. It is a very gradual process so I am looking forward to the day when the spot is gone. As I get older I am making sure to slow the visible effects of aging as much as possible (without surgery) and the Nia 24 serum is now part of my daily regiment. Two thumbs up!

0:58 Mins Our dogs, Skip and Hachi, reviewed Hill's Ideal Balance Crafted dog food. Their verdict: Delicious!In this short video review they are eating, for the first time, the shredded natural salmon. We slowly introduced them to this variety of Hill's with the shredded natural chicken; and then the shredded natural beef the following week. We always mix the boys' (as we call them) wet food with dry. In this video we used Hill's Science Diet Adult Advanced Fitness Small Bites dry food. They are big dogs but prefer the small bites.I'll let their video review speak for itself, but in a nutshell, they love Hill's Ideal Balance Crafted dog food! And they are picky eaters, too.

I've been using Eagle Creek travel gear for 30 years and still use the passport carrier I purchased for my first trip abroad in 1985.In testing the new Eagle Creek Travel Gear Pack-It Specter Starter Set, I was able to pack more clothing into my carryon then ever before. I usually just roll everything up and squeeze it into the suitcase. The Pack-it Spector takes that squeeze to a new level.The simple yet functional design ensures that this travel set is now a part of my carry-on travel prep. Not sure if I'll be using it for 30+ years like my first Eagle Creek travel organizer -- but I wouldn't be surprised. :-)

The Polk Audio Striker Zx is the third and by far the best gaming headset for Xbox One.Here's why:* Comfortable. I have a huge head (7 5/8) and this headset is light and fully encloses my ears.* Sound. The audio is amazing. Clear, crisp and I can hear every detail (for example, shell casings falling to being me to the right). This enables me to detect enemies and eliminate them in the heat of gaming battle (Titanfall, Call of Duty).* Mic. The boom microphone tucks in when not on Xbox Box Live (or when you don't feel like chatting there). When in use, this mic performs perfectly. It even broadcasts a little bit of your own voice (like old-fashioned telephones) which eliminates the "talking inside a bubble" effect. I can hear people well and they tell me my voice comes through loud and clear, too.* No battery. Since the Polk Audio Striker Zx connects directly to your controller, there is no need to worry about another battery. I haven't noticed a significant drain on the handset battery.Dings* The only ding is in my opinion an Xbox One software issue. And that is that periodically (maybe once every three hours of game play) the sound cuts out for a few seconds. I have seen this occur in the other 2 headsets I've tested for Xbox One that do not use a separate base station (connect directly to the controller).If you've been looking for an exceptional headset for your Xbox One, you've found it with the Polk Audio Striker Zx. Two thumbs up from me.

The DII Home Essentials USA Flag is large (50x60''), extremely soft and comfy, and looks fantastic in our family room. It was instantly a family favorite -- even our dogs love this blanket.The reverse side from the flag is a plush sherpa microfiber material that really is softer than fleece. This washable throw would even look great on the wall. But ours is staying on our comfy sofa and will continue to get much use. I salute the DII Home Essentials USA Flag and recommend it!

I recommend the Antec for Xbox One's inside a closed media cabinet. I've experienced around a 25% reduction in it's temperature at full-tilt (mainly Titanfall) Xbox Live gaming.If you have an open-air configuration (your Xbox One is not enclosed) then I'd say try it. The heat reduction is less but still advantageous. But the noise will be audible.

I have been using the Centon Electronics Flash Memory Card (S1-SDXU1-64G) for the past few weeks in my Samsung digital camera and also my Sony digital videocamera. This high-performance SD card, with an impressive 64GB of storage, doubled the capacity of my previous SD cards. While not an issue with my digital camera, the card has already eliminated the nuisance of running out of storage on my video camera (with 16GB of internal storage) while traveling/sightseeing.The Centon SD card eliminates the need to connect either camera directly to my computer in order to download the photos/videos. My iMac has an SD slot but I use a USB SD card reader for my MacBook Pro while traveling. And it is fast, and that means I can take more photos faster... and I also don't have to wait for my video camera in-between shots. In addition to cameras, this Centon SD card is also compatible with some models of Android smartphones.Two thumbs up for the Centon SD card!

I've tested the Bialetti Granito Nonstick Saute pan for about 2 weeks and it's been elevated to be the favorite pan in the kitchen.Light and durable, the Bialetti pan distributes heat evenly and gets hot fast. With minimal olive oil I have cooked perfect pancakes, eggs, corned beef hash, salmon, steaks, hamburgers, brats and a fantastic Reuben sandwich.With our old non-stick pans, which are chipping, I usually lose one pancake to the botched flip and one egg breaks open during flopped flips, too. They just stick no matter what in some spots.The Bialetti pan was also very easy to clean. I literally wiped it down with a wet, soapy paper towel and it was clean.This pan is built to last and I recommend it for your kitchen. I've not yet experienced one flipping accident since I first started testing the  Bialetti Granito Nonstick Saute pan. Two thumbs up! (My wife is starting to think I went to chef school!)

I work from home full time and I've been testing the Holmes HAP9240-NWU HEPA-Type Desktop Air Purifier for several weeks. I have extremely bad allergies, particularly to tree pollens and weeds. And now that spring has sprung here in central Ohio, I am seeing the benefits of the Holmes desktop air purifier.The unit rests on a small table next to my desk and it is so quiet on the lowest setting that I can barely hear it over the wrrrrr of the two computers running each workday. My wife and I have been using a larger Holmes HEPA air purifier in our bedroom for a couple of years and that's when I really learned the value of these machines.The desktop version, like it's big brother, has two filers: one HEPA and another sponge-like carbon filter. I haven't had to change either yet but based on my experience with the larger version, the carbon filters generally last one month and the HEPA anywhere from 4-6 months.I did test removing and replacing both filters in the Holmes desktop air purifier and it only takes a few seconds. Fast and easy like the larger version. I've also been using the ionizer but haven't noticed a difference with it on or off. I believe it's designed mainly to mitigate smoke.While early yet in allergy season the Holmes HAP9240-NWU HEPA-Type Desktop Air Purifier is keeping my eyes and sinuses clear -- two thumbs up from this allergy sufferer.

Our dogs love Honest Kitchen Halcyon's wet food. And while expensive with two 100-pounds dogs to feed every day, I have been mixing it in with our dogs' dry food to make it last longer.Honest Kitchen Halcyon comes in a powder-like form. You mix it with hot water, with the amount of recommended dry-to-water on a chart on the back of the package. Although both of my dogs are under the "giant" category on this chart, I've been using the "small" dog recipe and then added a cup of dry to mix in.The consistency when adding hot water to the Honest Kitchen Halcyon food reminds me of the instant oatmeal (also just add hot water) I ate as a child for breakfast on winter mornings. I loved that oatmeal then; my dogs love their canine version of it now -- only theirs is much more nutricious.Our dogs are cherished members of our family and we try to always give them the best of everything, which is why Honest Kitchen Halcyon is now on our shopping list. A bit of a hit on the wallet but worth it for the piece of mind this nutricious (and the dogs would agree "delicious") food delivers. Two paws up!

My indoor flood-lights just got skinny! I tested 2 of these lights in our kitchen, which has several recessed lights using traditional 65-Watt indoor flood-light bulbs. Upon first opening the package I was doubtful that the Philips SlimStyle bulbs would 1) fit and 2) match the rest of the lights. To my surprise, they did on both counts!I replaced 2 of the kitchen lights with the Philips SlimStyle and asked my wife if she could tell which ones were the new bulbs. She wasn't able to even tell the difference! The thinness reminds me of those old TV westerns that used thin store fronts along main street -- props with nothing on the other side. The only difference is that these thin light bulbs deliver the goods, too.It is not easy finding a good, dimmable LED light bulb. I've tested several brands and the light is too white -- overwhelms and creates a bleached out look. The Philips SlimStyle delivers here with a more natural light that matches the light from our traditional 65-Watt indoor flood-light bulbs.A closer look at light qualityI couldn't tell a difference between traditional 65-Watt indoor flood-light bulbs and the Philips SlimStyle bulbs. However, compared to another (65-Watt equivalent) LED flood-light (of another brand, which was traditionally shaped), the light from the Philips had a slight yellow hue. When looking at them side by side, I preferred the slightly softer yellowish hue to the extreme white light of the other (65-Watt equivalent) LED bulb.I'm slowly replacing all of the lights in my home with LED bulbs and now the Philips SlimStyle bulbs are on my shopping list for our 65-Watt indoor flood-light bulb replacements. Two thumbs up!
This is a very high-quality chain and it looks great, too. I purchased it for a WWII-era St. Christopher medal. I am getting a couple more of these chains!

My household's "munchkins" are two giant lab mixes and this gate keeps them out of trouble around here.I installed the Munchkin Auto-Close Designer Safety Gate (Dark Wood) in the doorway leading to our back two bedrooms and one bathroom, for this is the domain of our little cat, Miss Kitty. She doesn't always appreciate her big brothers.Installation took about 5 minutes. It was a matter of tightening the screw-clamps until they firmly held in place in the doorway.The gate looks beautiful and operates perfectly. We have a traditional white-coated metal gate in the entrance to our formal dining room and I am ordering another Munchkin Auto-Close gate in dark wood for that.This gate adds class to any doorway, operates as advertised and this dog-loving house recommends it for your munchkins, too.

I've been testing the Orbitsound M9 airSOUND Soundbar in our den with our 42-inch LED flatscreen for the past few weeks.Setup was surprising fast and simple -- plugged both pieces (the speaker bar and the subwoofer) into the electrical outlet and attached the included optical cable. There is an included remote control, which is very small. Once I found the "sweet spot" in terms of settings, I never even mess with marking adjustments. The sound bar blends in to our TV setup and the subwoofer is nearly out of sight on the floor to the one side. Both glossy wooden cabinets look very elegant.The Orbitsound has especially made movie night much more enjoyable. I have also streamed music through the speakers from my Kindle and iPhone when we want to rock out a bit.  I am surprised that this little system can deliver such rich, big sound. I give the Orbitsound two big thumbs up!

I have been using Corel Painter Essentials 5 to turn photos of our family, pets and places of interest around our local community into fun and interesting pieces of art now hanging on our walls (thanks to both PictureItOnCanvas and CanvasPeople... I use whichever service has the best sale going on at any one time).My family now has six canvases of varying sizes and we are planning on creating more during an upcoming skiing trip all thanks to Corel Painter. The software's tools are easy to use, but can be a bit daunting at first. I prefer to experiment and learn as I go.Installation took longer than expected, about 20 minutes, but that could be because my iMac is 4 years old and does tend to run a bit slow lately. Once installed Corel Painter takes 350.2MB of space on my hard drive, which is on the large size for apps.Corel Painter does not, in my view, replace photo editing software like Pixelmator or PhotoShop, but it is a fun and easy way for photo-editing amateur enthusiasts like me to create works of art. Two thumbs up for Corel Painter Essentials 5!

2:38 Mins I put the Miele Dynamic U1 Jazz vacuum to the test in our basement rec room, which is mainly used as a playroom by our two large lab-mixes. My short video goes over the features of the Miele (pronounced "Me La") along with a look at this powerful vacuum in action.In summary:* Great looks and it also delivers high-performance suction* HEPA filter along with filter bag removes 99.9% of dust and allergens* LED lights are very bright* Easy to use and maneuver* Brush and crevasse tool easy to access and works great* See my short video for details

I replaced the old twin mattress in one of our guest rooms with the "Classic Brands 8-Inch Advantage Innerspring Mattress." It fits perfectly with the existing boxspring, frame and headboard.The new mattress is much lighter than the old one and is very easy to move if needed. It's a very firm mattress, which I like, but is comfortable and the independent coils do in fact distribute weight evenly over the mattress.The UPS guy delivered the mattress and he looked like a sailor coming home from leave with a large duffle bag over his shoulders. It was 42.4 pounds according to the packaging. I had to cut the bag off, using scissors, and when I did it sprung open with a lot of force. So be careful when doing that.After testing the new mattress, instead of throwing the old mattress out, I put it under the new mattress. I did this mainly because we have some friends who visit each summer and they have a couple of kids. When they visit we can just take the new mattress and place it on the floor in the bedroom. I like the Classic Brands twin mattress and recommend it. Two thumbs up!

Our family has two large dogs, both rescues. We were using a different dog food so gradually introduced increasing portions of Natural Balance's Potato and Duck Formula to their bowls. They are generally finicky but both love this new dog food. And my wife and I love it because of the wholesome ingredients and the fact that it's made in the USA and not imported. I called Natural Balance (there is an 800 number on the bag) and spoke with customer care - the rep told me that all of their products are made in the United States. I think Natural Balance's marketing team should emphasize this fact (just some advice).Our larger dog, 108-pound Hachi, has skin allergies so we appreciate that the dog food is also grain-free (we switched to another grain-free food some months ago and it did seem to reduce his symptoms). The first three ingredients are: Potatoes, duck meal and duck. There is also salmon oil for Omega 3, a natural source of DHA. Omega-3 fatty acids are important for normal metabolism and DHA is the most complex form of Omega-3. DHA is difficult to include in the diets of dogs (and people) because few foods contain a significant amount.I highly recommend Dick Van Patten's Natural Balance Lid Potato and Duck Formula Dry Dog Food (that's a mouthful to say) and our two dogs both give it two paws up.
Simple yet ideal for the locker room and pool at the local family YMCA. Protects against athlete's foot which is why I got them.

My household has several OXO products and we like the brand because it's one we can trust to deliver quality, value and a good price. The 10-piece OXO Knife Block Set delivers here again and includes all the knifes that a regular family needs.The wood block has an interesting design, presenting the knifes at an angle that makes them easier to access. Though the the paring knife (the smallest knife) does sit a bit awkwardly in front of the four steak knifes. It's not a big ding but it is a little harder to select that one.I tested all of the knifes and have also sharpened each (even though they didn't need sharpening - I just wanted to see how they'd do because in the past I've ruined some low-cost knifes this way). I used "Smith's Adjustable Manual Knife Sharpener" because it has three slots (coarse, serrated and fine) and a dial to select sharpening angle - with a chart of common angles (filet knifes, for example, suggested at 16 degrees).All of the knifes sharpened up nicely - even the steak knifes, which I would usually never even think about sharpening. The handles are comfortable and designed to provide a sure grip - classic OXO. Really love that.The instructions recommend hand washing but I've had them through the dish washer a few times and they didn't come out any worse for wear. Unless you are a professional chef, the OXO Knife Block Set is all your family will need (unless you have more than four steak eaters) for preparing any meal. I give it two thumbs up!

I'm just getting back into shape after several years (just joined the local family YMCA with my wife a couple weeks ago). I've always been a strong swimmer but have always had trouble keeping the proper breathing cadence when doing laps (via the crawl). Breathing was even more difficult now, years later, when I am in horrible shape (comparatively).I was thinking, "I wish I could invent a snorkel that would let me breath while swimming..." then did a search on Amazon and found the FINIS Swimmer's Snorkel. I love it! My wife told me I look ridiculous with my "fancy swimming apparatus" but I'm nearly 50 years old so what do I care what anyone else thinks? :) Without the snorkel I can swim 10 laps (Olympic-size pool); with it I can put in 20 right off the bat. (I should add that I'm also using the Finis Zoomer Z2 Gold Fins - I love those, too!) I highly recommend them to use with this snorkel.One more item I recommend is nose plugs. I've never used them before - and I've been snorkeling literally hundreds of times over the years. But since I am going so fast (well, it seems fast to me) while swimming laps with the FINIS snorkel and fins, water was going up my nose more than I cared for. So I added "Harmony Smiley's Nose Plugs." The trio is a swimming trifecta (well, for me, anyhow) and now I'm working on extending my workout to 30 laps within the next 30 days. LOVE this snorkel. LOVE.

My family has two large dogs, both rescues, and they are great dogs - very well behaved unless left home alone. We put them into their crates when taking short trips to the store or when we go out to see a movie or dinner. However, our dogs do not like going into their crates (they sleep on the sofa for the most part at night - crate doors left open), so a "treat" is always required to convince them to get inside.Skip, our 75-pound 2-year-old yellow lab-mix, has been getting particularly finicky about treats lately and we had been having a tough time getting him to "take the bait" as it were. So I was excited to test Natural Balance LIT Jumpin' Stix treats for Amazon. He loves them so much he will actually take them into the crate to eat them! (We usually have to put the treat into the crate first). Our other dog, Hachi (1.5 years old; 105 pound golden retriever-mix) also loves them but he will pretty much eat anything. :-)Since both of our dogs are large, I will continue to offer them Natural Balance Jumpin' Stix treats because they contain glucosamine and chondroitin to help support healthy hips and joints. I was also happy to see they are made in the U.S.A. and don't contain any grains: no corn, soy or wheat. (Hachi has skin allergies and we think it might be wheat-related).NOTE: On the package it says: "Packed in pride in the USA." I wanted to ensure they were actually "made" in the USA (and not China) so I called the 1-800 number on the package and spoke with a Natural Balance customer care representative who confirmed that these treats are indeed MADE in USA - specifically in Utah.And one final aside, I remember watching Dick Van Patten's television show "Eight is Enough" when I was a kid in the late '70s. I googled him the other day and was happy to see he's still alive and active. :)

2:46 MinsMy short video review shows the TP-LINK Power Bank in action. But as I was testing it for this review I recalled the many, many occasions when, away from home, my iPhone would die (how frustrating) or when on a plane... having my Kindle's battery run dry before the end of a movie. Those days are gone thanks to devices like the TP-LINK Power Bank. This one is on the heavier side but it is solid and works very well. In addition to iOS and Android devices - I was also able to charge my digital camera.Two thumbs up but please watch my short video for details -- and feel free to ask question in the comments section. I hope this review helps!

4:18 MinsWhen I first started testing the BLU Studio 5.0 LTE, as a long-time iPhone user, I must admit my expectations were not high. I use AT&T as my wireless carrier and because the BLU Studio 5.0 LTE is unlocked, I simply ejected my the SIM card from my iPhone 4 and inserted it into the BLU. Connecting to my wireless network was also fast and easy. I also added a 32GB Micro SD card for storing more apps, photos and videos. It took about 2 minutes to insert both cards - then I powered up the phone, and after the initial setup, was off and running.My short video review will provide more details (along a snippet of the phone's video footage featuring our dogs). But in summary:Pros:Big, clear and bright screen. This makes the BLU Studio 5.0 LTE idea for...* Using as a GPS device (I have a smartphone holder attached to the inside of my windshield). I've been using Google Maps and it is better than my old navigation device. It even "talks" you through the directions. I love that feature!* Watching videos (Netflix, "Dish Anywhere" [Slingbox], etc. Note: Does not (at this time) support Amazon Prime Instant Videos* Excellent camera - with 2 lenses, one for filming and the other for reversing it to film/photograph you. The camera has a few cool settings, which include the following options:- HDR (High Dynamic Range)- Various picture size options (the size photos I take are usually 3,200 x 2,400 pixels)- You can choose where to store photos and videos - on the device or on your (optional) Mirco SD card (not included)- There are more options (Histogram, Picture Quality, ZSL, face detection, color effect, saturation, contrast, sharpness, auto exposure, redeye reducer, countdown timer.... and more)- Panoramic Mode (which is very cool)- Video: With up to 6X zoom- Photos and videos can be automatically sent to your cloud-based storage (DropBox, OneDrive, etc)* Auto-switches between 4G and 3G depending on availability* No typing (in many cases) needed. You can dictate map coordinates, Google searches - even emails! Just click the microphone icon and speak. Works very, very well.* Case and screen protector included* Headphones includedCons:* No visual voicemail (like the iPhone has). You can see the number of voice messages, but have no idea who they are from, so you have to slog through all of them one by one.* Doesn't support Amazon Prime Instant Videos (yet)* No native sync with iPhoto; though there is an app called "iSyncr4Mac" that does an excellent job of accessing/syncing iTunes.* It is a huge phone so takes up quite a bit of pocket space - though it is thin, about the same thickness of my iPhone 4.Conclusion: I love the BLU Studio 5.0 LTE and it has replaced my iPhone 4. I haven't looked back! I hope this review helps but please see the video more.  Two thumbs up!

We have eight miniature sheep (three Babydolls and five Harlequins) and because they are so small they have an easier time eating hay that is cut into short pieces.The Scotts Miracle-Gro Titanium shears allow me to grab a fistful of hay and cut it into pieces a few inches long - perfect for the sheep (who are also very spoiled because they are pets).The grip is very comfortable - big holes so I can even have gardening gloves on when using them. And if they are tough enough for hay then I'm sure they'll be tough enough for whatever use you have in mind.Two (green) thumbs up for these Miracle-Gro Titanium shears.

I tested the 3M Black Privacy Filter on my Samsung XE303C12 11.6in Chromebook - the concept is good: it's always a good idea to take precautions when using a laptop/tablet in public spaces like coffee shops, airports, etc.You must choose between one of two sides of the filter BEFORE the first use:* The "matte" side (sort of a "rough" surface) is described as cutting down on glare if you are near a window.* The "glossy" (smooth) side is described as providing better image clarity.I tested both sides and from my Chromebook's small screen I couldn't tell much (if any) between either side.Pros:* Excellent protection of the contents of the screen - you have to view the screen straight on, otherwise all that is viewable is blackness.Cons:* Adhesive strips: You must choose between using the "Matte" or "Glossy" side... once you decide you are stuck with that side. I suggest using little pieces of scotch tape and not the long adhesive strips. Then you'd at least be able to reverse it.* It darkens the screen quite a bit when looking straight on. A bit too much....* Once the blue adhesive strip applicator is removed you can see the adhesive on the edges of the screen (through the filter).* It's heavy and has fallen off a few times. Also, I am pretty sure the adhesive will soon wear out and I'll have to use scotch tape to hold it in placeConclusion: I'd pass on the 3M Privacy Filter - unless you absolutely must ensure privacy for one or two occasions. It is heavy, falls off and you'll need scotch tape before too long. It also darkens the screen too much for my needs.

I've tested an assortment of bluetooth speakers over the years but none of them match the small footprint and BIG "vibrant" sound of the 2014 Boombot REX. The sound is rich and you can literally "feel" the beat. I've never heard such excellent sound from a speaker this small.I tested the Boombot in a rainstorm on our desk (with iPhone safe in pocket) and true to the claims, it performed just as well (though much harder to hear over the rain). No noticeable damage and it dried out fine.I went to college in the '80s and I had to carry a big, heavy boombox to the  lake or to the gym. While that giant old boombox assuredly delivered more volume I would have much preferred to have had this small Boombot just for the tremendous convenience. While it does fit into the pocket of my cargo shorts, I wouldn't dub the Boombot REX officially "pocket-sized," though it can clip onto a belt or strap (messenger bag strap, for example).There are also a few optional accessories available: the one that most appeals to me is the handlebar mount kit for rides along our local creekside bike path. A coupon for "10 points" is included in the box for use in purchases from the company's website. You can also earn point by posting photos on Instagram with hashtag #BOOMBOTIX. They do not appear to require featuring the actual device (many do not have a Boombot REX in that).Details of earning points via Instagram...Post Photo to Instagram hashtagged #BOOMBOTIXMax 5 per day +2 PointsGet a "Like" +1 PointGet a Comment +2 PointsAdd a Title on Swagonomics +2 PointsAdd a Story on Swagonomics(50+ words) +5 PointsPairing Boombot REX via Bluetooth is fast and easy and there is no passcode - it automatically connects. The device does not come charged so plan on charging it for 2 hours prior to use. It comes with a micro USB charging cable but you'll need to connect it to a computer or have one of those small cube thingies that plug into an electrical outlet and have a slot for the USB. One of those is also available for sale (or points) on the Boombot website. An auxiliary cable is also included to use when Bluetooth isn't an option and a physical connection is required.The battery life is impressive - so far the longest I've blasted out tunes was an hour and it never ran out of steam. And again, this little box puts on some big sound. It's not enough for a party but it's perfect for "individual use" as my wife calls it. You can literally "feel the beat."Two thumbs up for the Boombot REX! Big sound from a small box.

I have been a fan of "Mommie Dearest" since seeing it on video in 1982 a year after its release. The movie is what made me a Joan Crawford fan and a fan of camp films. Over the past 30 plus years, however, there have been rumblings that this was an extremely hard film to make and it was difficult on the actors, writers, director and other crew members. What I realized was the film was so hard to work on because of Faye Dunaway. I have never yet heard anyone from that movie say she was a joy to work with, yet people remained closed mouthed about Dunaway. That is until now!! A few months back I heard that Rutanya Alda was writing a book on the making of "Mommie Dearest" with the title to be called "The Mommie Dearest Diary". The title is derived from the fact that Rutanya (who played Joan's housekeeper/companion Carol Ann) kept a daily journal while making the film. There is a lot of amazing things in this book and I don't want to reveal anything, but let's just say I read the book in one setting! If you think you know what really happened behind the scenes of this film you don't. Rutanya proves she is an extraordinary writer and I want to thank her for her honesty and bravery in writing such a compelling book. Thank you Rutanya!!!!

Angela Basset received her directorial debut making the film that was a partial documentation on Whitney Houston's life. The movie is nowhere near as good as a film for HBO or theaters (it was shot for Lifetime TV), but it is still a good dramatization of one of the greatest stars ever, The movie deals with the difficult relationship between Whitney and husband Bobbi Brown, Whitney's battle with cocaine (way before Bobbi enter her life) and the destruction of her marriage due to Bobbi's alcoholism and Whitney's descent into drug addiction.y and pushed her into a world tour after "I Will Always Love You "(the Dolly Parton penned-song) hit #1 for 14 straight weeks. One really gets the impression it was Clive Davis who ultimately destroyed Whitney forcing her to do a world tour right after she did 'The Bodyguard" and the had the biggest hit of her lifer. To make matters worse Davis knew she had a cocaine problem as early as the late '90s. Shame on you Clive...your obviously a money grabber, The film has strong acting and the script is well written although the Houston estate had nothing to do with the movie. Arista Records refused any of Whitney's vocals be used in the movie so a singer dubbed the songs.

OK...I was a late viewer of this show. Everything you have heard about "Breaking Bad" is true...the writing, the acting and the direction is superb and in this entire set you get all six season's episodes and a slew of bonus feature. I am only on Season 3 and I have to say I simply cannot watch just one episode...I have watched two or three at any given moment. Bryan Cranson (the star of the series) won a remarkable four Emmy Awards as Best Actor in a Prime Time Series and Aaron Paul won three for his supporting work. The show itself won multiple Emmys as Best Drama/ The story is simple. A father of two and a married chemistry teacher finds out he his dying and to support his family after he is gone he decides to get into the meth business and pack money away for their future. The plot twists are superb, the stories fast paced and you get to love all the characters like a real family. You understand why people do the bad things thet do: thanks to society and the way this wicked world is people have to succumb to doing illegal things to survive. I love the Blu Ray package and the bonuses are huge with interview by series creator Vince Gilligan and the actors. This si the best TV series I have seen since "Queer as Folk"!!!

Barbra Stanwyck received a well-deserved Oscar nomination as Best Actress in 1948 for this amazing psychological thriller about a woman confined to her bed. While her entire staff is off for the night and her husband is out of town on "business" Stanwyck over hears a phone conversation where two men are plotting the death of a woman at 11:15 pm. She soon discovers it is she who is going to be murdered. It is up to her to try and defend herself and survive this horrific ordeal. "Sorry, Wrong Number" was based on a radio play and I actually acted in a stage play of this a few years ago. With a script this good you can't fail! With excellent cinematography, the film ranks high on the list of film noir classics!

Harrison Ford stars in this steamy and well-written film. He is a prosecutor who is having an affair with one of his office sluts. She is found dead and he is accused of her murder. A married man with a son it is up to his character's mind and fortune to figure out who killed the woman. A well acted courtroom drama, "Presumed Innocent" has aged well although it was made in 1990 and if you can get past the horrible women's hairstyles you will enjoy the film. There are a ton of twists and turns and I won't tell you the ending, but is is with the price of the whole movie!!!

Simply the best natural disaster film since the 1970's, "San Andrea's" is an excellent film made along the lines of "Earthquake" (1974) and "The Towering Inferno". The acting is horrific, but if you like disasters movies this is it. The plot is simple: a massive earthquake has hit the entire coastline of California putting the major cities of San Francisco and Los Angeles in perpetual danger. The entire coast is falling into the Pacific Ocean. Filled wit major special effects, great action scenes and more "San Andreas" looks like the real deal and one must ask himself: is this what is going to happen if the big one hits California? The movie was an extremely huge box office hit raking in an amazing $918,000,000 at the box office becoming one of the biggest films of 2015!

Jackie Collin's 32nd novel is nothing short of a masterpiece. Filled with characters from the most popular heroine Jackie has ever written, "The Santangelos" deals with Lucky, her quest for the good life and the problems she has with her beautiful children. Her son, for example, is up on murder charges for a crime he didn't commit. "The Santangelos" is complex, interesting, well-written and full of the hot steamy sex scenes readers have come to expect from the world's greatest romance writer...Jackie you have done it again!.

"Love Somebody" is Reba's 27th studio album and her first since 2010's "All the Woman I Am" which didn't sell well in the U.S.. That album actually became the first record in Reba's career that was not certified Gold or Platinum since 1984. Yes times are changing with a newer crop of younger singers on country radio (some I detest, but I won't mention names), but to say that Reba has dried up or her recording career is over is nothing short of asinine. Just listen to this amazing CD and you'll see why. Her vocals are top notch (she sounds better now at the age of 60 than she did in her 30's) and her collection of songs on "Love Somebody range from ballads to heartbreak to up tempo. Favorites her are "Enough" featuring Jennifer Nettles, "Promise My Love", the title song, and her first single that flopped at #28 "Going Out Like That". An amazing album by an amazing vocalist "Love Somebody" is one of the best in Reba's discography: I just hope it sells well because she deserves it! Welcome back Reba...we missed you!!!!

Originally airing on November 11, 1977 "Intimate Strangers" was a Movie of the Week on ABC. It tells the story of a battered woman (played brilliantly by Sally Struthers) at the hands of her psychotic husband (played amazingly by Dennis Weaver).  Although the movie is nearly forty years old (and thank God the laws against batters are more stonger than ever) "Intimate Strangers" tells the viewer of what it was like for women in the late 1970's were they were being battered by their husbands with laws that were less than enforceful. The film is disturbing to watch (the movie is exceptionally directed) but a story like this one needed to be told in 1977. "Intimate Strangers" was written and produced by "Dynasty" creators Esther and Richard Shapiro and had a very impressive supporting cast including Tyne Daly (who won an Emmy nomination as Best Supporting Actress in a film made for television), Larry Hagman and Rhea Perlman.

It is fantastic at how fast the studio is at getting the entire "Little House on the Prairie" season sets out!  Following on the heels of Lionsgate's" release of season 4 a few months back now comes "Little House on the Prairie-Season 5". Like the other box sets these are the uncut and cleaned prints that are being offered. Don't get these sets confused with the cheap and cut syndicated DVD sets that came out years ago and were made by some Canadian company who didn't know their feet from their hands. This is the real deal...how a beloved show should be released to its legions of fans to joy for posterity. Season 5 of "Little House on the Prairie" began in the fall of 1978 and ended the season as the highest-rated show on NBC and coming in at #14 for the year. The stories this year were compelling: The Ingalls family along with other residents of Walnut Grove realize the city life is not for them so they return to their beloved Walnut Grove and rebuild their town; Charles is ecstatic that he now has a son (adopted) named Albert and he fits very well into the story.; The Garvey family is featured heavily and Walnut Grove wouldn't be complete without the Olson's especially Nellie. In this set 24 episodes are included. My favorite show this year was called "The Cheaters" as Nellie helps Andy Garvey with his school work by teaching him how to cheat. It's hilarious!

In 1985 ABC's "Dynasty" became the #1 series on American television. So, it was no great surprise that the network wanted to cash in on the Prime Time Soap Era that existed in the 1980's by creating a spin-off of "Dynasty" called "The Colbys" (originally the working title was "Dynasty II- The Colbys"). The series was also created in order to get Pamela Sue Martin back as Fallon Carrington who had quit "Dynasty" in 1984. The reasoning was that if Fallon came back she would head the new serial while also making appearances on "Dynasty". Sadly, Pamela declined the offer so Emma Samms (fresh from "General Hospital") came in to fill the part (to me one of the worst casting decisions ever made although I love Emma). In the spring of 1985 while "Dynasty" was at its height in popularity Fallon showed up in Los Angeles with amnesia and had no recollection of who she was. A young handsome man named Miles Colby found her and fell in love with her. Then the story began. The Colbys were first introduced on "Dynasty" in November, 1985 in a two hour episode called "The Colbys of California". They had everything the Carringtons had, but more. Jason Colby (Charlton Heston) headed the family and was the brother to Constance Colby (Barbara Stanwyck's last role before her death). Jason was married to the beautiful Sable (Scott) Colby who was Alexis Carrington's first cousin (Sable once quppied to Alexis; "You know darling our Mommies were sistas!). Jason and Sable had three children Myles, Monica and Bliss. The acting was top notch all the way, the sets were breath taking (the Colby Mansion exteriors were actually the same house in Brentwood where "Mommie Dearest" was filmed) and the story lines strong and involving ( the series really reminded me of the second season of "Dynasty" when you couldn't miss an episode). The series also had its really high moments, almost all of them involving the wonderful Stephanie Beecham as Sable. In one episode she told her husband what she thought of her sister Frankie (Katherine Ross); "Trust Frankie, that tramp, that slut!" and to her sister's face about her sister's son; "I don't give a damn about your bastard you little slut!" In this exquisite box set all 49 episodes from "The Colbys" two season run on ABC (1985-1987) are included uncut and cleaned from their masters and there will be new interviews with John James (Jeff), Max Caulfield (Myles) and Stephanie Beecham (Sable). For true soap opera fans and historians this set is a real treat when one considers that more popular prime time soaps like "Knots Landing, "Flamingo Road" and "Falcon's Crest" are far away from having their entire library of seasons put on DVD for posterity. Luckily for us now we will always have "The Colbys" to enjoy! Pop the wine, bring out the crackers and cheese and sit back and see a true dynasty bicker, fight, tear each other apart, sleeping on one another, shooting people and even boarding a ...( I can't tell you the last word!)

"Still Alice" really holds a personal place in my heart. First of all Julianne Moore has been one of my favorite actresses ever since she graced our daytime TV screens on "As the World Turns". Since that time she has appeared in several successful films, been nominated for four Oscars and is regarded this year as the guaranteed winner for Best Actress for "Still Alice".  Another reason the movie resonates with me is beacuse as a year ago a dear personal friend of mine was diagnosed with the early onslaught of Alzheimer's Disease. He is now in a Nursing Home. He is only 53 years old. The movie chronicles the life of Alice, an intelligent woman who is a professor of linguistics at Columbia University who suddenly finds her life turned upside down when she begins to lose her memory. Gradually things get worse and she is diagnosed with the early onslaught of Alzheimer's Disease. The movie shows how Alice bravely deals with the disease in her work, with her family and with herself. For me the most daring part of the character of Alice was her bravery and staunch firmness on not allowing this disease to control her, but to control it. "Still Alice" is mesmerizing with exciting performances by all in the film especially Alec Baldwin who plays Alice's husband, but it is Julianne Moore who delivers the performance of a lifetime. 2015 will be the year Julianne Moore finally wins the Academy Award as Best Actress. And on February 22, 2015 Julianne Moore was indeed named Best Actress at the Academy Awards, an award that was well deserved and long over due.

Well here it is: the final film in the series of "Final Destination" and it's a great ending. Like its previous successors the plot is lame....a guy or girl sees signs of death in which people will die. The fun part about the films, and this one in particular, is how the characters are "killed off" one by one. However, what surprised me about the final film was some of the performances especially by Jacqueline Woods from TV's "Bold and Beautiful". She gives a strong performance and is destined for more films.

This is simply a breath taking coffee table book of the male body, one of God's most beautiful creations. The book is filled with both black and white as well as colored photos of real men, some with full beards or unshaven faces. If your looking for young twinks or muscle bound guys who take too much steroids look elsewhere: this book is more than that. This beautiful collection celebrates the male form in all its glory. Some pics have men totally naked with others having their private parts covered. One thing is certain: you will not be able to put this book down!

This is really, in essence, Whitney Houston's. only live CD/DVD in her career. Her record producer Clive Davis is responsible for putting together this amazing set of Whitney's greatest appearances in her career. We see her perform for the first time on television on "The Merv Griffin Show" to appearances on the Oscars, Grammys and American Music Awards. These performances are flawless and really remind people of the kind of superstar Whitney Houston will always be: original, real, authentic with a voice like no other. This is what she must be remembered for. No one had a talent like Whitney Houston. On this set the DVD performances look flawless and like the accompanying CD sound impeccable. This is really a true gem for all music fans. In its first week of release "Whitney Houston Live" sold a whopping 90,000 copies landing it at #1 on the Billboard Pop Album Charts!. Obviously, the fans will never forget her.

Bob Barker will go down in television history as the most popular host of a game show which of course is "The Price is Right". Winning over 12 Emmy's as Best Host Bob has been in TV living rooms since the 1950'a. It's nice to see he has taken the time to write a bio on his life. Bob takes us from growing up on an Indian reservation to his arrival in Hollywood where he hosted various game shows like "Truth or Consequences", but in 1972 his life would change forever. In that year he became host of the newly revised "Price is Right" on CBS that continues to this day to soar in the Nielsen Ratings. He talks about his love of his wife, Dorothy Jo, who died of cancer in the late seventies, his love for animals ("get your pets spayed or neutered"" and his love for his fans. What reader will not find in this book is any mention of the popular female models like Janice, Holly and Dianne, the three most popular models who Bob had several problems with and who dealt with multi-million dollar lawsuits brought against him by the later.

I love Ryan Gosling and love anything he appears in. In the lightweight 2011 film Ryan plays a man who helps his friend in trying to find new love when his marriage to Julianne Moore (a superb actress) is over. Jacob (Gosling) and Cal (the newly divorced guy) go through a ton of fun when trying to find that perfect lady. "Crazy Stupid Love" was a huge success because of its funny script and wonderful supporting cast including Marissa Tomei and Kevin Bacon.

"Mr. and Mrs. Smith" stars two of Hollywood's greatest stars in one of the 2000's best and largest box office films. Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie star as a very bored married couple with nothing on their hands to do but to drive each other crazy. Things really heat up when both learn they are target assassins for two different companies. Funny, action-packed and a n edge of your seat film "Mr. and Mrs. Smith" was a huge hit at the North American box office and the production of the film is where both Brad and Angelina fell in love.

Based on Neil Simon's play of the same name (he also directed this great film) "Barefoot in the Park" is a wonderful romantic comedy which stars two of the biggest superstars of American cinema, Robert Redford and Jane Fonda. They play a newlywed couple who live in a one room apartment in Greenwich Village and who deal with rather oddball neighbors. Mister Straight (Redford) is a hardworking lawyer who has a bit of a drinking problem. The movie, even after all these years, is fun and entertaining and continues to please audiences of any age who are in the mood for a good film from the 1960's.

The "Final Destination" story continues with Part 4 where a teenager predicts and sees the deaths of those around him/her. The movie is scary, fun and jaw-dropping and if you like these kinds of films like "Carrie" and "Texas Chainsaw Massacre" the these "Final Destination" movies are for you. Five "Final Destination" films were made as of 2015. Sit back and enjoy!!!!!!

For those of us who can't wait until May 14th, 2014 when the Dolly Parton and Porter Wagoner Box Set comes out we can always purchase this tiny little gem of a CD. "Duets" is a great sample of the kind of music Porter and Dolly sang" songs about love, heartbreak, and romance. This set features nearly all their big hits like "The Last Thing on My Mind", "Daddy Was An Old-Time Preacher Man" and "Making Plans". The only song that appears here that was never released as a single is from their 1969 LP "Always, Always" called "I Don't Believe You've Met My Baby". What I like about this CD are the rare photos of Porter and Dolly's. The cover was taken from the photography sessions for their 1971 LP "The Best of Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton". This pic is a little different from the LP version as both Porter and Dolly are smiling differently. Also, on the back of the CD is another rare photo taken from the "Just the Two of Us" photo seassions with Dolly donning her own real hair!.

I love "Revolutionary Road". It's a simple love story that takes place during the 1950's. It's about a young couple who live in the suburbs who risk everything to seek a better life. For me the movie will always be a continuation of the film "Titanic" as that film's lead actors are reunited here so in essence jack and Rose are back. Kathy Bates also has a small supporting role. She too was in "Titanic".

"True Blood" was riding high during its third season. The stories are involving, well-written and the characters are neatly interwoven with each other. The addition of the beautiful and sexy Joe Manganiello as a hot werewolf only adds to the male sex appeal of the series. However, my hat goes off to Denis O'Hare who plays Russell Eddington, a psychotic vampire hell-bent on avenging the death of his gay-lover vampire. Believe me...O'Hare ( a four-time Tony-Award winner) delivers in this part and if watching his portrayal as a maniac doesn't scare you nothing will. I have never seen a character so evil since Hannibal Lecter! All the characters get great screen time and the love story of Sookie and Bill dominates, but their love story is always tested. Also, Eric is as hot as ever, Pamela is a hoot and who can not help but love baby vampire Jessica, Oh and Ryan Kwanten still looks hot as Jason!

Chely Wright was a virtual unknown in Nashville prior to the release of "Single White Female" despite having released three other studio albums. Once the title track was released to radio the song quickly went to #1 on the Country Charts making the album go Platinum and making Chely a  Nashville superstar. Other gems here include "It Was", "Unknown" and the wonderful "The Fire". Background vocals were supplied by big-name stars like Vince Gill, Patty Loveless and Trisha Yearwood. An exceptional album  by a great artist!

Anne Murray released "As I Am" in 1988 at a time when country music was changing rapidly. Newer acts like Ckint Black, Garth Brooks, KT Oslin and Vince Gill were starting to make huge carrer moves in Nashville and "older" acts like Anne Murray, Kenny Rogers and Crystal Gayle (huge stars in Nashville in the seventies) suddenly found that DJ's were not playing their music. "As I Am" stalled at a paltry #29 on the Billboard Country Charts and didn't produce any hit singles. This is not to say "As I Am" is not a wonderful Anne Murray album. The one song that was released to radio, "Flyin' On Your Own (written by Canadian singer/songwriter Rita McNeil), is really the gem here. Anne makes the song her own and it should have been a #1 hit, but alas it wasn't. Other greats include "If I Don't Fall Tonight" and the title track.

Although "Hawaii Five 0" fell from the Top 10 in the 1975-1976 TV season (it was completely out of The Top Rated 30 shows on CBS) it never-the-less continued to be a fun and fascinating crime drama, The writing was excellent, the guest-stars amazing and the scenery of Hawaii continued to be what made the series. During this season people like Jack Cassidy and Helen Hayes ( the real-life mother of James MacArthur) appeared. The episodes look brilliant and the sound wonderful.

Unless your a huge fan of Ewan MvGregor (like I am) you probably have never heard of "Brassed Off". The movie, a low-budget film from Britain, deals with the demise of the coal industry in Britain during the 1990's and how it effected the people. Fans and critics agreed "Brassed Off" is a fine film and the movie, with no promotion, actually became a worldwide hit. The acting is superb, the story strong and overall "Brassed Off" is an intelligent film filled with surprises.

This is an amazing road-trip film with the star powers of Oscar winners Kathy Bates and Jessica Lang along with Diane Lane. Lang plays a woman who must return her husbands ashes to California as so she brings along her two best friends for fun. The trip to California gets sidestepped as the trio embarks on territory like Palm Springs and Las Vegas where they meet a series of people with their own problems. What the film shows is that no matter how terrible things are it always works out especially if you have friends to depend on! The writing is strong and the acting could not have been better and "Bonneville" ranks up there with other road films like "Easy Rider" and "Thelma and Louise"

Forget about the women, the drugs and the bouts with law, this collection of five of Glen Campbell's greatest albums makes the listener realize there is a huge talent behind the man. Consisting of albums that were mainly released when Glen was at his peak this set is a must-have for collectors of Glen's as many of his albums have never seen the light of day on CD so this is a wonderful place to start. The hits are all here and original packaging and new liner notes only adds to the beauty of such a fine collection by one of my favorite male singers ever!

The second season of "True Blood" is wonderfully funny, scary and campy as all goes out! But for me the fun is with looni Maryanne (played to perfection by Michelle Forbes) who is somewhat of an out-of-this-world creature who makes the people of this small town in Louisiana (called Bond Temps) do weird and wacky things all the while displaying totally dialted eyes (neat effects). The main love story is the lovely and mesmerizing telling of Sookie and Bill, all the while sexy and hunky Eric watches who ponders over her. I also have to say Alexander Sarsgood plays one heck of a sexy vampire! His assistant, Pam, is both a combination of Joan Crawford and Annie Wilkes (love the line when she refers to Maryanne..."the bitch still owes me for a pair of pumps!" and when asking Eric if she can keep a human, Eric retorts by saying, "No...you have enough pets." Great serial, great acting and a superb show!!! LOVE IT!

I have to say I really enjoyed "Moulin Rouge". As far as musicals are concerned "Moulin Rouge" ranks up there with some of the greatest and for me what makes the film (no...it's not Nicole Kidman) for me is the beautiful and talented Ewan McGregor. Great acting and what a voice. When he belts out some of the numbers, especially on the "Love Song Medley) my hearts beats a mile a minute. Poet Christian (Ewan) falls in love with the star of the stage show "Moulin Rouge (played by Kidman) who is dying. Making over $170,000,000 at the box office the film was a huge hit, nominated for multiple Oscars and won two: for Best Costume Design and Beat Art Direction.

I love Julian Moore. I have watched her in nearly everything she has done in her career (even her time on "As the World Turns") and I am holding out hope she wins an Oscar because no actress today is truely deserving of such an award as she. "Savage Grace" tells the story of a socialite who has an incestuous affair with her handsome son to cure him of his homosexuality. Story may be hard to take, but what draws the viewer is the acting chops of its cast, the beautiful production, the cinematography and the direction. You also feel for these tormented characters who were based on real-life people and come to the conclusion that rich people are not always happy.

If you like quality television and hot naked guys with a story backdrop about vampires then "True Blood" is for you. One of HBO's biggest hits, "True Blood" in its premiere season introduces us to the character of Sookie Stackhouse living in a small town in the South and her ultimate encounter with vampires. Her life is forever changed when she meets and falls in love with Bill, a 100 year-old vampire who reminds me of Barnabas Collins, who didn't want to be a vampire, but knew he had no choice. Other characters include Tara, Lyfayette and cutie Ryan Kwanten who plays Jason, Sookie's brother and spends most of the first 5 episodes in very sexual situations and possess one heck of an amazing body. Created by Alan Ball ("Six Feet Under"), "True Blood" ran for seven seasons and has, to this day, an ardent fan base.

I became a fan of director Steve McQueen's work after seeing "Shame" starring Michael Fassbender. In "12 Years a Slave"  McQueen was the first black person to ever win the Oscar for Best Picture. The story takes place in 1841 when Soloman Northrop is captured in Washington, D.C. (where slavery was abolished at the time) and taken to Louisiana to be a slave. The film follows Soloman's life for 12 years as he battles slave owners, watches in horror as he sees how his race is treated  and his determination to free himself. The film reminds one of "Roots", the TV mini-series that aired in 1977, and one cannot help but be reminded how blacks were treated and its effects on society even today. Michael Fassbender (currently my favorite actor) also stars in this movie as a dastardly slave owner who constantly rapes and beats his female salve (played to perfection by Lupita Nyong'o,who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar). A great film about a terrible and unforgettable time in American history, this film, like "Roots", will live on for eternity for others to be educated.

"The Help" is simply an excellent and charming film dealing with the race issue in the South of the United States in the early 1960's. The story is a simple one in which the viewer is shown how blacks were treated by whites in a very unflattering way. Most black women at the time worked as Nanny's or housekeepers for rich white women and the movies dramatizes the kinds of relationships these were and the drama that unfolded from it. I sat through the first showing of this movie in my Entertainment Room in awe as I had not seen a film this good in years! "The Help" was nominated for four Oscars including Best Picture and won the Academy Award, deservedly,  for Octavia Spencer in the Outstanding Supporting Actress category. The film was a box office smash earning over $200,000,000 on a $25,000,000 budget.

Following the March, 2014 release of "Little House on the Prairie-Season 1" now comes word that in May, 2014 "Little House on the Prairie-Season 2" will be hitting stores. This is great news for fans of the series who usually have to wait 6 months to a year for multiple season releases of their favorite TV shows. Like the Season 1 release the Blu-ray edition of "Little House-Season 2" will be the original network prints remastered to pristine condition and shown for the first time since the 1970's when they originally aired on NBC. The DVD's of the series were the paltry syndicated versions where as much as 10 minutes were cut from the episodes. In all 22 episodes will be available along with several bonus features including cast interviews! Season 2 of "Little House on the Prairie" did not finish in the Top 30 programs, but NBC would move the series to Monday nights for the 1976-1977 season where it became a Top 10 hit.

"August:Osage County" is probably the most critically-acclaimed film of the year with a cast that most producers would kill for. Nominated for several Oscars including Best Actress for Meryl Streep, the movie deals with a mouth-over-the-hill woman who's husband has left her, but she believes he is dead somewhere. Si, the entire family is called in and that's where the sparks fly: it seems Violet( Streep) was never Mother of the Year and all three of her daughters have messed up lives. The film deals with the rotten dynamics of a dysfunctional family where nearly everyone is hooked on booze, pills and cigarettes. Others in the cast who also gives superb performances include Ewan McGregor, Julia Roberts (also up for a Supporting Actress Oscar and Juliette Lewis.

With a fine cast including Ryan Gosling and Naomi Watts, "Stay" was a box office failure at theatres and stars Ewan McGregor who plays a psychiatrist trying to help a man (played superbly by Gosling) from committing suicide. The film cost a whopping $50,000,000 to make, but only made a paltry $8,000,000. For a film that is so good with an interesting plot and a high caliber of actors, "Stay" should have been more of a hit.

Directed by Michael Bay and starring the sexy Ewan McGregor asTom Lincoln, "The Island" was a box office bomb when it was released during the summer of 2005 and panned by critics, but it has gone on to enjoy enormous success by its cult following. Tom finds himself in another time as he was originally cloned. He then questions this new world he lives in and the problems he encounters. More of a science fiction/ drama film the film has an interesting and original plot, fine acting and top-notch directing.

By early 1971 Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton were at the peak of their success. They had just won the Vocal Duo of The Year Award from the CMA, their songs were all hits on country radio and even Dolly's solo career was taking off as she had her first #1 song with "Joshua". "Two of a Kind", like all Porter and Dolly albums, is an excellent example of how good this duo was. Featuring ten tracks, the real gem here is the first song "Oh, The Pain of Loving You" which would be shortened to "The Pain of Loving You" when re released in July, 1971 on "The Best of Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton" album. Other greats here are the Dolly-penned "Is It Real?", "The Fighting Kind" and "The Flame". The album is a little strange in the fact no songs were released as singles from it. Look for the amazing Box Set of "Dolly and Porter-Just Between You and Me", a 160 song collection featuring every song Porter and Dolly recorded for RCA from 1967-1976!!! All their albums, rare songs and unreleased material in one set!

This is a microphone optimized for isolating musical instruments in performance. The microphone is 6.5 long and weighs 10 oz. The sides and grille are black metal. The mic accepts a standard XLR female cable end for use in sound systems, mixer boards, and digital interfaces. The contacts for the XLR connector are gold plated for corrosion resistance. Internally, the magnet is neodymium, and the microphone is constructed with dual-floating walls to reduce handling noise. The hypercardioid response pattern makes the mic ideal for isolating instruments in performance situations or for live recordings. Included in the box are the mic in a tight-fitting foam receptacle, a padded zippered faux leather carrying case, a heavy-duty plastic microphone clip that will screw into standard 5/8 microphone stands, a plastic adapter to screw the clip into 3/8 stands, and an informational brochure in English, French, Spanish, Portuguese, German, and Italian. The mic was manufactured in China.This mic has a hefty feel to it, which speaks quality construction. The XLR connector has a good, snug fit, and the included clip keeps a secure hold on the mic. Most important is the microphone sound quality, which is excellent. Guitar through this mic is exceptionally warm and sweetfrequency response is true. Compared head-to-head with a Shure 57, this mic sounds sweeter and richer, especially with acoustic guitars. That makes sense since this mic covers higher frequencies than the Shure 57. You could use this microphone for vocals, but it really excels in sound isolation, so it's great for snare and percussion instruments. Yes, like other dynamic microphones, you may note some tendency for feedback, especially if you don't pay attention to placement with respect to monitors. The manufacturer notes that feedback can be virtually eliminated if you make sure the back of the mic is at least 45 degrees off axis with the speakers. This is about what I foundif I placed the mic directly in front of a speaker, I got a lot of feedback, but by moving off to the side about 45 degrees, feedback disappeared. Overall, this is a quality microphone that will be a great choice for instrumental amplification or recording, especially for acoustic guitars or percussion.

This is a heavy-duty plastic tote bag, suitable for carrying a variety of small objects. The sides of the bag measure approximately 11x9x4, with 2 large looping handles whose opening measures 7x4.5. The bag is made of heavy duty plastic which has some flexibility, but is generally rather stiff. The bag weighs just under 1 lb when empty. The sides of the bag are composed of circular shapes that touch each other on 4 sides. This leaves diamond-shaped holes in between the contacts that are about 1/2 across. Being solid plastic, the bag is fully waterproof. There are 4 small (1/4) holes on the bottom of the bag to allow any fluids that might fall into the bag to drain. The bag was made in the USA.I am impressed with the quality of this bagit really feels like it will hold up to heavy use. I'm using the bag in my garden. It is just the right size and shape for carrying my garden hand tools and packages of seeds. It will stand up to the elements like dew and rain showers much better than my former bag, which was made of reeds, or the old standby plastic shopping bags that always seem to get ripped to shreds by the end of the day. Other suggested uses for the bag include a shower tote, a lunch bag, or a magazine holder. Basically, this bag will hold a lot of stuff and it won't mind getting wet. The big handles are great, not only for carrying the bag around, but also for hanging it on a variety of hooks. Overall, this is a handy, well made little tote.

This is a large format smart phone that can be used with the phone carrier(s) of your choice. It runs on the Android operating system, an open source variant of Linux adapted for mobile touchscreen devices. Android is developed by Google, and there are numerous apps (application software packages) available to add capabilities to your phone, from games to navigation to social media like FaceBook. The phone ships with Android version 4.4, nicknamed KitKat. Here is what some of the other specs mean:--6.0 refers to the screen size. The screen is a full 6 inches long and 3 inches wide. This makes it considerably larger than a phone like the iPhone 6. Thus, the Blu 6.0 has a bigger screen and is easier to read than an iPhone 6, but you might find it bulkier to carry around.--Snapdragon 400 is the make and series number of the processor, the brains behind the smartphone. Besides Blu, other manufacturers using Snapdragon 400 chips include Samsung, Motorola and Nokia. The Snapdragon 400 is a good fast chip for an Android phone, though there are some faster chips out there if you want to pay a premium for having the fastest phone on the market.--1.6 GHz quad core processor is the rated speed of the processor. This speed is plenty fast enough for most utilitarian uses of an Android phone, such as navigation, web surfing, or using social media.--13.0 Mp refers to the image quality of photos taken with the camera mounted on the back of the phone. With 13 Mp, pictures you take with this phone can be printed and enlarged to 8x10" or larger without graininess. In comparison, the standard camera on an iPhone takes only 8.0 Mp (rear), while high end point-and-shoot digital cameras may offer 18 Mp. The front facing camera on this Blu phone (for taking selfies or using for Skype video calls) is rated at a full 5.0 Mp, which far outshines the 1.2 Mp offered on the front-facing camera of an iPhone 6.--2Gb RAM refers to the size of the working memory for the phone's computer. 2Gb of RAM is a lot of working memory for a phone, but it's necessary to run the large high definition video display.--4G LTE [up to 150 Mbps] is the latest wireless communication standard. LTE itself stands for Long Term Evolution, which is often referred to as 4G. LTE networks are supported throughout most of the Americas, Europe, and Asia and provide for the fastest voice and data communications currently available. Speed of communications is measured in Mbps; it is determined by the type of communications network. 150 Mbps is currently the fastest network speed available in North America.--Up to 32Gb MicroSD refers to the size of optional data card that can be added to the phone for additional storage. The MicroSD is an itty bitty pinkie-nail sized card which comes in a variety of storage capacities. If you are using the phone just for communications and social networking, you may not need to add a data card, since the 16Gb built in storage on the phone is already quite generous. However, if you'd like to carry around a large music or video library, or if you'd like to shoot a lot of photos or videos with this phone, the ability to add a MicroSD chip for extra storage is a great feature.The phone ships with a small protective plastic case that fits around the back of the phone, and a tailor-made transparent screen protector with cut outs for the front camera lens and speaker, as well as a small cleaning cloth. In addition, you get a 5.0 V 1 A output charger with micro USB cord and a set of ear buds with a built-in FM antenna and extra protective plastic tips for the buds, plus a small paper booklet with instructions about the very basics of using this phone and Android (they forgot to explain how to open the phone to insert the batter however!). Preloaded software is minimal, with basic Android email, calendar, camera, gallery, contacts, and browser. You can download other apps, such as FaceBook, DropBox or Skype from the Google PlayStore according to your needs and interests. The phone has a standard 3.5 mm headphone jack and slots for 2 SIM cards (to connect to phone carriers) as well as a MicroSD (for extra storage capacity). It also has full WiFi and Bluetooth connection options.I was interested in this contract-free phone because I live in a rural area where there is no cell service, so a phone contract makes absolutely no sense for me. Still, when I leave home, I need a phone to use for emergencies and to keep in touch with family, friends, and colleagues, and these days, I'm finding a smart phone is essential for navigating large cities. Since this phone comes without a contract, in order to use it, you need to add a SIM card from a communications carrier so that you can access their networks. As soon as I got this phone, I took it and my old GoPhone down to my local AT&T store. The clerk at the store transferred my GoPhone SIM chip and account to this smart phone, together with my GoPhone balance at no cost. Instant service (as long I stay in the city where there is cellphone coverage)! Well, actually, my old SIM card was too big to fit in this phone, so the clerk destroyed it and replaced it with a smaller SIM card for this phone at no charge. I also had the option of signing up for a variety of AT&T plans, or going down the street to TMobile and looking at their plans. With 2 SIM slots in this phone, I could even do both--get an AT&T SIM and TMobile SIM, although I think a better use of the second SIM slot will be for an international SIM when I'm traveling out of the country. I found the sound quality on this phone quite good, a great improvement over my old flip phone, which could only access older communications networks. Even though the screen is a little large, the phone feels comfortable for making calls. Note, though, that under current AT&T policies, with GoPhone (pay as you go) service, you can't access data on a smart phone via the AT&T network unless you buy a separate data package, starting at $5/month. Yes, on an old flip phone, AT&T allows you to use data services for a few cents a Mb, but the interface was clunky, so they knew you wouldn't do it. On a smart phone like this one, data services are easy to use, so they won't let you use them unless you pay extra for a data plan. Don't you love phone companies? If you don't want to pony-up for data services via the phone networks, you can still access data over WiFi networks at no extra cost on this phone.I migrated to this smart phone from a Samsung 7 tablet that I have been using for 18 months. Although I liked the tablet a lot, the sharper screen on this phone has made the new Blu phone my go-to device for reading and social media. Until seeing the action on this new Blu phone, I never noticed how slow the Samsung tablet was. I've read a few reviews about this phone and how there are other phones on the market that are faster. I guess if you absolutely must have the fastest phone on the market this week and money is no object, you might look elsewhere. But for the money, this phone is more than adequate, plenty more. With its sharp display and speedy Internet browsing, it is a pleasure to use.Speaking of the display, this phone makes a good book reader. I've tried reading books on an iPhone and other similar-sized small devices. No fun--either the print is too small to see, or just 3 words can appear on the screen at once. With the 6x3 inch display on this phone, you can get a full column of text, even with large print. The Kindle app works well on this phone; so does the Bluefire reader, for borrowing ebooks in epub format with Adobe rights management from libraries.
