After reading this, I went to Reyes Beach and picked up trash on Coastal Clean Up Day which is an annual event that takes place each September and has for the past 30 years. This year with the threat of El Nino flooding California, people are worried all the trash will be washed ultimately into the sea. The problems of pollution and habitat loss (and over fishing) for animals is a worry. If you personally take care of what you can do and do things that will help - it makes a difference from a grassroots perspective. If it all overwhelms you, you can be paralyzed. There is still time but we have to pay attention. This book gives a lot to think about in that regard.Liz Cunningham has written a very good and thoughtful book about "Our" oceans and the ocean creatures we should be respecting and caring for-if we want our children's children to be able to eat fish and enjoy the ocean as we once knew it. If we don't do it, who will? This is a very thought provoking, good book to read if you are interesting in the oceans at all. This is also about her journey and not just the environment. Cunningham's journey is inspiring and her writing of this book is important. Read it and do what you can to help save the oceans for future generations.

Elderberries have been used for a long time for help with combating or preventing flu and colds. They are very high in antioxidants and help with a few other health problems as well. I think this is a good supplement and you can take one a day to keep the flu away or two a day if you feel like you are coming down with something.I've had no trouble with digesting or swallowing this supplement and when I looked up the benefits of Elderberries I was surprised I hadn't heard of the benefits before. I've used New Chapter for a while now and take other versions of their vitamins and I trust their supplements to be good quality. I will definitely keep these around to help combat the flu during the flu season and I will continue taking it for its antioxidant properties. I think this is a great supplement.

In Fortune Smiles, Adam Johnson displays his writing talents by giving a voice to unique people in uncommon circumstances. Johnson's talents shine in each tale, though the stories themselves may provide food for thought, they are rather grim. I enjoyed this story collection and was not disappointed, but I was challenged in reading several of them.There is an ease of reading quality to Johnson's writing though his talents are of a high caliber-witty, stark, humorous and revealing-all qualities that are needed to create good short stories, but it seems to me each story in this selection could be its own book.

The Honest Kitchen has created minimalist food for dogs and while, it doesn't look like much-it reminds me a little of horse food, but my dogs really like this dehydrated food, a lot. This recipe has 6 ingredients: turkey, navy beans, parsnip, pumpkin, and coconut. There are no preservatives and no fillers in this dog food. You mix it with warm water and wait three minutes until the food is hydrated and then serve it up. A four pound package will make 16 lbs of wet dog food.All three of my large dogs love this food and one of them is a very picky eater. I just mix this with their kibble for breakfast and they eat it all, no crumbs. I really like this food. It's something different for sure and it is healthy with no junk-which certainly can't hurt my senior dog. The only thing I can think of to improve this product is to put the food in ziplock bags. There are two bags in this box of food and they are non sealable plastic bags. I think using sealable bags would help to keep the food fresh in between feedings. I put this food in the gallon sized Ziplock bags to keep it fresh. My dogs really like this food. I will have to see how long this box last in comparison to the canned food that I feed them in addition to their dry food. This seems a bit expensive, but in the long run, it might be well worth the cost. I am going to look into other products by this company. I really don't find that waiting the three minutes for the food to hydrate is an imposition as I can usually busy myself while the food is moistening. I like the idea of this wholesome food quite a bit and have used other dehydrated products but I think this one is my dog's favorite so far.

This leash works really well and keeps your dog safe with lots of room to roam. The handle is comfortable to hold on to and the leash allows for your dog to really roam, and if something pops up, you can safely reel them back in closer to you with no problem. I have a large dog but he's good on a leash so this is sturdy enough to take him for a walk with. I have another dog who is large and not so easy to walk but I have no problems with this leash being strong enough for her either. This is perfect for a medium sized dog though. The clip that secures to the collar is solid and over all this is a very good leash.I received this leash free of charge to test and review. Thumbs up!

The Xen-Tan Fresh Tanning  Mousse can create a nice, even tan. The mousse is easy to work with and the results take a little while to show up. Applying the product a little heavier than usual will result in a darker tone because a light coat doesn't create enough color for a tanned look. This is really easy to apply and the mitt really helps to evenly apply the tan without creating areas that are darker than others. I really like the smoothness of this product and how easy it goes on and the following results. The first time use though, created a very light tanned effect.Tanners can dry your skin and this one is no exception and it caused more dryness than the tanner I have used in the past, but a good moisturizer can fix that. The scent is nice and not too strong.All in all this is a long lasting bottle because a little goes a long way, but you'll want to apply it a bit heavier if you want a darker tan. The mitt makes using the product so much easier, but the product is a bit drying to skin.

My daughter says this notebook is perfect for school. This is an advanced notebook. This has a reinforced binding and plenty of pockets, tabs and divided sections that make it perfect for multiple classes. The durable cover is perfect for life in the backpack. This Five Star Notebook is a pretty blue as well.There are not many products that make my daughter say, 'it's perfect for school." This is definitely a sweet notebook that is designed for use and a longer than average notebook lifespan.

I like Jesse Ball and have previously read, Silence Once Begun. I think Jesse can write experimental fiction and has the talent to back it up which is why I chose to read, A Cure For Suicide. In my humble opinion, Silence was much better. Cure is very flatly written. Much like the contents which is like a report of sorts, the book reads like a report and is very flat with little tone. This book does share one attribute with Silence in that once read, the end doesn't really justify the cause. There is not a big payoff in either book. But, they are both interesting to a certain degree.I will continue to read books by Jesse Ball because I like his experimental style his work contains enough mystery to interest me and I think he will get better as time goes on.

The Winter Horses is a middle grade book about a young Jewish girl who escapes death at the hands of the Nazis in her small village and ends up in an old Ukrainian zoo that is looked after by an elderly man named Max. The zoo has been overtaken by the SS and many of the animals, much to Max's horror are slaughtered to feed the soldiers. When Max discovers that two very special and nearly extinct Przewalski (pronounced Shuh-VAHL-skeez) horses have been spared and are being tended to by a thin, freezing girl he steps in to help them and puts his own life on the line.Blending magical realism and history, Kerr has spun a unique story of survival during a bleak time in history. The name Kalinka is taken from a Ukrainian folk song and she is a great heroine in this book as she makes her escape from the zoo bound southward to find the Red Army as the SS close in on her and the horses which are to be put to death as they're too deemed an inferior breed and should be cleansed from the Earth.I enjoyed this tale. Though it deals with the random killing of zoo animals by the brutal SS, it isn't too graphic in nature. I enjoyed the tale of Kalinka and her love of animals made the story worthwhile. Old man Max is a gentle soul who adds character and depth to the story. The descriptions of war and brutality are given a go over in this book but not overly so, and I think this is an age appropriate tale for kids who like history.

I was looking forward to reading The Household Spirit. I like the idea of this book and expected maybe something like The Accidental Tourist with quirky characters and some backbone. While there are some facets of interest in this book such as the character, Emily Phane's sleep experiences that cause her to get very little sleep and be sort of disconnected. The thing about this story is that both of the main characters are so awkward that every little thing becomes a big thing-simple gestures and conversations are gone over in detail because they are a big deal in their lives, however, there isn't enough liveliness or substance to make these things interesting. While reading some of these details, I would lose track of what was going on. I think the idea and the premise of this book is good but the execution of it went a bit astray, at least for me. The characters needed some sort of strength to carry this story but they were so inhibited that it made them somewhat boring to read about-though some of the writing is really great. There are some strong points to this story about loss, loneliness and friendship but in between them, it's just so so.

Ageless La Cure Natural Organic Hydrating Toner is a nice, refreshing product for your skin. This isn't drying and it has a nice scent. My daughter is using some strong acne cream right now and this toner is soothing on her skin and hasn't caused extra dryness or irritation. This organic toner has some really good ingredients such as rose flower water. It does contain some alcohol but alcohol is the 6th ingredient.This is a good product, but it's very expensive for toner. This bottle will last a long time since a little goes a long way, but it's an expensive bottle.

This is a large bar of soap that's shaped like a huge bean. It is definitely great for the bath because in the shower with my smallish hands I am a bit afraid of dropping it on a toe. This particular bar (Pierrevert) has a powdery soap scent-I don't find it too overwhelming-a little headachy if you smell it too long. It's nice and relaxing for the tub though. The de Provence Soap makes a nice dense lather that works great for shaving your legs and it isn't drying. A little soap goes a long way so this bar will last quit a while.This is great gift-giving soap. It's a huge luxurious bar that comes nestled in a very pretty box. I think I have bought this brand of soap at World Market as a little gift. I like the Shea Butter because it's nice and moisturizing. All in all, I am enjoying this soap-it's a little big, but it should last a long time and it's got extra moisturizing ingredients and a nice scent.

If you want to read at least one great book this summer, I strongly suggest you pick this one. I feel as though I was transported to Paris, to Avenue Foch from the beginning of the German Occupation and stayed until the liberation-though in reality, it was only a two day stay. From the second I began to peruse the first page as I usually do when I get a new book, I could hardly put this down. Avenue Of Spies by Alex Kershaw has it all: guts and glory, horror, bravery, cowardice, greed, atrocity and heartbreak all with a backdrop of love, kindness and most of all, bravery.Alex Kershaw's writing style is spectacularly simple but gives the reader an acute understanding of what is happening which is rare when I read history, and is a sure sign of a good writer-I have read quite a few books about WWII this year, and this book by far is my favorite-but it's not even the history that is riveting in the pages of this book-it's the story of heroes. In this tale, Kershaw recreates the German Occupation in the City Of Lights. His subject is an American, Dr. Sumner Jackson, who lived on the posh Avenue Foch with his wife, Toquette, and their boy, Phillip. Dr. Sumner was the head doctor at the American Hospital in Paris and if that wasn't enough, he chose to help in the resistance against the Nazis as did Toquette and Phillip. Even when they could have gotten out, they stayed. Even when things got perilously close in danger they didn't leave-when the noose began to tighten on Foch Avenue and they were surrounded by the enemy, they stood firm.This book is inspirational. It could change a life. It could inspire you, dear reader, to be bigger than yourself. With the example of the human beings in the pages of this book, you could be bigger and better than ever and aspire to do good things. This is no mere history book, though the history is appallingly real, this book is more about humans at their best and their worst. This story is about real people who faced an empire and did not back down though most did. The hunger, the horror, the power the Nazis held over France was impressively strong and Paris fell with a whimper due in part by what had happened in Poland, but in the background there were people such as Sumner, his wife, Louise Marie Dissard, Violette Szabo, British Intelligence and other forces who where chipping away at the regime with the very real cost of being caught and murdered. The Gestapo and the SS had sinister ways in which to capture those in the resistance, such as the Funkspiel, where the Germans would impersonate a British spy after taking control of a their radio. In this way, and others, they were able to crack into the line of resistance fighters and gain valuable information. It was a cat and mouse game on Foch Street and the Sumners never knew when someone would turn them in or confess information after being tortured. Parisians left and right were either working for the Germans or had befriended them.So, if you want to read a really great book-pick this one. This is an incredibly great story. I can't recommend it more. I was literally stuck to this book for two days and while I wasn't reading it, I was talking about it.I would also suggest the Notes in the back of the book for further information and reading. I also see that Alex Kershaw has written several other books and I intend to get them. This is my great book alert for you. There is no way you would be disappointed reading about great heroes in the midst of terrifying danger in the most beautiful city in the world during one of the ugliest wars in history.

I have three cats and three dogs. We live in a rural area where things get dusty. There are tree orchards and vineyards everywhere and the pollen count is very high. This Holmes HEPA Allergen remover helps to keep the air fresh wherever you place it. This unit is nice looking and backs up to a wall or lays flat-it's not too huge or bulky.I've noticed a great difference in air quality and this freshens the air and keeps it clean. I found that my perfect setting is 2. It's quiet but still powerful enough to place in the bedroom. If I want to up the setting I can do so for a few hours but I feel at setting 2 it keeps the air fresh and has a nice hum to it that doesn't bother me. During the hot days that we have, this seems to also keep the room a bit cooler.The filters are easy to replace and are not too expensive when you compare the filters to other brands. This unit notifies you when the carbon filter needs to be replaced. You can also program this air cleaner to run when you want it to. Overall, this is a versatile unit with 4 settings. It's easy to set up and use and looks really nice. It isn't too loud and looks decent. More importantly, it does help to keep the allergens and pet dander down to keep the air in your home fresh and clean.

The End Of Tsarist Russia is a dense read that very thoroughly details the lead up to WWI and the end of the Tsarist rule over Russia. This is an interesting book in that it discusses the ways that Eastern Europe and Russia were ran prior to the war. There is a lot of information regarding the races between the countries for dominance and how Russia rose to be a power when most of its people were farmers who lived far outside of the city. This book gives a great view of nationalistic views of citizens and the Tsar and how opinions and governing changed over time. This book also details the minor and major conflicts running up to WWI and who was with who in the world of international politics.This book won't be for everyone and it helps to have a basic understanding of the history of Eastern Europe while reading it. There are many, many players discussed and their politics and beliefs are laid out. For a relatively dry history book, I learned quite a bit from this book and enjoyed it to a certain extent. Some facts and information seemed a tad repetitive to me which slowed up the pace quite a bit. That said, Dominic Lieven has created a history book that is fairly easy to understand and there are page of footnotes and sources in the back of the book for further investigation if the topic interests you. Pertinent to this book is how the same areas are important to us today with the current conflicts with Russia-this book explains why these areas are hot buttons even in today's world.What I thought was interesting was the biographical tidbits of Nicholas, his family and his cabinet. Nicholas was severely nationalistic and held on to an old belief system that didn't allow him to change. His armies as well were ill prepared. As a whole this is an interesting albeit very detailed account of prewar history.

These Sterling Silver Cushion Cut Emerald Earrings remind me of the style of the 1930s. The cushion cut creates a very dynamic look and these are very pretty. and elegant. The emeralds are clear and bright and the silver fastenings are all well attached and sturdy. These earrings are perfect for a formal evening or can dress up a casual look. Verigold packages these earrings in a black jewel box inside of another black box and the packaging is well done and professional. The only thing I've noticed with these earrings are that they look a little smaller in person in comparison to the picture. These are elegant earrings and not large dangling ones though the drop style is a very pretty look.These are quality earrings that look beautiful.*After having these earrings for several months, I want to add that these are my go to earrings when I go do something special. I really like these and they have become my favorite earrings.

I really thought this book sounded great and wanted to relax and enjoy it. This is an excellent premise but it wasn't executed in the way I expected. I found the situations of Ava and the dialog and the premise while reading it, a bit silly-all the way through. This could have been more seriously done because I feel that agoraphobia is an interesting subject, but I wish this was written more realistically. An American agoraphobic inherits a house in London and breaks free of her fears is a great idea, but there is just a lot of unintentional slapsticky moments that don't ring true, at least for this reader. I am not sure if the comedy is intended but moments that are serious, are not handled in a serious way. Some characters are charming and good but the story as a whole was fluffy and nonsensical at times.This could be a good beach read, but you'll have to stomach a few things that may be unsavory to many readers who wanted a good book about breaking free and starting over and not a weak, relying on whimsy, unsettling humor and other methods to entertain its readers. Good premise but iffy execution. The talents of the author, Mary Carter, are okay but the story and the antics involved throughout the book were not believable or realistic for me. I wanted to like it but I didn't care much for this book or about the people in it.

I really like this Jergens Wet Moisturizer. My legs have been pretty dry lately and I put this on after showering, while still damp, and the softness this oil provides lasts a long time. I have no need to reapply lotion during the day, even when it's very hot and dry outside. This goes on a bit sticky but soaks in nicely leaving no oily feeling, just nice soft skin. This bottle will last as it doesn't take much to do the job and is a nice sized bottle. The consistency of this moisturizer isn't oily and goes on more like a lotion versus an oil. This works better than the rose hip oil I have been putting on to combat dry skin.I like the concept of this moisturizer as well. It says it works on wet skin to lock in the moisture. I have no complaints so far and my skin has been really soft and nice since using this and I have had dry skin since wintertime. I like this product. It has a nice scent and isn't heavy but makes my skin very smooth and soft and lasts throughout the day with no need for reapplication.

This is a nicely laid out herb book that provides lovely pictures and lots of helpful remedies for the beginning herbalist. There are twenty chapters covering herbs such as garlic, sage dandelion, thyme, stinging nettles and much more. The book covers how to make tinctures, teas, oils and ointments and teaches you how to look for herbs in the wild. I think this is a very pretty book. It's not a huge, cover all the herbs book, but it is a great intro with some wonderful pictures. Tina Sams also teaches how to make some soothing baths and syrups and also some cooking recipes.The herbs presented in this book are fairly common which makes this a fun book to try out, but some of the recipes call for other herbs or ingredients such as crystalized ginger and mushrooms. There are some great vinegars in this book. This is a great way to start using herbs. A few of the herbs, such as mint, I have in my yard and I love the mint toothpaste recipe included in this book. There are lots of little gems to try in Healing Herbs. This isn't a huge comprehensive herb book but it is simple and inspiring for the beginner who wants to work with herbs and doesn't know where to start-for this, it's perfect. For the more experienced herbalist, there are still recipes, pictures and informative information.

The Pulaski Pedestal Table is a lovely, large pedestal that will accent any room. It's perfect for a plant, statue, books, pictures or whatever you'd like to display. This is a bottom weighted, sturdy table that looks so pretty but it's very sturdy and strong. You can put it in an entry way or living room or anywhere that needs a special something. The detail on this pedestal table is beautiful. This is also a large table but it isn't too heavy. I had no problem lifting it over my couch to put it behind the couch in front of a window. It looks like a big wooden column. The detail and craftsmanship show on this piece. It's also easy to care for and comes with a little guide to help you take good care of it.I am enjoying this pedestal table because it is very sturdy but it is light enough to move around. The weighted bottom is great because this won't tip over or wobble and the detail on the pedestal is really pretty.

I chose Boo because many readers seemed to really like it. I thought this book sounded really interesting, but reading it, I felt I lacked the connection many had to Boo and his adventures in the afterlife of Town. I felt this book meandered and I was just reading words but not making any real connections. I did like Boo, a thirteen year old boy with a photographic memory, who was killed by a gun toting middle school boy in a school shooting. He was okay but I had trouble with the setting and the other characters who just seemed to pop up and do this or that and I didn't get the whole deal. I read the words but didn't feel much regarding the story as a whole.While I was interested in reading this book, it feel flat for this reader, unfortunately. In consideration of if my kids would enjoy this book being closer to the target age, I don't think they would get into it either. This is a unique and imaginative story that must have appeal. I just felt disconnected from it. I have read the Dog In The Nighttime book and greatly enjoyed it, but I don't think Boo really compares to it except for the fact that the main character is autistic. The publishers really pushed that angle and I have to disagree, but I am getting wary of comparisons in general.Give this a try if you want, you may like it. I just didn't connect in a way that others seemed to.

Happy is a tiny hardback book that is great to have around for people to pick up and see what's up in other areas of the world, as far as happiness goes. Each page is dedicated to a different culture and what they do for happiness sake. This is a cute little gift type book that really has some interesting tidbits from around the world. I set mine on a counter for everyone to enjoy a bit of a happiness break throughout the day or week, and to learn something new or interesting from another culture. This is a tiny but interesting book on happiness-perfect for a stocking stuffer or little pick me up gift for a friend.

My significant other has a number of watches, including watches meant to be worn as jewelry to a party.  Unfortunately, most of her watches are very small and given our increasing age, difficult to see.  This watch has a face that has a great size and a face that is simply elegant, perfect for any environment.Though my significant other owns numerous watches, they all have metal bands.  This watch is the first with a leather band, and she, to her surprise, loves the way it fits and feels on her wrist.  She loves the stitching on the band, and the way the relatively large face rests on her arm.  I should not that she is a relatively small person at around 100 pounds, so she has small arms.  I thought the face might appear to large on her arm, but it looks good to me, and more importantly, to her.The glass covering the face is synthetic sapphire, which is antireflection coated on the interior to reduce reflections.  Yes, the exterior surface still reflects light, but the interior face does so only minimally.The watch is allegedly water resistant to 165 feet.  I would not recommend diving in a watch with a leather band, but if you do, as long as you stay about 165 feet, you should be good.This watch comes in a box that is absolutely gorgeous, with an exterior cover with the Gucci name, and an interior hinged box, also with the Gucci name.  The watch is nestled on a thick pillow.  An instruction book in numerous languages is included in the box that contains instructions in, for example, Japanese, Korea, Chinese, German, Spanish, French, and more.  It appears that the instructions are in 25 different languages, many of which I am unable to read.  The instruction book includes its own slip cover, with Gucci embossed on the cover.  Indeed, the Gucci name is on the box and contents multiple times.From the simple face, to the gorgeously designed body and the stitched leather strap, this watch will be an elegant touch at a party or in a business environment.  Though the watch is relatively expensive, its simple elegance and beauty avoids being ostentatious.  This watch would be a perfect gift for most women.Enjoy!

This large china snowflake ornament is simply beautiful.  The ivory snowflake is decorated with gold and green paint with red "stones," which surprisingly feel like glass.  Though a touch on the gaudy side, this ornament is a perfect addition to any Christmas tree.The snowflake has six points, with openings extending through the snowflake to permit lights and other features to show through the snowflake.  The gold trim paint dresses up the snowflake nicely, keeping the snowflake from being too plain white.  The red "stones" are a particularly wonderful addition that turn a lovely star into a phenomenal star.  In keeping with traditional Christmas colors, small green dots finish off the trim in various places on the star.  Lastly, a gold tassel is configured to secure the star to a tree.This Lenox jewels snowflake ornament may be a bit on the pricey side, but it is gorgeous and heirloom quality.  We think this ornament will be a treasure that will be passed on to our children, and perhaps their children as well.Enjoy!

We initially selected this toy because it looked interesting, and seemed to have enough action to entertain a child age three and up for a long while.  Well, the toy is kind of interesting, but it gets old fast; really fast.Getting this toy out of the box was remarkably easy.  There are four fasteners in the bottom and two in the back that are covered by tape.  Either cut around the outline of the fastener (my approach) or remove tape from over the top of the fasteners (my significant other's approach), rotate each fastener about 90 degrees, and remove.  Once the six fasteners are removed, Chase comes out of the box readily.  It took us about a minute to remove Chase from his box and another few seconds to remove the stretchy bands that secured packaging to Chase.Before playing with Chase, a switch on the bottom must be moved from a demonstration position to a play position.  Once in the play position, press Chase's badge and missions begin.  Each mission involves pressing various buttons to open Chase's backpack and to light the search light, to open Chase's backpack and to launch the net, or to activate the megaphone.  As a part of these missions, Chase can sit down, stand up, sniff, move his head up and down, and move his head side to side.  Chase allegedly comes with more than 130 phrases, though we have not counted them.  It does not seem as though there are that many phrases, but I presume the manufacturer would present only accurate information.  Maybe some phrases like to repeat too often.Our biggest disappointment is that Chase does not walk.  It just seemed that Chase should be able to move a few steps, but he pretty much stays in one place for everything he does.  So, when Chase is on the case, he pretty much does not move anywhere to be on the case, which is disappointing.  Another disappointment is that the megaphone is not very mega.  Indeed, putting your mouth next to the microphone and yelling, other than being annoying, can be louder than the megaphone output.  While the megaphone may be muted to keep parents from being annoyed, it does seem as though it could have been a little louder.A more serious disappointment is restoring the net to its launcher.  The net is hard to replace, particularly for the target audience of age 3 and up, and it can be installed backwards.  Incidentally, if you install the net backwards, at least one person has reported that the net will not come out.The bottom line is that Paw Patrol - Mission Chase, is hard to recommend.  Chase hardly does much of anything, and he does not walk.  After a few missions, the few things he does get kind of boring.  This toy seems like one that will quickly end up in the heap of toys that do not get played with often.Good luck!

This kit is awesome, and includes almost everything a new breastfeeding mother might need if that mother needs to pump.  Evenflo apparently makes three different types of breast pumps, and this particular pump is the most capable pump of the three.This kit includes Evenflo's double electric breast pump, a box of 40 five ounce milk storage bags, four five ounce milk collection bottles, a pair of membranes and valves for the breast pump, and 60 disposable nursing pads.  As a basic kit, this one is awesome, but a nursing mother will need a few other items, as noted below.The double electric breast pump is the center piece of this kit.  This pump includes 32 different settings to optimize pumping for virtually any level of flow.  The design is configured to allow one person to completely set up and operate the two suctions and the controls, though it might take a bit of practice to become proficient.  The pump also includes a carrying bag, though it is a bit on the small side, three different size flanges to find the best fit for mom, two five ounce bottles (thus the kit has a total of six five ounce bottles), and two extra valves and membranes (thus the kit has a total of four valves and membranes).Though this kit includes a lot, and makes a phenomenal gift for a new mom, a few more items would be valuable.First, a larger carrying bag.  The drawstring bag is fine for the pump, but that leaves everything else.  Find a zippered bag to hold all these items, plus the others that I list.Second, nipple cream for mom's breasts.  Nipples are very sensitive, and though mom swaps out nursing pads often, it is really tough to keep breasts from being irritated and sore.  A good option is Bella B Nipple Nurture Butter, which is lanolin-free.Third, get some large storage bags to hold bottles, storage bags etc.  The storage bags will keep everything clean and sanitary.Fourth, get a couple of small towels.  Even better, get a half dozen.  They can go in storage bags (preferable), or into the bottom of the zippered bag.Fifth, get lots more disposable nursing pads.  LOTS more.  Seriously.  As long as mom is nursing, she will go through these things quickly.Sixth, get more milk storage bags.  It is amazing how much milk babies need, and how much mom can generate, at least initially.  May as well save up for later when baby starts to eat more than mom can produce.You might also want to consider getting an adapter to pump directly to milk storage bags, rather than pumping to a bottle and then pouring into a storage bag.  Less handling is more sanitary.Many moms need to pump because they work, or need to be away from baby for short periods.  This kit is a great starting point.  Get the other items I listed above and turn a great starting point into a comprehensive kit for mom.  She will love you for your thoughtfulness!Enjoy!

On the plus side, the three china kings are beautiful.  The style is classy and elegant.  The one issue I have is with the internal lights, which I think actually detracts from the beauty of these three pieces.As decorations, these three pieces are understated.  Though the gold trim could be gaudy, the artist used it to a level of effectiveness rather than taking it to a level of cheesiness.  The finish is smooth and bright with the white primary layer and the gold trim.  Indeed, these pieces would be at home in a church or in a house.Then there are the lights.  Each of the kings has a light for some, inexplicable reason.  I suppose some people might like the lights, and it seems like most Christmas decorations include lights.  However, the lights turn these beautiful sculptures into something more akin to the cheesy decorations you buy from those magazines filled with cheap, kind of good looking decorations made of plastic, all of which have a light.Even though I am less than impressed with the lights, which I leave turned off, these ivory, china Christmas decorations are beautiful, ready to decorate a bookshelf or a mantle.  Yes, they are a bit on the pricey side, but at more than 7 inches tall, they are sculpted miniature statues celebrating a Christmas-related event.  These decorations will eventually be passed on to our children, and hopefully their children.Enjoy!

On the very plus side, the pictures are vibrant and edge to edge.  On the less than plus side, I am not a fan of all-in-one cartridges because invariably one color runs out of ink before the other colors, and you have to replace the entire cartridge, which has always seemed wasteful to me.Setup and connection was a breeze, though a touch slower than I would have thought.  I am not 100% sure how long it took, because I was not timing the connection, but I was presuming a couple of minutes maximum, and it seemed closer to 15 minutes, though it might have been longer.  It seemed like forever, but time seems to go slowly when you are waiting for something to happen.Once the printer connected to our network, there is the usual business of finding the right software or downloading the right drivers to drive the printer, which takes a few more minutes (okay, maybe a bit longer for some devices, because I always forget how to find the drivers because I do not do it very often).  Once you have the Wi-Fi connection and the drivers, FINALLY you are ready to print.The pictures are gorgeous, and the ink is non-smearing (Epson ink - some non-Epson ink is not so non-smearing or permanent, as we have discovered to our chagrin).  The clarity of the pictures on glossy paper is fantastic, and the colors are vibrant.  A 4" by 6" picture takes about 35 seconds, give or take, to print, which is actually fairly fast, certainly faster than our older Epson printer with Durabrite ink, and the pictures look better.Perhaps the biggest downside to this printer is the current price, which is quite high compared to many printers that will print photos.  If you really want the quality, speed, and borderless prints, and the portability is important, than this printer could be made for you, in spite of the cost.Overall, we love the speed and quality of the pictures, and that the pictures go from edge to edge.  The ability to print without a cable is cool, and the printer is small enough to be portable.  The cost per picture, excluding the price of the printer, is about 41 cents per print, based on current price of cartridge from Epson and 4" by 6" photo paper, which might be slightly higher than for some prints.  The only real down side is the single cartridge, which means that the first ink out requires a new cartridge.Enjoy!

We have seen many different baby bottles, many of which contain gimmicks.  Initially, we thought these bottles might be yet another bottle with a gimmick, until we saw them in action.  The two coolest things about these bottles are that they minimize a baby's air intake and they are the closest thing to a breast we have ever seen.The vent on this bottle is configured to minimize a baby's air intake, and also seems to reduce colic.  The sophisticated valve appears to do a good job of controlling airflow into the bottle as baby feeds, and keeps air well away from the nipple area.  Regardless of whether a baby ends up with colic, minimizing air intake during feeding is a significant plus.In addition to the valve, the flexibility of the nipple does a fairly good job of mimicking a breast.  A human breast is quite amazing when it comes to feeding a human child, and bottles typically do an awful job of being even remotely similar to a breast.  The nipples on these bottles, on the other hand, have great flexibility and behave much like a real breast.  An accordion-type fold helps orient the nipple so that baby can remain latched even as baby's head moves or the bottle moves.  Indeed, baby may come to prefer this bottle to an actual breast, so unless you are trying to move baby from breast to bottle, best to keep baby on the breast as much as possible.While this bottle advertises that it is dishwasher safe (top rack, of course), and likely it is, we are somewhat concerned that over time the nipples will lose their flexibility due to exposure to the heat of the dishwasher.  On the other hand, different nipples provide different flow rates to adapt to baby's milk intake, and since the nipples need replaced regularly as baby grows, it could be that nipples are not washed enough times to lose their flexibility.In addition to all the bottle goodies that come with this gift set, a bottle brush is also included.  Yes, you really want a bottle brush to provide a proper cleaning to a bottle when hand washing.  A bottle brush may even be required when dishwashing bottles if you accidentally permit milk to dry in the bottle, which should always be avoided if possible.After what seems to be an extended commercial for these bottles, you would think that we overwhelmingly recommend them.  Unfortunately, these bottles do seem to have a flaw that we consider occasionally annoying.  Sometimes the bottles leak in the valve area.  Part of the challenge seems to be properly assembling the bottle.  However, it may be that the valve is not closing properly, which seems curable by reaching into the bottle and pressing on the valve tip.  We are not sure if the valve issue is a design flaw or a compromise that had to be made to minimize baby's air intake.  Regardless of the reason, the leaks seem to happen at the worse possible times, like when baby is REALLY hungry and you are trying to quickly prepare a bottle.  Hopefully subtracting only one star for the periodic leak issue is not being overly generous to the manufacturer.  However, the bottles otherwise seem about as perfect as a bottle could be, and given how well these bottles mimic a breast, we are willing to forgive a periodic leak issue, even while wishing there was never a leak.I am unsure of how many different types of baby bottles we have purchased over the years, from the old glass bottles with the yellow nipples to modern, super sophisticate baby bottles.  While some have worked better than others, none appeared to even try to mimic a breast.  it is almost as though mimicking a breast was not a consideration.  However, it seems to us that baby prefers a bottle that is close to the real thing.  Further, baby does not care that the bottle sometimes has a leak.  Baby just knows what baby likes, and baby likes this bottle.  What more do you need to know?Enjoy!

Children are naturally artistic.  They love to play with crayons, colored pencils, water colors, and tempura paints.  This table is a great place for one or more children to let their imagination soar with all child-suitable artistic media.To make it easy to take advantage of a wealth of creativity, this table includes multiple storage cups and a canvas storage bag to hold the various tools of the artistic trade, such as crayons, paints, paint brushes, scissors, etc.  The table also contains a location for a 100 foot roll of 18 inch wide paper, which is ready to receive a young child's imagination.  The paper feeds up through a slot to permit the paper to lay flat on the table in preparation of whatever inspiration strikes a young artist.  The table also includes a child-safe paper cutter.The table is colorful and attractive to young children, though children even past the recommended age of 9 could find this table useful, depending on the size of the child.  This table could even be used as a place to build Legos or a model.  The two benches provide room for up to four children, depending on the size of the children, so multiple children could work on a single project or on individual projects.Though we love this table, we have only had it for a short time, and it is nearly impossible to assess durability of such a product in such a short time.  We notice that a few reviewers have experienced issues with the legs and apparently smearing paint.  While the table currently seems sturdy and stable, we will be monitoring it for any issues.Traditionally, our children have used the kitchen table as a place for their artistic endeavors.  Now our grandchildren have a place to let their creativity soar that leaves the kitchen table available for other activities, like eating.  In addition, the table provides a great location to store the tools of the artistic trade, rather than those tools ending up under the bed or in the dog's mouth.  Of course, the children must be encouraged to put all their goodies into the storage cups, and to pick up the crayon that rolls onto the floor, but that is always a challenge, and given how much they like this table, just the mere suggestion that the table might be removed typically encourages a bit of cleanup.Enjoy!

While the ABC picture boards are advertised as a toy, they are a great learning tool that parents and educators can use to help children learn their letters, and how the letters sound.  This set includes 13 double-sided boards for a total of 26 sides of learning, and 52 colorful letters, both small and large.To really use this educational toy, a parent or other adult will need to work with the child to explain how the letters sound, and to help sound out the words on the picture boards.  Of course, this learning opportunity is great for bonding with a child, also helping the child see that the adult values the ability to recognize and use letters properly.I remember having a similar toy when I was little.  My much younger brother also had a similar toy, as did my son and daughter when they were little.  In each case, we helped the child understand how to the letters sound and look, helping prepare the child for pre-school or kindergarten.While this educational toy is quite valuable as a learning tool, it is made of wood and as such, it is a potentially valuable building tool.  Thus, if your little one becomes a bit bored with learning, the wooden boards can be used with other building toys to create cities of the imagination.Enjoy!

Small children have great imaginations, and these story blocks can help them to focus their imagination to become story tellers.  While basic play requires one of each block, multiple blocks can be used to tell a story.  For example, the princess might journey from her palace to a distant planet, where she finds a frog.  Upon kissing the frog, a pirate appears.  Where will the story go from here?  It is up to the imagination of the story teller.Some children may discover that telling and controlling their own narrative is far more fun than television, and often funnier than television.  Because block combinations can vary a lot with the mix and match possibilities of eight blocks, the variety of stories could be nearly infinite.Beyond telling stories, the block appear to be about the same size as standard letter blocks, so if a child becomes bored telling stories, they can use the blocks with other blocks to build with creativity and imagination.  The blocks come in a wooden tray that can also be used as a building element, along with being a storage tray for the blocks.Anything that spurs a child's imagination is a good thing.  When a child is challenged to develop verbal skills, it can only be helpful to them in school, or in life in general.  These blocks are great to develop creativity story telling capabilities.  And when a child's story telling imagination wanes, they can build a tower of blocks.Enjoy!

These sippy cups are a bit on the expensive side, but they are also feature-laden.  When you consider that these cups will likely be used by your children, and perhaps other children thanks to their durability, and in consideration of the useful features in these cups, the price may be less of an issue than it otherwise would be.First off, these cups are highly leak resistant.  As with all sippy cups, a few drops can leak out if shaken vigorously or banged, but a properly adjusted cup should not spill.Second, this cups are attractive.  Each cup is colorful with either numbers (1, 2, 3) or letters (A, B, C) and an array of colorful animals that are sure to attract the attention of most toddlers.Third, the flow rate is adjustable by way of a patented valve (innovation at work!).  Adjust the flow downwardly for a new cup drinker, and upwardly for the experienced old timer getting ready to graduate from sippy cups to a real grown up cup or glass.Fourth, these sippy cups have a small diameter and are tall enough for two hand to grasp.  Toddlers are still learning good hand-eye coordination, and these cups are great for little hands to find lots of orientations to hang on.Fifth, double wall construction for insulation.  Does your toddler like to haul milk around for what seems like forever?  With double wall  insulation the milk will stay cold longer and be less likely to deteriorate.Sixth, the plastic of these cups is break resistant.  Of course, virtually all things are breakable if abused enough, but these sippy cups should stand up to a fair amount of abuse without breaking.Seventh, the plastic is BPA free.  Yippee for that!Eighth, dishwasher safe.Why four stars instead of five?  With all the features, a couple of compromises had to be made.  The cups tend to be a bit unstable, particularly on slick surfaces like a high chair, and they have  tendency to fall over when being picked up.  How many times do you have to say "USE BOTH HANDS?"  As much as these cups like to advertise being leak and spill proof, they are not shaken by a child proof.  Drops of fluid can still come out, and little hands love to push the drops this way and that.  Not enough liquid, shake the sippy cup some more.  I doubt that a cup can be designed that prevents a toddler from shaking drops out, but maybe one day...As you can see, these sippy cups are loaded with features, including a patented adjustable valve.  They are a great choice for parents seeking a safe, spill-proof (though not drop proof) sippy cup for their precious progeny.Enjoy!

This phenomenally sturdy waste receptacle is perfect for outdoor use in any environment.  Business owners looking for a heavy, wind resistant waste receptacle configured to take a beating look no further, you found it.  Though a bit expensive for home use, this waste receptacle could be an option for a sturdy recycling bin, or for a garage waste receptacle.The frame and side panels are steel frame with perforated steel sides.  The top is also fabricated from steel.  The top is removable to expose a 15 gallon plastic liner, which can be used directly for waste, or can be lined with a 15 gallon plastic bag.I am not sure what kind of paint was used for the steel, but the paint is uniform and seems thick, which should minimize corrosion and provide for excellent durability.This waste receptacle is probably not a good option for a kitchen because the interior remains open to air.  Thus, odors can escape, and flying insects can easily enter the open spaces.  However, this waste receptacle is perfect for a patio, deck, or other outdoor location.  This product could be an excellent option if you host upscale backyard parties and need attractive waste receptacle options.While there are less expensive options for outdoor waste, most, and perhaps all of those less expensive options are relatively light and are not wind resistant.  This receptacle weighs in at more than 50 pounds, which not only makes it wind resistant, by stable.  It is attractive and painted in neutral color suitable for many environments, including indoor commercial or business environments and a home garage.  This waste receptacle should be emptied frequently if used for organic waste products, such as food or garden debris.  While it seems as though it would be difficult to wax enthusiastic about a waste receptacle, this one is so nice and perfect for out back patio that it has to be five stars.Enjoy!

This apron was awaited with great anticipation because it looked cute.  Sadly, the reality was much less than the anticipation.  The material is thin, so if you are hoping for much protection from anything other than dust, prepare for disappointment.  Not only is the material thin, but it is stiff.  Even worse, the apron appears to be suitable for a woman who is a certain size that is neither too small or too large, given the complaints from people who find this apron too large or too small.Perhaps the worse thing of all is no pockets.  We have several aprons, all of which have pockets.  Without pockets, this apron is little more than a decorative bib, and not a very good one at that.Does this apron have any redeeming features?  Well, it is kind of cute.  However, when it comes to the kitchen, which is more important, being cute or being functional?  Sure, it would be great to have both, but this apron falls short on the functionality side.Good luck!

On the plus side, these sheets are pre-cut and ready to go.  On the less than plus side, these sheets are relatively expensive, and because the sheets are folded into quarters, creases need to be accommodated.We have used baking sheets in the past, but mostly the roll type.  The roll type baking sheets have their own issues.  The rolls can be a challenge to store.  The roll type sheets curl until you get some weight on them.  You also have to cut the roll type sheets, either with a built-in cutter, or with a pair of scissors, or both if you are trying to line round pans or extra large cooking sheets.These baking sheets are easier to store because they are in boxes that fit in a lot of spaces.  In addition, the curling problem of roll sheets is mostly gone.  These sheets are small enough that for many applications there is little or no need to cut or trim the sheets.While these baking sheets solve some problems, they introduce a brand new problem, two creases that extend entirely across the baking sheet.  We were able to decrease the effect of the crease by folding the baking sheets in the opposite direction, which helped the sheet lay most flat, but the crease remains.  The crease does not seem to be an issue with respect to drop cookies or roll cookies, but it could be an issue for certain kinds of sheet baking.Perhaps the biggest issue with these is the cost.  There are lots of baking sheets available in roll form that are far less cost per unit area.  However, there are times when speed is important, and there is just not enough time to cut baking sheets into smaller sizes.  That is where these sheets come into play.  Think about baking six dozen cookies in a hurry with twenty other things to do for a big party or for a family gathering, and you realize that these baking sheets could save you a lot of time in cutting and fitting baking sheets to baking dishes.We do not see these baking sheets as a one-size-fits-all solution for non-stick baking needs.  They can be a time saver in certain specific situations.  They may even be a perfect size for some baking tasks.  However, we see roll sheets as continuing to be our first choice for baking needs for the primary reason that they are more cost effective.  Furthermore, these baking sheets do not fit all our bake ware well, and the rolls are typically large enough for just about any bake ware, even requiring some trimming in many situations.  Certainly these baking sheets will be one of the options that we keep available just because they can be extremely useful in some situations.Enjoy!

Mr. Potato Head has been a staple of many toy boxes for decades.  Mr. Potato Head Darth Tater provides a contemporary update to this toy box fixture, just in time for Star Wars #7.As with all Mr. Potato Heads, Darth Tater is easy to assemble and disassemble.  While I have enjoyed making different variations of Mr. Potato Head, putting body parts in weird places, etc., I like Darth Tater for being Darth Tater, and not a crazy mixed up Potato Head.  Okay, putting the funny glasses on Darth is kind of amusing.  The mustache is funny too (hey, Darth, nice 'stache dude!).  It is also easy to think of "Space Balls" and Rick Moranis's portrayal of Dark Helmet.I am surprised, and very pleased, to note that Darth Tater seems to have quality similar to the Mr. and Mrs. Potato Heads of Yore.  The parts go in snugly and stay in well.  The plastic seems to be fairly high quality as well, and the parts are nicely formed.As for containing all the Darth Tater parts, there are two options.  Nearly everything goes into the belly of Darth Tater, except the long parts.  Of course, it always seems like a part gets lost in the first month or two.  I am crossing my fingers on that one.  The other option is the phenomenal container in which Darth Tater is transported.  The container is similar quality to many kitchen containers, and ranks as a very good feature for holding pieces of tater.Darth Tater is a great reimagining of the Mr. Potato Head franchise.  What else could be next but the other Star Wars characters?  I would love to see Chewbacca, Luke, Leia, and Han as Mr. Potato Heads.  They could have a Mr. Potato Head Star Wars convention!Enjoy!

This watch is massive at 48 mm in diameter, and heavy.  It is a beast of a watch, water resistant to 330 feet.  This watch is also beautiful in a masculine way.  With the rose gold tone timing dial, gray gunmetal band, and its 18 mm thickness, this watch could be an timepiece option for a steam punk outfit.Other than providing an analog indicator of time with its Swiss quartz movement, and the rotating timer wheel, this watch also includes the date at the four o'clock position, which actually makes the date approximately level when you look at your watch.If you are looking for a sleek, dressy watch to go on a date, this watch is not what you want.  If you want a massive watch that is water resistant and makes a statement that you like your jewelry to be heavy and functional, this watch could be just what you want.  You can certainly feel the weight of this time piece whether you are just resting your arm on your desk, and directing a team at the office, in a lab, or at a work site.Enjoy!

I have some mixed feelings about this shot tracking set.  On the one hand, it is an interesting way to keep track of where each shot went, each time you make a shot.  If you are an experienced golfer, this tracking set might help you figure out where you need a shot adjustment.  On the other hand, if you are an inexperienced golfer and are shooting balls all over the place, this set may just tell you how bad you are golfing without giving you any suggestions as to what to do better.To begin, you download the Game Golf application from the Play Store.  Note that the application is available for Android phones only, so all others will have to find a different tracker.  The set includes little near field communication tags that screw into the handle of golf clubs.  Before you begin playing, you choose the course you are golfing.  Each time you prepare to take a shot, you press a button on the tag to tell the system where you are positioned, and then you take your shot.  The application records the data and starts keeping statistics.  The application can automatically keep score, and can tell you where each shot went as compared to the configuration of a particular hole.  If you play the same course multiple times, you can get a feel for where you might need to make adjustments to your swing, or to your power.  Note that the tags do not tell you anything about your actual swing.What kind of information can you get from the application?  Essentially anything that can be gathered from a GPS.  Just remember to push the button each time.  Trends can be seen, along with various statistics.  This information can be plotted on a lovely display that shows how shot location compares to the configuration of the course.  If nothing else, the displays are pretty.Keep in mind that this set will not help you with your swing.  For help on your swing, you need different kind of help, like a golf professional.  This set only tracks where your ball begins and ends with respect to any particular golf course.The real question is whether a player has the diligence to use the shot tracker on each shot.  If you forget to push the button for a shot, then statistics can be thrown off.  On the flip side, the displays are a lot like a video game, so if you like the melding of the real world to displays that might remind you of a video game, then you might become so enamored of this system that it drives you to golf continuously.  On the other hand, if you just like data or information and you like to see it organized neatly, and you like playing golf, you could find yourself wanting to play more and more golf just to watch the statistics gather.  Sounds like fun to me!Enjoy!

This disposable nitrile glove is an industrial version of Ammex's disposable exam glove of a similar color with the same specifications otherwise.  As with other disposable nitrile gloves, these gloves can split easily.  These gloves generally should not be used with sharp objects or objects that generate splinters, because the gloves are easily cut and split.  In addition, nitrile gloves cannot be used for protection from certain types of chemicals.  However, nearly all gloves have an Achilles heel when it comes to chemical resistance.  However, if you need light protection for your hands in a variety of applications, disposable nitrile gloves are affordable protection.Our traditional go-to glove has been the Ammex disposable exam glove.  These gloves are essentially the same as the disposable exam gloves, though without the medical-related features of the exam gloves.  As with the exam gloves, these gloves are useful in non-puncture environments.  Also similar to exam gloves, the chemical resistance of these gloves is fine for exposure to many typical household chemicals, excluding toluene, which is used in some fingernail polish removers, and some acids.  As with any glove, before using these gloves in any location where they will be exposed to chemicals, the user should determine ability of the glove to withstand exposure to the chemical.One feature of Ammex gloves that I really like is that each glove includes a textured area around each finger tip that should provide additional grip of slick objects.  Nitrile gloves tend to be slick when wet, so caution should always be taken when picking up fragile or heavy items when using these gloves, particularly when the gloves are wet.We began using disposable nitrile gloves when working around dirt and mud.  One of the biggest drawbacks to these kinds of gloves is that once they get wet and are removed, it can be difficult to get the gloves back on again.  Often we wait until the gloves dry out to try to put them on again, or we just, as the box says, dispose of them.  Of course, once the gloves dry out, they typically go on again about as easily as they originally did.While the exam gloves are rated for medical purposes, these gloves are not.  However, these disposable gloves can be used as hobby gloves, for working in the yard, or as protection while using chemicals to clean house, though some common chemicals can eat through these gloves, so check before you use.  The nice thing about these gloves is that they are so inexpensive that there is minimal guilt in throwing them away once they have served their purpose.Enjoy!

Those friendly folks at Kiddopotamus bring you Laffy Giraffy, which seems to deliver what the marketing blurbs promise, meaning a bit of chuckling and amusement.While Laffy Giraffy seems like a relatively simple toy, it includes a marvelous spinner that makes balls spin around, bounce, and pop, making more than a little noise.  The balls can be viewed through a front and back window on Giraffy, which should create a bit of amusement for baby.  Giraffy also has arms that extend and retract, and bend as well.  Giraffy's bottom right foot can be pressed to make Giraffy squeak.  Giraffy's bottom left foot makes crinkling noises when pressed and scratched.  In addition to all the various activities, Giraffy is colorful and cartoonish, sure to attract the attention of most babies and toddlers ages six months and up.Enjoy!

We tend to have a lot of birds around our house.  Fortunately, many of them are songbirds, versus invasive nuisance species.  This bird feeder is specifically configured to hold black oil sunflower seeds, which are somewhat small and which easily slide through the wire mesh of the bird feeder to feed various enterprising birds.  The color of the feeder is a beautiful red that makes the feeder easy to see when hung in a tree.  I have no idea whether birds are attracted to the red, but it does make the feeder pretty.This feeder is entirely metal, which is powder paint coated.  The powder paint coating should provide corrosion resistance, but ultimately I expect the feeder will rust and require replacing.  Hopefully the feeder will last for years before rusting starts.Filling this feeder is relatively easy.  The top cover angles up to detach from one of the wire handles, which permits rotating the cover out of the way to access the fill port on the feeder.  Fill the feeder with sunflower seeds, and then rotate the cover to close the port.  I strongly suggest filling the feeder outdoors, because it is nearly impossible to prevent some sunflower seeds from falling on the ground.The handle is also the place to attach a hook to hang the feeder.  This feeder can be hung almost anywhere through the handle, but try to avoid being close to a tree trunk or an enterprising squirrel can jump from a tree trunk to the feeder.  Of course, a squirrel can also reach the feeder from above in some situations.This product also includes a metal wind spinner.  We have several of these that we have hung on our deck for years.  Unfortunately, all our older spinners are rusting and do not spin as easily as they once did.  However, until the rusting starts, the spinner is an attractive decoration that can be hung just about any place.This bird feeder seems to be a high-quality metal product that should provide years of use.  The color is a bright attractive red, and the feeder holds enough seed to keep birds fed for days.  The attractive spinner is a decorative plus that makes this product even more desirable for bird lovers.Enjoy!

This hummingbird feeder is an attractive addition to any backyard.  Fill the with mix specifically made for hummingbirds, and watch them flitter to and from each of the four metal feeder ports.We have had other hummingbird feeders, but all of them were plastic.  This feeder is mostly glass and metal, with a plastic base.  My only concern is whether the metals are all corrosion resistant.  The brushed nickel portion should be water resistant, at least for a while.  I guess only time will tell.In addition to being beautiful, this feeder is easy to fill and clean.  The base unscrews from the glass reservoir to permit easy filling of the reservoir.  The base also separates into two piece to permit easy cleaning of the base parts.  The ability to clean the feeder is important because the food mixture has to be replaced every few days because it goes bad relatively quickly.The color of the glass is allegedly cranberry.  The color may be cranberry, but I would call it pink.  Whatever it is called, the glass is very pretty.  Indeed, the entire hummingbird feeder is pretty.  Fill the feeder with a mixture of sugar and water, after it has been boiled and cooled, or a suitable hummingbird nectar, then hang the feeder in your backyard and wait for the hummingbirds to find it.Hummingbirds are present in much of the United States during the summer, though they are resident year-round in a few places.  Hummingbirds are one of nature's most amazing creatures, flying like a helicopter.  It takes a lot of energy to do that.  Buy a hummingbird feeder and help these little guys out!Enjoy!

These disposable gloves are supposedly intended for industrial applications, but there are some drawbacks to the gloves.  For example, latex allergies are common, and wearing these gloves could cause a reaction.  As another example, these gloves are not suitable for prolonged exposure to harsh chemicals.  Thus, when the manufacturer says "industrial applications," it appears that the applications are non-chemical applications for people who do not have latex allergies.On the other hand, these gloves are more elastic than gloves made of nitrile, vinyl, or chloroprene, and I thought they went on my hands more easily than gloves of nitrile or vinyl.  While these gloves allegedly have better puncture resistance than vinyl, they still break relatively easily.  My significant other broke through several pairs of gloves with fingernails, though her fingernails are relatively sharp.  I guess that means that a woman with sharp nails needs to use extra care in pulling these gloves on their hands or puncture is likely to result.While these disposable gloves are suggested for food service use, I wonder whether that use should be applications where the gloves do not contact food directly.  It would seem that contact of latex gloves with food might cause allergies in people eating the food.  At least, it seems reasonable to me that such transfer might occur.  Better safe than sorry and avoid contacting food with latex.As with many other disposable gloves offered by Ammex, these gloves have textured areas around each finger tip to help grip items, which is particularly helpful when handling wet items.Frankly, latex gloves, which contain natural rubber, are not my favorite gloves because of the risk of allergies, which is a relatively common allergy.  However, they are slightly more resistant to puncture than some other materials, and they are more elastic than common nitrile or vinyl disposable gloves, which makes it easy to put these disposable gloves on hands.  Of course, these gloves should not be exposed to harsh chemicals.  So, depending on whether you are allergic to latex, and whether anyone you know if allergic, and depending on what you plan on doing with these gloves, the may be an option you want to consider.Enjoy!

Our favorite type of disposable gloves are nitrile, so we were anxious to try these gloves to see how they compared to nitrile.  These gloves are very light weight and are not suitable for use in any relatively tough environment, including exposure to chemicals.  Further, the gloves do not stretch as much as nitrile or latex, which means that a person who might be able to fit into a nitrile small might not be able to fit into a vinyl small.These gloves are non-sterile, but are anti-microbial.  These gloves are generally suitable for food service and certain other applications.  While the gloves are recommended for plumbing and janitorial, such recommendation may not consider exposure to certain chemicals used by janitors and plumbers.  Neither does such recommendation consider that plumbers can solder and braze, and these gloves should not be exposed to high temperatures or they are likely to melt.  Indeed, the box suggests the gloves should not exceed 104 degrees Fahrenheit (40 degrees Celsius), which a human can achieve with a fever.Likely the best place to use these powder-free gloves is in the kitchen while preparing food when working with food without bones, because bones would likely compromise a glove.  Another potential issue with these gloves is that when wet, they can be very slick, making handling of dishware potentially problematic.The relatively low cost of the gloves encourages frequent glove changes, which is great when switching from raw meats to working with vegetables where prevention of cross-contamination is potentially important.  Just remember to toss the used glove into the trash.All disposable gloves have their limitations, and vinyl gloves may have more limitations than other gloves, such as nitrile and latex.  However, they are relatively low cost and anti-microbial, so they could be a good option for light-duty applications not involving heat, chemicals, and sharp instruments.Enjoy!

Most guys, and more than a few females, love a set of virtually any kind of high-quality tools.  This set of SAE (also called English or inch by some people) standard tools is beautifully finished and is probably the minimum wrenches you would want for household or vehicle use.The finish on each heat-treated wrench is beautiful.  Indeed, it is tempting to avoid getting the wrenches dirty or scratched precisely because they are beautifully finished in gorgeous, shiny chrome.  As noted elsewhere, this set includes 10 wrenches in inch sizes of 1/4, 5/16, 11/32, 3/8, 7/16, 1/2, 9/16, 5/8, 11/16, and 3/4.  Several of these sizes have gotten a lot of use over the years, and I look forward to years of service from this set.In addition to the wrenches, this set includes a labeled holder for securing each wrench.  The holder is not nearly as pretty as the wrenches, but it is functional and fits well in my large tool box.As noted on the package, these wrenches are guaranteed forever, which has historically been the claim to fame for several other brands, such as Craftsman.  Admittedly, I have not had these wrenches for very long, but based on the "forever" guarantee, the fit, the finish, and the chrome vanadium material of the wrenches, it seems like these wrenches are ones that will be passed along to another family member.Enjoy!

My review is based on only a few hours of use, and I have to review what I see.  What I see is a camera that is a little slow, but easy to configure with unexpected features.I have noticed that if the camera is connected to my phone continuously, it does have a tendency to disconnect from my N-router or my cell phone periodically.  I have had to restart the software to get the camera going again.  I will note that I am sitting about six feet from the router in clear view of the router, so the issue is not signal strength.  On the other hand, I have had the camera sitting next to me connected to the camera continuously for nearly two hours without an issue, so I am not sure why the camera sometimes loses connection, or why my phone loses connection to the camera.Connecting to the camera is really simple.  Download the application from the internet, connect to the camera, set the user name and password, connect back to the household network, update the firmware, fire up the application, connect to the camera, and go.Several different display options are available.  I keep to the lower resolution because display updates seem really slow.  In addition to the standard display, this camera has an infrared light that enables night vision, which works really well.  I was not expecting night vision in a camera at this price point.In addition to the video, this camera can play music over the built-in speaker.  I think the music may be stored in my phone, but I am not sure.  The ability to play music over the camera was another unexpected feature.As for sound, it is available in one direction at a time only.  Communication can be set to the camera speaker, or sound can be received from the camera microphone, but duplex communication is apparently not available.This camera does have limitations that make it somewhat single purpose.  I doubt the range of this camera and the limited capability of the night vision would make the camera suitable for a security camera.  I suppose you could use the camera to monitor a room, or use it as a nanny-cam.  The camera does permit recording of still images, but I cannot record video on my phone.  I am not sure whether video can be recorded on a computer, since I have not tried this camera with a computer.As a baby monitor, this camera seems to work fine as long as you have good Wi-Fi connectivity.  While I lost connection with the camera a couple of times, getting connection back seemed relatively easy.  I like the night vision, and the ability to listen in on the baby.  Perhaps when the baby is older, being able to talk to the baby might be beneficial.  For now, listening to the baby is the most desirable option.  The ability to play music over the camera speaker is really not necessary, given all the other music making devices baby has (including one that connects to the crib), but that feature could be useful if baby's other music making devices are on the fritz, or out of batteries!I was tempted to give this camera a five-star rating, but the periodic connection issues pushed it down by one star.  I should note that I have run the camera for several hours without an issue, and plan to run it much longer, to see whether the connection issues reappear.  I will update my review after my additional testing.Enjoy!

Easy setup; timed, low-energy LED's; and fresh herbs and vegetables; what more could you ask of an indoor garden?This indoor garden is based on hydroponics, gardening without soil.  Setup is remarkably simple.  Remove everything from the box, attach the bank of LED's to a vertical post, which is adjustable in height, pour in water, add the plant pods, and then add the fertilizer.  Plug it in, choose the length of time the lights should be operated, and wait.  Periodically you do have to add more fertilizer, and you do have to adjust the post height as the plants grow, but growing is nearly as simple as that.Of course, it is rarely as simple as the instructions claim, but other than choosing plants that like to be grown hydroponically, it really is simple in this case.  By growing plants this way, there are no weeds, and rarely are there any bugs.  If you do find annoying insects, just remove them.  Can you grow seeds other than those provided by Miracle-Gro?  Yes, by providing the seed with a porous base, many seeds can be grown this way.Fresh veggies in the winter time sounds awesome, and though the veggies are small compared to their outdoor cousins, you choose harvest time.  Think about home-grown salad in the dead of winter, and then give one of these indoor gardens a spin.Enjoy!

This watch is simply gorgeous.  It looks like a fashion watch except for the top metallic blue dial that allows timing of events, an indication of a diver's watch.  This watch is simply perfect for the office, for an event, or even for diving!In addition to the sheer beauty of the body, bezel, and band, this analog watch also includes the date, with a magnifier.  The watch is also water resistant to 660 feet.  Thus, you can go right from a dive to a dance.  All you need is a dress to cover your wet suit!This watch comes in one of the prettiest gift boxes I have ever seen for a watch.Frankly, there is little more that I can say about this watch.  It is pretty enough to be a fashion accessory, but it is also water resistant with a timing ring for diving, or for any other purpose that requires timing.Enjoy!

On the one hand, I really wanted to not like this toy because, as others have noted, the focus here seems to be on outfits, wigs, and accessories rather than being a marine biologist.  I suppose we should not disillusion children with the actual rigors of a profession such as marine biology, but perhaps this toy sugar coats it too much.  The problem is that if I overlook Sandy's alleged aspiration to become a marine biologist with incredible fashion sense, I like the toy as a child's toy.Essentially, this toy is a doll house that also looks like a boat, specifically, an "ocean cruiser."  Sandy activates various magic points throughout the cruiser, and Sandy is compatible with all other Flipsies toys, and vice versa.  Excluding the marine biologist distortion, this set includes quite a few doll house accessories, such as binoculars, dolphin, table, chairs, etc.Perhaps where the rubber meets the road is how much children like this toy.  They love it, and they like playing with it.  At the same time, you can explain that while being a marine biologist is fun, in real life marine biologists do not work on a ship that looks like a cruise ship, and marine biologists are not typically fashion models.  The response:  Duh, grandpa, I'm not STUPID.  Well, there you go.  Even little granddaughters know that marine biology and fashion modelling really don't go together.Enjoy!
