Star Wars is always super cool!This is designed for ages 2+ but I think children much older will really have tons of fun with the Frylo Ren Mr. Potato Head with accessories included.1 Potato Body1 Base4 Costume Pieces7 Accessories

My 8 year old is a huge fan of Hulk. Hulk has anyways been his favorite Marvel character. He was super thrilled with the Super Hero Hulk Masher set.The new Mash Ups is a new thing going around in toys. The arms, legs, heads, bodies, and accessories can be mix and matched with other (each sold separately) figures. At first, I really thought the concept was gimmicky and was just to get parents to buy several figures in the set. Which of course, is true. But what I wasn't expecting is that my son loves that. I mean really loves that. I'm not sure why but being able to do that is super cool to him.The Hulk set is a great set with all the included accessories. You get weapons, food (why?, I don't know but it's cool) and helmets.This one is a winner for my super Hulk fan!

My sons are huge Transformer fans. They love the Rescue Bots too. This is a pretty nice set for fans but there are some strange aspects to the toy, especially in this price range. While this isn't overly pricey, it is still odd to me that you get cardboard cut outs for the characters. The rescue rig and Rescue Bot High Tide are plastic but the Cody and Servo pieces are cardboard cutouts. For a brand like Playskool, a toy over $20, the Rescue Bots, the age range, for all that, cardboard cutouts just sound bizarre. Why?The Rescue Rig has to be assembled of course. The Rescue Rig and High Tide are made out of plastic. Even the plastic used seems cheap and thin. Playskool was really cutting corners on the cost of this toy. I would have preferred a slightly higher price point and to get a toy that would actually hold up to the recommended ages of 3  7.

These are designed to prevent slippage in the shower. One end is notched out so you can slide it right up to the drain. The other end is straight across.The material is 100% vinyl and comes smelling like a skunk for some reason. As it airs out, the scent dissipates.There are raised circular bumps all over the mat. On the bottom of each circle is a suction cup to keep the whole thing stuck to the floor and to raise the rest of the mat up off the floor to allow for drainage. There are also small holes all over the mat which allows drainage and air flow.It is an average mat.

I  ordered the infinity scarf in the camel color. I tend to have too much black and gray clothing so I branched out and ordered the brown. All the colors are really cute and it was hard to choose, the blue is really pretty too.The infinity scarf is one solid piece of material. The one piece design means you don't have to worry about tying the scarf in some hard to tie fashion but you just put it around your neck and twist once to put the scarf around your neck one more time. Magically (not really) you have a perfect scarf in style and function. I have actually worn it wrapped around my neck just once too. Wearing it that way, it's longer and more like a traditional long scarf.The material is like a sweater, very soft, warm, and comfy.I really love the scarf.I received a free sample for review and evaluation purposes.

The set is a set of 6 with 2 scrub cloths, 2 scour cloths, and 2 polish cloths. I didn't realize when I ordered the set that there are 3 different types of cloths included. Each type of cloth has a different texture to perform a different job.Scrub cloths:These are like a typical microfiber towel but they have stripes that run through the towels. The stripes have a rougher texture to them. They aren't overly rough or scrubby but there is a different texture to them. The textured stripes are to help grab dirt and dust.Scour cloths:These are textured all over and feel very scrubby. They are great for washing dishes and for scrubbing on really dirty appliances.Polish cloths:These are super soft and perfect for polishing and drying items like silver or delicate glasses where you don't want the items to get scratched.Wash all on cold and low heat in dryer to prevent shrinkage.

My husband attends business meetings which call for a dressy casual which means dress shirts but no ties or coats needed. I normally buy him shirts in the Croft and Barrow brand. He wears the classic fit and not a slim fit. I ordered this shirt in the exact size that I normally buy him. They were similar in fit but the Oxford NY brand is slimmer fitting although it is not a slim fit. I would say that the Oxford NY is more what they call modern fit.The shirt does not have pockets which may or may not matter to you, or it may be a plus or minus. My husband personally prefers shirts with pockets.The shirt material is a little thinner than the material used by Croft and Barrow brand. Both are 60% cotton and 40% polyester and both are made in Bangladesh, interestingly.Both brands are similarly priced.

My two favorite ways to keep foods from sticking to pans is to use non-stick tin foil or parchment paper. The thing about non-stick foil is that it can make cookies spread too much. I really prefer the parchment for cookies.Reynolds has made it super easy to use parchment paper. Reynold's Cookie Baking Sheets parchment paper are already pre-cut and ready to insert into baking pans.The parchment prevents sticking and no need to grease the pan.Just a shipping note: I received mine in a padded mailer instead of a box and the parchment box was pretty mashed.

It is really hard to find medicines for children that don't contain sugar AND do not contain artificial sweeteners. My son is hypoglycemic and he can't take anything with sugar or even honey and I also don't want to give him any artificial sweeteners. Hyland's has been the only company that I've found that doesn't put any of these ingredients in their medicines.

As I'm aging, I am finding that my eyesight is not what it used to be. Lately, my glasses aren't quite cutting it sometimes. Even with my glasses, some products have writing so tiny that I still can't see the writing. This magnifying glass has really came in handy.The magnifying glass has a very nice quality glass. The magnification is very good and clear. I have been able to read anything that I've tried, no matter how small the writing.I received a free sample for evaluation and review purposes.

This is a large and bold statement necklace. It looks great over a solid black dress or sweater. This necklace really makes a statement, this totally makes you understand where the term statement necklace comes from.There is some weight to this necklace, because of that, I prefer to wear it cooler weather.It really is gorgeous!I received a free sample product for review and evaluation purposes.

This is a large yoga towel. It long and narrow, the right size for doing yoga. Its also good for all sports and water activities because of the water/sweat absorbing material.Its also super soft. It has a brushed fabric which makes it soft against skin. I would love to have a whole blanket made of the fabric.It has an attached elastic loop so you can roll the towel back up and secure it in place with the loop.I received a free sample product for review and evaluation purposes.

This is just the right size to slide right under a bed or in the top of a closet. Its a simple storage container that can hold articles like sweaters, pillows or blankets. I think large bulky items like that work best so that the sheer weight wont put the storage bag under stress.The bag is a lightweight material with a clear, plastic top that has a zippered compartment to it. Lay it down, fill it up and zip it back up. It will keep till you need it again. Mine is perfect to store extra pillows in and keep the dust out.Mine arrived in great condition without any defects. I do feel the price is a little high.I received a free sample product for review and evaluation purposes.

My husband is a contractor and many times will use a forced air heater on the jobs. Sometimes its nice to just have a more constant even heat. This outdoor small propane heater is great for that. You hook it up to a propane tank and you have a nice even, instant heat.The heater is much smaller than I imagined at just 13 high. Its 11  wide at the widest part which is the base. The hose and regulator are included. The hose is extra long at 10 ft long.Its rated at 25,000 btu, to heat up to 625 sq ft in a 360 degree pattern.You can operate it on a 20, 40 or 100lb cylinder propane tanks. It will provide 17 hours of heat on a 20-lb tank. You control the heat with a dial knob which adjusts from low to high.It is marketed as reliable, instant heat for construction sites, industrial/commercial workspaces, agricultural buildings, remodeling jobs, emergencies, workshops but it could also make a great patio heater.

I like little containers like these. I actually have a set that is almost identical to these except that the lids are a different color. I got those on clearance at a drugstore for $1 so I think these are a overpriced.I store my food in glass containers so I dont use these for that purpose but they make great organizing containers for small items. They will turn your junk drawer into a neat, organized space.I received a free sample for review and evaluation.

Ive always wanted one of these and its such a pretty one too.Banana holders are pretty and functional. The holder displays the bananas which I think looks nice but while it is holding the bananas up in the air, the stand is keeping the bananas from bruising. Normally when you lay bananas on the counter,  the weight of the banana sitting against the counter will bruise it.This is a large stand and its pretty in the black finish. The black finish is much nicer looking than a cheaper looking chrome.I received a free sample for review and evaluation.

Ive never seen a basting brush with similar design to this one and I really like it. One of the things that I dont care for in most basting brushes is the material used. Some are like an actual brush and some are like little mini mops, with both materials, you may end up with some of the bristles and/or fuzz in your food. For that reason, I like a silicone brush like this one has.This one goes even further and provides a glass jar for the marinade. Its glass, not cheap plastic. The glass is great for marinades because you dont have to worry about it reacting with the ingredients in the marinade and you can even stick it in the microwave to heat the marinade.It also comes apart completely for easy cleaning.Dishwasher SafeMicrowaveable SafeBPA FreeI received a free sample for review and evaluation.

My husband has been using a Paslode cordless framing hammer for years. He wont hardly use a corded any longer. The convenience of not having cords and not having to use an air compressor is worth the price of a Paslode. His old one quit working after he has had trouble with it off and on for the last 2 years. He finally took the plunge and got this new Paslode. This one has Li-ion battery instead of the old batteries. The fuel cells are also different now, having an adapter.We ordered from Amazon because it was cheaper than the big box local stores. I checked the models numbers listed to make sure that this was the latest version. This is the CF325Li.Couldnt be happier with the purchase. We ordered from the seller,  FastenerSource and received the package in 3 days just as described.

I had read the reviews previous to using these so I knew that they come stiff. These are almost sponge-like but larger and flat like a wash rag. They swell up slightly when wet and dry back out when not in use.I found these to be practical and useful for wiping up countertops and tabletops more than for washing dishes. They wash dishes fine but there is something that just doesnt make it my favorite for washing dishes.I also thought the print might look cuter but werent as cute in person as they were online.

I need to bandage my wrist from time to time since I have carpal tunnel. I like the clip idea. It makes it easy to clip the end of the bandage but it is really just as easy for me to tuck the ends of the bandage as the clip. Either way, clip or no clip, the Ace bandage works well.

I never any problems with my skin when I was younger. I only occasionally had a pimple when I was in adolescence. Now that Im older Im having more trouble with my skin including melasma and occasional redness and unevenness.This is designed to soothe and relieve skin redness and irritation. You have to store it in the refrigerator. The refrigeration helps with the soothing sensation of the product as well. Im familiar with refrigerating products which makes it cool and soothing because I keep my aloe vera burn gel and several other skin products in the refrigerator already.

The CAILLER L'Ecorce Dark Chocolate Cocoa Bar is a dark chocolate bar. It's definitely not the best dark chocolate that I've tried. It isn't as creamy or rich tasting as Ghirardelli. I buy a generic brand at our local grocery store, Aldi, that is great. I know that it is a dark chocolate and it's not supposed to be creamy like a milk chocolate bar but you want it creamy in texture as it melts in your mouth. I found the consistency to be gritty.It's 70% cocoa so it's not intensely dark chocolate like advertised. The bar also does not come in squares for those who like to break off by squares for portion control.

I personally thought the whole line of Create a WWE Superstar was gimmicky and set up to just make parents buy more wrestlers. The premise of the sets are that the arms, legs, heads, and all the accessories can be taken off and mixed and matched with other wrestlers which are of course, sold separately but my boys have absolutely loved them.They love action figures anyway and I think there is something cool about the wrestlers to them. They have actually loved taking off all the parts and switching them around. I constantly hear the pop, pop of a head or arms getting jerked off and switched.The set also comes with tattoos that can be applied to the wrestler. The tattoos work just like regular temporary tattoos and actually stick pretty well. Note: they are not meant to be applied to skin, just for the toy.

I love these hangers. Ive purchased items that came with the single hangers like these but they werent anywhere as nice or heavy duty as these are.These have a hanger just like a regular clothes hanger but the bottom is a single clasp. They are good to hang boots, hang scarves, etc. Thats what I use them for. My boys also use them too. They hang their backpacks and other type of items up in their closets with them.The inside of the clip is smooth so you can use them on boots and the clips dont press into the leather. They still are very strong and do not have any trouble holding heavy items.I have the satin nickel and the silver chrome finish, both are really nice.I received a free product for review.

This is a perfect handbag for dances, prom or other evening out. It has a metal handle. It also comes with a chain shoulder strap that is removeable. You can also leave the shoulder strap on and leave it inside the purse to have in case you want it. The closure is a ball that has a crystal in the middle of it.I received the apricot color and I thought that it would be a peach but it is just a goldish-beige to me. Its very pretty with satin and chiffon materials. The inside is also lined.I received a free sample for review.

Ive never had a silicone cutting board before. I had the old plastic ones in the past and they would end up getting cut up and I would be afraid that little pieces of the board may get into the food so I havent used one of those for years. For several years Ive used bamboo cutting boards. You arent supposed to put bamboo in the dishwasher. I like being able to put things in the dishwasher to keep my hand washing load light. The iNeibo says that it wont cut or scratch. Its also dishwasher safe.I was very pleased when the cutting board arrived. Its much bigger and heavier than I imagined it would be. It feels substantial and gives you plenty of cutting room. The silicone doesn't slip around on counters either.It has a neat feature in that it has measurements marks around the sides but they arent in inches.When it came, it did have a silicone chemical scent but went away completely after I ran it through the dishwasher.Since its silicone, its also microwavable or even safe in the oven to 425 degrees.I received a sample product free for review.

My boys love these athletic shirts. All the kids at school are wearing mostly athletic type clothing and of course, my boys want to dress like everyone else. This shirt isnt as soft as the boys And1 shirts but pretty comparable to other athletic shirts they have.This type shirt is what my kids wear to the water parks and the lake because they dry very quickly. Its 100% polyester which is why it dries so quickly.They are almost like a rash guard shirt but without the SPF protection of course.The fit was true to size.

I love these sheets. The description that says brushed microfiber sheets which made me think they would feel fuzzy like a microfiber blanket but they feel like a fine cotton sheet. They are 100% polyester but they dont feel like other polyester sheets that I own. They are soft and feel very nice.I got the sheets in the color, Blue Haze. The color is a very beautiful gray-toned blue.The fit was great. It fit our queen memory foam mattress and the sheets have stayed on well at night.I received a sample product free for review.

It doesnt matter if the pillow played music if it was uncomfortable and you didnt want to sleep on it. I love that the pillow is memory foam which makes it very comfortable. It is more of a square design as opposed to the a big round pillow. My husband doesnt like sleeping up in the air, he likes to lay down flater. This pillow has a more flat design.The pillow comes with a plug to charge it. It plays music that is mixed with ocean sounds. There is a volume button so you can adjust the volume.I received a sample product free for review.

This is my first memory foam pillow and Im in love. Weve had a memory foam mattress for about a year but we still had regular old fashioned pillows. The old pillows start out nice and fluffy but it doesnt take long and they get mashed down and lose their shape. The memory foam pillows keep their shape without going flat.The memory foam is covered with soft bamboo-rayon cover. Its zippable and can be removed to be cleaned.I do not detect any kind of odor or chemical smell to the pillow at all. Memory foam products can have a chemical scent at first but there was no scent with this pillow.I feels wonderful when you lie on it. Its firm but yet it molds to you and feels soft. It just feels wonderful and comfy. Im converted over to memory foam pillows.I received a sample product free for review.

We just pulled out our dining room rug to give it a good clean. Dining rooms are not the best place to have a rug but the rug protects our hardwood floors from the chairs scratching it. I cleaned the rug but it still had odor. I really didnt know how I was going to get the odor out. It wasnt awful but it didnt smell fresh. I even tried Febreze, that didnt really help.I received the Pogis Natural Bio-Enzymatic Stain and Odor Remover in the mail. I decided to try the Pogis on rug. I sprayed it all over the rug and let the rug dry out in the sun on some saw horses. The rug now doesnt smell at all. It actually smells fresh.Carpet and Fabric: The directions say for surface stains, to spray liberally, allow 10 minutes for it absorb then wipe with a dry cloth. For odor problems, remove cap and pour directly on problem area. Allow to soak at least 1 hour, then fully absorb with a dry cloth. Repeat as needed.Hard surfaces: Pour 4 fl. oz. into a pail with 1 gallon of water. Wipe or mop hard surfaces as needed. Not for use on food or wood surfaces.Made in the USASafe for use around children and petsIngredients: Water, plant based anionic surfactant, natural microbes, fragrance, preservativeI received a sample product free for review.

This is a very moisturizing formula. Its a sulfate free formula so its gentle and doesnt make my hair frizz. I have coarse, wavy and dry hair and the keratin helps moisturize my hair. I could really tell a difference after using.The scent is light and refreshing.The packaging is really nice and the pump bottles work great in the shower.I received a sample product free for review.

I recently just went to darker color on my hair color and wanted to make sure that it doesnt wash out so I was really wanting to use a shampoo that is sulfate and phosphate free. Sulfates and phosphates make shampoos foamy but they arent supposed to be good for hair. They make hair color wash out faster and tend to make hair frizzier. The Luseta shampoo and conditioner set is sulfate and phosphate free. After using it, what I really love even more than the ingredients is the scent. This shampoo and conditioner smells amazing.Its very moisturizing with the added the argan oil. With the absence of sulfates & phosphates plus the addition of the argan oil, the shampoo and conditioner are very moisturizing and not drying to my hair. My hair is very coarse and dry so I need products that help moisturize my hair and make my hair less frizzy.I received a sample product for review.

My hair gets really dry from time to time, especially in the winter. I like to put really moisturizing oil treatments on my hair for extra moisture. Ive made my own blends before but it can get really expensive to buy all the different types of oil so I can mix them together. Thats why I was really glad to try the Luseta Macadamia Hair Treatment Oil Treatment. It contains macadamia oil but also soybean, Vitamin E, argan oil, olive fruit oil, sweet almond oil, lavender oil, and sunflower oil.The oil treatment has doesnt have an oily feel at all; instead it feels very silky. It is scented, it has a nice light scent. It feels wonderful on the skin and the hair.I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My boys have wanted their own tablet for years now which seems funny to say since they are only 8 and 10. Ive had a Kindle Fire HDX and its usually with me. The boys also get to use an iPad at school occasionally so they are well aware of tablets and what you can do on them. I had hesitated though because I didnt want to let my kids loose on a device that gave them access to the world wide web. I mean seriously, World Wide. Moms just have visions of what all that can lead to. I also didnt want to hand my Kindle Fire over to realize that they had bought in-app purchases and what not without realizing that they were spending real money. I know there are restrictions that can be placed for that but you never know. Its hard to tell sometimes in a game if you are spending coins that you earned playing the game or spending coins that someone has to actually pay for.It is more expensive than a regular Kindle. Amazon now has one for $50. Amazons kids Kindle is selling for $99 while the Epic is running $129 at time of this review. The Kindle has 8GB memory while the Epic has 16 but you can install a microSD card in the Kindle for more memory. The cameras in both are 2 MP.The Epic comes with 20 apps already installed. Other LeapFrog apps and games can be purchased in addition. This is not like the LeapFrog LeapPad or Explorers, this does not take game cartridges but is a true android tablet.I definitely prefer both the LeapFrog Epic or the Kids Kindle Fire over other non-kid tablets just because of they are kid friendly, kid-safe, and durable. With the LeapFrog, you still lock yourself into the all the LeapFrog only apps, etc. but you do get a real tablet with internet access. With the Kids Kindle Fire, you also get a free year of the Amazon Freetime Unlimited which includes free access to 10,000 kid-friendly books, movies, TV shows, educational apps, and games. I still think its hard to beat a Kindle and the value of all that Amazon offers.What I like about the LeapFrog Epic is that my boys have grew up on the LeapFrog Explorers and LeapPads and they are familiar with them and the way it looks, operates and is set up. That made it an easy transition to this Epic tablet for them.

We have a 3rd generation 7 Kindle Fire HDX and one of the new 7 Kindle Fires that was just released. This case fits both of the Kindle Fires with their cases on with ample room left over. It is not a tight squeeze at all. It leaves plenty of room for plugs and accessories. It would still fit the 8" with no problems. This is specifically for Fires so I wanted to address the size for Kindles right off.I actually wanted this for my sons new LeapFrog Epic 7 tablet. The Epic also comes in a big, thick kid-sized case. It does still fit in this case but barely. I want to mention that in case someone is considering this case for the Epic. Leapfrog does sell their own cases and one of those would probably be a better fit. With the Epic, there is not room for the cord.Back to the case. The case is very dark navy neoprene with bright blue fabric on the inside. On the outside: one side contains a slot for a name badge. The name badge is a piece of paper behind clear plastic like the way  a luggage tag is made. The other side contains a zippered compartment. Inside that compartment is a small pocket.The inside is roomy and contains a pocket on one side.The handle is sewn on well and doesnt appear like it will give any problems.

This is so cute! Its so hard to tell when you see clothing online as to how it really looks. You cant tell for sure the color or fabric so it can feel like a shot in the dark. I was so surprised and super pleased when this arrived.The first thing that I really like about the sweater is that the colors are very pretty. The colors are pretty and the shades of each are great. Next thing I noticed is that it is very soft. It has a comfy super soft feel and fit.The neckline is a boat neck. It looks cute with a tank top underneath it, you can see the straps under the sweater. The sleeves are bat wing until it reaches the elbow then it is fitted. It is long and looks good with leggings. Mine was not as big as it looks in the pictures. (Im a small, size 4 and 52.) It comes down right below my bottom.According to the tag: 65% Acrylic, 35% WoolHandwashOne Size Fits AllI received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My boys have started wearing these type of athletic pants all the time to school. My boys who are 8 and 10 are actually the same size and both wear the same size. Neither of my boys are very tall but they are muscular built so jeans dont fit them all that well. The athletic pants with an elastic waist fits them pretty well. We have been buying the Starter brand that we buy at Wally World. That brand fits them really well. This brand seems to run a little smaller in the waist and a little long in length which is not what we need.I have the same size in both brands I was surprised to see how much smaller the STX brand was. Ive included a picture with the two pairs together. This brand, STX is the black one on top. They are a good 2 inches smaller than the Starter brand. This is good for those that have taller, thinner boys but unfortunately, mine are the opposite build.The construction is really nice. I like the gray stripe down the side which is stretchy. The whole pant is lightly lined.

My sons loved this set so much that they fought over who got it. My one son loves anything green and the other loves anything athletic so it was exactly what they both wanted.The set contains 1 pair of shorts, 1 tee, and 1 tank top. The tank top and shorts are a mesh fabric and the t-shirt has both a t-shirt type material and the sleeves are mesh. The set is 100% polyester although the t-shirt has that cotton tee look.The style, colors, and fit were all great. It was generously sized with no shrinkage. I like that it is a size 10 which can be hard to find. Many clothes companies do the combo size of 8/10 or 10/12. It does fit closer to a 10/12 than an 8/10.The only negative is that it came in a plastic bag and had a strong chemical smell. The scent has lessened but I can still detect it.Made in Egypt

This is such a lovely serving piece by Lenox. It has the delicate, classy of Lenox but for a fraction of the cost of their bone china because it is crafted from porcelain.This a 2-piece cold dip bowl set, it has a shallow bowl and a deep bowl. The shallow bowl is for the dip and has a 16-oz capacity. You place the shallow bowl with dip in it on top of the deep bowl that you fill with ice. The ice from the deep bowl keeps your dips cold which is great for cream cheese and sour cream type dips.The shallow bowl has a gold rim and the holly print inside the bowl. The deep ice bowl has the holly print all around on the outside.Both bowls say dishwasher safe but Im always a little leary about washing gold rimmed dishes in the dishwasher. I will wash mine by hand to be safe.Im really pleased with the quality. There doesnt appear to have any imperfections of any sort. The print, the gold trim, and the porcelain are all done superbly.The size is also really nice. I feel like Im getting two bowls for one because they could be used separately as well.

I opened this book first for the photos, which are nicely reproduced but too small.  What caught my eye was the text -- so interesting.  As I read, I felt like I was listening to the narration of a good documentary, which was explained when I saw that the author was a BBC documentarian.I really like the world-wide scope of this book, and the fact that it includes many non-traditional kinds of architecture.  I have quibbles with some of the selections: there are better examples of Mayan architecture, and interesting buildings have been left out (a second volume perhaps)?  Although it calls itself a "history", chapters are  conceptual, rather than chronological.The images, though not tiny, are too small to fully appreciate the buildings, so it is not going on my art book shelf.  Instead, it is going with my travel books, because the interesting commentaries have given me lots of ideas of places to travel.

This is more of a project book, and it is definitely not a comprehensive recipe book (a bit over 70 very useful recipes & preserves, all useful and tasty, as well as almost 40 home and personal care projects).  But there are a number of nice features.  It is organized into seasons, but includes a section of year-around projects as well as seasonal projects.  One thing nice is that it includes almost 40 useful recipes for home care (e.g. "DIY Oven Cleaner that Really Works) and personal care (e.g. lip balm).For each season, there are sections for recipes, preserving, home care, and personal care.  (The last three topics are great ideas for diy gifts).  But even before that, there are 100 pages of basics and techniques -- not only is this informative, it has a nice tang of pragmaticness.  Personally, I think the food recipes are fine but not novel to me, but I've got a lot of experience in this area, though they may be quite useful to less experienced cooks.Besides the organization, what I really like about this book is that there is a lot of depth to her thinking and analysis.  She has really thought out various aspects of her approach, for example, how not to be wasteful (e.g. interesting ways to use scraps of food, like making vinegar out of scraps of fruit trimmings), or the tradeoff between diy and "outsourcing" (e.g. it is worth buying soy sauce rather than making your own, saving your diy time for other things).  She has a great way of organizing information, such as a table of cleaning products in order of pH, or top tips for food preservations (e.g. "Brine fermenting is faster and simpler than vinegar pickling, especially for small batches of vegetables").Overall, this would be a great gift for a diy type, and I am really looking forward to making projects out of this book.

I really like my Basis, I've been using it for 2.5 years now, even though I wish for some software improvements.  However, it looks so clunky on my female wrist, that i ordered this white band hoping that it would look better.  However, the graphic white and black looks even worse.  YMMV, but I haven't ended up using it.

This fits perfectly inside the inner pot of 6 quart electric pressure cookers.  It makes it so easy to make, for example, stock, I just put my flavor ingredients (typically vegetable trimmings and chicken bones) in this mesh basket, cook for a while in the pressure cooker, and then lift out this basket to have just the pure stock left behind.The one thing is you have to break off the handles in order to fit inside a standard 6 quart electric pressure cooker.  They are surprisingly easy, too easy, to break off, which is probably a problem for those who wish to keep the handles.  But it is an ideal tool for people with 6 quart electric pressure cookers.

The content of this book is better than I had hoped.  For Knitters who are interested in stitch anatomy and alternate ways of doing increases and decreases, and the resulting appearance, this is a gold mine.  It is nicely organized into increases and decreases of different types, and then has a separate section of increases and decreases for special circumstances such as lace, textures, cables, ruching, bobbles, color, tams.Everything is illustrated with clear color photos.  And here is the problem:  the page size is so small that most techniques take several pages to illustrate, so that you can't see it all at once.  It would be so much better if this book had larger pages, so that each technique's photos and illustrations could be seen on a single page or two-page spread.But in spite of this, the content here is incredibly useful to knitters who have progressed beyond the beginner stage.

CONs - can't insert plugs completely, weak protection, not arranged for power adaptorsPROs - sliding outlet covers, screw holes in back, UL ListedThe biggest problem with this strip is that I cannot insert plugs all the way, and power flows when a plug is not completely inserted -- what is in the innards of this thing?.  When I was a kid I thought it was fun to get a buzz by letting my finger touch both live prongs of a partially inserted plug at the same time, but I don't think that this is such a good idea any more. I'm surprised it is "US Listed".  Though it worked fine once things were (partially) plugged into it.If you are still considering purchasing this strip, here are some more details:If you need good surge protection, you want to look for one with a higher joule rating.  Practically every other surge protector is rated at significantly more than 250 joules.  Think of this more as a power strip than as a real surge protector.  It is fine for mechanical appliances, but due to the outlet arrangement and the weak protection, it isn't for delicate electronics.Because of the short cord, it is useful only if you want a few additional outlets close to an existing outlet. In my kitchen this would work for attaching underneath a cabinet (using the screw holes in the back) by my little appliance village.However, if you need to plug in power adaptors, the way these are aligned will make it so you can't use the neighboring outlet, thus reducing capacity.  (I suspect it is cheaper to manufacture if the outlets are lined up this way.)And, If you simply need more outlets, you might also want to consider instead a wall-mounted "6-outlet tap" (searching for that phrase on Amazon will show you lots of alternatives).This power strip is missing many bells and whistles that some might prefer to have, like a blinking light to indicate prior power surges or surge alarm, right-angle plug, usb charger ports, and so forth.  It does have sliding covers for each outlet.  It is made in China.

This is a lot clunkier than I imagined, and I've ended up not using it.  First of all, the description says it is 12" long, but including the handle, mine is 13" long when folded. And the bundles of tubes are rather wide.  I was hoping for something that had the convenience of a collapsible folding umbrella which could them be opened up when I needed a stick.  I guess I've been spoiled by the convenience of my telescoping tripod.As a walking stick, it seems decent, though a little wobbly.  If you're flying somewhere and need to carry a walking stick folded in your carry-on, this is a good one.  But if you want a compact stick to carry around with you all the time and which you can then open up when you, say, walk on unstable rocks, or encounter unfriendly dogs, this stick, folded up, makes a larger bundle that is inconvenient to carry along routinely.

This has worked well for us.  I selected it because of good ratings at a "popular consumer magazine" along with the fact that it is smaller than other oil-filled radiators.  The one issue (hence 4 stars) is that if power goes out, the automatic timer needs adjusting.

Get these for the caramel, not for the chocolate.  I was really hoping for a chocolaty treat combined with caramel.  Instead it is super sweet caramel with a breath of chocolate.  If you want good chocolate, look elsewhere.The caramel itself is good, nice smooth texture and not too firm, nice flavor.  But I can barely taste the chocolate, on both types.  To me they taste too sweet, but then I prefer a lower ratio of sweetness in general, others may like them.  But I was really hoping for more chocolaty flavor.  However, for the right person, this would make a good gift.One thing good is that each piece is individually wrapped, so they will stay fresh (hopefully) even after the tin is opened.  And the tin is nice (as tins go), one which many people will want to keep because of the Hershey's logo.  The tin is about 7-1/4 inch in diameter and about 5-3/8 inches high.A few other details:- the first ingredient is corn syrup, and then after the chocolates, there is sweetened condensed milk followed by high fructose corn syrup (no wonder I can't taste the chocolate and they are too sweet),- each piece weighs about half an ounce (in the wrapper), and the total contents weighed 2.5 lbs,- the "Best By" date of my batch is 6/2016, and- they are made in Mexico.

Though the built-in thermometer probe is not something I use all the time, it is really handy and makes this appliance much more useful than other toaster ovens, because you can program it to cook just until the done temperature is reached, and then either turn off or switch to keep warm.  This is useful not only for meats, but also for baked goods (bread is done from 200-210), casseroles and reheating frozen food (165 degrees +). I found a comprehensive list of internal temperatures for all different kinds of foods, and at WhatsCookingAmerica that got me going, and then when I cook my own recipes, I notice at what temperature they are "done", and then the next time I make them I can program it to stop cooking at the precise moment, even if I am not around.The one problem is that the lowest temperature you can specify as a stopping point is 140 degrees, so if you want to cook a meat to rare or medium rare, you have to watch it yourself and manually stop it at a lower temperature.  However, "Warm" is just the right temperature to slowly raise a piece of meat to rare, so I've made some great steaks by first searing the meat, and then letting it slowly come up to my desired doneness on "Warm" while I then work on other parts of the meal.As a toaster oven, it isn't perfect, but the advantages of probe controlled cooking makes the flaws easy to ignore.  In particular, it is warmer on the left, so I simply utilize that feature by putting larger pieces to the left, or by rotating half way through cooking.  Also, there are two rack positions but it comes with only one rack.  I ordered a second rack on their site, and frequently use both racks during a meal.  They say it is 11" wide on the inside, but it is just a smidgen under, so my 11 inch pizza pans have to go in slightly tilted until I get to the middle of the toaster and can find a spot that will let them lie flat.  As a toaster, it is a little on the slow side, and often I will "preheat" it by turning on toast while I am preparing whatever it is that I am going to put inside.I had an older one of these, and after many years of use, the number display became hard to read -- I could figure it out but others could not.  But I liked the features of this model so much that I bought a new one, but have kept the old one as an extra to bring out and use when I have lots of cooking going on.Note, Hamilton Beach has a number of temperature controlled kitchen appliances.  They have a slow cooker with a temperature probe, and a water kettle that will heat the water to the precise temperature you want.  I'm definitely watching this line of appliances to see what else they will come up with that has innovative features.

needed a phone that would work with only "line power", so that it would work when the power is out.  I narrowed it down to two models, and picked this one because of the large display and buttons, which are easier to see when the power is out.  This phone is great, because the basic functions work when the power is out, but if you're interested in the bells and whistles, those work only when there is additional power.  And at the time I bought it, it cost very little.Note, although this phone has a large base, it is very light, as though there is really not much in the base, which is there only to provide a space to present the large buttons.Note, many of our neighbors have accepted fiber optics from the phone company, which means that they don't have line power to make their phones work when the power goes out (the fiber optic installation has a battery, but from what I've heard it doesn't last that long).  I simply cannot be out of touch that long (old sick family members) so we have refused the fiber optic "upgrade", and are very happy when the power goes out that this phone keeps working.

It tried for many minutes, a few times, during which I moved it around from time to time to see if there was a "good" spot.  My other trackers communicate with my iPhone just fine (Withings Pulse and Basis Tracker).  I was really looking foward to trying this out, especially with the useful magnetic fob.  Too bad.  [I am running iOS 7 due to work constraints.]I also put the app on my iPad (iOS 8), but when I tried logging in, I got an authentication error, so I was unable to test bluetooth pairing on it.Also, their lawyers were pathologically unleashed when it came to writing up the terms and conditions -- completely unreal.  I just finished a bunch of legal junk, and the language here was even worse.

I'm glad to have this, since I usually make a mess when cooking, and I prefer to avoid getting spots on my clothes.  It is useful to have the neck strap be adjustable, that way I can make this apron align where I want it to.  The twill fabric is a bit heavier than simple woven fabric would be, which is good since it will make it harder for grease stains to pass through.It shrunk significantly with the first laundering.  It lost 2 inches of length and 1 inch of width, so that after washing it is 30 inches in height (not counting neck strap) and 27 inches wide at the bottom. After laundering, the waist ties are each about 34" long (originally 36") and the apron at the waist is a bit over 26 inches wide. (I washed in room-temp water and dried on "medium".  In case there is a difference from one batch of fabric to the next, mine is black.)Note, the description of this product mentions two pockets. The one I got has only one pocket, around the belly-button area, which is a bit larger (after laundering) than 9 inches wide and 5 inches deep.  This is a large pocket, and could be useful, and if you want two pockets, a vertical line of stitching can divide this single large pocket into two smaller pockets.

This is a really nice slim-fitting case that doesn't have the bubble-gum look that so many plastic cases have, and is super-convenient because you can keep a few cards or bills with it, so you don't need to carry a separate wallet.  The inner storage slot is closed magnetically, so is rather secure.  The outer slot however doesn't work so well, things can slip out of it, but overall it is a very likable and functional case.

Because I have a septic system ( which has been working great for over 60 years), I am careful about what I put in it.  In a recent testing of dishwasher detergents by a nationally-known consumer publication ;), this was at the top of the ones which met my criteria for more natural detergents, so I tried it.It does not clean my dishes as well as the cascade I was using previously.  They need to be better scraped, and some items (like cottage cheese) need to be washed off by hand.  However, I am still using it because I prefer to be gentle on our septic system.  I finally found a local grocery which carries this line, but initially I couldn't find it locally so ordered it on Amazon.

This protein drink is almost ideal -- not too many carbs, easy to carry around and then mix when I need it.Except the flavor is sort of fake, and it is way too sweet.  The annoying sweetness grows and grows in the moments after swallowing it and I can't get it out of my mouth.  Why does everything have to taste sweet !?!Otherwise, much though and cleverness has gone into this product.  The mixing mesh in the middle of the pouch is a great idea, and the pouch is slightly hourglass shaped which makes it easy to grasp in the hand and shake.  I'm going to try saving the pouch and re-use it for my own protein powder instead.I'll keep an eye on other products in this line, maybe they will come out with something that is not so overly sweetened.

This roller is easier to use than a similar obscuring stamp which I have tried earlier.  It is not as easy to use on a bottle (one of the uses they suggest) but still it is usable.  I haven't experience the skipping that other reviewers have mentioned.They have improved their ink so that it dries in a few minutes even if used on glossy paper.  Previously I tried their Guard Your ID Stamp, Small and the ink never dried when it was stamped on glossy paper (but that was years ago, maybe that ink is improved now also).This is not the be-all and end-all of security -- if you have someone determined to mine your paperwork they can probably play with differences in ink texture to figure things out.  But if you just want to make it easy for prying eyes to glance at things, this works great.

I selected these to use at my mother's 90th birthday celebration.  There is nothing quite like them that I have encountered elsewhere, and it was a great way to personalize this celebration and provide something to go along with the favors as a memento.

These bright white labels have the texture of professional watercolor paper, but are thinner.  There is a lot of wasted material in the label layout, so you may prefer a different shape which fits better.  However, it would be hard for you to cut your own scalloped labels and have them look so well made, so this product is useful where a professional look is needed.

Because of the size of these labels, they are laid out with much paper wastage.  You may want to consider other pearlized labels which fit on the sheet with less wastage, such as their oval pearlized labels.

I picked this book because I saw it compared favorably to "I Capture the Castle" (the book, not the movie).  I see why the comparison was made, but to me the tone is different -- it doesn't have the same kinds of capers with comedic aspects, and the protagonist quest doesn't involve seeking boyfriends.  Instead, it involves unexpected pairings of people, with money-raising schemes, and one of the main issues driving the plot involves dealing with people who are suffering the effects of dementia and other mental/medical issues.It is nicely fleshed out and realized, but I would like to have had more depictions of the inner life of the boy protagonist. As I read it, I kept being reminded of the movie Paper Moon: this book seems sort of like that story, but set in WWII Britiain.

These are not quite as effective as cupping my hands behind my ears.  It increases tv volume by only one "notch" of tv loudness, I was hoping for more.I do have to get them on just right or they fall off. I still use from time to time so that others don't have to put up with a overly-loud tv, but I need to find a different solution for helping me hear the tv better.What is working much better for me is the customizable Petralex app, which runs on iOS and Android.  It is a real joy to use, and is unobtrusive, because walking around with a smartphone and earbuds doesn't look odd at all.

We repaired our dryer with this kit, after following diagnostic information on a couple of different webpages.  At the time we ordered, there were many versions of this part available, but we opted to pay more for this version because it was Whirlpool brand.  (The packaging did say Whirlpool, but I have no way of knowing wheher or not that was true.)The included diagrams were not as clear or as accurate as they could be, hence the four star rating.  But we did this repair quite a while ago, and the dryer is continuing to work fine.

It is really useful to be able to put two sims into one phone, then it can receive calls from two lines (e.g. business & family).  For me it is useful for travel, because I can put in a cheap local sim to get non-roaming local service, along with roaming on my US service so that my family can easily contact me when they want to.  (Currently I am using it with Tigo in Guatemala).  Being unlocked, I can put any GSM sims in it that I want. [At this time of writing, if you look on amazon for unlocked dual-sim phones, you will find that most, but not all, are much more expensive than this model.]Having local service is invaluable for running Waze when driving around the crazy traffic here, especially during the rush hours.  Additionally, I have put a few useful bare-bones apps useful for travel, such as translation, weather, etc.  but otherwise have attempted to use up as little as possible of the memory (actually I just bought a memory card so will be moving photos and suitable apps to that).  I have had no problems with crashing etc. because I am not expecting this travel accessory to be the do all and be all that my iPhone is and have not filled it full of apps.It is not as nice as my iPhone, both in terms of user interface and screen responsiveness and speed, but it suits my travel purposes.  Previously I had used earlier Android systems so I was used to all the manual tweaking etc. that is needed with Android, but if you have never used an android phone, you may find *any* android phone, including this one, frustrating.  It is rather crufty, but since it is cheap, I don't have to worry about losing it while traveling.Note, this has only a  3MP back camera, no front facing camera (some reviewers seem to have interpreted the word "dual" in the name of this phone as referring to cameras, thinking that there is a front-facing camera, but that is not the case).  There is no front-facing camera, the word "dual" refers to the fact that you can install two sims, and thus receive calls from two different phone lines, in a single phone.What was in the box when I purchased mine in Guatemala: phone, battery, charger, minimal quick start guide (english & spanish).  The phone accepts a mini-sim.Where I purchased mine, the only TiGo sims they had were the regular size ones, so I was appalled to watch the vendor trim the sim with scissors and then put it into a special punch that cut it to mini-sim size, but it seems to work fine.

I'm on my second trip using the passport case, and it is not as durable as it should be.  The seam where the edges join is starting to come apart,  Also, as the material looses its stiffness, it is getting harder and harder to insert the passport. It wasn't hard to insert my passport when the sleeve was new and the material was stiff.  But as it has gotten more floppy, it is harder to insert.  Since the material weakens, it would be easier if the sleeves were not sized to be so tight, now it is like trying to insert the passport into an envelope with a floppy cloth edge.

The photo makes it look like it is glass and wrought iron, but it looks more plastic in real life.  Also it is smaller than I expected.  However, I still like the styling and the fact that it looks different than the citronella candles I have.

We gave this to a scientist, who spent a bunch of time playing with this puzzle and figuring out the different constraints and permutations.  From what we hear, it has stood up well.  Personally, I love the way this puzzle messes with your expectations of the orderliness of something like a Rubik's cube.

This book provides an excellent reference manual of FileMaker Pro itself, but it is uncertain who the target audience is.  It is not for DB beginners, because it doesn't talk about what databases are, why you'd want to use them, getting started building DBs, etc.Experienced FileMaker users would benefit most from the depth of coverage in this "reference manual" level documentation of the FileMaker Pro system.  Yet things which experienced users need, such as concise summary lists of functions (one per line), are not here.  And the in-depth explanations of how to do things remain at a beginner level throughout the book, including "click on this" types of instructions for those who haven't ever done those steps before.  It would have been better to not spell out all those step-by-step instructions every single time, and instead spend some time/space on synthesizing and summarizing the features and resources of FileMaker Pro instead.Also for those used to other DB systems and who know well how to build databases, just not in FileMaker, would benefit with a "just the gist" kind of coverage, rather than the exhaustive detail which is in this 2-inch thick heavy book.With the depth of explanation, it may be good for advanced CS people who are studying and mastering FileMaker Pro.  However, even they would benefit from some of the overview and summary information that is missing from this entry into the Missing Manual series.  This book would make an excellent supplementary reference manual to some other higher level FileMaker Pro usage book.

I've been using a magnetic suction cup mount, but the magnetism isn't strong enough for smoother (less grabby) phone cases.  Therefore, I needed something better.  I like the clothespin-like grabber of this one.  And besides being a great mount for the car, it also works great on airplane windows for making time-lapse videos of your flight.

This cable worked with all the devices I used to test it.  Specifically, it works fine as a data sync cable for Apple devices using the Lightning connector, and it works fine as a charging cable using either the micro-USB or the Lightning connector.It is compact (7" from end to end, not including the Lightning adaptor), so it is easy to carry around -- I am going to replace two different cables with this one.  However, due to its short length, it is hard to actually use your device while charging it, so you may prefer a longer version of this cable.  Even just a few inches longer would make this cable be a bit more usable in action.Also, it could use some protective caps for the ends when not in use.  They put so much material and design work into the box that I'm just going to toss into recycle, that it would have been nice if they had put a tiny portion of that packaging effort into including protective caps.Finally, though there are no hints of problems with this cable, I've had Lightning cables go bad (both Apple and Belkin), so if you may want to make sure you keep another Lightning cable as backup.

PROs- handles & zippers on both ends, see-through top, breatheableCONs- no moisture barrier on bottom, flimsyA few well thought out touches make these good for under-bed storage of large items (or many small items).  These are long, so there are handles on each end, as well as zipper openings.  So it is easy to access items from either end of this long rectangular storage bag.  Also the top is covered by clear plastic, so you can see what is where inside the bag without opening it.  The sides and bottoms are breathable to keep items from getting "stale".They are cheaply made of attractive but lightweight materials, but under bed storage is really a light use application.  But don't expect the quality of construction you'd find with a heavy duffle bag suitable for checking as luggage.Two issues which might be important to you.  First, at times we have trouble with musty floors during rains, and it would be better if there were a waterproof bottom -- but I can do it by DIY by putting a large garbage bag on the bottom.Secondly, for some people with allergy problems, it might be good to have it constructed from fabric which is impervious to dust mites.  However, for most people this wouldn't be an issue (unless you have other insect problems).

PROs- can charge devices & battery simultaneously, two USB outputs, high capacityCONs- no built-in prongs, larger than alternatives, included cord hides needed micro-USB plugLike the FluxMob Bolt , this is one of the few power banks which can simultaneously power your devices as well as store charge in its internal battery.  Having dual functions at the same time can be very handy if you have a short period of time in which to charge your devices as well as battery backup (e.g. while changing planes).This one claims to store either 4200, 6000, or 9000 mAH of power (depending on which one you choose), unlike the Bolt which claims to store only 3000mAH.  And it is really nice that there are two USB output ports, so that you can power two devices at once.However, it is missing the built-in outlet prongs of the Bolt, so you have to carry around a wall-to-USB base.  Also it is about twice as large as the Bolt, so if you are budgeting space, that can be an issue.  Speaking of budgeting space, it seems like some of the deep textured design on the rubbery surface is taking up room, and it could be a bit more compact if it skipped that part, however, the rounded edges and corners make it feel good in the hand.The included cord is rather clever, at first appearing to be the wrong type.  It appears to be a standard-A to mini-B USB plug, which is not what the box needs to charge.  However, if you pull on the useless mini-B plug, a micro-B plug is revealed.  I didn't realize this at first and raided my cable drawer to be able to charge the thing (I needed to provide wall outlet prongs also).  This dual cord-type could be useful if those match the devices you carry around.  (If you want to see an image of these different plugs, look at the "Connector Types" section of the Wikipedia article about USB.)For the space and the modest price increase, I think it is worth getting the largest capacity possible.  And for the right person, it could make a useful gift.

This is a well-made cover with a waterproof plastic lining, and convenience features including a handle, buckle, an elastic cinch tightening thing, and an inner plastic lining which keeps the water out.  On each end, there is a ventilated section which is covered to keep rain out.  According to the label, it is woven polyester, with a pvc lining.However, there are some ingredient mysteries.  First, one of the content labels says that it contains urethane foam -- I can't figure out where that is, unless it is a very thin sheet of foam to give the cover bulk.  Also, it says not to clean it with soap or detergent, in order not to remove the special coating it got at the factory -- I'm wondering if that is something like generic Scotch-guard, which now days requires a health warning.  Or is it one of those old fire-retardants that they used to put on nightwear, also which has health issues. Too bad they don't say what this mystery coating is.Finally, the image looks like it covers a round grill, but actually it accomodates a side-table, and is oblong.

In the past, I have used dry granule fertilizer on a lawn, and it worked great, and was easy to apply.  I thought this was going to be a hand-spray bottle, but it requires being hooked up to a hose to apply, which is a bit more of a pain.  There are some specific instructions about how to hook up the hose and start and stop the stream of water that are _behind_ the back label, so be sure to check them out.

After reading an excerpt of this book which appeared in Discover Magazine, I wanted to read the rest, especially because this was about the experience of, and recovery from, concussion by a cognitive scientist.I found it enlightening to know the kinds of thing a concussive could suffer, however, I am more fascinated by harnessing brain plasticity to repair problems.  I wish the book had spent more time on approaches to dealing with brain repair, rather than his experiences as a person who suffered long-lasting damage from a concussion.However, I do find it very hopeful that such changes can happen long after the initial injury.  When my father had a stroke, the feeling was that he had a short period of time in which to regain skills, though he actually kept normalizing long afterwards.  It is good that a book like this shows that brain repair can occur long after injury.

This book is an incredibly detailed account of the rise of the MP3, interwoven with the story of the music industry versus music piracy, written by a journalist/math major with prior experience with the world of Wall Street.  While I was generally aware of the general flow of events, this book details specific meetings, detailed business dealings, law enforcement and court activities, and so forth. It gives a good window on the growth and changes of the internet over the same period of time, from the music industry point of view.  The pivotal results are at the very end of the book.The end of the book explains how he tracked down and pulled together all of the threads in this book, the interviews he conducted, and the published sources he relied upon.  Yet sometimes, events in the remote time and past have such vivid detail that I wonder how much is reconstructed after the fact; for example, when describing a meeting in 1995, he describes someone speaking in "sentences, punctuated with short, sharp intakes of breath".  Still, there is an incredible amount of meticulous research and detail in this book.  If there is any flaw, it would be this book is filled out with overly detailed results of dedicated research, and that some people may prefer to read a more analytical and condensed version of this tale.Along the way, this book, in the first chapter, reveals  how and why MP3s suck, compared to CD music quality.  In the first chapter, the science of psychoacoustics suggested where and how bits of music information could be thrown away, when digitizing music.  Years ago side-by-side comparisons showed me how much presence and depth of music was missing in MP3, so I have avoided them, so it was illuminating to know the specifics.

This is the first powdered dip mix I have tried that I have liked.  When you first mix it up, the flavor is just about right.  As you let it rest, the flavor grows and the onion flavor gets a bit sharp -- too much flavor is a nice problem to have, but I tone it down by adding a bit more sour cream, so for me it makes even more dip than the back of the envelope states.  Also, my daughter feels it is a bit too sweet and needs a dash of soy sauce to balance it (I like it either way).I have fond memories of green onion dip that my mother would make from a dry mix in the 60s, but when I tried the same brand now, Laura Scudder's Dip Mix, Green Onion , I guess my tastebuds have changed, because it has a fake taste to it now, probably from the MSG.  Another one I tried, Gourmet Village Dip Mix Onion Chive , was out of balance too sweet.  And Lipton Soup & Dip Mix, Onion is not awful, but not great, and missing the freshness of the green onion flavor.  Usually make our own at home out of dried minced onion, fresh chopped scallion greens, and a dash of soy sauce, and leftover caramelized onion if we have some.I'm a big fan of Spice Hunter blends, especially because they aren't filled out with salt, so i was optimistic about trying this dip mix when I saw it in my local store.  I'll be keeping some of it on the shelf.Note, to those who are sensitive, it has no MSG or glutamates or yeast extract.  [Yes I know that when my daughter adds a dash of soy sauce she is adding glutamates, but at least it is not in the form of MSG, and that is the way she likes it.]

Everyone in the house agreed that this dip was good, but that it covered over the basic flavor of the avocado. The instructions said to mix the contents with one large avocado, I used a single large Haas, but we found the resulting flavor to be too strong.  Adding an additional half an avocado made it better (I do appreciate that they are generous with the flavor ingredients).I tried this because I am a big fan of Spice Hunter in general, especially because they don't pad out their spice blends with salt. i find their Steak & Chop Grill & Broil blend to be very useful in all sorts of dishes, including roasted vegetables, grilled burgers, dips, etc.  And their Green Onion Dip Mix is really good, without the MSG of other brands of green onion dip.  But I won't be getting their guacamole mix again.To me, the point of guacamole is to taste the avocado. I prefer Guatemalan style with just a bit of white onion, a pinch of oregano, mexican/key lime juice and salt to taste.  So while this was not bad, to me it misses the point of guacamole, it would have been better if it enhanced the avocado rather than overwhelmed it.Perhaps it would be useful if you don't have access to good avocados, to make weak avocados work, like during that time of year when most of the avocados aren't so good.p.s. I was really happy to find this mix at my local market.  I really didn't want to have to buy many packages (as listed on Amazon), just to be able to try it.  I won't be buying this one again, but I will be buying their Green Onion Dip Mix, and will continue to try out others from Spice Hunter.

This book is a couple of different things.  On the surface, it is a chronological account of Jackley's path from early encounters with poverty, anecdotes of people and situations throughout her schooling and her work in other countries, on to the founding of Kiva and later ProFounder, interspersed with brief profiles of micro-entrepreneurs she encountered along the way.  But what takes this book to another level is that she extracts lessons and advice from these experiences, that would be useful to anyone struggling to build an organization which can accomplish things.Early on, she talks about her frustrations in trying to find a lawyer to help set up Kiva so that it conformed with SEC regulations.  While seeking other supporters to work with, she learned that she had to customize the language she used for each person, and that she "had to tell stories to move a person from a place of ignorance to a place of understanding".  After a while, I realized that this is exactly what this book is doing, telling her stories to the reader, to convey the perspectives and tactics she has realized over time.Sometimes the lessons surprise you by jumping out from behind a simple anecdote. For example, in one chapter she talks about building her initial team, then she started reminiscing about dealing with chickens that people would give her when she visited in Uganda, and then suddenly her flock of hens and a rooster brought her to the importance of picking strong team leaders (roosters) and getting out of the way to get them to lead.  Then she proceeds to expand upon experiences with her team leaders.Much wisdom about making good things happen in an entrepreneurial way, and choices in life, are in this book.  I was interested in reading it because I am reaching a stage where I want to focus on charitable choices I'd like to make, but I thought the book was going to focus on specific kinds of activities worldwide, rather than building effective organizations which make a difference.  Still, there are lots of good lessons in this book which I find illuminating and helpful in refining my own goals.

I love to play tennis. With all the sudden stops/starts/twists/turns, knee problems are all too common. This sleeve provides a perfect amount of compression to the entire knee area to give constant support. The measurement 4 inches  above my knee cap is 14 inches and I ordered the medium size which fits perfectly. I love how it fits snugly yet doesn't cut off circulation.The sleeve stayed in place despite vigorous activity with no bunching or rolling. The thing I notice about the construction of this brace that is different from others I've tried is the multi-directional knit fibers all around the knee....front, sides, and back. It is very light weight - made of nylon and spandex which allows for quick drying upon hand washing.This brace is going to get lots of use!  I received this item free for my objective review and evaluation but I would recommend it and will buy it again when this one needs replacing.

This 1 1/2 inch triangle will save me hours and $$$I am constantly misplacing my keys (with a cost of $225 to replace) and this small device is just what I need for locating them. There are 3 instructions printed on the inside of the box....that is how easy this device is to hook up. After opening and charging for a few minutes until the red light turned green, I located the app in the app store, installed it and followed the simple on screen directions. I have an iPhone and this pairs without any difficulty.The device works perfectly in my home on the main level. When I tested the device by placing my keys on a different level, a red light blinked on the device upon Bluetooth separation, and a message on the phone with a red pin notated the last known location. So, this lets you know if the keys are in your house, or if you left them across the city!There is a web site that has more detailed written and video directions. I still could not get the car finder app to work reliably, but, my main purpose for this device is for key location.*I received a free sample of this product for my objective evaluation and review. It did not work well with my android phone so I am happy to report that it is definitely compatible with iPhone.

Ah that feeling -- when you just finish a great story and only want more -- more of the characters and another great suspense thriller to capture your interest and enthrall you for a couple of hours. That's how I feel after finishing this 4th book in one of my new favorite series.DI Helen Grace is a very complex and interesting woman. In this case, she is investigating a series of arsons that have left several dead women in the ashes of burnt out houses. An excellent police procedural, the reader follows Helen and her team as they try to put the disparate pieces of this puzzle together to stop a killer without conscience. Red herrings abound, and I was stunned by the denouement and revelation of the killer and the motives.I cannot wait for the next one (LITTLE BOY BLUE). If you like strong female lead protagonists and lots of action with supporting characters who add to the depth of the story within, you will like this series. I am one of those people who has to read a series in order, and I think that the reader sees the development of the characters by doing this, which ends up further cementing the attachment to the setting and characters.Series order  Eeny Meeny  Pop Goes the Weasel  The Doll's House  Liar Liar  Little Boy Blue

These sunglasses are the right size and shape to protect the eyes of my 5-year-old grandson. The lenses are polarized and orange in color with a black rubber flexible frame. These are basic sunglasses that I hope will last for a long while, but don't have much hope as this is the type of item that tends to get broken by repeated overstretching, sitting on, running over with bicycles or some other method. The price is right to replace them, however, should that happen.I feel it's important that kids wear sunglasses to protect from UVA and UVB light and I was happy to receive this complimentary pair for my objective evaluation and review. RIVBOS makes these kids sunglasses in a variety of styles and colors that would work great for both girls and boys. Depending on the size of your child's face, nose, ears, the fit will vary, but I would guess should fit ok for most above age 3.The first set of these I got had a lens scratched at delivery so I contacted RIVBOS and they sent a replacement pair right away -- that kind of customer service is definitely an important factor when placing online orders. I'd recommend them as you can order with confidence. The sunglasses come with a black drawstring pouch for storage and protection.

I love this block print dress. I have the pink, white and navy version. My dress arrived without a care/content tag so I was unsure about proper washing and care.  It had a few wrinkles from packaging which were easily ironed out with a warm setting. It did not scorch/singe. The sizing chart is a little different than the USA sizes. I usually wear a 6-8 and the XL size fits me and hits just a bit above mid thigh. It can easily be dressed up or down for multiple occasions.Although I received this item free for my objective evaluation and review, I would purchase this dress as it will be perfect for summer outings.

The special mirrored credit card holder for chip embedded cards is very convenient to carry. The cards fit nicely into six slots with easy access...no more tugging at cards that are crammed into a tight spot. These slots have ample room so multiple cards can fit into each of the slots. And, because of its special construction, I feel more comfortable knowing my chip cards are safe and secure from would be thieves.The case can also be used as a mirror as it is provides for a true reflection, but, its surface easily gets smudged with finger prints. I carry a small glasses cleaning cloth with me. I received this set free for my objective evaluation and review. This came in a set of two so keep one for yourself and share the other!

This 30W outdoor LED Flood light is perfect for the backyard fountain. It provides a bright enough light at night to help highlight the moving water of my water feature without being overpowering. It also provides light that might deter unwanted visitors. It is a light that must be hardwired into an electric source. So, if you aren't handy with electricity, you may need to hire an electrician.It is advertised as lasting for 25000 hours, is non-dimmable, and contains a non-replaceable bulb. I received this item free for my objective evaluation and review but it would be a great light for the price!

This is a very soft and lightweight electric heated blanket that will surround you in warmth and comfort. I have used an electric blanket on my bed for most of my life and have had mixed results with the various different brands. The big issues for me have always been, how fast does it get warm, is the blanket "zoned" to provide more warmth at the feet, and how can I remember to turn it off.This blanket solves my major problem of remembering to turn it off as it has an automatic shutoff after 10 hours. I can't tell you how much peace of mind that gives me. One of the things I always worried about was leaving it on and creating a fire hazard -- and wasting electricity. Problem solved.The blanket is not zoned and provides a uniform heat -- directions say to make sure that the label is at the foot of the bed facing up as the heat is produced in a downward fashion. The top of the blanket is still warm anyway, just not as warm as underneath. I placed the blanket on top of a thin down comforter and I set the heat level at 8 and leave it there all night long. The unit does have dual controls for both sides of the bed, ideal for those of us who sleep in the same bed with someone who doesn't want to get too hot. It is also programmable so you can decide how long you want it to heat between intervals of 15 minutes to 12 hours. The blanket is thin and you can see and feel the coils, but that is not an issue for me.My complaint is with the controller. It has several buttons to preheat, set the temp level and any timer settings, but the main thing is that it is not backlit and you can't really tell if it is on unless you turn on a light or press the power button so it lights up before it goes off. I wish it was backlit while on. The two cords attached to the controller provide a counterweight to the controller so those tend to pull the unit off the bedside table. I ended up putting it on the floor beside the bed (where I can't reach it, unfortunately as I have a very high set bed), because it kept falling off the table. I don't want to stick it onto the wood of my night table, so it will remain on the floor.I like the blanket and it will keep me warm on those cold winter nights.

I have always liked pearls, and this is a nice sized set that adds a touch of sophistication to your look as this gem really never goes out of style and is always appropriate either dressed up or down.The set of earrings comes in round pink box with a cute little bow on the outside. The pearls are larger than usual and a button shape so they are not perfectly round. The stud metal is listed as sterling silver on the post so that is helpful information for those of us with sensitive ears or a nickel allergy. I did not experience any redness or other irritation from wearing these for 10-16 hours in a day. They have a nice lustre and are comfortable.The only issue I have with these is that the butterfly used to keep these studs in place is very small and I have replaced those with other, larger fasteners that I already had in my jewelry collection. I received this free set for my objective review and evaluation, but can recommend them to any woman who loves the look of pearls.

Part police procedural and part mystery, this novel  focuses on the hunt for the person who has abducted and killed 3 women -- and now has possibly taken a fourth.  The women share common traits, most specifically they have dark hair and blue eyes. In addition, each of the bodies discovered on the isolated beach has another commonality -- a bluebird tattoo. Helen knows that the man they are desperately seeking must be linked in some way to all four of the women and she and her team are out pounding the pavement and knocking on doors trying to find the latest victim, Ruby, before she too becomes another.The reader has the benefit of the points of view of Helen, Ruby, and glimpses into the psyche of the man behind these crimes. In addition, Helen is still dealing with her personal problems and work issues with her subordinates and superiors. It is important that you read the first two in the series before opening this one as Helen's character develops and we get more insight into what makes her tick with each book.
