I regularly take a high potency vitamin D3 supplement so was pleased to receive this product for an honest review.Important to me is the sourcing of the ingredients and Viva Labs assures their vitamin D3 is produced in the US from US-derived ingredients (with the exception of the lanolin which is sourced from New Zealand or Australia). Ive used other Viva Labs supplements and have been highly impressed with the quality of their products.This vitamin D3 is a small softgel capsule. It contains extra virgin olive oil and no soy or GMOs. While during the sunny months, one can get an adequate supply of this essential vitamin, the 5,000 IU dosage is perfect for the cooler months when sunshine is limited.I personally take the 5,000 IU dosage year round and my 25-hydroxy vitamin D test always comes back with optimal readings (between 50 and 70 ng/mL).

Sonia Lacasse has created a masterpiece in Paleo Home Cooking. The book is beautifully illustrated and contains more than 150 grain-free, gluten-free, dairy-free recipes and a number of useful guides to making your own sauces, stocks and mayonnaise. Sonias sugar-free desserts use only modest amounts of pure natural sugars such as honey, maple syrup or dried fruits. In addition, there are guides to stocking your Paleo kitchen and helpful hints on the best kitchen tools to have in your arsenal. Theres even a recipe for making your own dark chocolate chips!The recipes use only real food, and they are simple and simply delicious. I have three rotisserie chicken carcasses in my freezer, and after seeing the delectable Brown Chicken Stock on page 76-7, I know what Im making tomorrow!The first recipe I tried was the Chicken Fingers with Spicy Honey Dijon Dipping Sauce (p. 158). This turned out to be a family favorite. The coating is wonderfully spicy and flavorful and is a perfect foil for the sweet, mustardy dipping sauce. The Honey Sesame Chicken on page 160 was also very tasty, however, Im on the fence about the date paste used as a sweetener. Maybe will use a tad less for my next batch.A new recipe for me was the Cauliflower Fritters (p. 254). They are light in texture and lightly browned. Be sure to squeeze as much water out of the steamed cauliflower as you can to achieve the desired lightness. These call for ghee, however, I used organic butter with good results. A favorite was the Smoked Ham and Asparagus Omelette (p. 146). To accommodate my Kosher diet I used sliced strips of chicken breast in place of the ham and the resulting dish was superb. The dish is not an omelette per se but tasty thin crepe-like rounds wrapped around the asparagus, chicken and sliced mushrooms. If you tolerate cheese, a little grated Gruyere is very nice on this dish.Ms. Lacasse has a blog (The Healthy Foodie) for her followers where she offers more of her delightful recipes. If youre like me, youll visit it often until you can get your hands on her next book.

I received a bottle of LOreal Paris Skin Care Age Perfect Hydra Nutrition Facial Moisturizer for an honest review. Heres my take on it.L'Oreal Paris Age Perfect Hydra Nutrition is a daily moisturizer with an SPF30 protection. This works well for me because I have rather dry skin, exacerbated by almost daily contact with chlorinated water. As a water fitness instructor, I appreciate both the thickness of the moisturizer as well as the SPF protection. And the scent is delightful!The bottle comes with a built-in pump that opens and closes. It dispenses a very small amount of lotion, one pump not being quite enough for all-over facial protection. It contains five essential oils: orange peel, jasmine, lavender, rosemary and pelargonium. The scent is definitely floral, but no individual scent dominates. Very pleasant to use and highly emollient. I am entirely happy with this product and it leaves my skin feeling baby soft and wonderfully hydrated. A little pricey, but definitely a keeper.

I received a bottle of Joint Support with Glucosamine, Chondroitin, MSM and Hyaluronic Acid for an honest review.Zenwise labs is known for producing quality products and since I already take each of the four listed ingredients for osteoarthritis and a damaged knee, I thought the four ingredients combined in one tablet would be helpful. At first glance, I found the tablets to be large, and I have some difficulty swallowing large tablets, however, these are soft enough to be broken in half easily. Due to the curcumin, a product of the turmeric plant, these tablets are a pale yellow in color.In addition to the aforementioned ingredients, they also contain bosweilla and curcumin, both known to help with inflammation issues. Its far too soon to know if this product has positive effects, but since its a continuation of the ingredients I am already takingand in the same dosages, I feel confident that the results will be beneficial. I will report back when I have finished the 180 tablets.

I received this lovely gift jar of pure American made chocolates for an honest review. Not difficult for this chocolate lover! Firstly, four varieties of wrapped five-gram chocolates arrive in a lidded glass jar tied with a chocolate brown ribbon. What could be prettier? There are 121 chocolates in the jar30 each of Bittersweet Dark, Semi Sweet, Extra Dark and 31 Milk Chocolate.Im liking them all. But probably favor the Semi Sweet (62%), a deliciously satisfying dark, reminiscent of the 72% chips used for baking, only much smoother and tastier (the squares being 70%). The Milk Chocolate at 41% is sweeter but still robust enough to outshine any bar chocolate. The Bittersweet at 70%  has only the barest hint of sweetness but is equally satisfying, and one square is enough to satisfy a craving. Extra Dark at 82% is perhaps my least favorite, however this exceptionally high quality chocolate is rich and robust, a bit like the strong Black Magic coffee beans I grind for my morning cup of Joe. Each square wrapper I stamped lightly with a best by date to ensure maximum freshness. Mine all are marked 2016 and 2017.These quality chocolates present beautifully in an attractive lidded gift jar that can be used long after the sweets are enjoyed. The package is a bit pricey, but for this quality and for gifts it is lovely.

Normally I choose dark chocolate, but the opportunity to try the Cailler Milk Chocolate Selection presented itself, so I indulged.This is a beautifully packaged 7.9 ounce box assortment of 16 rich milk chocolates made in Broc, Switzerland. A small booklet accompanies each box. It pictures and describes the confections. The assortment includes creamy centers, caramels and nutty pieces, mostly almond or hazelnut. Each piece sits in its own shaped depression for full protection.The candies are small and one can easily eat three pieces without too much sugar overload. The milk chocolate is delicious, though a bit sweet for my taste. Also, even though they are delicious, I found the flavors seemed similar, perhaps because the milk chocolate and sugar is a bit overwhelming. Still, this makes a delightful gift for the milk chocolate lover. Five stars for packaging and overall beauty. One star off for the price and mingled flavors.

I have osteoarthritis and knee joint degeneration. Ive been taking curcumin for a while to cut down on joint pain since I choose not to use NSAIDS. I had the opportunity to try Ubervitas Turmeric and Curcumin capsules for an honest evaluation.While its too soon to assess the benefits to me personally, I can say this: Ubervita is a respected company and they source only the highest quality of organic turmeric curcumin for fighting arthritis and joint issues. Their Bioperine is a patented formula that delivers a high absorption level of curcumin, the main ingredient in the spice turmeric. It has long been used for relief of joint pain, but also for its anti-inflammatory qualities and now is used as a preventive for tumor growth.The capsules are large. One to three capsules per day between meals is the recommended dosage. I would say that my symptoms are less intense with its daily use, though I will need a couple more months to determine just how effective it is overall. I also take an anti-inflammatory supplement and hyaluronic acid and hope with this supplementation to avoid knee replacement surgery. So far, the prognosis is good, and I am back to regular walking and exercise after months of debilitating bone-on-bone discomfort. I appreciate that Ubervitas Turmeric Curcumin is also an anti-oxidant and is helpful for relieving headaches. In fact, since taking turmeric I have not had to resort to ibuprofen.

I like the fact that this surge protector offers six plugs plus two 24 Watt USB ports to keep your smartphone or Kindle charged. Plus the outlets are set to avoid cord interference.Blue and green lights located at the top of the device let you know its grounded and/or charging. Nice! Here are the specs: 6 outlets with 2 adapter-spaced 900 joules of surge protection 2 USB with 4.8A output charges two tablets at once Lifetime product warranty $100,000 connected equipment warrantyIt was easy to install and has documentation that tells you to remove the outlet plate mounting screw. The surge protector plugs into the lower three-pronged outlet with a plastic nub resting on the existing faceplate so you actually can use only one of the faceplate outlets. Still, the lower two outlets are angles so those annoying large plugs can be facing downward.Overall, the surge protector is easy to use, accommodates all my needs and looks very clean and tidy. I plan to add another for my kitchen use where I keep my phone plugged in.Definitely an improvement over other brands.

These amethyst and white sapphire stud earrings are very smart looking and suitable for business to dressy wear. The earrings are about 10mm in diameter with genuine amethysts and tiny created white sapphires encircling the gemstone. Theyre designed in sterling silver for a nice classy look. I have short silver hair and the combination is great.They come boxed (box is quite large and could be better presented for gift-giving) and have the silver backs and non-slip grippers to keep the posts from falling out.Another reviewer commented on the amethyst stone not being very sparkly. This is true, but I find them subtly elegant and love wearing them.

Why eat tasteless Paleo food when you dont have to? says paleo chef and cookbook author Juli Bauer.A blogger extraordinaire at Paleo OMG, Juli, along with George Bryant, is the author of The Paleo Kitchen, a cookbook previously reviewed by me. Now, in Julie Bauers Paleo Cookbook, this amazingly talented lady shines again.I love Julis direct approach, her sassy personality that comes alive on the pages of her latest book, and of course the recipes. Be sure to read Julis introduction where she explains why she created this book. These pages will help you to know her better and look forward to the taste treats further along. Also in the Intro are tips to make Paleo easier as well as the basics one getting started with a Paleo lifestyle needs to know.The recipes are divided into sections: Breakfast; Poultry; Beef; Pork and Lamb; Fish and Seafood; Soups, Salads and Sides;  Snacks; Desserts; Drinks and Shakes and basics which covers all the sauces and dressings. As a former fan of Nutella, I loved Julis Easy Chocolate Hazelnut Spread (p. 292) which recreates the decadent chocolate hazelnut confection in a healthy way. I also suggest her Truffle Aioli thats simply delicious with French fries and uses homemade mayo and white truffle oil.Street Fish Tacos (p. 150) is a winner and is becoming my new go-to taco dish. The recipe calls for homemade tortillas (p. 290), avocado cream, seasoned tilapia fillets, and a red onion, cabbage and cilantro slaw infused with fresh lime juice. Muy Bueno!Each recipe is a culinary masterpiece, gorgeously presented by Juli and photographed by the winning team of Bill Staley and Haley Mason of primal palate fame. I love how this book is laid out and am delighted with the recipe selection. (Check out the Winter Squash Salad (p. 172) with its Maple Mustard Vinaigrette. Yum!)This beautifully presented cookbook deserves a place on your shelf. I guarantee Julis fresh approach will have your family singing her (and YOUR) culinary praises.

I received a bottle of Neutrogena Body Oil for an honest review. Earlier this year I reviewed another brand and was skeptical since brand x left a film on my body that I didnt like. Not so Neutrogena Light Sesame Formula. This oil really absorbs into your skin and leaves it soft and supple (and since Im no spring chicken, that says a lot!)I love Neutrogenas other bath products and this one ranks right up there with the others. I use it after my bath while my skin is still damp. The oil vanishes into my skin within minutes, leaves it soft and very delicately scented. Ive also used it smoothed on my face as a light day moisturizer. I could add a few drops of essential oil, however, I love the delicate fragrance already there so wont do that. This is truly a delightful boon to any skin type. I love it!

If you struggle to achieve the right work/life balance and most of the self-help books on this topic all seem pretty much the same, I invite you to read Bogus Balance by Deirdre Maloney. Not only does she stress-relieving tried and true aids, she was in this same situation. Until she discovered in her own life that you cant really achieve that balancethat trying to do so creates family problems, relationship problems and a host of other stressesand she set about learning how to achieve bliss and that it requires making choices, only then did she come to grips with her problem.Deirdre learned in her own life and in interviews with many others who had arrived at a blissful compromise that sacrifice, choice and deciding what one really wants out of life are the keys to achieving a happy, balanced and blissful life. You cant have it all, so you must decide on what part of all you need.Life is a journey, and you can choose stress or bliss. In our electronic and digital age it becomes harder to do. Thats where choices come in. Deirdre offers her own perspective on making the right choices based on personal experience and research. Divided into three sections, the book covers I. Breaking down the bogus part, II. Building up the blissful part, and III. Battling those sneaky bliss-busters.Maloney writes in an easy and believable style, but inside are deeply relevant principles to help you make the best choices for your individual life needs. Not only is it readable, it warrants rereading.

I have a FoodSavor vacuum sealer and it came with a supply of FoodSaver bags. When I ran out, I bought a different brand. Bad idea! Not only were the bags thinner, often I couldnt get a good seal. I thought my old vacuum sealer must be failing. When I had the opportunity to try these FoodSaver bags, my faith in that little gem was restored.I garden and like to extend my harvest by saving all the produce. These bags are especially nice for freezing and storing excess bell pepper strips. On shopping trips to Costco, I dont hesitate to buy in bulk because I know I can pack what I dont need now into freezer bags and store with confidence therell be no freezer burn. I package chunks of wild-caught salmon, bulk ground beef, homemade seasoned tomato sauce and so much more.I have a chest freezer and have never experienced freezer burn using FoodSaver bags. I concur with another reviewer that the bags maintain a better seal if left in room temperature a few minutes before putting the hot-sealed bags directly into the freezer.

I have osteoarthritis and prefer not to take NSAIDS. For years I was taking a combination of Glucosamine and Chondroitin, and then my trusted nutritionist recommended adding MSM to the formulation. This has kept me relatively pain free, however, I have difficulty swallowing large capsules or tablets. Viva Labs Triple Strength Glucosamine, Chrondroitin and MSM capsules are a smaller size and perfect for me.I have used other Viva labs supplements and find they are of high quality With a combination of 750mg of glucosamine sulfate, 600mg of chondroitin and 500mg of MSM it provides a 5:4 ratio, considered ideal for maintaining healthy cartilage and forming connective tissue in a synergistic formula. The glucosamine sulfate is bound to potassium chloride which helps the stability of the glucosamine. What does this formula do for me? Virtually no pain or joint discomfort.I follow a holistic diet that precludes putting manufactured anti-inflamatories in my body. This formula takes the discomfort out of everyday activity.The large 240 capsule bottle lasts for 4 months if taken as directed (two capsules per day).

I love a good pair of kitchen shears and have been very pleased with my current shears. However, in the interest of giving a fair, unbiased comparison to another brand, I was happy to receive these Fiskars Heavy-Duty Shears for an honest review.Firstly, after considerable difficulty opening the plastic package, I gave the shears a run-through of the basics: paper (a bit too wobbly with the separating design to effectively cut paper), string (worked well), chicken breasts (easy peasy, even with my arthritic hands), thick steak (again, very easy to cut through). They are thin and curved to make trimming easy and theres a power notch that enables you to cut bone without wearing on the blades. They come with a protective sheath and have a take-apart design to place the used shears in a dishwasher.Touted as part cleaver, part chefs knife, they work well for most applications. While I like the idea of a take-apart design, it also makes the shears a bit too wobbly to cut paper effectively, and my inability to do this makes me knock off one star for precision, because they are not precision when they dont perform all the tasks. Still, I give them high marks for meat and tendon cutting and for being dishwasher safe. I also appreciate the lifetime warranty.

I received a pair of the blue Motorola Talkabout T460 Two-Way Radio Pairs for an honest review. Heres my take on them:They are fairly compact ( 4 1/2-inch body with a 2 -inch antenna) with a range of features that are easy to use. They sit well in the hand, are reasonably lightweight for hand holding, and also have a hard plastic belt clip for easy transport. 22 channels and 21 privacy codes ensure the availability of finding a private channel.While the directions seem fairly simple, I had to go through the instructions a few times to have a flawless operation. Maybe Im not that intuitive, but with so many buttons and not being familiar with walkie talkies, it was confusing at first.You power on the device by turning the cap on top clockwise (all the way for high volume). Press the music note on the face of the device to ring the other person. Then to talk, theres a cartouche to depress (the top for high power, the bottom for low). My husband and I tried both and didnt notice any degradation using just the low power. However, in our forested, mountainous living area, theres no way we could get more than a couple miles transmission range with either power output. At three miles the signal dropped off entirely. This tells me that range is dependent upon terrain and forestation or structures.The top round button is a flashlight; not really powerful, but bright enough for map-reading or similar. An orange emergency alert button on the same side as the two mentioned sends a strong signal. I managed to get the latest weather update through the NOAA weather channel. In short, everything worked as advertised except the range.These units do not come with a charging cradle, however, each has a power cord with a plug on one end and a micro-usb connection on the other. With the micro-usb, the devices can be charged with a solar charger if youre away from an electrical outlet. On the negative side, battery life is about 24 hours, even with little use which, along with having no charging cradle, knocks one star off my rating. Still, this is a nice pair of radio units and worth considering. They seem well made and damage/weather resistant.

I received this George Foreman GFO200S Indoor/Outdoor Grill for an honest review. Heres my take on it.With a 200 square-inch cooking surface, this indoor/outdoor grill will easily serve 12, so no need to cook in batches. The temperature is controlled by a round dial, and items cook evenly. As with the George Foreman original two-plate grill, the surface slants downward so grease runs off and is collected in a tray. The stand and legs snap on easily for patio use or you can set in on a table or counter to use indoors. (A note of warning: the unit gets hot, so be sure to place it on some type of insulating board as it can crack Corian.) The grill plate is treated with a tough non-stick coating so is easy to wipe clean. Its also lightweight and attractive. These are the pluses.On the negative side, the stand seems a bit flimsy and the unit is rather large to store. Being electric, this is not an item youd want sitting out in the weather.indoor and out, you may want to do some careful comparisons with competing offerings. Another point worth mentioning is the grease-collecting tray, though dishwasher-safe, is not very sturdy.I give it five stars for cooking ease but am taking off one star for flimsiness and storage difficulty.

We are Wellness Core fans and have used this brand on our 21-year-old kitty and now on our two-year-old indoor male. Hes been getting a mixture of grain-free wet food and the Wellness Core Indoor Formula and hes done very well with this combination. When I had the opportunity to preview the original formula (slightly higher in calories and with the addition of fist to the formula), I ordered a package. He really loves any food with fish as an ingredient, and Original Formula is no exception. As with the Indoor Formula, he gets a mixture of dry kibble and wet food in small portions a few times a day. It agrees with him and he has a wonderfully glossy coat, good teeth and is in great health.I am as concerned about what kind of diet he eats as I am about our food. Wellness makes quality pet foods and I am confident hes getting a good nutritional balance. Its nice to know that the people at Wellness also recommend a combination of wet and dry food to help increase the level of water in the cats diet.Yes, Wellness Core cost a bit more than grocery store cat food, but we believe in optimal nutrition for our fur babies, and it is so worth it to know were giving him the best.

Microbiome is the name given to the trillions of bacteria that live in our gut. Its become popular today to rethink not only our lifestyle and what we eat, but how clean we are in our personal lives. In this age of over-dependence on vaccines and antibiotics for every little ailment, and the need to sanitize everything we touch, we are actually depriving our bodies of the balance of good germs to bad that actually build our immune systems and keep us healthy.Gastroenterologist and author Robynne Chutkan explains why we need to eat a peck of dirt before we die and much much more. She explains why using hand sanitizers may be counter-productive and why we need to eat more natural, fermented foods.Ive been treating hormonal and gut imbalance and found Robynnes book helpful and very readable. In addition to explaining the how and why, Robynne offers a number of recipes for simple gut-healing foods as well as cleaning products.  She ascribes to the live dirty, eat clean life and suggests we do the same. I found her writing style both refreshing and informative.She also shares practical advice Ive never seen elsewhere. For example why its so much better to have a natural childbirth than a Cesarean section, because the fluids a baby gathers as it comes down the birth canal provide essential bacteria to build the babys immune system and which helps to prevent allergies.The diet in Robynnes book is mostly a low sugar, high fiber onethe ingredients we need for a healthy gut.Very well done, and kudos to Dr. Chutkan.

For me kale is an acquired taste, so Im usually putting it in salads and making a somewhat spicy dressing to overpower the kale taste. Kale chips are a some and some item. Some are quite tasty and some are pretty blah.Rhythm Superfoods Kale chips rank somewhere in between. Theres a decent ranch taste, but the consistency is rather dry and bland. My sample bag had three or four chunky bites and the rest were crushed into little bitty pieces that required a spoon to eat.Sodium is 220 mg. and sugar 3 g. per serving, both a bit more than I like to see, but the taste is better than average and they are relatively healthy. They have 7 grams of fat per serving (two servings to a bag), derived mostly from sunflower and sesame seeds.These snack bits are rather pricey for what you get. Based on value, taste and consistency, I am being generous to give these chips four stars.It was decent but not something I would purchase.

Ron Cantor has penned a very fine fictional book on the identity theft many churches and gentiles have had in trying to eradicate the "Jewishness" of our Lord and Savior. Though written as fiction, Cantor backs up what he says with scriptural documentation. The facts remain: Yeshua (Jesus) was a Jew, a Rabbi, a teacher in the synagogues, as were Paul and Peter. Lifelong Jews who never changed their faith to start a new religion. This needs to be understood by modern Christianity and modern Judaism alike. I have a few nits about the writing style, but none about the content. Very readable and informative.
Love the smaller size for my raw cacao candy making. Excellent quality and melting consistency.

I've been using ThyroAid for a month now and am pleased with the quality and with my results. I have a thyroid imbalance not detected with the common test and felt this product would help to regulate an underactive thyroid and to aid in increasing my metabolism. While I do not yet have clinical proof of any improvement, I "feel" as though it is helping through increased energy and well-being. I have placed a reorder based on my results.

The Phantom Aquatics Impulse 1500 LED Dive Light offers a sealed magnetic side switch with three brightness settings. The switch, as well as the flashlight body, is well made and durable.While installing the batteries is fairly intuitive, it took a bit to figure out how to unscrew the case as it came with NO instructions save a tiny card that tells you to remove the batteries after use.It comes with a neoprene hand holster and an adjustable wrist lanyard with a rubberized tube, but no instructions. I checked online and found nothing.Using the latest USA CREE XM-L2(U2) LED, it provides a maximum 1500 lumens output and has over 18 hours runtime. It is a robust tool, weighing in at a little over 1  pounds. The light intensity, however, is incredible, particularly at the high beam. The batteries are rechargeable and the unit comes with a generic charger. It took just three hours for the battery charging lights to go from red to green. Also, there are three additional o-rings to use as replacements whenever needed.Instructions on the tiny card say to wash off any salt water after use. I will be using this powerful light for camping and similar activities.My only complaint(s) had to do with overall weight and the difficulty of keeping one of the o-rings from bulging out of the flashlight body when screwing the barrel back on. This could be a problem with waterproofability.

I tested these earbud headphones today while riding my spin bike and have to say they do the job quite well. Of course they dont have the sound quality of my Monster earbuds, but for workouts, they are better because they stay in place, thanks to their over the ear design.They were easy to put on and easy to adjust. I listened to a podcast and found the voice quality very acceptable. They are comfortable to wear, and not likely to fall off. I used them with an iPhone 4 and was able to pause the sound for mobile phone use. Unfortunately, I live in a cell dead area so wasnt able to test the phone quality. Not a problem for me since these will be used almost exclusively for podcasts and music while running or exercising.Noise isolation is average since they dont have a tight ear canal fit, but again, not a problem. The bottom line is they are inexpensive, they stay put and do the job. The green color is kinda neat, too. The only downside might be that the cord is a bit flimsy, so precaution needs to be made not to pull on it.

The Jergens Wet Skin Moisturizer is perfect for after pool and bath use. My skin gets rather dry from being in the water so much and the moisturizer really keeps my skin moist and supple feeling. I prefer to apply to just damp skin rather than dripping wet, but the results are equal.My skin stays moist feeling for hours and the product has a nice scent, a light gardenia fragrance.

When Ginger Dysart comes to Thunder Point, her life has taken a serious downturn. She lost her baby to SIDS, then her marriage broke up. Ginger lost all interest in life and her parents thought staying with her cousin Ray Anne just might help her regain an interest in life. She takes a job at the local flower shop and slowly moves out of the morass her life has become. Slowly she begins to take an interest in living and working. Her life takes on meaning. Assisting at the Lacoumette wedding, she encounters Matt Lacoumette. He is intoxicated and says inappropriate things to Ginger. Later, when matt comes to the flower shop to apologize, Ginger wants to send him on his way. Matt, however, persists, and Ginger finds an unwanted attraction to the Lacoumettes son.Matt has deep trust issues and a broken marriage and he in no way wants an involvement, yet he, too, is attracted to Ginger. Can these two let go of the past and find a future together?Robyn Carr has penned an emotional story in book eight of her Thunder Point series with these damaged souls. How she explores the deep emotional scars each carries and how they overcome impossible odds makes her one of Americas gifted storytellers.Youll enjoy reacquainting yourself with characters from previous books and learning more about the magical place that is Thunder Point. Two thumbs up for this one.
Easy to follow directions, but unfortunately, nothing on the knee which is the reason I bought the book.
A perfect challah pan for my grain-free challah. I needed a pan to hold the dough (more of a batter, actually) since the grain-free flour is impossible to braid. This small challah mold is perfect.
We use LOTS of dry mustard and Colman's is hands down the best tasting mustard out there. Perfect for my hot, sweet mustard recipe.
Excellent product and our personal favorite for leg of lamb dishes. Haven't been able to get this particular product in our local stores so ordered from Amazon. We love Colman's Classic Mint Sauce.

My husband and I are both using this product. This is a reorder and we're very pleased with the results. Husband's sleep has improved, and I'm feeling more energy since starting the product about five weeks ago.

I have a FoodSaver vacuum dealer and ran out of the 8" bags. I bought an off brand and wasn't nearly as satisfied as I have been with these. They are easy to use and easy to seal. This width is the one I use most of the time for chicken thighs, bell pepper strips, even home made tomato sauce.

We adopted our fur person two years ago, and since then weve had him on a grain-free diet. I was happy to try Instinct Raw Boost Mixer Chicken Formula Dry Food for Cats since it fit all my criteriaraw, grain-free, gluten-free, preservative-free. Its not a complete food but an additive to your cats regular diet. Our boy eats moist food with a little kibble, so the mixer seemed ideal as a treatfive or six chunks on top of his wet food.Unfortunately, its not one he loves. He eats it, but only after leaving it in the dish for a while, so I guess to him the flavor is not irresistible. I love the all-natural ingredients and feel it is a superior food source, however, based on the taste test, I can only give these treats four stars. Perhaps your pet will appreciate them more than mine.

I loved Russ Crandalls The Ancestral Table and was delighted to have the opportunity to review Paleo Takeout. Its good looking, the photos are wonderful and the recipes easy to follow no matter your skill level or whether you are new to Paleo or a long-time follower, as am I.Russ story of how he came to Paleo (stroke by age 25) is inspiring and a shout out for letting nutrition and diet do the work instead of over-medicating. As for the content, its everything you want to see in a Paleo takeout bookfavorite restaurant recipes made Paleo, variations on a common theme (as in the recipes for Sweet and Sour Chicken, General Tsos Chicken, Orange Chicken, etc) with the sauces, and a variety of themes ranging from Chinese to Japanese and Korean, to Southeast Asian and beyond, and ending with American classics.My first recipe from the book was the Sweet and Sour Chicken (p. 64), followed by Orange Chicken (p. 66). Both are taste sensations, and the leftovers are pretty darn good. Russ has perfected the art of Paleo breading. The trick is to flour the meat first, THEN dip in beaten egg and plop in the hot grease. Done this way, the coating stays on and has a soft, bready texture. I added the thinly sliced green onions and a sprinkle of sesame seeds but added some torn cilantro, a personal favorite with Chinese takeout.My next menu from the book is going to include a Greek Gyro (p. 256). Theres recipes for the gyro meat, a flatbread, Greek salad and Tzatziki Sauce. One of my pre-Paleo Santa Cruz treats was a visit to our local Greek restaurant for gyros in pita bread. Ive been hungering for this dish and am ecstatic to know I can have it again in a Paleo-ized version. (All I need to make this Hellenic perfection is a bottle of retsina.)Russ shares recipes for beef, chicken or bison broth, barbecue sauce, chili oil and mayo, honey mustard and ketchup to keep the menu Paleo. There are recipes for guacamole, perfect oven fries, both cauliflower and grain rice and even a perfect burger bun.I guarantee youll have exciting adventures cooking up the delights in Paleo Takeout. Get your copy of this great cookbook today.

I was offered the CM4 Q Case in Pacific Green for an honest review. Here's my take on it:The case comes nicely packaged in a small box with a screen cleaning cloth and a flat screen cover included. The clear screen protector is easy to apply, however, I chose not to use it. The case fits easily over my iPhone 4 and looks very classy. The front is a silicone that's easy to handle and the back has a suede-like cover that holds up to three credit cards and/or cash. The buttons are responsive and the camera works equally well with or without the cover.I love the look and like how comfortable it feels in the hand. Definitely the nicest case I've used. Easy to spot with the attractive color, great soft feel and for the minimalist, a no-brainer when shopping. You can insert a credit card, your driver's license and an insurance card and you're set to go. I love it!

I received this bra in exchange for an honest review. Heres my take on it.The taupe pattern is attractive and the underwires are minimalized, almost to the point of being unnoticeable. The fabric is lovely and the bra fits well and has adjustable straps. I found it very comfortable to wear though Im not sure Id call the effect of the bra slimming. It was, however, well-fitting and didnt slip and slide as do my other Playtex Secrets bras (different style and fabric). I have worn it under both light-colored tee shirts and a rayon blouse with equally good results. Have not washed it yet. Washing instructions recommend hand-washing, however, I generally toss my unmentionables into a zippered net bag and wash on the gentle cycle and will with this bra, too.Would I choose this bra again? My tried and true style has been discontinued, so yes, I would purchase this one again.

I teach classes at a local gym and need to make note of my times to be there plus a myriad of other appointments and scheduling, so Ive been using planners for years. I prefer the weekly/monthly format since most of the time Im filling in only the monthly pages. This one has a minimalist look and the size is convenient. It, however, is the first one Ive used that is not spiral bound, and that will take some getting used to, but since this was sent gratis for an honest review, Im putting it into service starting next month.To its credit the pages lay nearly flat and the day squares are a decent size to jot notes. I dont care for the orange font on the pages or index tabs because they are hard to read in low-light situations. I would also prefer the tabs be reinforced rather than merely printed on paper. The planner has two ribbon place markers, probably a good thing. The cover is a hardboard material with a burlap-like finish and it looks like a composition book.Its well organized and practical, so Ill give it four stars.

I am reviewing a wireless dual band range extender provided free in exchange for an honest review. I have previously reviewed two similar products by a different manufacturer, however, using an older model router.Recently, I exchanged my Comcast modem for one of their WPS model router/modems. Interestingly, with this stronger router, my need for a range extender lessened since I wasnt experiencing the drop-off rates I had noticed before, so I wasnt sure how effective the TP-LINK RE210 AC750 Universal Wireless Dual Band Range Extender would be. I do, however, have a very large house with many walls between the router and the areas where I need wi-fi, so I figured this would be a decent test.First of all, the setup couldnt have been easier. After plugging in the range extender about 15 feet away from the router, I managed to set it up using the WPS button on the top of the router. Then I moved it to the desired location and found it functioning perfectly. It even set up the password automatically! (The same as my router/modem with an ext tacked on.)I mainly use the wi-fi with my smartphone to read email when away from my computer or to listen to podcasts in other areas of the house. The router/modem accommodates all that, but astoundingly, I can now listen to podcasts out in my greenhouse and the vegetable garden which are at least 60 feet from the building. This I could not do with just the router/modem, and not before with my old non-wps router and the other range extenders. So I give this unit a solid two thumbs up for performance. Its not the sleekest piece of equipment with its boxy shape and dual antennae, but it does the job and does it well.

I was sent this Brinks commercial marine resettable lock for an honest review. Heres my take on it.Touted as the ultimate lock for marine environments, I figured it would be perfect for our emergency gate at our castal mountain home where we normally get an abundance of rainfall and fog.I really like the concept, the sturdy boron shackle and the resettable combination. Everything including its construction should garner it a solid five-star review, howeverThe back opening where you move the lever, opens easily as directed, but the front, where you need to set the dials to either open the lock or reset the combination does not open easily. It took me four tries to get the front open, then I was unable to get the lock to open after resetting it. I gave it to my husband to figure out, and while he managed to reset the combination, hes having the same problem with the front cover not opening easily. Unfortunately, this is a game-changer for us since we have to be able to open it to use it. Perhaps we were send a bad lock, but I can only give it two stars with a faulty front dial cover. Im sorry I cant give it a more positive review.Update: Another lock was sent and this one works well. We are using it on our outside gate with no problems. I have therefore adjusted my rating.

I was sent this Stainless water bottle by Contigo for an honest review. Heres my take on it.I like the cool design and color. I like that the water really stays cool and that the liner is BPA-free, also that it doesnt leak when lying on my cars leather seat (Have to lay it down since my vintage Volvo doesnt come with drink rings that fit the diameter of this bottle.).It snaps closed and has a carry handle, that, while not comfortable to carry, at least offers that option. The push-button lid snaps open and makes it easy to use.I use bottled spring water at home so this is what I fill the bottle with 100% of the time. My only complaint aside from the nominally uncomfortable carry handle is that the interior can only be cleaned using a bottle brush. Even with spring water, a film will build up over time and will require cleaning. The opening is small enough that not any bottlebrush can be used.Otherwise, I am enjoying using this bottle which is a good-looking and efficient alternative to my old stainless bottle.

While our kitty is two and not a kitten any more, I was happy to have the opportunity to review the Nutro Companys Minced Salmon Entre in Gravy.The list of ingredients includes: Salmon, Chicken Broth, Pork Broth, Chicken, Chicken Liver, Egg Product, Water Sufficient for Processing, Natural Flavors, Minerals (Potassium Chloride, Magnesium Sulfate, Zinc Sulfate, Ferrous Sulfate, Manganese Sulfate, Potassium Iodide, Copper Sulfate), Sodium Phosphate, Guar Gum, Vitamins (Choline Chloride, Vitamin E Supplement, Thiamin Mononitrate [Vitamin B1], Pyridoxine Hydrochloride [Vitamin B6], Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid, Menadione Sodium Bisulfite Complex [source of Vitamin K activity]), Xanthan Gum, Taurine.Both texture and smell are pleasant and kitty loves it. I like the fact that its also grain free since weve only fed him grain free food since his adoption at four months. I also appreciate that it's US made.Im using Minced Kitten Salmon Entre in rotation with other nutritious other grain free foods and it is one of his favorites.

Our two-year-old tuxedo loves this Pro Plan True Nature Grain-Free Chicken & Liver Entre. Hes been getting a diet of grain-free since he came to live with us at four months of age. Our last kitty spent her last few years on a diet of moist, grain-free food, and we could see the benefits, so we decided to start this guy on a strictly grain-free diet.On opening the first can, I noticed both smell and texture were visually appealing. I checked the ingredients online before ordering and was satisfied they were suitable. Kitty loved it from the first mouthful! I think in cat food as in other things in life, you get what you pay for and the cost is comparable to other high quality brands such as Avoderm and Against the Grain. I believe in varying mystrictly indoor cats mealtime menu so will add Purina Pro Plan Wet Cat Food to his diet. Our boy is somewhat finicky, but this food is definitely to his liking.Very pleased with the quality.

I should state up front that Ive been usingand lovingdown pillows for the last three decades. I need to replace one of my down queen pillows so took the opportunity to give shredded memory foam a test drive.Some time in the middle of the night I need to flip my down pillow over to achieve the loft I prefer. I thought memory foam might make this practice obsolete, so I settled on the shredded memory foam. Bad decision for this reviewer. Not only is the memory foam pillow heavy, that new car smell is rank. It is also very lumpy. Furthermore, the loft is way too high for me to rest comfortably. This pillow is probably the most uncomfortable pillow Ive ever used. I love down, love the fact that I can wash it. The shredded memory foam is only surface cleanable, plus the benefits of breathable bamboo are negated by putting a pillow case over it. I will bite the bullet and purchase a quality down pillow.I had high expectations for this pillow. Perhaps other will find it more to their liking. I would like to have given it a higher score, but could not.

I feed our two-year-old tuxedo a diet of grain-free food so was interested to try the Wellness CORE Air Dried Natural Grain Free Dry Cat Food. Hes an indoor-only kitty, so the indoor formula was perfect.I like that the formula is mostly meat (70%), but noted it also has some veggies (peas) and fruit (cranberries) as well as other nutrients. Upon opening the sealable bag, I noted the scent is not unpleasant, however, the kibble is somewhat moist, not at all like the Wellness CORE dry food we normally give him. He gets a diet of moist and dry food, and while we originally tried him on Wellness CORE wet food, he would not eat it, though he likes the dry kibble. So, first serving he ate well, but he doesnt seem as interested in subsequent servings. Im having to add it in to his regular moist food.My take on it: I love the Wellness brand and philosophy, this kibble seems to be a good product, but only if your kitty likes it.

I find my iPhone needs a charge about halfway through the day. Now, with the OtterBox I can charge my phone with the push of a button when out and about. I also appreciate the added military spec drop protection.The case fits well but is a little hard to put on or remove, probably a good thing so it wont slip out if dropped. Also, since it is a charging case, its a bit thicker than a phone with an ordinary case. Its not a problem for me but it does add extra bulk. Theres no screen protector, however, this isnt a problem for me since I choose not to use one.One nice extra is the auto-stop feature that shuts the case off when the battery is full and thus prevents over-charging. I give this case a solid four stars.

As a Christian I have long been aware of the significance of the Passover but have focused more on the last supper observance. However, for some time my research has guided me into a deeper, more Mes-sianic following. Rabbi Moffics conversational style made understanding the Passover seder from a Jewish point of view much more meaningful by showing the parallels between Jewish history and the ancient Israelites flight from Egypt and their relationship to Messianic times. History and theology are woven together into a seamless tapestry that should add significant meaning to Gods relationship with his peopleboth the true vine and those grafted in.I appreciated the chapter on Blessing and Questioning at the beginning of the seder as Rabbi Moffic shows the reader how to prepare for a Passover seder in ones home. He covers everything from cleans-ing the house in preparation to the closing songs and he does it with interesting personal anecdotes that make for easy, but meaningful, reading.

The InStyler Ionic Styler is the first of its kind for this user. What I was looking for is a tool that gives body and direction to my fine, limp hair. Using the round brush allowed me to direct the flyaway ends into a smooth style while adding volume. I have mostly straight hair, but it wants to curl in the worst of places, so the InStyler keeps the do looking smooth while directing the ends to turn under. It heats up quicklyin about 90 secondsand it replaces the round bristle brush I was using.I have no need for the flat iron, but the heated brush is perfect for my hair, and the ionic molecules real-ly do fight frizz, but the added body and sleek smooth look is what I was looking for and this tool gives that in spades.

This was a long anticipated book from Urban Poser blogger and chef Jenni Hulet. Suffering from an autoimmune condition in 2010, Ms. Hulet went from active mom, yoga instructor and chef to being barely able to get out of bed. Over a course of tests, Jennis condition was diagnosed and she began a course of recovery. Now she delights in creating beautiful and tasty delicacies for those who also suffer from such conditions.My Paleo Patisserie is a stunning hardcover book by Victory Belt Publishing. Beautifully photographed, this book is a must for your baking collection. I love Jennis reasons for creating her book, listed in the Why Paleo Patisserie section. The Food as a Common Language theme resonated with me as did the Artisan Approach. Other short sections include helpful tips and weight versus volume in the Getting Started section. Other sections discuss various ingredients and the equipment required. Other short sections include helpful tips and weight versus volume in the Getting Started section. Other sections discuss various ingredients and the equipment required. Chapters 1 through 9 cover Fillings, Frostings and Glazes, Choux Pastry, Tarts (my favorite dessert), Cakes, Cookies, Ice Cream and Frozen Desserts, Marshmallows and Savory Pastries.As a Primal/Paleo follower and avid culinary artist I was excited to try some of Jennis creations to upgrade my own grain-free dishes. After looking over some of the outstandingly beautiful and creative desserts, I, too, wanted to see if I could create dishes as beautiful and tasty as Jennis.My first foray into Patisserie was Jennis gorgeous and oh-so-tasty Citron Tart (p. 114). Made with a nut-free crust and lemon curd, the result is as delicious as it is beautiful. Im a fan of lemon curd, and this one is made with honey or maple syrup for sweetener. To say we loved it is an understatement!If eclairs or cream puffs are your passion, theres a section with many flavors and shapes; I particularly liked the Double Chocolate Blackberry Cream Puffs (p. 95) made using Chocolate Choux Buns (p. 76) and Chocolate Whipped Cream (p. 49) which is coconut cream for those with a casein intolerance. They are not only delicious, but a sight to behold, and every bit as artistic as any wheat flour confection. Another outstanding recipe is the Italian Almond Cookies (p. 175). We love these almond flour and maple sugar morsels for our afternoon tea, and so will you.While none of the recipes is difficult for an experienced cook, some are certainly more involved. Its definitely a book for someone who loves the creative process and appreciated perfection. But dont shy away from it just because you might feel its too advanced. Every method used here has easy-to-follow how-to tips to guide you through.Mr. Hulets expertise and culinary skills shine in the breathtakingly beautiful book. I highly recommend it to anyone intrigued with beauty, great taste and looking for thoroughly professional results.

I think this timepiece is lovely with its bold look and the gold and black styling. Much larger and heavier than other watches I have worn, but bold pieces are popular and with the curved tonneau-shaped case, it lays flat on my wrist. Also, the dial is fairly easy to read, even with my imperfect vision.The watch has a Japanese quartz movement and a 36 mm gold-plated stainless steel case. The triple-row bracelet has a deployment-clasp closure that opens on the inside, thus avoiding accidental opening or catching on clothing.I like most things about the watch, however, it is, as I stated, large, more of a unisex style except for the pink spade at the twelve oclock position. Being large, it is also fairly heavy which might be problematic for some. I think this design is best suited to a large woman. Even so, most women will need to have the band resized. I have average-to-large wrists and I needed four links taken out.On the plus side, the watch is both dressy and sporty so is suitable for all occasions. Its easy to set and so far, mine has kept excellent time. As another reviewer noted, the battery stops when the stem is pulled out, a nice touch for extending battery life.

This towel (30 W x 84 L) fits nicely over my yoga mat and works well for hot yoga. I havent tried it over a mat for power yoga, however, I feel it works better to help absorb sweat than as a mat for yoga moves.The medium grey color is nice and it seems well made.  My main complaint is that because it is microfiber, it catches on rough skin which is annoying. Also, the mat/towel is quite thin. If a quick-dry towel that absorbs moisture is a requirement, this may be the towel for you.

My husband uses Now Foods Glucose Metabolic Support to help control high blood sugar. He started taking this product four months ago, and after ninety days, his blood sugar had moved back into the normal range. It is an automatic reorder for him. n fairness I should add that he's careful about his starch and sugar intake, but also that he's the only member of his family not to have acquired diabetes.

We bought three of the trash cans and these lids to store wild bird seed and chicken scratch in our garage. I like how well the lids fit onto the containers and provide space-saving storage. They're even stackable so are a win-win for us. High quality and perfect for our needs. Should've bough the sets a lot sooner.

I recently received for review Make it Paleo II, the new cookbook by Bill Staley and Hayley Mason, along with Hayley's sister, Caitlin Grace Nagelson. I'm familiar with Bill and Hayley's other books, having copies of Gather: the Art of Paleo Entertaining and the first Make it Paleo, both of which I love. I hadn't known about Hayley's younger sister who is a notable sushi chef. Credentials aside, I am blown away by the beauty of this book and the wonderful recipes the trio have presented.The book is divided into three sections, the first, as one might expect, an introduction to what is Paleo, the basics, ingredients, tools, cooking techniques and more. I was happy to see an explanation of why a small amount of white rice (considered an ancient grain, since cultivation began perhaps as far back as 12,000 years ago) and potatoes might be acceptable additions to a Paleo diet. (A cautionary note: even though one might tolerate this nightshade member, it's not going to help with weight loss.)The middle--and largest--section presents the recipes, each accompanied by a spectacular photo (by Bill Staley) of the finished dish. There are nine sub-sections,starting with Meat and going down the line to Poultry and Eggs, Seafood, Plants, Sauces and Dressings, Basics and Projects, Drinks, Savory Things and Sweet Things. I began my culinary experimentation with the Lamb Barbacoa Tacos (p. 80). Included are recipes for a Pico de Gallo to serve over the meat and wonderful, crepe-like tortilla, big as one made with wheat flour. The dish is not complicated, though it takes four hours in a slow cooker. The flavors are outstanding. The Beef Daube (p. 60) is another winner. The recipe calls for beef stew; I used a grass-fed chuck roast cut into one-inch chunks.Next on my list is the Orange Chicken (p. 128). It has a batter made with arrowroot starch and so closely resembles non-Paleo battered coatings. Orange zest tops the orange-y sauce. My favorite sauce has to be the Carmelized Maple Balsamic (p. 234) which can be used on salads or ice cream. In the dessert section, I was amazed at the beautifully made Nut-free Tart Crust. So many Paleo pastries show pie and tart crusts that look a bit...uh...homemade. Not this one. As a tart lover, this is definitely on my "to-try soon" list.All Paleo books strive to showcase their recipes and tips in a different way, offering something unique. I like Make It Paleo II on several levels including the sections on kitchen tools and how to adjust for particular dietary requirements. But in the end, it has to be the recipes that draws one to a particular book. Make It Paleo II contains many recipes that reflect my own food favorites. This is a masterpiece in culinary instruction with really good-tasting recipes I will use time and again. Bravo Bill, Hayley and Caitlin.UPDATE: This week I made the Skillet Chicken Thighs (p. 136). Oh. My. Goodness! What an amazing recipe. Stupid easy simple, too. Just be sure to buy skin-on, bone-in thighs (I used Mary's from my local natural food store). Hayley gives her simple tip for boning the thighs (and suggest you save the bones for bone broth). This is a quick, comfort food, and the crispy chicken, Mediterranean olives and artichoke hearts add an extra measure of wonderfulness. Make sure you use an oven-proof skillet so you give the dish its full 25 minutes in a hot oven. As with me, this might just become your next favorite chicken dish.

Since switching to a Primal/Paleo lifestyle, I use more fish sauce than ever before. Red Boat adds that perfect umami note to all my soups and stocks and much more. How delighted I was to find two large bottles for sale on Amazon. These are perfect pantry additions and very high quality. Highly recommended.
I purchased two set of these organizers for my children. They are ideal for a binder where family recipes can be kept and retrieved in minutes. Very nice quality and useful.

I use almond flour instead of wheat flour for my baking needs. Bob's Red Mill is convenient and economical when bought in the four pack. I love the quality and have made this my go-to product for all baking needs.

NOW Foods Cinnamon Bark is a high quality, yet inexpensive alternative to pricier brands. Hy husbands takes cinnamon to help with high blood glucose. Now, following a careful diet and taking cinnamon bark, his blood glucose is back in the normal range.
I bought these in two colors to make cultured sea glass earrings. They are beautiful and lightweight. Love them.

We bought three of these containers with lids to store our wild bird seed, laying pellets and hen scratch. They easily hold a fifty-pound sack of feed and the lids fit securely. We chose these because of their space saving feature and that they are stackable. Perfect for our garage and still allows parking space for a large sedan. Pricey but worth it.

I spent a long time trying to make a decision between this heater and the Aqueon 06105 Pro Heaters Submersible Aquarium Heater, 50-Watt.  Finally, I presented a question here and on the product page for the Aqueon, asking reviewers which they would choose "today" (it's the end of October 2015 now).  Overall, the most resounding answer was to choose the Eheim.Both of the Eheim and the Aqueon have very attractive features.  One thing I thought about was that this heater has a 3 year warranty, while the Aqueon has a life-time warranty.  Also, this heater is made with glass as opposed to Aqueon's aluminum.  Despite that, it seemed that the Eheim had better features when it came to even temp control and easy to access and read thermostat controls.This heater comes pre-set at 80 degrees.  After some initial adjusting, I found that it's keeping my 10 gallon tank at 80 degrees with the thermostat set at 75.  The weather is a bit warm right now, so I might have to adjust the thermostat as the temperatures get much colder.  One thing to bear in mind is that this 50 watt heater is around nine inches in length.  That's a lot longer than any aquarium heater I've used in the 50 watt size.I really like that I can easily see the numbers on the thermostat dial.  Also, because the heater is so tall, the thermostat dial is very close to my aquarium's surface.  All this makes it very easy to set the thermostat without endless fiddling, or worse, having to take the heater out of the aquarium.  When the heater is on, there is an easy to see amber indicator light.  The two suction cups that affix the heater to the wall are very effective.So far, I'm very pleased with this product.  I will update this review as time passes to let you know how things progress.  In the meantime, I'm posting some pictures from my initial experiences.Um, not sure what is up with Amazon, multiple copies of my phots keep showing up despite my removing them.

I'll begin by saying that I have never been disappointed by anything I've purchased from SubstrateSource.  They have always provided me with top notch plants.I received my package via 2-day air with tracking and insurance.  After opening my package and the internal plant wrapping, I was delighted to find TWO small plants.  They were vibrant green and they had well developed roots.  Per the enclosed instructions, I simply removed the gauze like floss around the roots, rinsed and planted.I write here to give you my initial experiences.  I intend to raise these two plants with a Zoo Med Reef Sun 50/50 Fluorescent T8 Bulb 15 Watts, 18-Inch light.  Also, I intend use Seachem Flourish.  I've been experimenting with different Zoo Med lights.  I intend to update this review as time passes to let you know how things go.I'm not sure why, but my photos keep multiplying in repetition.

Wow, this detergent smells great!  We have also used the lavender liquid hand soap and the lavender surface cleaner by Mrs. Meyer's, so we had an idea of what to expect as far as scent.  It gets our clothes just as clean as Ecos detergent (which does a good job).  The scent is not overpowering, just clean and floral.Something to consider with regard to our experience:  We have a high efficiency front loading Whirlpool Duet washer in which we wash super large loads.  If the Whirlpool recommended amount of detergent is not used, the clothes do not come clean.  Therefore, we often have to use almost twice as much detergent as the Mrs. Meyer's suggested amount.  With our high efficiency washer, we save more in the long run.. but for us, we have had to keep detergent quantity requirements in mind  when counting how many loads a bottle will yield.

I find these sandals to be very comfortable.  For me, they were true to size; they fit perfectly.  Also, the color of the sandal strap is nice.  I got the Blue Mosaic, and it's a nice touch.  I can wear these all day without discomfort.  One last thing, I have a very high arch and these sandals nicely accommodate that.

Ok, I have to admit, it's a little awkward writing a review about underwear... but here goes...  I had to write something about this order because I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of these briefs.  They are well made with material that isn't skimpy.  They are don't have tags, so you don't have to worry about that irritant.For such a good product, I was very surprised at how relatively inexpensive they are.  Actually, I'm shocked.  If you figure in 7 pairs of briefs, well the individual price is amazing!For me, they ran true to size.  They fit perfectly (plus, they are returnable at no cost if they don't fit you - as of 10/25/2015).  This is one of the better purchases I've made here on Amazon.

Depending on your intended use for this light, this light may be ideal or it may fall a bit short your expectations.  I purchased this light in search of light that would be good for our live plants while still providing the light spectrum for ideal fish color enhancement.  To that end, I actually ordered this light, the Zoo Med Coral Flora Sun Plant Growth Bulb T8 15 Watts, 18-Inch, and the Zoo Med Reef Sun 50and50 Fluorescent T8 Bulb 15 Watts, 18-Inch.  In this review, I intend to help you determine which light might be best for you.After the Zoo Med Coral Flora Sun Plant Growth Bulb T8 15 Watts, 18-Inch, I found the Trichromatic to be the next best for maximum plant growth. This light is more in line with "sunlight" and is in the "yellow" light spectrum. This probably provides the most natural looking light of all. After using this for a while, I noticed that algae growth was stimulated. Plant growth was very good.  In contrast, the Coral Flora Sun Plant Growth Bulb has a tones that fall more into the red spectrum (sort of a pinkish).  The Ultra Sun definitely provides a more natural appearance.  If that's your goal, then this light might be good for you.While the Zoo Med Coral Flora Sun Plant Growth Bulb T8 15 Watts, 18-Inch seemed to provide the most ideal light for plant growth, my family and I really don't care for the pink hues it casts in our aquarium.  The aquarium is still quite beautiful, but we can't help but compare it to the other two lights.  Ultimately, though, it is this light that we use most of the time.  When we have guests over or when we want a change, we briefly switch over to the next light...The Zoo Med Reef Sun 50and50 Fluorescent T8 Bulb 15 Watts, 18-Inch is our favorite of these lights.  This light casts hues that are in the "blues."  As such, we feel that the colors of the fish really stand out under this lighting.  The one drawback is that the lighting is less than ideal for live plants.  After a couple weeks of exclusive use, our plants looked a bit less healthy.  So, we alternate the 50/50 light with the Coral Flora Sun.  We really don't use the Trichromatic light because we don't care for the "natural" look.  We actually prefer the other lights because of how the fish colors are enhanced (particularly the blue colored fish).  This might not suit your taste, so if natural is your goal, the Trichromatic could be best for you.  Again I caution, algae growth will likely be stimulated.As a side note, I've noticed that Amazon's prices for these light fluctuate greatly.  Sometimes they are a bargain compared to pet shops, and sometimes they are ridiculously high.  If price is important to you, you might want to do some price comparing before you buy.I wish you much success with your aquatic hobby.  I hope my comparisons have given you some insight on these products.  If you happen to be near a tropical fish store, you might want to call them to see if they use any of these lights.  That way, you can visit the store to see for yourself how these lights look in an actual aquarium.  If you have any questions about my experiences with these lights, please feel free to ask me in the comment section.

I've found that SubstrateSource is very reputable.  For me, purchasing a plant sight unseen seemed pretty risky, so I had low expectations. In my case, I ordered three plants from SubstrateSource and all arrived in excellent condition (the only blemish was some slight yellowing, no doubt due to not having a light source for a short period).  This plant was anchored in a substance that has a sort of fiberglass consistency.I bought this plant in December 2014.  It's now early August 2015.  My aquarium lighting is not the best, but I do use a Zoo Med Coral Flora Sun Plant Growth Bulb with some effectiveness.Keep in mind, please, that this plant grows VERY slowly.  That being said, it really seems to thrive under my light conditions.  Below is a photo of the plant today.  It's leaves have spread out a bit.  Since it's low growing, it makes a good foreground plant.I've very happy with this purchase, and I recommend SubstrateSource.  If your worried about a "mail-order plant," this company is top notch.Special Note:  When ordering two or more plants at the same time, Substrate Source combines shipping cost and that reduces overall cost.

This is a very sweet picture book that beautifully expresses how everyone gets angry... but also how everyone eventually gets happy again.  There's even a touch of whimsy when the book describes how the pet dog and the local squirrel get angry too.The illustrations in this book take up the whole page (which, on Kindle Fire, is a large horizontal format).  This book is great for teaching young ones about their natural emotions.  It's also a great book for beginning readers.  Thumbs up on this one!

I am a transplant to Georgia, so I need all the help I can get when it comes to how to grow things here.  I borrowed an older version of this book from our local library, but I'm not very good at returning books (it was becoming more of a donation arrangement).  In any case, since this book has information that is helpful all year long, buying a copy really made better sense.I very much enjoy reading this book and the advice is truly helpful.  Also, there are some interesting tidbits of information that are nuggets of good advice.  For example, July is a good month to sow more zinnia seeds since they are quick to mature and can provide another round of flowers.This book is a marvelous reference guide for any Georgia gardener (regardless of whether you are planting vegetables, flowers, shrubs, etc.).  I'm sure I will be consulting it for years to come.

This soap is one of the best smelling I've ever tried.  A basil scent might seem odd sounding, but trust me, it really works.  It's nice to know that this produce is all natural.  It moisturizes really well and is not irritating at all.  It easily gets your hands clean.As one of the best soaps I've ever tried.  It also makes makes for an unusual and luxurious gift.UPDATE 07/29/2015:  I just wanted to add a few comments to help you make an educated decision on buying this soap.  Keep in mind that this is a natural product.  As such, there aren't chemicals to make it lather like mainstream hand soaps.  Also, the basil scent is rather "sweet," so if you feel that might be cloying, you might want to try the lavender variety.

I know this soap is expensive, however... This soap is amazing!  If you like lavender scent, then this is the soap for you.  What's best is it's very gentle on the skin.  It also perfumes your whole bathroom as it sits in your soap dish.  Just take a look at the ingredients I've listed below and you'll see that this soap is purely natural.I'm going to list some of the information on the bar (as well as ingredients in case you have any known allergies):All-One Hemp LAVENDER PURE - CASTILE SOAP MADE WITH ORGANIC OILSINGREDIENTS:  Organic Coconut Oil, Organic Palm Oil, Sodium Hydroxide, Water, Lavandin Extract, Organic Olive Oil, Organic Fair Deal Hemp Oil, Organic Jojoba Oil, Lavender Extract, Sea Salt, Citric Acid, Tocopherol

Well, it's happened.  My baby girl is growing up.  We have found that this soap is amazing when it comes to taming oily skin.  It also helps with getting rid of pimples more quickly.I actually started using it after I come in from gardening.  It cuts through grime and residual sunscreen really well.  One thing though:  If you have dry skin, you might want to apply a non-comedogenic cream just to keep you skin from drying out.Here's what it says on the back of the box (I've also listed ingredient in case you have any known allergies as well as 800 number for questions to can directly ask Neutrogena):Break the Breakout CycleNeutrogena Cleansing Bar, Acne-Prone Skin Formula is recommended by dermatologists.  It provides effective yet gentle cleansing for skin and acne.-Pure, gentle cleansing- Hypo-allergenic formula won't over-dry while it gently and effectively cleanses away excess oil from the skin.-Superior rinsability- Rinses completely, leaving skin free of residue which can interfere with the effectiveness of acne medications.-Won't clog pores- Clinically tested to be non-comedogenic, so it won't clog pores.INGREDIENTS:Triethanolamine, TEA Stearate, Sodium Tallowate, Glycerin, TEA-Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Cocoate, Water, Sodium Ricinoleate, Sodium Oleate, Cetyl Acetate, Cocamide MEA, Sodium Stearate, BHT, Tocopheryl Acetate, Tetrasodium Etidronate, Acetylated Lanolin Alcohol, Trisodium HEDTA, Fragrance (1347-018)If you have any questions, you can call Neutrogena at 1-800-582-4048 (USA only).

It provides effective yet gentle cleansing for skin and acne.-Pure, gentle cleansing- Hypo-allergenic formula won't over-dry while it gently and effectively cleanses away excess oil from the skin.-Superior rinsability- Rinses completely, leaving skin free of residue which can interfere with the effectiveness of acne medications.-Won't clog pores- Clinically tested to be non-comedogenic, so it won't clog pores.INGREDIENTS:Triethanolamine, TEA Stearate, Sodium Tallowate, Glycerin, TEA-Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Cocoate, Water, Sodium Ricinoleate, Sodium Oleate, Cetyl Acetate, Cocamide MEA, Sodium Stearate, BHT, Tocopheryl Acetate, Tetrasodium Etidronate, Acetylated Lanolin Alcohol, Trisodium HEDTA, Fragrance (1347-018)If you have any questions, you can call Neutrogena at 1-800-582-4048 (USA only).

It provides effective yet gentle cleansing for skin and acne.-Pure, gentle cleansing- Hypo-allergenic formula won't over-dry while it gently and effectively cleanses away excess oil from the skin.-Superior rinsability- Rinses completely, leaving skin free of residue which can interfere with the effectiveness of acne medications.-Won't clog pores- Clinically tested to be non-comedogenic, so it won't clog pores.INGREDIENTS:Triethanolamine, TEA Stearate, Sodium Tallowate, Glycerin, TEA-Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Cocoate, Water, Sodium Ricinoleate, Sodium Oleate, Cetyl Acetate, Cocamide MEA, Sodium Stearate, BHT, Tocopheryl Acetate, Tetrasodium Etidronate, Acetylated Lanolin Alcohol, Trisodium HEDTA, Fragrance (1347-018)If you have any questions, you can call Neutrogena at 1-800-582-4048 (USA only).

It has been over a month since I set up this aquarium (I wanted to review this after some time had passed to give you a better viewpoint of this aquarium).We have a very aggressive red betta with pink/purple highlights (very unusual).  We were keeping him in a breeding chamber in our community aquarium, but over time I felt that that was not a proper home for him.  So, I bought this aquarium to upgrade him to more palatial digs.  I have to say, he seems to love it.I need to tell you a few things that I did differently:1.  I immediately created a post filter sponge to slip over the output nozzle.  As others have noted, the force of the filter output is quite strong and our betta was swirling around in a vortex.  He did not like that at all!  However, after making this very small modification, everything works perfectly.2.  Instead of the filter media that came with the aquarium, I used the following:  A Seachem 100ml Purigen bag instead of the charcoal that came with the aquarium.  I also used Seachem Matrix for the bio-media.  I contacted Seachem to verify that these products would work well with this filter set-up and they said it would be more than fine.  The Seachcem 100 ml Purigen size bag is major overkill, the the Seachem representative told me that it would just mean that it would last longer.  Since the Purigen is pre-bagged, I just use it in this form because it's way more convenient for me.3.  I added a large Marino Moss ball and a small cave ornament with some artificial plants (after aquarium as some decent substrate, I intend to add some live plants instead of artificial).4.  I added a Cobalt 25 watt heater.  It's black and thin, so it is pretty unobtrusive.  It's an awesome product (although they can be expensive when not on sale).With the above modifications, this aquarium has worked extremely well for me.  Now, I'm not saying you need to do any of these things, I just want to mention how I've done it.  Lots of folk who've written reviews have set up this aquarium in very different ways.  My method is just one of many options.  All the additional things I'm using were purchased here on Amazon and the pricing was competitive, and in some cases, a real bargain.  One last very important thing.  I used Seachem Prime to remove chemicals before adding betta and whenever I've made water change.  Neutralizing harmful chemicals in tap water is very important, so make sure to use some product (not necessarily Prime) to purify your tap water.  I change the water about 30% every week and I vacuum the bottom waste with a siphon.Our aquarium has pretty well cycled (algae bloom is finished).  I think this aquarium is fantastic and I'm very pleased with it.  5 stars all the way!

This game is very addicting.  The concept is simple:  Match three or more colored orbs for a successful move against an opponent character.  You have lots of characters to play with and progress is challenging without being so hard that you want to quit.  One special thing that I like about this game is that the developers are constantly making updates and providing more content.  You have an option to pay for extra perks, but you can also play for free without pressure to buy stuff.  As a very young child, I watched Dr. Who back when it was broadcasted on Public Television (in some areas called PBS).  As a youngster, the monsters and villains were terrifying... but I still loved the show.  This game brings back some nice memories.If you grew up with Dr. Who, are a new fan, or just love science fiction games, you might end up really enjoying this one.  If you find "matching" games tedious... move on, this game isn't for you.UPDATE 2/25/2015:I wanted to add a few comments to the review I wrote yesterday.  I'd like to stress again that purchasing content is by no means necessary in this game.  Like most games of this type, it just speeds things along.  However, profits from proceeds of this game go back to the BBC to help continue their programming.One thing about the game developers really touched my heart.  A fan of the game wrote to the developers and told them he and his daughter relax to together while playing the game.  His daughter has some difficulties, so game play was hard for her.  Well, the developers actually prepared a special area in the game called "Anna's Playground."  This game area is easier to play, so virtually anyone can enjoy game play.  I thought that was most considerate.Yesterday I had a game question... so I sent an e-mail to Support.  I got a very polite response in less than 24 hours.  Very impressive.Also, I got my first weekly newsletter today.  In it are descriptions of special new limited time game bonuses and introductions of new content.I don't think I have ever come across a game where developers are so diligent and really care about their gamers.  Well done!UPDATE 7/2/2015:  I wanted to add some comments to my review.  I am still addicted to this game.  Substantial new content is added each week, so the game remains fresh.  I WANT TO CAUTION YOU:  My Kindle Fire HD had to be reset to factory defaults because it was getting glitchy.  While all my game progress and characters were preserved, my time crystals and time fragments were lost.  I don't really have a problem with this, but you show know about this from the beginning so you don't have a shock later.

I must admit, I had reservations about ordering such an item via mail order.  However, the fine reviews quelled my concerns and I decided to try it.  I was more than pleasantly surprised.  The positive reviews are correct.  The moss ball arrived with just the slightest yellowing on one side.  I suspect that that spot was simply the end it sat on... so it was not exposed to light.My daughter soaked the moss ball in filtered (non-chlorinated) water and rinsed it several times.  Then she molded its shape into a nice ball and placed it in our Fluval Spec (two gallon home of our betta).  It sank pretty well and remained stationary.  Our betta looked at it with some interest.  It's now been ten days since we received the moss ball.  It's lush and verdant.  The bonus baby ball is near it, so it looks like mama and baby (kinda cute).  Our betta likes to perch on the fuzzy ball from time to time.This was money well spent for a superior product.  I very highly recommend.

I bought this to go in our Fluval Spec 2 gallon tank.  It fits in the tank well and it looks nice.  I cringe when I see some of the artificial plants on the market, but the plants attached to this ornament are pretty decent looking.  The small cave in the center of the tree stump is just the right size for our betta to hang out in.  He went in for the first time (that I've seen) this morning.  He stayed there for a while with his head peeking out.The thing I'm pleased with the most is that the wood looks extremely realistic.  I'm exceptionally happy with its appearance.
