The Church presides over the Sacraments like Baptism, Confirmation, Marriage and Extreme Unction. There are considerable ceremonial activities of priests like the daily mass, baptisms, weddings and funerals. In addition, the Vatican itself has special ceremonies like Canonization of Saints. Hubbard's book studiously avoids treading on Church functions and prerogatives. Instead, The Evolutionary Testament of Co-Creation concentrates on the teachings of Christ as amplified by the Apostles.Overall, Hubbard's book begins a very important conversation which can happen beyond the boundaries of Christianity by extending to the highest spiritual levels attainable by an expanded consciousness.Immortality Commons

Hydrilla Verticillata is a highly concentrated raw form of B12 and calcium vitamins which is highly bioavailable and absorbed easily.The taste is absolutely pure for optimal immune system results-especially during a winter season. The preparation is 100% vegan and 100% raw vegetable powder.Hydrilla is perfect for health buffs seeking to obtain the highest degree bioavailable product to maintain good health. The package contains 150g. The recommended dose is 1/2 teaspoon to 1 tablespoon daily. At that rate, the package could last well over a month.The green powder may be added to a cup of hot water and mixed to taste like a refreshing tea before bedtime. There is no after taste as with products having artificial flavors and additives. A natural sweetener like stevia may be added to enhance the flavor. This reviewer asked for and received a free product sample for purposes of testing the raw green preparation for an honest appraisal.

Carpenter provides some excellent simple dinner recipes. Examples are Quinoa w/Kale, Mushrooms and Sweet Potatoes and many others. A theme of the book is to have less meat like in "meatless Mondays". Increasingly, more dieters are going veggie as a source of proteins and antioxidants.The meal preparation is very detailed with the time listed, ingredients and food content in grams. For instance, the number of grams of protein, sugar, fiber, fat and carbs are all listed prominently. Some preparations like the Quinoa w/Kale are non-gluten. These preparations are important for people who are sensitive to gluten or have gastrointestinal issues aggravated by eating gluten-based foods. Foods like quinoa may help with keeping the C-reactive protein (marker for inflammation) within the reference range.There are important substitutes for sugar; such as, anise, cinnamon and stevia. Overall, Carpenter's book will be very helpful for health conscious dieters who enjoy eating fine food without the penalty of too many additives or non-organic content.Immortality Commons

How Habits Influence Children by Anna Andersen is right on target with what small children need. With the advent of pre-kindergarten, parents and teachers have a once in a lifetime opportunity to engender good habits in children at an early age.The most important concept in this book is that children need to master things by doing rather than standing on the sidelines. The author advises parents to encourage enforced routines to do good. Remember that whatever parents teach will remain for life. Overall, this is a wonderful book for teaching children solid values and good habits.

Italy Travel Guide by Lak is a wonderful book covering many important sites like The Alps, The Coliseum, St Peter's Basilica, Brunelleschi's Dome and many other areas of interest. The presentation makes reference to the 20 regions in Italy, as well as, the 800 mile length of the country.The author explains the need to secure travel and health insurance. There are important details to settle when traveling through Italy; such as, the International Driver's Permit. Insuremytrip dot com is one of the important sites mentioned for insuring the trip.The guide mentions various therapies available in Italy like Clay Therapy and Inhalation Therapy. Overall, the presentation is very informative and timely. The price is affordable.Immortality Commons

CoQ 10 by Viva Labs comes in a good bioavailable form in a 100 mg form. The product is made in the USA. The container has 150 softgels or a 5 month supply.CoQ 10 is similar to Vitamin E in its active form. CoQ 10 helps energize cells and assist in exercise recovery. It is known to help the immune system and aid as an active anti-aging preparation. Deficiencies in COQ 10 have been linked to conditions like muscular dystrophy.Users can read more from Prescriptions for Nutritional Healing by Balch and Balch.The primary ingredients in this preparation are:o Co Q 10  100 mg.o Bio-Perine Black Pepper (fruit extract) 5 mgOther Ingredients:o Extra Virgin Olive Oilo Vegetable Glycerineo Beeswax and Geletino Purified WaterThe reviewer used this product and has found it helpful. A free sample was requested from Viva Labs in connection with evaluating the efficacy of this product.

Amino HD 1000 comes with 450 tablets. Users take 2 capsules per day and there is a 225 day supply which is sufficient for about 7  months. The components are L-Leucine, Isoleucine and L-Valine which act cooperatively. L-Leucine acts to protect the muscles and helps to normalize blood sugar. L-Valine serves to correct amino acid deficiencies and aids in muscular metabolism.The preparation is helpful-particularly in combination with workouts. The label says that there are no additives, starch, artificial ingrediets, gluten or sugar. Users can do further research of the branch amino acids utilizing references; such as, Prescription for Nutritional Healing by Balch. This reviewer asked for and received a free sample for review purposes.

The Ivation Universal Smartphone Camera Lens Kit comes with a number of very good features. For instance, the package comes with a 180 degree Fisheye Lens, Macro Lens, Wide Angle Lens, Universal Smartphone Clip and Pouch to store the kit. Each lens is easy to install and focus on objects.The images are absolutely clear and the color is rich. Each lens can capture detail right down to the fine print on keyboards or appliances. The beauty of this kit is seen in the ease of use and quick assembly. Connecting and changing each lens is simple with the sturdy universal clip. In addition, both lenses are made well and connect to the smartphone or cameraphone easily. The lenses are easy to clean and install. In addition, the metal housing on the components is made well as are the precision fittings. The accompanying pouch is very handy for storage purposes. Lastly, the diagrams on the face of the box are useful.Overall, the Universal Smartphone Lens Kit would be an excellent purchase-especially at the price offered. This reviewer asked for and received a product sample in order to make an assessment for review purposes.

You learn something new every day! Crystal Healing by Tiffany Rush is a very helpful resource which explains how crystals are employed to promote body wellness and harmony. There are many different kinds of crystals like elongated ones, chunks, clusters, tumblestones and cuts.The stones are utilized to promote energy, balance the chakra, promote harmony and manifest love. The book explains how to cleanse crystals and dedicate them to specific desires. Crystals may be used to help us visualize conceptd, as well as, breath through meditation sequences.Stones are employed for different purposes. For instance, the red jasper is used to promote endurance. The bloodstone is employed to promote circulation. Practitioners may use crystals along with magnets and acupuncture to promote healing.Overall, Crystal Healing by Tiffany Rush is a very helpful resource for prospective practitioners of the art.

The Dalai Lama by Orlando Woods is an excellent book which explains the dynamics of Buddhism. The book begins with explaining that Buddhism is a philosophy of life or way of living. Enlightenment is reached via compassion, mindfulness and meditation. The idea of Nirvana comes to a climax when suffering ends.Woods explains some history about Tensin Gyatso (1935-Present) who is the current Dalai Lama or Ocean of Wisdom. The idea of an Enlightenment stems from selfless love and compassion. Woods explains that every person is a teacher because he/she is a repository of personal experiences which add up to accumulated wisdom over decades of living. In Buddhism, the idea of making a pilgrimage to a place like India or Tibet is important. Islam also attaches importance to the idea of making a pilgrimage to Mecca.As practitioners of Buddhism, it's important to analyze lessons learned in life.Overall, The Dalai Lama by Woods is a wonderful book on the increasingly important subject of Buddhism and living life through prayer, meditation and selfless compassion.

250 Random Facts Everyone Should Know by Tyler Buckhouse has some excellent pearls of wisdom. The contents could be debated extensively at any party or family get together.Some of the lesser known facts include the following:o Pigs can't look up at the sky.o A crocodile isn't able to chew.o Humans can live without food for a month.o Dogs have a keener sense of smell than humans.o Jelly fish prefer salt water.Overall, the book will round out your knowledge of science in just about every area. This book is loaded with interesting tidbits which could be debated for hours at a time.

Meditation for Beginners by Aaron Hill is an excellent resource for learning the dynamics of meditation. In short, meditation provides healing for the inner self, as well as, stress relief. Major religions have found a benefit through meditation. Examples are Buddhism, Judaism and Hinduism.Meditation has been employed to heal body systems like immunity, muscular-skeletal systems, arterial blockages, hormones and emotions. Proponents have found benefits in keeping the posture erect, enhanced breathing and deep contemplation.Overall, Hill's book is an excellent resource for health buffs interested in healing spiritually and psychologically, as well as, physically.

Fairy Tales Every Child Should Know by Mabie is a wonderful collection of classic tales. For instance, Hansel and Grethel documents the food scarcity throughout the land and how the children coped with the scarcity. The story of the White Cat is about the life and times of a beautiful white cat kept by a palace prince. Everyone has heard of Sleeping Beauty in the Wood - a most amazing tale for children.There is a considerable list of short tales contained in this volume - all geared for young audiences. Examples are:The Golden Goose (Grimm's Fairy Tales)The Twelve Brothers (Grimm's)The Fair One With The Golden Locks (From the tale by the Comtesse d'Aulnoy)Tom Thumb (first written in prose in 1621 by Richard Johnson)Blue Beard (from the French tale by Charles Perrault)Cinderella; or, The Little Glass Slipper (from the French tale by Charles Perrault)Puss in Boots (from the French tale by Charles Perrault)The Sleeping Beauty in The Wood (from the French tale by Charles Perrault)Overall, this book is a huge value because it consolidates many of the most important classics for children.

The book is easy to read with plenty of illustrations showing how the stitches are made. The book illustrates classic stitches like the simple stitch, double, knit stitch, cross stitch and others.The presentation contains an extensive depiction of the flexible Afghan hooks with accompanying widths and sizes. In addition, the author explains how rows can have two passes, as well as, instructions on how to keep loops on the hook.This book would be helpful for consumers interested in crocheting with a particular emphasis on Afghan styles. Readers can use the "You Tube" as another reference to help with visualization. There are ample diagrams in this book. As a practitioner of arts and crafts, this reviewer believes that readers will need plenty of practice to learn the techniques over time.

"Handmade Jewelry" by Kristina Austin is a rare gem on the mechanics of making your own jewelry. Kristina goes through the details of specifying the requisite tools like scissors, needles, thread, nose pliers and silicon adhesive.The book is illustrated in full color with depictions of the double stretch bracelet, the plastic and chain bracelet, chain necklaces and much more. This wonderful book would be useful in making your own bracelets, as well as, repairing existing jewelry you own."Handmade Jewelry" is an arts and crafts masterpiece for people looking for a viable hobby. At the current price, the book is a tremendous value.

The Ketogenic Diet Cookbook by Kole is an excellent resource for transitioning from harmful carbs to veggie and good fat foods.The book explains the necessity to transition to ketosis to break down fats. This process takes about two weeks to accomplish fully.The first step in this process is to get rid of blatant carbs like cookies, cakes, breads and pastas.The author provides a plethora of delicious preparations to accomplish this task of achieving ketosis.Dieters should review these food preparations with their physicians and/or nutritionists. In addition, the individual blood chemistry and urine chemistry are important tools in fine tuning any diet. Sometimes, an allergist can be helpful in identifying foods that can be problematic like gluten or alcohol.The book documents meal preparations like Cauliflower Waffles and Salmon w/Green Beans. Overall, this book is an important resource for dieters and health conscious consumers everywhere. At the price offered, the book is a great value. The author should have made a statement requiring users to review their individual diet choices with the personal physician on the case.

Smoothies and Juices by Alisha Abbott has many excellent preparations packed with valuable fiber and anti-oxidants.Favorite smoothies consist of titles like All Fruit, Mango Peach, Pacific, Avocado and Fig.The layout of the book is good.The ingredients are set forth in great detail, as well as, the exhaustive directions. These all-natural preparations would be perfect for any meal, as well as, parties or serving random guests.Overall, the book would be very helpful for health conscious consumers and dieters alike. At the current price, the book is a huge value.

This book is huge. There are hundreds of easy to interpret recipes. Examples include summer salad, slow cooker squash, lentil vegetable ( a personal favorite), miso soup ( another personal favorite) and broccoli soup.The directions are exhaustive and easy to read. Most of these preparations are classic health foods with tons of anti-oxidants and fiber.This book is a physician's delight for patients.At the current price, buy it now because the price will certainly go up soon enough.

Low Fat Vegan Recipes by Jack Green has some very interesting preparations for dieters and health conscious consumers.For instance, the Acai Banana Berry Bowl is nutritious and delicious.The contents are loaded with healthful anti-oxidants.The Cajun Bean Soup is a marvelous lunch dish packed with protein with a trace of fabulous southern cooking.The Vegan Pasta Fagiole is a spicy Italian dish packed with fiber and protein.Overall, these dishes are to die for figuratively. The reviewer's only enhancements to this book would be to include pictures of sample preparations and prepare the meals with stevia instead of white sugar.

Quinn's book is interesting and informative.For instance, the author discusses the importance of pruning in your herb garden, as well as, the classic drying techniques to remove moisture and inhibit bacterial growth.Dried herbs are easy to store and reuse.The author explains the importance of harvesting during specific times like the early morning. Exposure to direct sunlight is a classic method for drying. This reviewer does this with herbal teabags. With proper drying in sunlight, a single teabag can yield up to 10 or more cups of tea. The cost savings are huge!Overall, How To Dry Herbs is an important resource for drying herbs like sage, mint, basil, cilantro and many others.

Fruit Infused Water by Nick Bell is an excellent book on the mechanics of adding fruit tastes to water.The author begins by explaining that water aids in weight loss because we feel fuller. In addition, water helps our metabolism. Pure water avoids the dangers of metabolic syndrome and the attendant stubborn fat which is hard to dissipate.The author provides specific combinations like Raspberry-Lime, Triple Citrus and Strawberry Lemon. There are herbal combinations like Mint with Plums and Apples. Overall, this is a good book for putting a trace of fruit into your water. This is infinitely better than diet soda which can cause problems with the metabolism and even impact the blood chemistry.

Backpacking for Beginners by Lewis Parker is a wonderful book which contains the essential elements of this most amazing sports hobby.The author urges prospective backpackers to travel light yet well equipped with things like a protective stick, compass, candles, toiletries other necessities.In addition, be aware of the dangers of parasitic transmission in woody areas. There are products out there like Iaso tea to help combat parasites.The author provides caution in problem areas like dehydration, language translation problems and much more.Cheap backpacking locations are provided like Eastern Europe, Africa, Asia and South/Central America.Overall, this is a wonderful book for prospective backpackers everywhere.

Mini Farming by Alice Bolden is a wonderful book which illustrates how to grow an indoor garden on a small budget with constrained living space.The advantages of an indoor garden are numerous. These include improving the air quality, growing fresh produce and using space efficiently by growing plants in vertical columns.Bolden discusses how to nourish the soil with things like compost or organic matter we would normally throw out. i.e. grinds, apple peels, banana fragments, lettuce stems and much more. The book indicates that the plants should be proximate to natural sunlight in a well ventilated space.The book provides lots of ideas on potential plant candidates. These are tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, peace lily, shamrock, parsley and peperomia to name just a few.Overall, Mini Farming is a gem which is being made available at a highly competitive price.

Ricafranca's "30 Day Abs Challenge" is well illustrated with the torso positioned strategically for each exercise. There are red arrows pointing to the body part which needs to be flexed properly.The author illustrates the plank, the bicycle, kick, reverse crunch and the spider plank. These exercises require repeated performance- that's why the author has developed them for a 30 day period These types of exercises are important to maintain good spinal flexion in both the young and old.A strength of the presentation is that the exercises are well developed and illustrated so that a prospective athlete can perform the steps without the assistance of another person. Overall, this book would make a wonderful purchase for anyone contemplating a serious abs program.

The Stainless Steel Manual Juicer is virtually indestructible. It's easy to assemble, use and clean. This juicer is perfect for squeezing lemons, lime or oranges with ease. The pits collect at the top and the fresh juice falls to the bottom. There is no mess in the cleanup which can be accomplished with fresh water. This reviewer asked for and received a sample for review purposes.

This is a great high volume water filtration kit. It is quite handy for camping, hiking, or to keep for emergencies.I tested the 12 Liter unit. I first tested it at home with tap water. I wanted to see how it works before I took it into the field. With clean tap water I filled the bag then hung it from a door. I set up a jug below the clean water outlet and it started dripping away. The entire bag was empty in under an hour and gave me just over three gallons of water.We then took it onto the Appalachian Trail for a long hike. We brought empty water bottles which we used for drinking water. We stopped at the Delaware river, filled the bag, hung it from a tree and filled six 1 liter bottles in 24 minutes. I emptied the bag, rolled it up, and put it in my pack. We then hiked for a few hours and refilled the bag from a different location on the river. We filled up all 6 bottles again as we ate lunch. We hiked again and filled bottles one more time that day.The water was good tasting and very clear. I do have to say, we used pretty clear water to begin with, but it was river water which I would not feel comfortable drinking unless it was a life or death emergency. We did come across a murkier pond but I did not really want to use that water in my nice, new water filtration unit. I do think it would have worked, but I did not want to muck it up testing it.I have a few other portable filtration devices that I normally carry when hiking. They are smaller, more compact. While this unit is pretty compact when rolled up, the capacity is a bit large for when I hike alone. It is quite good for a larger group of hikers.I cleaned the unit when I got back home and dried it out. I then put it away. For me, this will get used when we do hikes in groups, but I will also pull it out for emergencies. We have had a few incidents where we were left without power for many days at a time over the last few years. Clean drinking water is always an issue during those times. This unit is a nice addition for just those times.Sample provided for review purposes.

We always seem to be needing just one more lightning cable around here. And the long ones are the favorites. The 10 footer allows me (or any family member) to use the device while it is plugged in. Normally a 3 footer is a bit short as we only have one chair in the house that is directly next to an outlet. With the 10 footers every chair in the house is now close enough to sit and use the device while charging.These are good cables of good quality.Sample provided for review purposes.

This feeder plate works very well on my Dillon case feeder. I took a chance on this because I had read it works well on a Dillon, and was also less expensive. Very happy I gave it a try as it works just as good as the Dillon feeder plate.The sizing is almost exactly the same. The clutch mechanism works well in the rare occasions where I get a jam. I do get an occasional upside down case, but I have not heard heard of a case feeder that can guarantee all cases will drop correctly. If I watch how many cases I feed into the case feeder and do not try to overfill it, I find the upside down cases are even more rare.Overall I am very happy with this case feeder plate.

This charger does not work on my IPhone 6 Plus unless I remove the case first. I have more than a few cases and even the thinnest case does not contact the charging plug enough to charge my phone. This is a very poor design.I have read other reviews where the reviewer has cut and modified the charger plug. I may try that, but probably won't for two reasons. 1, it will leave an ugly cut line and I do not want ugly on my desk. 2, I shouldn't have to modify a product to get it to work.

This feeder plate works very well on my Dillon case feeder. I took a chance on this because I had read it works well on a Dillon, and was also less expensive. Very happy I gave it a try as it works just as good as the Dillon feeder plate.The sizing is almost exactly the same. The clutch mechanism works well in the rare occasions where I get a jam. I do get an occasional upside down case, but I have not heard heard of a case feeder that can guarantee all cases will drop correctly. If I watch how many cases I feed into the case feeder and do not try to overfill it, I find the upside down cases are even more rare.Overall I am very happy with this case feeder plate.

This is a decent looking case. It has good grip yet still slides easily into and out of my pocket.The case has a front cover, which is nice sometimes. There are many times where I leave my phone on a desk or table and still like some protection for the front glass. This front cover has a metallic slide bar so I can answer the phone without having to open the case. It does not appear to effect the microphone or speaker. The front cover also has a window towards the top where it shows the time and date, it also shows the caller id of any incoming phone calls.You can select menu items through the front window. That feature does not really work for me as I normally lock my phone requiring the touchid or a passcode, so I would have to have the front cover open anyway.My case came in black. Inside the case the color is red. It looks nice. The case also has the option of folding the cover back to tilt your phone at an angle, handy if you were watching a video, etc.Case provided for review purposes.

I do not have a lot of experience with compression socks, so understand I am by no means an expert here. I will say they do seem to work. I tested them on two long hikes on local trails. I have hiked there many times and usually my legs are pretty tired when done. Using these socks I did notice my legs felt much better when I finished hiking. I am assuming it is due to the compression socks not allowing as much blood to pool in my lower legs. Maybe? Not sure of the reason, but I did feel better afterwards.The socks fit well. I used a size Large and they came to just below my knee but fully encompassed my entire calf. I am 6' 1" and weigh about 220. I did like the fit. The toe and foot area is not as compressive, which is good for me because I do not like compressive or restrictive shoes or socks around my feet. For my lower legs the compression was nice. I did get a little bit of irritation after about 6 hours at the top of the sock on my right leg. I readjusted it and it seemed better. I will continue to wear these as they fit well and seem to help.

With more technology added to our house every year, but no increase in the available electrical outlets, having a two port fast charger makes sense. This unit is a dual 2.4 amp charger so it easily handles large charging loads like IPads and IPhones. It also charges devices safely that draw less current so it is safe for all your devices that charge through a USB port.The orange color makes it easy to find. The finish is a matt orange texture. Its a bit different because these items are usually a gloss finish but I like it. The plug folds in to make for a more compact, tangle free unit when traveling. Overall it is a good charger.Sample provided for review purposes.

While I normally do not review cardboard boxes, these do make my life easier, therefor deserving of a review.These boxes hold three loaded stripper clips. They keep my range bag neater when I throw in a few dozen boxes on my way to the range. Using the boxes and stripper clips I can reload faster at the range, saving time which I can use for more shooting.The boxes also allow for neater stacking at home. I am a big fan of neat, not in all areas of my life, but definitely in my reloading area. There are some things that demand neatness.I am careful with the boxes and stripper clips because they can be used over and over again.The boxes are shipped flat and need to be assembled. You can use tape, but I found using a hot glue gun works best. Its also much neater. Remember, neater is better?

I shoot a lot. Good problem to have. Range time can sometimes be long, so I try to do anything I can to minimize my non-shooting time at the range. These stripper clips can be loaded at home saving me plenty of reloading time at the range, which translates into more shooting time.The clips can be loaded bullet by bullet, but as the picture I uploaded shows you can load them directly from the bullet block. Its the block most new bullets come with. Just slide the strip along the base of the bullets to get 5 in. Lift the clip, snug the bullets, then turn it around and slide in another 4 bullets, lift then snug them up, then load the last bullet by hand. Doing it this way I can easily load up a thousand rounds in about 15 minutes or less.I use the boxes from new bullets and save the blocks. When I reload the .223, after case gaging I place the bullets into the blocks to make loading into the stripper clips easy.The loaded strips then go into stripper clip cardboard boxes which hold three clips for a total of thirty rounds. The boxes keep everything neatly stored on your range bag.The stripper clips and boxes are reusable so if you are careful with them they will last you a long time.

My desk is a mess. I have an IMac and a PC on it. I also have charging cables connected to both. The problem I have is that I have more than one phone. I have a personal IPhone 6Plus and then I have an IPhone 5S for work. I also have a Bluetooth Jawbone device for the work phone. My ports on the IMac are pretty much full, and reaching behind to swap cables is inconvenient.Here are my main problems, the Jawbone earpiece won't charge connected to the IMac, so it needs to be plugged into a wall socket. The two IPhones will charge connected to the IMac, but then they always update, download pics, etc. Sometimes I just want them charged, not synched.This USB Smart Charger resolves those issues for me. I plug it in, place it on my desk, and now I can charge both IPhones and the Jawbone at the same time. And I also have two spare ports in case I need to charge something else. No more CPU time going towards synching my devices while I try to work. No more having to charge one phone at a time because the IMac can only synch one device at a time.I tested the USB Smart charger for power load and found it can charge 2 Iphones, my Jawbone device, and 2 IPads at the same time. And they charged at a fast rate. The charger did not get noticeably warm. It appears to function perfectly for my needs. This unit is also smaller than my other USB Smart Chargers so I will take it with me when we go on vacation too.I was provided a sample for review purposes.

These patches are very thin and leave strands stuck on any somewhat sharp corner they get wiped across. I have to use multiple patches to get the right tension when cleaning the barrel. They are not nearly as absorbent as the cotton patches I was using. The only positive comment I can make is they were very inexpensive. But I guess sometimes you get what you pay for.

This cable works well to charge my IPhone 6Plus and my IPad. I have gone through a number of cables, some said they were Apple certified but would not charge all of my Apple devices. This one works well.I do not know about you, but I need quite a few charging cables in my life. I have a set-up on my desk. I have one on my nightstand. One in my car, and another in my wife's car. Then I need a few extra because my sons always seem to "borrow" my cables when they can't find theirs. So having a good cable that works, and is priced reasonably, is a great find.Sample provided for review purposes.

I have to say I am a bit impressed at the solid construction of this aluminum stand. It has a sturdy feel to it. It is adjustable for angle, making it easily viewable on my desk whether I place it on the low portion of the desk, or up higher near my monitor. The adjustment button is solid and holds well so it will not fall. The rubber feet give it good traction. It is painted with an "Apple like" color and texture so while it does not match my IMac perfectly, it is close enough where it does not look out of place next to my monitor.The only negative is that I cannot charge my IPhone 6Plus or IPad while it is sitting upright on this stand. I can turn the device sideways while it charges. If there was room to have the cable attached while sitting upright this stand would be perfect for me. Yes, that is a minor issue, but this is a review so I am just stating my thoughts. Overall this is a great product.Sample provided for review purposes.

I have been taking this for 25 days and have noticed a big improvement in recovery time. I am able to push harder, lift more, and recover faster than I was without this supplement. I have tried other BCAA and have been impressed with them too. I think it is a great supplement if you are looking to push yourself to new highs in exercise.I was sent this bottle at a discount for my honest review.

These are my first pair of leg compression sleeves. I can see why people like them. They do keep my legs feeling better on long runs or even days where there will be a lot of standing. I have noticed that they also seem to lessen the restless leg syndrome I get at night.I am not too crazy about the black color, as I am not really a fan of long socks. Maybe they could print them in a tattoo sleeve?  That would look much cooler.

This kit was added to my sons already large GoPro accessory collection. He was most excited about the head strap, chest strap, and the window mount. There are a lot of other mounts and clips, floating handles, and other items to make sure he can mount the camera to almost anything. All the parts are of decent quality and work well.

The print quality on this mat is not up to the usual great quality on my other Tekmats. I can read everything, but the printing is noticeably blurrier than on my other Tekmats. Its not bad enough that I will return it, but I am disappointed.The mat is thin, but more than adequate for my purposes of disassembly/reassembly and cleaning. It appears to be the same mat as my AR mat, so I am assuming it will hold up in the washing machine too.

Things I never knew...We play bocce at a couple of friends houses. I commented that my one friends balls were so much nicer. Don't get dirty on me, I am talking about the bocce balls. He told me he uses bocce ball polish, something I have never even knew existed. The balls were much cleaner and had a good grip to them when I handled them. They also did not appear to attract grit from the court, and the little they did attract seemed to wipe off easily.So it looks like I need to add polish to my list of items I need when I add a bocce court to my yard next season.

This is my first ceramic burr grinder, and I like it a lot. I have a mill grinder, but I am not crazy about it. This ceramic burr grinder gives me a lot more control over the grind size. It makes an excellent fine grind for espresso, so that makes me happy. The grinder is simple enough to use. fill it, set the grind size, crank away. It does smaller portions, which works well for me because I like that I can grind just what I need for each day. It also comes with a travel bag. I am leaving soon for vacation, its coming with me. No reason not to have good coffee while traveling.

After using this for a few days I did start to notice a difference in that I am getting a pretty good pump after lifting. After about two weeks I can definitely say my recoveries are getting better. I have less muscle soreness so I am able to push it harder and lift more. It seems to be only a pump amplifier, not the amplifier and energy mix like a lot of other similar products. I like it.

This roll of gaffers tape is very high quality. It works perfectly for temporary items that need to be held securely, but needs to be removed later without leaving the sticky mess that duct tape leaves in a temporary installation. The tape has a matte finish and a cloth-like feel to it. It rips cleanly and neatly making installation easy. It sticks to most surfaces I have tried, and sticks very well to itself.

I filled these bags with rice to make them lighter. The rice works just as good as sand.The bags are well made and come in three different sizes/configurations. They work very well for rifles but I have also used them to zero in my pistols.Excellent product which I am sure will serve me well for many years.

Set up for this camera was very easy. I plugged it in, then scanned the barcode with my IPhone, set up the wireless, and starting viewing live video.The cameras 115 degree field of view works well for my application. The daytime, or light feature provides a very good view in color. The IR/nightvision provides a monochromatic view, but gives plenty of detail too.I mounted the camera on a wall. I did have to use a wedge to get the proper camera angle I needed. It would have been nice if I could have rotated the camera head in the holder, but mine did not seem to want to move. Maybe it is not designed to move?After about a week I decided I wanted to hardwire the cameras. I ran Cat5 to each location and now have them connected to a server with NAS attached so I can record video. I used Blue Iris for that. I was able to adjust the sensitivity of the motion detector and also the size of the field. I set up alerts which send out emails if there is motion. It is very handy to be notified when I am away from home. I did have to adjust the sensitivity because I was getting some false alerts due to cloud cover during the day. A 1 second motion trigger works perfectly to avoid that problem.The audio feature works very well to. There is a two way communication feature which was very helpful when my son was looking for something in the garage. I was able to view and talk to him and steer him to the correct drawer for the tool he needed. I think I may have to get a few more of these and put one in the living room so I can tell my dogs to get off the couch. I am sure that will freak them out.Overall this is a very good camera in this price range. Very easy to set up and use. I am quite satisfied with it.

Installation was rather easy. I attached the clamp/holder to the stem of my bike, adjusted the angle, then tightened it all down with the supplied Allen wrench. My IPhone 6Plus fit in it easily after depressing the two side buttons to release the side holder arms, then squeezing them tight to close in on the phone to hold it.Having a phone mount is great, especially if I am using the GPS or mapping features of my phone. Having a phone holder that also has back-up battery capacity is even better because now My phone can stay charged for the long rides, even when I have the display lit for the entire ride while using the GPS.Overall this is  a good holder/battery combo for street riding or mild trail use.The only negatives I found were that it came with a micro-USB cable so I had to get an additional cable to use my IPhone, which uses a lightning cable. I also found out that when riding on rough trails the phone can be knocked out of the holder when hitting rocks, bumps, or just going very fast over rough terrain. On the street it held up great, but the trails near my house are a bit rough.

This case is listed as waterproof, and while I normally test all features on products, I did not submerge the phone and case to test this feature. I do feel pretty confident that if the phone drops into the water and I retrieve it relatively quickly that it will protect my phone. Or rather my sons phone because he really liked the bright colors and lets face it, he will drop his phone in the water before I do anyway so why not let him have it.The case is pretty easy to install. It even comes with a handy flat screwdriver that will fit on a keychain. There are two screws that secure the case sides together. Installation took me less than two minutes.The phone works and all features are accessible.  There was a problem when I tried it on my phone, I could not get the touchscreen to work. It was because I have a tempered glass screen protector on my phone. This case has a layer of screen protection and it appears that two layers of protection will keep the IPhone from being able to receive tactile input from your fingers. So limit it to one.

I could not get these glasses to fit well. Initial try had them sitting very lopsided on my face. I laid them on a table and found that one arm was much higher than the other. I was able to bend them and after a few tries got them to sit level.I tried them on again and realized they sit way too high on my face. While wearing them I could look down at maybe a 10 degree angle and I was looking under the glasses. I like a set of safety glasses that touches or almost touches my cheeks to keep projectiles from being able to easily reach my eyes under the glasses.I spent about 15 minutes bending and adjusting the the nose piece. When I was finally able to get the glasses sitting centered on my eyes the nose pieces were actually touching my eyelids. It was a bit uncomfortable and quite distracting.Ok, I know the bridge of my nose is a bit thicker than some. But I usually do not have much of an issue finding glasses that fit me well. So I tried them out on one of my sons. He is 19 years old and has a thinner nose than I do. I spent about 10 minutes readjusting the nose pieces to get a perfect fit for him. He also felt the nose piece came uncomfortably close to his eyes.The glasses arrived in a plastic bag. No case or cleaning cloth. I thought they might be a good, inexpensive set of safety glasses to keep for the times I have other shooters joining me that do not have gear. I think these might be good glasses fo hot climates because they sit so far off your face and could work well as sunglasses, but for shooting safely they do not work for me.

My first thoughts were that this would be great for camping and cooking breakfast on my Weber charcoal grill. I thought it would get put into my "camping" bin. Only to be pulled out once a year. But now that I have it I realize it is be useful for so much more.We cook outdoors a lot around here. This griddle opens a another avenue for us. Bacon is usually an issue at our house. We sometimes cook large amounts of it, and when the AC is on and the house is closed up, the bacon smell really stinks up the house. Cooking it outdoors is a much better solution. Sausages and peppers is another great thing to cook outdoors. I can grill the sausage and use the griddle for the peppers and onions.This fits very nicely onto the grate of my Weber OTG. It also fits nicely in my XL Big Green Egg. But I also used it to fry up onions and mushrooms on my propane Weber while I grilled burgers on the other side of the grill.This is a well made, heavy duty piece of stainless steel. I expect it to last a long time. The only negative thing I have found, and its minor and more of a problem the way I am using it as opposed to a design issue, is that the trough which catches liquids, can really fill up and be a bit hard to empty carefully if you cook a large amount of greasy food, like a few pounds of bacon. Don't ask me how I know this. To avoid a spill, just get in the habit of emptying it sooner, not later.

I have a few different pizza peels. I built a pizza oven in my yard a few years ago, so you tend to collect pizza related items after that. I do have to say I prefer a wooden pizza peel for preparing my pizzas. The pizzas seem to stick less to a wooden surface (coated with flour) and since they stick less, they have less of a tendency to stretch or distort horribly as I try to slide them into the oven. This is an issue especially since I really prefer thin crust pizza which are more fragile in the un-cooked state.I also prefer an aluminum peel with a long handle for rotating the pizzas and removing them once cooked. The longer handle keeps my arms from getting burnt and the thin aluminum slides right under the pizza.This wooden peel is quite sturdy and has a decent beveled edge to slide under the pizza. It works great as a pizza prep station and the pizzas slide off it into the oven quite easily. Once the pizza has cooked a bit this peel slips easily under the pizza so you can spin it for a more evn cook. It also works well for removing the pizza once fully cooked.I normally slide the cooked pizza onto a cutting board to let it sit for a minute before I slice it. This wooden peel could be used as a cutting surface too. I would stick to a plastic pizza cutting wheel because a metal one with too much pressure could scratch or gouge the peels face causing imperfections that could cause the pizza to stick. I like a smooth, mark free peel for my pizzas.

We purchased two of these lamps to replace some older units that sat on our nightstands for years. I wanted touch lamps because its sometimes hard fumbling for the on/off switch in the dark. I like that I can just touch anywhere on the base to turn the light on and then touch it again to adjust the brightness.  The lamps are medium sized which works perfectly for our bedroom and nightstands. No need to have giant lamps taking up a lot of space.  The brightness levels are good, the brightest could be a touch brighter, but overall I like these a lot.

This cable works with every Apple product I have tried. I currently use this one in my wife's car so my boys can charge their IPads. At 3.3 feet it is long enough to use in the car, but not too long where it gets tangled or caught while getting into or out of the car.Sample provided for review purposes.

This car charger has become the new unit for the back seat of my wife's car. My two youngest sons use it to charge their IPads. It will charge both IPads at the same time when you add a USB lightning cable to the USB slot on this charger. It has a clean, sleek design and works well. You really cant ask for more in a car charger.Sample provided for review purposes.

I normally do not clean the primer pockets on my pistol brass. I tumble it all and then throw it on the progressive press where it gets de-capped and processed into shootable brass again. That changed when I started loading large quantities of .45 brass. With LPP and SPP primer hard to separate 100%, I decided to de-cap the .45 brass first. That makes sorting for primer size much, much easier.Since I was de-capping first, I might as well clean the primer pockets a bit before tumbling. This tool does a good job of cleaning them. I do not get it perfectly clean, just knocking out the major dirt/tarnich/carbon. I then let the tumbler handle the rest. A simple twist in the primer pocket is enough. My primer pockets come out much cleaner and that makes loading a bit easier.

I am using this to replace the original temp gauge in my XL Big Green Egg. The original unit still works great, but there is condensation inside the glass that on really humid times of the year makes it difficult to read. This gauge is an exact fit for my egg. It was also dead on accurate right out of the box.I was surprised when I tested it, because I calibrate and test all temp gauges when new and once a year. The calibration/testing procedure is pretty easy, just do an Internet search for calibrating smoker temp gauges and you will find plenty of hits on how its done.

I am a fan of tempered glass screen protectors after seeing my friend drop his phone on the face and the screen protector shattered, but the glass on his phone was unharmed. I like glass much better than the feel of the plastic screen protectors. The idea of a "sacrificial" glass protector is great, especially for an IPhone 6 Plus, cause I don't even want to know how much that will cost to replace a broken screen.Installation was rather easy. This kit came with the tools to complete the job and easy instructions. The tools were a cleaning pad, lifting tape, and a soft cloth. I took my time installing this and the whole process only took me a few minutes.The tempered glass screen fits very well. The edges are nicely rounded. The touchscreen works as it should and the fingerprint ID functions properly too.

This grill gripper is handy for removing an empty grill rack off my Big Green Egg or Weber grill. The angle it grips the grill at is kind of awkward. I can use an overhand grip or underhand grip, but both feel a bit awkward. Not really too big of a problem because I normally only use this to move the hot grill rack to the side so I can add more charcoal. I only have to hold it for a few seconds, so the awkward grip is not too bad.The finish is a rough, chrome appearance with some sharpish edges. I store this outside, so far I have not had any rust issues.

There are two ways to clean the ash from your egg that I know of. One is to remove the grates and clean it from the top. The second is to pull the ashes out through the bottom door using something like this ash tool. Since I only remove the grates and plate setter to add more charcoal, I like to go with the second option of pulling the ash out the front door. I do that for most cleanings because it is easy, and if you are using a good lump charcoal you really do not get that much ash anyway.The second thing that I like this ash tool for is to slip it into the front door during a long cook to tap and unblock any holes in my lower grate that may be getting blocked with charcoal and ash.

This is my 3rd soccer net/trainer from SKLZ. They are great for my sons and really make practice in the yard much better. This 8' by 5' net is a great size for practice. Not huge, so the kids really need to place their shots well.Setting it up is very easy. My 9 year old and 11 year old are already experts at setting it up and tearing it down. takes them less than 5 minutes. The net and frame is high quality and pretty durable. I kick into it and my 19 year old son kicks into it full force and the net stops the ball. Its not like some of the cheaper nets where you feel like you will break it if you go full force on a kick. This net will take the abuse.Comment

I used these bulbs to replace my florescent bulbs. They give a bright, clear light that is a more pleasing to the eyes over my workbench. I need good lighting there as I do a lot of work, some of it very detail oriented and my eyes are not getting any younger, so good light is important to me. I have had these a few days and so far I am very happy with them.I am using these in my fixture without ballasts. When I put this into a ballasted fixture the bulb goes off after a short period. If I through the flourescents back it, the fixture works fine. These work great in the fixture without a ballast.The spectrum of light is very good. Its a bright and clear, great for a workbench area where you need bright light.

My first impression was "wow, that's heavy" then I looked closer and was happily surprised at the excellent quality of this base unit. This is the FCL Healthy Women Cute Short Straight Cosplay wig with Blonde Highlights. I really like this wig, the style is super cute. I think the shades of blonde in this wig are really nice. This is the Heavy Duty Scouring Scrubber Dish Cloth for Dishes and Cast Iron by The Crown Choice. OK, so we all need scouring scrubbers for our cast iron and stuck on messes. It isn`t so bad if you have something good to clean them with, it makes all the difference really.So I have tried metal scrubbers, they eventually rust and can be hard to clean themselves. I have tried many nylon scrubbers and the design causes them to get food stuck in between and inside that never comes off.These are different, they are thin like a wash cloth. They have the same scrubbing power as any of the others that I have tried, but they don`t rust and they don`t get stuck on food in them. Have you ever had professional framing done? It can cost a small fortune, and I've paid hundreds of dollars for custom frames MUCH smaller than the 24x36 size of this one. But when I wanted to frame a $5 art poster that I happened to love, I turned to Amazon for something a lot more affordable. Honestly, I was very hesitant to order a frame of this size at such a low price point, for fear that what I would receive would be absolute crap. But after reading so many favorable reviews, I decided to take a chance and I was glad that I did... if you keep your expectations calibrated to the price point of this frame, it's a five star buy. Here's what you should expect:First, do not expect to receive a five star quality frame of this size for less than $50. That's totally unrealistic. But you will get a good quality frame in which the compromises made to achieve this price point are all within reason. Just the specially designed, heavy duty corrugated packaging to ship this frame and have it arrived undamaged--which mine did--must cost quite a lot.Second, the frame itself is light beige MDF (medium density fiberboard), which is a very sturdy choice, and its surface has a vinyl covering in either the wood grain or solid color that you ordered. This may sound "cheap" but the result actualy looks very good--I ordered "Espresso Brown" and it's indistiguishable from the brown/black wood color of some IKEA shelving that surrounds it. The naked eye would not know that it's not real wood.Third, the shipping box is labeled "GLASS" in bold letters on all sides, but that's only to insure that the shippers will handle the box with great care. Smart move by Art To Frames! You would never get glass of this size at this price point, nor would you want it due to issues with weight, fragility and the greenish color cast of cheaper glass. What you do receive is crystal-clear acryllic, which has better clarity and greater scratch resistance than the polystyrene material often used by even cheaper frames of this size. The acryllic sheet will look AWFUL out of the box, until you remove the clear protective film layers on both sides of the sheet before mounting, which protect against scratches. Both sides of my acryllic sheet were completely scratch free, once I had removed the film and cleaned both sides of it with paper towels and Windex.Fourth, mounting is very straight-forward: put the acryllic sheet in the frame, lay the poster on top of it, secure it with the included corrugated cardboard backing sheet, then fold down metal tabs positioned all around the backing sheet to hold it tightly in place. This is an inexpensive solution, but it gets the job done. If the poster you're framing has any signifcant value, you're going to want to replace the corrugated backing board that comes with this frame with an acid-free archival backing board from your local art supply.Finally, you attach the hanging hardware, which is included as a complete set, including wire and wall hanger... nice touch! As a guide, my poster hangs horizontally (the longest sides are top and bottom), and I found that screwing the hangers into the frame 9 inches from the top gave me a really nice "hang" with the frame laying completely flat against the wall.One warning: I would avoid using the supplied hanging wire, or I would strip the plastic coating from it. Here's why: when you've threaded hanging wire through the hanger loop, the traditional way to secure it is to repeatedly twist the end of the wire tightly against itself. This seeemed to work fine with the supplied wire until I did a security test before actually hanging the poster on the wall. When I lifted the frame from the center of the wire, as it would be when hanging on a wall, the plastic coating on the wire proved too slippery and the twisted ends began slipping out. This would ultimately send your frame crashing to the floor or whatever was below it.  So, you can either strip the coating from the supplied wire, or buy uncoated hanging wire at your local hardware store. I happened to have some uncoated wire, which quickly solved the problem.All in all, I'm thrilled with the way my framed poster looks on my wall, and it has exceeded all my expectations at the price point.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find in helpful in making a buying decision.

Ella & Louis and its follow-up, Again, are two of my favorite jazz albums of all time. After buying various remasters over the years, I thought I had made a "final purchase" when I bought the SACDs from Analogue Productions. The sound quality, I felt, was absolute perfection, and all the more astonishing for a mono recording from the late 50s. The voices of Ella and Louis had a palpable presence in my living room, utterly natural sounding and convincingly right there. Instruments had the unmistakable weight, timbre and texture that they do when played live in a real space.So if I had reached audio nirvana, why bother buying this blu-ray? Good question. First, and most importantly, it contains all 19 songs from Again compared to just 9 songs on the SACD. (Many versions of Again are similarly truncated.) So the ability to have both albums complete on one disc was very appealing, especially at a price under $30. The SACDs, by comparison, are $30 each and contain 10 fewer songs. Second, there was the possibility that UMG had managed to wring even higher sound quality from the original master tapes, though I wasn't sure how that would be possible. Nevertheless, it seemed worth checking out.Well, enough with the preamble, let me get to the conclusion and explain from there: it didn't take much comparison to realize that, in terms of sound quality, the APO SACDs blow this Pure Audio Blu-ray away. The Blu-ray is a very nice recording. The SACDs are the unmistakable sound of real singers and real instruments in a live space. The difference is just that simple, and is not subtle or nuanced at all.Some caveats about this conclusion: if you only owned this Pure Audio Blu-Ray, you might be perfectly happy with it, unaware of its shortcomings without a clearly superior remastering against which to compare it. That said, I'm still happy that I purchased it for the 10 additional songs on Again.Also keep in mind that the superiority of the SACDs isn't going to matter if you're not set-up for SACD playback of the pure DSD stream. Otherwise you're left with the CD layer of this hybrid disc, which is simply not as good. Finally, I wanted to mention the playback system used for this comparison:For the Analogue Productions SACDs, it's an Oppo BDP-95 feeding the pure DSD signal via analog XLR to the passive pre-amp section of a Theta Gen VIII processor, then out via XLR to a Spectron Musician III Amp and Gallo Reference 3.5 speakers. All cables and interconnects are Cardas Golden Reference. For the blu-ray, it's much the same, except the Oppo is feeding a lossless, 24/96 PCM 2.0 signal into the Theta Gen VIII for decoding, then out via balanced XLR to the amp and speakers.Thanks for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

The MFSL SACD of Modern Cool, which I own, has enjoyed a long reputation as an audiophile classic. But I've actually never been a huge fan of it. To my ears, it has a very big, showy, demo disc kind of sound that might be great for impressing friends with your system, but it doesn't sound like the real thing at all, and I go frequently to hear live jazz in NYC clubs. In particular, I've never heard the bass so totally dominate the sound of a jazz group the way it does on the MFSL disc and, in general, the images of Barber's voice and other instruments are too big and unnatural. To be clear: I'm not saying that the MFSL sounds bad, because it doesn't, but if you like your jazz recordings to sound natural and live, it will prove to be disappointing.I wasn't aware that a Pure Audio Blu-ray of Modern Cool had been out there for a while, but I bought it immediately once I discovered the disc, hoping that it would be an improvement over the MFSL because I'm such a fan of the music on Modern Cool. I'm happy to say this purchase was worth every cent because the blu-ray addresses my main issues with the MFSL. Barber's voice is much more focused and natural sounding, as if she's performing live in my living room, as opposed to this huge image of her voice that occupied 2/3 of the space between my speakers. Similarly, the images of instruments are more focused and natural, as the Blu-Ray trades the showy, demo quality of the MSFL for a sound that's more like the real thing across the board. Lastly, the bass has been significantly tamed, and while I still find it a bit on the dominant side, it now sounds much more properly integrated with Barber's voice and the rest of the instruments.FWIW, Stereophile also preferred the sound of the blu-ray over the MFSL, and mostly for the same reasons I've noted above. So if you're as much of a fan of Modern Cool as I am, this is the version you simply must own. In case you're wondering about my playback system: for the MFSL SACD, it's an Oppo BDP-95 feeding the pure DSD signal via analog XLR to the passive pre-amp section of a Theta Gen VIII processor, then out via XLR to a Spectron Musician III Amp and Gallo Reference 3.5 speakers. All cables and interconnects are Cardas Golden Reference. For the blu-ray, it's much the same, except the Oppo is feeding a lossless, 24/192 PCM stereo signal into the Theta Gen VIII for decoding, then out via balanced XLR to the amp and speakers.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

Who knows how many shower radios I've gone through over the years? I lost count a long time ago, and I can't remember a single one of 'em as being more than just "adequate." Then, several years ago, I bought this Sangean H201 and have thoroughly enjoyed it during my daily shower ever since.Right out of the box, there's a high quality look and feel to this radio that impresses you--you know immediately that this is not your run-of-the-mill piece of consumer electronics junk. The reason for its higher price tag is more than evident. The design, especially the pale amber/orange illuminated display, is really elegant and features fine ergonomics. And you'll love the intelligent thought behind the hook system for hanging this radio from your showerhead.Radio reception is outstanding. I like listening to AM news radio when showering in the morning, and this is flat-out the best AM reception and sound that I've ever heard from any radio, bar none. And I say that as a resident of New York City, where AM reception is often terrible. FM reception and sound quality are also excellent.The single speaker on this Sangean may look small and and unassuming, but it will impress you with the clarity of its sound quality. And years of being in the damp environment of my shower hasn't diminished that sound quality at all.Battery life is so long from 2 D-cells, it's ridiculous. I find myself wondering all the time how it could still be running on batteries I haven't changed for as long as I can remember. And then there are the host of other conveniences: LED flashlight, 10 presets, a timed power-off option and accurate digital tuning.Last, but definitely not least, keep in mind that this Sangean is not just water resistant but is actually waterproof, and meets the tough JIS7 waterproofing standard. You can even drop it into the water without worries--it floats.So, given this glowing review, could there possibly be another radio you should consider? Actually, yes. In 2013, Sangean released the H202 as the follow-up to this model, although the H201 remains current, as well. The 202 seems essentially the same except for an improved LED flashlight and the addition of bluetooth streaming capability--for which you'll pay about 33% more. Neither of the new features is important to me and, since I've never used the 202 myself, I can't say for certain if it truly is "essentially the same" in build quality and performance.Thanks for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

My cat became obsessed with drinking from the sink, so I bought the Drinkwell fountain in hopes of changing that habit. Unfortunately, after just a few days, he ignored the fountain and was back at the sink. I deducted no stars for this, however, as cats are notoriously finicky on an individual basis, so there are never any guarantees--I simply mention it to advise those in a similar situation and thinking about buying this fountain that it may not be the solution you're seeking.The real problem, in a word, and the reason for the two stars is this: cleaning. The instructions emphasize the absolute necessity of a thorough cleaning every two weeks to ward off all manner of dire consequences for which Drinkwell will not be responsible if you fail to do it. Fair enough. Both the pump and the fountain, itself, must be cleaned, using special brushes for the task. So are those brushes included to perform this essential cleaning? No, you'll have to pay an extra nine dollars here on Amazon to get them from Drinkwell, but not so fast: read the reviews, and most say the brushes are absolute crap, and to save your money. So you're left to improvise cleaning tools, and even then it's virtually impossible to clean the muck from some cracks and crevices.If the above does not dissuade you from buying this fountain, then I suggest you get the version with the "Bonus 50-Ounce Reservoir" so you have a 100-ounce total capacity. Here's why: if the water fails to main a certain level, you can damage or destroy the pump, and you'll be surprised how quickly the level can drop due to the combination of your pet drinking and evaporation. The extra reservoir will give you peace of mind about the water level. Yes, this version does cost more, but is still significantly less than buying the reservoir separately. You'll find it here on Amazon as "PetSafe Original Fountain wiht Bonus 50-Ounce Reservoir." Note that PetSafe and Drinkwell are the same product.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find in helpful in making a buying decision.

First thing to know: I deducted no stars (obviously) because these didn't fit my Bergan Turbo Track. I really dislike reviews that downgrade a product for not doing something that it never claimed to do. I just didn't want others to make the same mistake I did, following another review here that states these illuminated balls are perfect replacements for Bergan. They are not, they are actually smaller and don't "lock" into the track, so my cat was able to bat them out almost immediately, swat them under a sofa and... well, you know how it goes with cats.  ;-)However, both balls worked perfectly, and the illumination was actually brighter and much more sparkly than my Bergan ball ever was when brand new. Since I have to rate based on my own experience with them, these get five stars for being exactly what they're supposed to be, but you also can't ignore reviews where reliability has been a problem, either right out of the package or shortly thereafter.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

Whether it's food for myself or my cat, I want the purest choice possible, free of chemicals, additives and fillers. This made it tough to find a treat I could feel good about giving my cat, since many had a paragraph long list of "ingredients." No thanks!Thankfully, I found PureBites here on Amazon, and food seriously doesn't get any more pure than this: one ingredient, freeze-dried chicken, USDA inspected. This is a healthy treat that's high in protein, low in calories... and my cat loves them! From one room away, he can now hear the sound of me handling the bag and comes running.Unfortunately... and despite the five star review... I can't guarantee that your cat will love them, too. Why not? Hey, we're talking CATS... who are notoriously finicky on an individual basis... so who knows? :-)  But based on the overall reviews, I'd say the odds are in your favor.One final tip: if you're cat enjoys these treats, start buying them in the 11.5 ounce size for dogs which you'll find here: http://amzn.to/SLNnss They are MUCH cheaper this way and exactly the same product, except the pieces are larger, so you'll have to break them up a bit.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, and I hope you find it helpful in making a purchase decision.

Leave it to Oxo to take a simple product like a kitchen utensil holder and smartly reinvent it in not one, but THREE different models! So while I liked this one enough to buy two of them, only YOU can decide which model suits the particular storage needs of your kitchen.The three models are alike in these ways: Stainless Steel and plastic construction Large capacity for about 16 large-handle utensils 3 separate compartments to organize utensils however you wish Easy clean-up of compartments when needed All three sell for the same priceWhere the models mostly differ is in their shape, and deciding which one will depend on your design taste and where you plan to store the holder: I prefer the aesthetics of this elliptical shape, it fits my countertop space well, and the tapered height of the side compartments allow shorter utensils to stick up more prominently in the holder, and not get lost amidst taller ones. The circular version of this holder rotates on a ball-bearing base, giving you access to all your tools in spaces that might be especially tight. The rectangular version doesn't appeal to me, personally, but it's perfect for storage space best-suited to that shape.SO this is a rare five star review that doesn't insist that this product is the best because Oxo has given us three different "bests" from which to choose! And no matter which one you pick, you'll have chosen a utensil holder that will provide many years of convenience and service.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a purchase decision.

As described on this product page and initially, in actual use, the Brabantia Napoleon Corkscrew seems just about perfect. Heavy duty construction, built-in foil cutters (good but finicky to position properly), general ease of operation, and a stand-up design for storage when not in use. I mostly had no complaints.And then, one night, I pulled a cork from a bottle, started drinking with dinner guests, and forgot about the cork in the Brabantia until the next morning. It was mission impossible when I tried to eject it. The now dried cork was jammed in the mechanism and simply would not budge. I had to get a knife and start cutting the cork off of the corkscrew, piece by piece, which wasn't easy and leaves the hand holding the Brabantia while cutting in a very precarious position.Now, I could have written this off just as a weird, one-time accident, except that it has happened on two more occasions when I've forgotten to eject the cork from the Brabantia until the next day. And both additional times, I had to go through the same worrisome cutting procedure to remove it.I will say that this corkscrew works fine when you eject the cork from the mechanism promptly, which is what normally happens, but leaving it until the next day should not be the problem that it is. Deducting three stars for this flaw may seem excessive, but I felt the risk in doing serious injury to your hand warranted it, and I would not buy this product again.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

You'll find many reviews here that will tell you how awesome this little power strip is for travel. And it is. But that wasn't my need when I went searching for it.I needed three more outlets to plug into my A/V system power center, but didn't have the space for even a regular office power strip. The super tight confines of my equipment rack meant that the strip had to have a super short (but still three-prong) cord and outlets configured in the minimal amount of space. To be honest, I didn't think such a product existed until I found the Monster OT G400. It was absolutely perfect!While its compact size will impress you first, it's the high quality at this price that will really blow you away. Both the cable and plug are clearly heavy duty, while the thin profile of the strip itself, with two outlets per side, is an ingenious design. And since I was adding A/V equipment with a low power draw, I had no fears of overtaxing the power center that I extended by plugging this strip into it, turning a single outlet into four.Kudos to Monster for not only creating the best travel power strip on the market, but also the perfect strip for any power need in which limited space is an issue.Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision.

I love the slick, unique look of this flat USB to Lightning cable, and its 10-inch length is offered by virtually no one else. (And why not?!) It's perfect for situations where the 3-4 inch cables that various companies make are TOO short, but the jump to a one meter length is too long. For me, it was exactly the right length for running a cable to my iPhone 5s (running iOS 7) in my car.Out of the box, the first thing I noticed was that the Lightning connector is slightly fatter than on my "Apple certified" cables. And I do mean slightly, because it still fits, but requires just a bit of force that's normally not needed, and doesn't seat with the same firm "click" of a certified cable.The second thing I noticed was that it didn't work--I was getting an "unsupported" message on my car's indicator when I tried to play music stored on my iPhone, which worked perfectly with a longer length of an Amazon Basics cable. But after unplugging/replugging this cable a few times from both my car and the phone, it began working reliably. Now, every once in a while, that message will come up again, but a quick unplug/replug will solve it--so it's not a huge issue. And given the choice between THAT, or going back to a sloppy looking one meter cable in the car, I'll put up with the occasional inconvenience for the neater look.I did wonder if that slightly larger connector would end up compromising the fit of certified connectors in my iPhone, but that hasn't happened after months of use. At this point, I'd say it's a non-issue.I've had this cable in my car through one of the worst winters in memory in the Northeast, an environment of freezing temps and then heat when driving, but no cracking or fraying of the cable so far.This would be an easy five star recommendation if Innovative was manufacturing this cable to Apple Certified specs, as Amazon and some other companies do for their cables. Unfortunately, they don't, so while this cable has pretty much performed to my satisfaction, I've deducted two stars for the Lightning connector that's clearly out-of-spec, and the occasionally buggy performance.Also, despite the small number of reviews for this cable, I cannot ignore (and neither should you!) the percentage of reviewers complaining about quality issues, especially fraying. This is not a good sign, and makes the purchase of this cable more of a coin toss. Fortunately, Amazon has great return policies!Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision!

This is a five-star cable for both its high-quality construction and flawless performance, even in the most demanding HD video applications. No, it's not as slick looking as the Monster MC 1000HD version, but it actually has better specs than the Monster and costs less than one-fifth the price. This is a no brainer decision if ever there was one, and a bargain to boot.BUT if you need an HDMI cable with one elbow connection like this one, you MUST also know if you need a 90 degree or 270 degree elbow (Cable Matters makes both kinds), which will depend on the connection at your TV or other A/V equipment. Here's how to find out which one you needFirst, take a close-up look at the HDMI elbow connection on this 90 degree cable. See how one side of the gold connector is slightly tapered and narrower than the other side? See how the narrower side is oriented towards the cable itself? This is a 90 degree elbow. If you look at the 270 degree elbow, you'll see that it looks exactly the same except the narrower side of the connector is oriented away from the cable. Why is this important? Here's whyTake a look at the female HDMI connection that you plan to use on your TV or A/V device. Note which way the narrower side is oriented--is it in the same direction you want the cable to go or in the opposite direction? If it's in the same direction, choose a 90 degree elbow if it's the opposite direction, choose a 270 degree. For example, I was using an HDMI connection on the side of my flat panel TV and I wanted the cable to go towards the back of the set. On the set's female connection, the narrower portion was oriented towards the back of the set so I chose the 90 degree elbow. If it had been oriented towards the front of the set, the 270 degree cable would have been the right choice.What happens if you make a mistake? The connections will still fit just fine, but you'll be left with a cable that's running opposite of the direction you want. This info can be a bit confusing, but hopefully what I've described is understandable.Thanks for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a buying decision!

This is Oxo's second try at a covered ice cube tray. I previously bought the first version (which is still being sold at half the price of this new one), and while I thought it was the best of what was out there, it was still prone to spills and therefore messy to refill. But as they say, "if you don't succeed at first..." and Oxo has delivered ice cube tray perfection this time around. Seriously--if you need ice cube trays then just stop reading now and go buy this. But for those who'd like to know why it's so great, I'll tell you:1) The anti-spill lid works easily and exactly as advertised: fill the tray, smooth the lid down with your hand, tilt the tray to pour off excess water and you're ready to go. It simply does not leak after that, even when you tilt it beyond Oxo's recommended maximum angle. Honestly, I questioned if this system really could work, and it's like watching a magic trick. Very impressive solution!2) The silicone lid protects against evaporation and freezer odors, lifts easily when you need to get cubes, and reseals the tray just as easily.3) The new lid gives the trays a lower height than other trays, so you can stack more in the same amount of space. I can now fit five trays in the same space where I could only fit four of the old Oxo trays. Also, the ability to store a newly filled tray at an angle give you additional options for more storage.4) The no spill system also works well if you just want to partly refill a tray to replace a few missing cubes.Bottom Line: this tray is the next best thing to having an automatic ice maker. If there's a way to improve it, I have no idea what that would be. Bravo, Oxo, for taking another swing at this product and hitting this one out of the park!Thanks for taking the time to read my review and I hope you find it helpful in making a purchase decision.

I've seen the U.S. version of this film about a half dozen times in theaters. Needless to say, I'm a huge fan. But I've been wondering if, as some have suggested, it's a "dumbed down" edit for American audiences compared to the longer Hong Kong release. So when this Blu-ray's launch date was delayed, I decided to buy the HK version and I was surprised by the differences in ways I did not expect at all.Let me start with the bad news first: if you're a fan of the film, you really need to own both versions. Both have important strengths, and neither one is a wholly satisfying substitute for the other. BUT if you forced me to pick just one, I'd have to say the U.S. release would be it, and that's not the conclusion I expected to reach. Here are the pros and cons of each:HK PROS:1) It fully fleshes out a few characters who have been edited down to cardboard cutouts in the American release.
